kzQBHuq1lKuM-JiFNL6Vwg.text: My boyfriend and I went here for New Year's Eve and we were quite impressed with the food and ambience. We ordered quite a few items, the scallops, hanger steak, meat and cheese board, octopus, and the baked truffle ricotta. We got a couple drinks as well. The scallops were amazing, flavorful and tender. My boyfriend loved the hanger steak. The octopus could have been a little more tender but it was quite tasty. The baked truffle ricotta was delicious especially with the bread. I wasn't too impressed with the meat and cheese board. It had duck, prosciutto, and mortadella. The duck was an acquired taste and we both didn't prefer it. I found it odd that mortadella was served on the board since its such a simple cold cut, nothing special. Prosciutto is common as well. Parmesan cheese slices were included which was just okay.   I will say that I'm impressed that they granted our seating request for a nice booth. The back waiter was kind of in a hurry to wrap our food and kept asking if we were still working on our plates every few minutes so we felt rushed. Server was nice but our waters were never even filled once. Food was great but service was average hence the 4 stars. Be prepared to spend quite a bit here. Our bill almost neared $160 before gratuity.

A7ELDBQMKf89PODGTic18g.text: Where are all my young people at? They're all at Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar! Not one employee looked a day over 30 and the diners were pretty youthful themselves. I felt young and hip just eating at this Red Rock Casino restaurant.   I made reservations using OpenTable after reading about long wait times from other Yelpers. I made a 7:30PM reservation for two, but I think it might have been unnecessary. Upon arriving 10 minutes early, I informed the hostess I had a reservation. She seemed confused and didn't seem to actually look up reservation requests, but proceeded to seat us right away anyways. It was a Monday night, so that might explain things.   We were handed at least 4 different menus. Craziness! We already knew what we wanted after looking up the menu online - I was getting the Tomato Bisque and my husband was ordering the rotisserie chicken.   SERVICE: The hostess was an absolute doll. She was super nice and even draped a napkin across my lap! The various staff who filled up our beverages did a decent job. What really killed our experience at Hearthstone, however, was our waitress with some kind of mermaid name - Lorelai. She took FOREVER to take our order and pretty much avoided us the entire time we were there. My husband wanted to order a glass of wine but decided not to because it would take too long. Waitress Fail!    ROTISSERIE CHICKEN ($21): This is a baby-sized rotisserie chicken. My husband said it was good but not enough food. The chicken came with a small salad which he didn't care for. The "dressing" didn't taste like anything. Be careful of the teeny red jalapeno slices. I ate half a slither and just about burned my face off.  TOMATO BISQUE ($10): Mimi's Cafe has better tomato soup. Plus, it was lukewarm. The grilled cheese served with the soup had annoyingly super crusty bread.   AMBIANCE: I loved the decor and feel of the restaurant. It's open and spacious, and I think I saw shuffleboard over by the bar/lounge area!   PRICE: I didn't even order an entree and the tab came to just shy of $38, not including tip. They charge $4 for a Pepsi. WTF? To top it off, we were both still hungry upon leaving Hearthstone. I don't get the whole "You're supposed to share these plates" concept. For that price, I better be stuffed at my meal's end!  Return Visit?  No thanks, I'll pass. The waitress sucked big time. The food is mediocre, overpriced, and the portions are for infants.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #21  *THIS IS MY 100th REVIEW!!*

ltuhGJXakD2x4J3J4Avm6Q.text: Everything here is good. I had the shrimp & grits. It was delicious. Creamy and full of flavor. My sister had the steak which was cooked perfectly. The kids had personal pizzas that the server brought out and they got to top with cheese and toppings themselves. They loved it. Rn4ca2Xkc4p-VPXqfjayhw.text: I can't say enough about our experience at Hearthstone!  Our server Ahmed was the BEST!  He is so fun, attentive and smart!  One on the best dining experiences I've ever had!  Even at some of the most exclusive restaurants in Seattle and Manhattan! The food was amazing!  We had dinner and Sunday brunch!  I highly recommend this restaurant!

6akoRjm-SAu89kKBKXbjpg.text: Beautiful restaurant. Ambiance inside, patio, live music occasionally, TV for sports, friendly staff. I've only been once but will definitely check it out again for breakfast & dinner. I ordered the burger & fries, my boyfriend got the pasta & of course I liked his dish more than mine. I asked for my burger to be cooked medium & the texture wasn't burnt but the flavor was burnt. Enjoyed the fries & my boyfriends dish. Can't remember which pasta exactly but it was so good & a nice size portion. Overpriced as most of the other reviews state - we thought about some appetizers but decided drinks instead (one or the other so we didn't have $100+ bill for a random night out for dinner). Not shocked about the prices, expected from a casino restaurant. I'll be back & would recommend.

1xDkLjZp8Sb5LqU_bGxX4A.text: A chic place to go to in Redrock Casino. The ambiance is pretty cool and inviting. The lighting is just perfect. The service is fantastic esp Jeff who was our server on my last 2 visits. He was very polite and he even remembered my name. He took care of us seamlessly. The menu is full is delicious choices from salads to flatbreads, fish and meat! It's a place to take your friends and family. The best part is they have live music every 8pm and you can even dance. There's an elegant seating area by the performers where you can have a relaxing time sipping your wine while enjoying the live music. I highly recommend this place. It's worth it!

7eypkxuYtX1YJgo31_MFbw.text: Came in for happy hour with a friend & enjoyed a beer and appetizers at the bar. Shared some good conversations with Jocelyn. Food portions & price point were great~ definitely a fun time!! Be back again soon for oyster Wednesday :)

GKGh9UUFVdLuBJR73dEmCQ.text: Delicious Brunch,  yummy Tomahawk Steak dinner for two or just a nice dinner with the family. Love Hearthstone

d0vdPDv86N6XiyQuGy-94g.text: Yummy in my tummy!!!! Taco and tequila Tuesday's makes this place, the place to be on on tuesdays . Super tasty street tacos, and margaritas.... tasty AF..... perfect price, tasty food, fab atmosphere, and great servers!!!

oFKQ9pw19v0_Qjip4KHPTw.text: The staff and the food were excellent!  This was my second time at Harthstone and I would recommend to everyone!

-rLtiiVuq_8TY4WHAndoQA.text: Had to host a last minute  small family dinner party.  Chose this restaurant based on other reviews and was pleasantly satisfied. Everyone was happy with their choice and especially moi with the Hankering steak meal.  Service could have been a tad better but overall I give it a 4.5 rating

cCXbL7xZR9EbDAAEed14Fw.text: We came here a few times now, happy hour and dinner.  I really like the atmosphere here.  They do live music on some nights (Fridays & Saturdays, I think) and it was pretty good.  The service is so-so.  Sometimes very good and others not so much.  The food is great.  We enjoyed everything we tried so far.  Some of the portions aren't so big, some are really big.

TXFCIQu52F-_bS_nLqXHXA.text: When you go to a restaurant, not only are you going for excellent food, but also a memorable experience. My friends and I went for happy hour, and our server, Elisa, did not disappoint. She quickly caught on to our sarcastic nature and really added a great element to our time spent here. We had some drinks, including the special mule made with whiskey, which was spot on. In addition, we had some appetizers, and it was more than enough to satisfy our cravings. The ricotta spread was savory and had a nice crunch factor with the toast, and you can't go wrong with sweet potato fries and the surprise kick of the harissa yogurt. Overall a great experience and we will certainly return.

spsZDram_y6JlLRyStLQ-Q.text: A lot of the reviews say the service is poor, and I've been here enough to say that it really is hit or miss. However, I will say that our server last night was very attentive, and our food was brought out really quickly without compromising on quality.   We went for the Wednesday $1 oyster special, and were also there during happy hour, so were able to take advantage of both. The oysters were extremely fresh, perfectly chilled, and we didn't receive any of the overly large ones that can at times be unappetizing. We started out with two glasses of wine, a dozen oysters, 2 orders of the steak tartar bites ($6 each during happy hr), and an order of hummus that was complimentary with a yelp check-in. Everything was perfect. We opted to sit on the patio since the weather was as perfect as it could possibly be, and ended up deciding to get another 2 glasses of wine, with an additional dozen oysters.   As I mentioned, I've been here quite a few times before, and none of the food has ever been bad. Sometimes the service is lacking, and occasionally the food is 'good, not great', but as for last night, the experience was a perfect 10 all around.   I will most definitely be returning for the oyster special, as it really can't be beat for the price and quality.

Pzpx7OsdP0poGgdXgoFaMw.text: Every Mouth Full was Fantastic! Great place for Lamb ! I Highly recommend this restaurant !

wR26i2mdKen1kln0OM06Ug.text: Came in for dinner to repay a visit to Annie who comes and sees me at PTs. She was was super attentive to not just us but all the tables she was serving. Her food recommendations were spot on and made a date night very awesome!!

7DptEtsSAM5yEtR-dmO9QA.text: Monday's are a tradition here now for the $10 dollar wings and $10 dollar pitchers. Brady, Devin and Josh are the best servers.

pDaWx9EFqPLjvCIkT-FIkQ.text: I saw this place on an episode of Food Porn and despite all the red signs, I felt I had to come here. Though I saw the 3 1/2 average stars and their corporate looking logo, nothing could stop me. I came despite the fact that the item I saw on food porn could only be ordered for a few hours on Sunday during brunch and I was coming for dinner... still I came! Well, you walk in to the place and honestly it is stunning. The design is clever, using reclaimed, repurposed everything. Super chic. Old, dimly lit industrial lighting is everywhere. As far as design goes, it doesn't get any better. We started at the bar, ordered a Big Tom's Sour. What I received was watery fruit juice with hardly any rum. One of the worst drinks I've had in quite some time. Bad tasting and no feeling whatsoever on the brain. Avoid the Latin bartender with the red Henley.  At the table we ordered this stuff: Deviled eggs - how do they make such mini deviled eggs and why are they so bland? Tasted like yellow cream. Burger with an added egg - adequate but missing every flavor you want. Shrimp Pasta - this was good! Green beans - another hit! Fries - the worst type in the world.. steak fries. Triple frying helped a little. Peanut Butter Lava Cake - the cake was not good, the filling better. Butterscotch pudding - lacking a key ingredient... Butterscotch! Super meh Seems like this place is on it's way out, like the chef has moved on or is working on something else... like the restaurant is not a priority. Manager no longer responds to reviews here. Sad because this place could have been great.

3Lc2H7Cz5cR7turwanaJCQ.text: I came in last night for the lobster boil & the dollar oysters. It was my first time here and let me just say the service was amazing & so was the food. I think our servers name was Kate & she was super fun & made our time there a five star experience. Needless to say we will be back for the Monday night wine night she had mentioned. Thanks!

NfxI5UO6y5mMgMFfJToWfg.text: This is based off my second experience at this restaurant. The server Lisa was great, the hostess friendly, all around the service was spectacular. However the food is mediocre, the menu is limited but the pineapple upside down cake was amazing! If you go try to just go for drinks or desert.

cgecow_jpXKkCb7qfNccPQ.text: Went here for the first time for brunch, it has very cute decor inside and they have outdoor dining as well. I had the corned beef and hash, it was too salty for my taste. Also, the white cloth napkins leave a ton of lint all over your clothes :(  The fresh watermelon juice was delicious though.

y_PtjqMwv19YviGSqcn1ug.text: Came on a Friday night so this place was buzzing. Great upscale ambience, spacious dining room, friendly service. Lots to choose from on the menu and prices are not crazy.  Meatballs, burrata jar with truffle/honey, beet salad with goat cheese....All really amazing. Good cocktail menu, nice wine list and a great bar scene. The place had lots of tvs so I would definitely come back for a game.

bPlCsnsGwJHxvs3h8GpUXw.text: Located at the Red Rock Hotel and Casino which is probably about 15-20min away from the strip, Hearthstone Kitchen and Cellar is an excellent option to dine, in a very relaxed chilled out rustic atmosphere eatery. Added plus, either before or after dinner, the casino is right there if you want to try your hand at luck, though you may want to opt for the after dinner gambling foray to make sure you can pay for dinner, ha! Certainly glad I did, haha! Made reservations for 7pm and we opted to eat in their outdoor seating area because the weather outside was so awesome (yes, i know, Summer in Vegas where temps hover in the 100's) but it was a warm 85 with nice breeze, which made it ideal. Plus they sat us next to flowing water fountain, which I think part of the cool breeze came from. The menu is plentiful with multiple options to fit everyone's taste which I believe 90% of the dishes are wood roasted in two oversize hearth ovens, hence the name. We had three vegetarians in our party, and everyone was pleased with the selections to choose from. I opted for the Hangar Steak and Wood Roasted Octopus as an appetizer and both were cooked to perfection and delicious! Others opted for various selections of pizza and asparagus and roasted garlic mash potatoes (which seem to be the only dish that didn't wow) but with a great selection of wines to choose, awesome service and reasonable prices, everyone was extremely pleased. This was my first time in Vegas visiting family and friends, and I will definitely be back and Hearthstone Kitchen and Cellar is definitely worth a repeat visit!

dKkLeISRE4TaCQ7ZPfVHjw.text: The service is mediocre at best, our waiter wasn't attentive at all and we arrived when they opened at 5 when no one was there. It took about 30 mins to receive our 9 oysters when other tables received their oysters before us. If you want to try this place their appetizers are the way to go anything else is just mediocre. I'm about great service and quality food and our main courses were not impressive at all. I order a chicken pot pie but their veloute was poorly made, the flavors were not there. The veloute was more of a runny soup than the thick stock it should be. Scallops were great and the tuna tartar was delicious, it was flavorful and decent portioned for an appetizer. Major work of improvement is attention to all tables not just certain tables!

5jZhw2zqsvKYO8uv8t0mRw.text: Had reservations for Mother's Day, I was not happy with the waitress service. The waitress seem like she was not interested in our table. If it was busy on the patio I could understand. I realize it just wasn't our table that was disappointed. A manger was called out. Whom ever is mangers this place needs to work on there service. I would like to try them again, I would just like a different waiter. Food was very good. Just serves sucked.

8ZRXleMtxnTrORRVGHYGeg.text: Called to ask about their menu for brunch. Drove across town for their wings wouldn't serve them because it was not on brunch menu. We'd had to wait 40 mins until they could serve us. Glasses and silverware were dirty when we sat down. Overall a disappointment

STr46bX772quBNNMiVpUOA.text: Hearthstone is always an unforgettable experience every time I venture there. The staff is very friendly and service is stellar. This particular dining experience I had last night was even more special for me. Daniel F. accommodated our needs and took care of us in a way that made us feel truly welcome and at home. I ordered the prime rib and it was out of this world. Although, I have had the opportunity to try many items on the menu and you can't go wrong with any of them.  A+ to this restaurant. This is True hospitality AND GREAT FOOD!

o7Z2e0in9B7xhD0gdNX3xA.text: My boyfriend and I came here for our two year anniversary. All we can say is wow. The service was amazing, our waitress was very attentive and constantly checking on us to make sure we were okay.  The ambience on the patio seating was amazing! I recommend requesting patio seating if it's available. The inside of the restaurant is beautiful! They designed it very well and it also has couches and a full bar for lounging.  Our food was incredible. If you're concerned if you get your money's worth here, don't second guess it, because you do! We ordered the calamari for our appetizer, and the hanger steak and lobster roll for dinner. We both couldn't finish our food it was so much and so delicious too!!  We both got ourselves the flower bomb cocktail. I recommend this drink to any Jameson lovers out there! It was incredible!  They even brought out a complimentary dessert for our two year anniversary! The dessert was extremely delicious as well! Everything was perfect 10/10.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari. The portion is huge!!! Definitely worth the price.
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll, calamari, and hanger steak.
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our complimentary dessert brought out for our two year anniversary :) peanut butter lava cake. A M A Z I N G!!!

IP3Zfc_6Yzv8H8MFqa-bXQ.text: I came here for the happy hour. I got there and had a complimentary glass of wine with my yelp checkin. The wine was quite good too. The bartender was very friendly and took very good care of me.    I ordered the tartare and wings because she recommended them. I also got the pepperoni pizza and parm meatball slider.   Very glad that I ordered the tartare. Very good recommendation. Wasn't sure how pickled veggies would taste in tartare but it was pretty good. I'd order it again.   The pepperoni pizza had a little bit of a spicy kick to it but nothing I couldn't handle and the crust was very good. Tasted like it had been made in a brick oven. No soggy parts on it even the middle was nice and crispy. I would have liked for it to have a little more cheese on it but nonetheless very tasty. I'll be getting that again.   The tartare and pizza came out first and I ate it. After finishing the pizza and tartare I Waited about five minutes before the wings got there that I had ordered at the same time. The bartender had to go and check on what was taking them so long. Eventually they got there. I had ordered them because of the bartenders recommendation. She said they were "falling off the bone," but I would say that's a very bad description of them. They weren't falling off the bone by any means. They were tasty though. Paired nicely with the blue cheese dressing. They were 6 one sized bite each of "wings". I honestly don't think they were wings but rather maybe thighs. The bone did stick out nicely from the meat making them quite easy to eat. But it took a little bit of effort to tear them apart from the bone. They came with a slice of carrot and celery and some purple thing. I'm thinking it maybe was a purple carrot. They were very good but not falling off the bone and honestly don't know what took it so long to get to my seat. Would have rather had it with the rest of my food.  After finishing the tartare, pizza, and wings I was still feeling a bit hungry. So I ordered the parm meatball slider. But after having the first bite of it I wished I hadn't. The meat in the meatball had NO flavor. I don't even think they added salt to it. I could have gotten packaged meat at the supermarket and rolled it into a ball and that might have had more flavor than this sandwich. Why didn't they add any Italian seasoning to it I'll never know. Honestly the meatball sandwich at subway is a lot better than this sad to say. The fries that came with it were good. Very thin, crispy, and very lightly salted. Maybe even too lightly salted for some people's taste but for me it worked.   I saw that there is a Thursday night wine tasting with appetizers so I'm going to come tomorrow and check that out. Made a reservation for two for that. Maybe try a few more things on hh.   I've lived here a year and a half and have always walked by this restaurant when at Red rock and had never yet tried it til now. Glad I did. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because of how long the wings took to get to me and the tasteless meatball slider. I'm willing to overlook that though and give it another try tomorrow night. Hopefully the wine tasting will make up for it.  *******Update *****  Went to the wine tasting on Thursdays. Had a reservation made for the lounge. The night I went there just happened to have a group in the lounge area so they moved the wine tasting to the back of the restaurant near the casino side. I checked in with the lady at the door on the casino side entrance and gave her my email address and she gave me two tickets for each person on the reservation. Each ticket was good for a wine tasting. I would say they poured about 2 ounces worth  in each glass. Not quite a full drink but after two tickets and my free wine with yelp checkin I was feeling good. A waitress and  waiter made rounds to each of the tables in the wine tasting area and allowed us to try different hors d'oeuvres. Some of the things that I sampled were the hummus which had chunks of chickpeas in it, the pepperoni pizza, the tartare, and I think something else too that I forget (thanks wine). They also brought out bread to the table. We were able to order appetizers from the happy hour menu even while being seated at a table. That was really nice. We ordered a couple of the burger sliders, the pigs in a blanket, the lamb pizza, and the pepperoni pizza.  The lamb pizza tasted really meaty. The meat was a little bit overpowering imo. I would have liked less meat and more cheese on it. The burger sliders were just ok and the fries that come with the burger I do like. The pigs in the blanket had a very nice flakey roll for the blanket and the pigs part was mediocre. Would have been nice to have packed that little piggy with some bigger flavors. I had a very fun time there though. Don't know if it was because of the wine, my company, or the overall atmosphere and service but whatever it is I would recommend trying the place out on Thursday nights. Lots of fun.

Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine tasting Thursday nights. How fun! First glass of two tasters.

-egiU1Y9aeo2GtXl8Ww0JA.text: So my boyfriend and I came here this evening, thought we would try something new and off the strip.  First of all, the atmosphere is very hipster/ NYC ish. Love it!  We got a charcuterie board with salami, pepperoni and pecorino cheese with stone ground mustard and truffle honey. I could have eaten the honey by itself with a straw but I didn't wanna be that weird person lol  The baked ricotta was hands down the best thing we tried. It came in a deep dish and was still warm from the oven. Again with truffle honey  Short Rib Meatballs were delicious and paired very well with the goat cheese underneath.  The DOC pizza was the only thing I didn't care for. It was  good, but lacking flavor. Crust was very thin and flimsy. Buffalo mozzarella needed some salt to set off the flavor. The pizza itself didn't have much sauce either. But I ate it because I love pizza and I refuse to send food back.  The Wagyu Short Rib Burger was delicious. Perfect portion and had a side of fries. Fries were GF free too!    Service was fantastic! Ryan A was our server, did a menu walk thru and gave recommendations. If you come in, sit in his section, he was very knowledgable !   At the end of our meal we decided that we would rather drive all the way up from deep henderson to eat here than deal with the hustle and bustle of the strip.  Amazing find!

BUXU5y2DDRKdX1FL1ahzSg.text: Went here for their Restaurant Week menu. It was my first time dining at Hearthstone.  It's such a cute place. Loved the decor and airiness of it. Now the important stuff.  Food & cocktails. The BlackBerry Bliss mule was refreshing and delicious.  A must try is the lobster roll. Great app for the table. IMO. From the RW menu I got the cheese plate,  flat iron steak and the nutella pizza.  The cheese plate was my least favorite item. They used slices of parm for the cheese. It overtook the prosciutto and bread. The flat iron steak was cooked perfectly & flavorful. The nutella pizza was nothing special. I'd definitely go again and try something different from the regular menu.

Q8myx7OYIS_N1XXBgoQbjg.text: We were greeted with a warm smile and were seated right away on a busy Saturday night. The ambience is fantastic. Upscale yet casual. Felt very comfortable right away. Caitlin was our server and was phenomenal. . Great knowledge of the menu with a smile on her face the whole time. Very attentive and on her game. Sarah the manager was very hands on and as I watched her go to every single table to assure everyone's comfort. You can tell she has a good hold of her staff and her knowledge of how to run the front of the house is second to none. The food was fantastic. The Chick Pea salad was amazing along with the Wood Oven Pepperoni pizza. I recommend this place to everyone... A++

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Couldn&#39;t be happier!!! Love everything about this place.

nKqmu7a2KBGAhdWoMcXXCw.text: Probably one of my favorite places to go. Every time I've been here, I always have a different server but they are all so very friendly and chilled! Love the atmosphere of this place and I love that they have live music on Saturday's now! Food is great and they have happy hours, sometimes reversed happy hours. Their seared lamb was really good, and the D.O.C pizza is something I always order when I go. The GM was present the last time we went but he makes sure your food is good and that everything is ok, so it sort of has a professional yet laid back feel in the restaurant. Overall, I always take my friends here if they haven't tried it because I like it that much!

BufAfrm6wmk4r0LSoixv0A.text: I haven't even finished my meal here yet and I had to jump on to leave a review. It's a Thursday for dinner and the place is packed! Every staff member has been so nice and accommodating to all of special request. And the ambience is beautiful.

DAM6sEoqZH0ROdZOXfB33A.text: First visit and we're hooked!  It doesn't seem Hearthstone has been open all that long, but it's been long enough that it's a shame we haven't gone before.  Located right in Red Rock Casino, and right in the front of the building, it's easy to find.  A great menu and good prices.  Lots of indoor seating, and a generous section of scenic outdoor seating where you're surrounded by fountains and nice views of the mountains on the west side of town.  It's definitely a casual place (advertised as "rustic"), but if you're in a job requiring business clothes and you're headed there after work, you won't feel like you're overdressed.  There's no need to head home to change first.  To kick off dinner, we shared an order of Crispy Calamari.  It was just the right amount to prep us for dinner (most places serve you too much) and it wasn't really crispy--it's just a nicer way to say it's fried.  Don't panic though:  it was lightly breaded, lightly fried, and very tender.  I followed the appetizer with the Prime Flat Iron Steak (ordered medium rare and cooked perfectly) and my wife had the Prime Rib French Dip.  Both were amazing and as with the Calamari, the portions were just right.  We had room for dessert if we'd been in the mood for it, which is nice.  Next time we go back we'll try some other dishes and probably see what's happening on the dessert menu.  There are lots of regular and high-top tables, with seating and full service available in the bar area too.  There are also sofas and chairs around low coffee-style tables making this a great place to come for casual snacks and drinks, and creating a vibe that is almost like sitting at home.  As we were getting ready to leave there was a guitarist setting up to play in the area between the bar and where the couches were, adding live music to an already cool place.  They feature live music on Friday and Saturday evenings:  something we'll definitely go back to check out.  Annie was our waitress, and she was outstanding!  I rarely mention wait staff by name, but I wanted to mention her.  She treated us so well we felt like family or close friends.  We'll definitely ask to sit in her section again!  One note:  even though it didn't appear busy when we arrived, all the regular tables were full and there was clearly a list of reservations.  Go ahead and make one if you're headed there during typically busy restaurant hours or on those nights when folks like to go out (Friday and Saturday for sure).  When we went (on a Friday evening), there was only seating available in the bar area without a wait.  Not a big deal though, the seating and service in the bar area was just as nice as the rest of the restaurant, and frankly, if you're there for casual conversation with friends and want to be near the music, the bar is probably the best place to be.  And it was never too loud to carry on a nice conversation.  We're going back soon.  Hearthstone is definitely on our list of new favorites in Summerlin!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Flat Iron Steak with potatoes.  Perfectly cooked!

yHl9LJ8ZtkOYC5kQnETS7A.text: Just leaves a lot to be desired. Every time I go there I'm just left a little underwhelmed either by service, food quality, portion sizes, price for what you get.

cWEzSBzPwKoq-guzbWhE2g.text: Hearthstone was the perfect spot on a Saturday night for me and my girlfriends to grab some drinks and dinner ! Everyone at the table got a totally different type of dish and we were all super impressed at how delicious our food was .Rigo, our server was pretty funny and provided amazing service . We just loved the atmosphere too , live music is always a plus and sooo hard to find good live music around vegas that's off the strip ! Definitely recommend this spot for a fun and delicious dinner with friends or date night  (There's a really cute outdoor area too when it's not so cold out !)

8X9RE-5r9XMEAW8_xPFC2Q.text: Giving 4 stars for the ambience, mostly.  It's really cute and inviting. The service was mediocre.  The shellfish plate was ok. The cucumber essence cocktail was really good.  The quinoa salad was really good.  So,  good for overall.

X3QVR0q2thWCowVXyrTNjw.text: Decided to make first-time reservations for happy hour here. Which has an outside entrance as well as inside the casino. It is beautiful and unique. I want to say it reminds me of a rustic southern countryside feel. We enjoyed our dinning experience outside on their patio area. Very spacious, lot of seating arrangements as well as a bar. It's a great place to catch a bite or to grab drinks after a long day.   Baked Truffle Ricotta (Truffle Honey+Black Pepper+Gouda): This was excellent! I love anything truffle & ricotta, so I really enjoyed this appetizer. Pigs-in-a-Blanket (Ketchup+Mustard): Traditional snack, didn't find it extraordinaire. Blackberry Bliss (Grey Goose Vodka+Blackberry Shrub+Lime+Mint+Ginger beer): This cocktail was yummy! Great combination of flavors, almost like a blackberry-mule  Happy Hour is from 5pm-7pm & Reverse Happy Hour from 6pm to 11pm All items on happy hour menu is $6 +including draft beers & house wines. * Don't forget to check-in on Yelp to redeem a free glass of wine offer.

go5HyebhORlC0zXAawgKnQ.text: The atmosphere here is amazing! The decor and environment is very welcoming and open. The food is decent and the service is pretty good. They have a pretty good happy hour and the food is reasonably priced.

ISNn4NRaQ2rllspLiAne1Q.text: I've been here a few times and I like the ambiance and decor, especially the patio, but I'm not consistently wowed by the food or service, which should arguably be the highlights of a restaurant. One networking event had passed apps that focused on bar food like flatbread pizzas, wings, and deviled eggs. They were fine but not memorable. I attended a wine tasting that included access to a Whole Beast Feast (wood fire roasted pig!), which was cool to see and tasty to eat. Returned for HH with a friend and enjoyed the subtle sweetness of the Ricotta toast but loved the tartare bites! Wish we'd ordered a second round of those rather than the unremarkable chickpea chopped salad, which had maybe three chickpeas in it altogether and arrived nearly a half hour after our other dishes.   The service is what prevents me from rounding this up. At events, servers came across as disinterested and aloof. Most recently, we passed five employees on our trip through the empty restaurant to sit at the bar and not a single one said a word to us. Jocelyn helped us with our order and she was friendly. Then as we left, an employee walked out from the raw bar area, literally crashed right into us, and kept right on walking. It was downright bizarre.  They're currently running a half-off pizza special on Sunday evenings. Maybe I'll try that? I'm confused about why they're emphasizing their pizzas and bar food but going for an upscale vibe, it's uninspired and doesn't really work.

imAFqPA4zC66UNGW66DReA.text: Beautiful restaurant inside Red Rock casino! Staff was super friendly, food was OUTSTANDING!!! We loved the thin crust pizza, the pineapple beer and all the seafood we tried was so fresh and delicious! We'll definitely go back, I recommend this place to everyone

ZSpjzRfbu8mlq-jsazzn4g.text: My wife and I are new to Las Vegas and we're looking for someplace new for dinner friends of ours said let's meet at the Red Rock Casino and go from there as we were walking around we noticed this restaurant named Hearthstone so we took a chance Let me say my experience there was nothing less than amazing our waitress Ketzia was absolutely the best not sure that our experience would have been as great as it was if it wasn't for her personality and Russell Sexton the general manager "Class Act" he came to our table making sure everything was to our liking I highly recommend this place the food is great the staff is amazing so happy to be writing this review THANK YOU Ketzia for a memorable experience WE WILL BE BACK !!

jvOFPPBp53QDY1yEEjMHPA.text: I sometimes tear up thinking about the truffle ricotta. It brings me straight to tears. Because the entire place is so expensive, but also, it's beyond good. I make my own truffle honey at home. I buy ricotta and fancy crusty bread. But it isn't the same. I keep thinking: what can I do without? Should I stop paying utilities? How can I save in gas? Do I really *need* other food? Or should I just eat one of the ricotta things a day? And unfortunately, reason normally takes over.  If you're with a group and have the budget, it's fun to get the charcuterie, the truffle ricotta, maybe split a pizza and some bacon brussel sprouts - it'll be $60+drinks, but also, it's fun, the ambiance is nice, and you'll be dreaming about it for the next year.

3PpjuGqiGqYX9EU7suj7gw.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Summerlin area, always great atmosphere and service.

HlaF_utaC0M56LB9L9K3UQ.text: Everything here was really beyond expectations. We came for the incredible Taco Tuesday deal - three tacos and all you can drink tequila and margaritas for $24 each. All you can drink! Which became more than we could drink very quickly. But the drinks were amazing, everything we ate was delicious, and the service was unreal! Gersom was always there at the table right when we needed something, before we could even ask for it. He made great recommendations, everything tasted unbelievably good, and we had so so much fun. We can't thank Gersom enough - Hearthstone is more than worth the visit!!

4MrlquM52WdPxUeKUt54zw.text: Good food.  Too loud to have family conversations.  They lose one star for the noise and one star for the manager eating while expediting guests food (so gross)!

gbRdFZ-vLtB7wH-gyrwndA.text: This restaurant has changed the expectations for brunch period. The staff here was exceptional, the food and drinks were prepared and served well above expectations, and above all the staff was professional and courteous to create the best dining experience for us. Thank you for making my fourth anniversary one to remember Ahmed!!

p-GJ0NrQxMEGO-knOcLu1w.text: My husband and 3 kids surprised me with brunch today for Mother's Day and we had the most amazing time! Finding out that I got free bottomless mimosas just made brunch even better! Our server Annie was so wonderful and lovely, she recommended the crab Benedict special and it did not disappoint. When the manager Kevin stopped to make sure everything was good we told him how  Annie made my Mother's Day so special and we can't wait to come back and try more from the menu. Everyone was so attentive even on such a busy day. Thank you hearthstone for such a great experience!

GiyQvRlAGDUllo8F73PSaw.text: I warned the waiter of my food allergies and he ignored me and served me a dish with chili. I was sick for days! Hearthstone management NEVER followed up with me despite repeated requests!  Do not eat here!  Update: GM if the restaurant reached out to me after 2 weeks.

CZzu84q90aqqh1OVZUxghA.text: The happy hour is really good! There is a great drink variety available for happy hour also. However, I would like to see ALL of the appetizers and ALL of the menu items at a special price during happy hour. I hope this suggestion will be taken under serious consideration.

frbC7q5Kc5CrtNlvi1D6ag.text: Love this place for the dollar Wednesday oysters and happy hour but for the love of God please bring back the duck and waffles

L_t5s2f_VxNjVYFJdiQjmA.text: This place has great decor and a wonderful atmosphere. But more importantly the food is delicious. We come here often but the last time we came we tried the seafood tower ( Ummmm yes please!!! ) The manager was really nice and allowed us to sub the raw oysters for extra shrimp . We also had the crispy string fries ( those didn't last long). I haven't tried the dessert here yet but best believe that we will be on the item next trip.

2l5sxEWQIhh26r--fBT8ag.text: Ahmed is awesome! He took really good care of me and my friends on their $1 oyster night! He was very knowledgeable and attentive. Oh, the food was good too. ;)

_q4ZD9UAVSGbxz0S0f3GmQ.text: Former Las Vegas residents, came in to Red Rock to kill time while visiting on our last day before heading back to Cali. Noticed the poster out front about $1 Oysters on Wednesdays and waited around for a few more hours just for that. So glad we did! The ambience was great, love the decor, oysters were great, small and freshly shucked (Kumis today), unlike most places that give you the extra large yucky tasty ones that the staff can't tell you what kind they are. Our server, Ahmed was attentive and awesome! Wish this place was here when we lived here. We'll be back when we're back in town. Thank you!

iMRfaNCsjBRR-FFP5JHGfQ.text: Probably my favorite steakhouse in town.  A big fan of there happy hour wings , the mini looking burgers they have , the dessert menu in general can't forget about the steak cooked at its best.  Now for the restaurant in general it has a great view in and out it has it's own look. It has a great timing service hosts and waiters are fantastic at there customer service and getting the food orders right. The place is Friendly great for dates with your significant other or big family.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kind of views I like nowhere else is it like this

Qn_jy9LZ_5GPUIxDGf1l_Q.text: If this review was based solely on food they'd definitely get a 5 star but the service here is just awful!   My girlfriends and I came here for Sunday brunch which by the time we came, around one, the rush had basically died down. Once seated we weren't approached by our waitress until about 10 minutes later. Throughout the entire meal she was very inattentive. It wasn't just our waitress though our runner also seemed pretty awful. He first brought our food to the wrong table and then to us. Even as he was setting everything down he seemed very uneasy and shaky. It seemed like this was the first week they had ever worked in a restaurant.  Food wise it was pretty good. I had the croquet Madame sandwich which came with a fried egg and gravy type sauce on the top, very good! Also you can't beat bottomless mimosas for $15.   If only this place could train up their staff it'd be a huge successful. The ambulance and location are great!

xBsDUXHGRKYvYqKmD2buag.text: Hearthstone is a beautifully decorated restaurant inside of the Red Rock Casino. If you're a big fan of oysters or seafood in general, Wednesday's are a great night to indulge on the little sea pearls! They have $1 oyster specials the entire evening and specials throughout the week to suit your needs be it half price wine on Mondays or their happy hr through the weekday. The real reason to come is for the service. The entire staff is very knowledgeable and attentive. I've had several great encounters with Jocelyn who is such a boss behind the bo! Hard not to want to sit up up there with a great view of the tv and feel like you're VIP!   Update 2/07/2018 THEY HAVE WINE ON TAP, YA'LL! $6 for happy hour Mon-Fri 5pm-7pm. That alone should prompt you to get in your car and drive over directly for work stress relieve if anything.

6fEKR8vVo6tapp7N1LOgOQ.text: Came in on a Weds night and it was hoppin so the fella and I found a cozy spot in the bar area while waiting for a booth to open up. The hostess was so attentive and kept checking in with us and updating us on their status. Loved that! Once we got our booth, I looked up to see their specials of the evening and was soooo so excited to have the Florida stone crab & clam chowder in a bread bowl!!! Unfortunately, we were sat at 6:30 pm and told the specials ran out "10 minutes ago" bummer. Major bummer, but the lesson here is MAKE A RES. and get your orders in for specials, early!  So, moving on to the meal, I had a hard time deciding on anything once the specials fell through, since I had a taste for clam chowder and crab now, but I really enjoyed my glass of Educated Guess Cab, and was sooo excited they had it on their wine list. +1 for that! Eventually the fella and I ordered the bacon wrapped dates, beet salad and a meatball flat bread. The dates texture was off for me - the bacon wasn't crisped, and soggy bacon fat was not pleasant. The flavor was awesome though- good garlic, tomato and smokey flavor from bacon. Lesson here, order them extra crispy, maybe?? Could be a really yummy dish when crisped up.  I moved on to the beet salad and had my MIND BLOWN, so completely that I didn't even care about the dates anymore, and was only slightly sad about the crab and chowder :). Seriously though, if you are a fan of the beet/goat cheese relationship, you must must order this salad!  The flat bread was also delicious, but the salad had all of my attention. We also enjoyed really great and fun service. Our server didn't rush us as we sat for a loooong time drinking wine and mulling over the menu trying to decide. She was so patient, all smiles and offered us plenty of suggestions. The hostess checking in with is while we waited for a booth in the beginning also sticks out for me as GREAT hospitality, and you definitely won me over in hospitality.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball Pizza
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet Salad oh yeah!!!

fxcokX7Jp5GvIA43z2F8_g.text: Great food, but I hate how the hostess seats you with no menus. You have to wait for the server to bring them, and if they are busy, you can sometimes end up waiting up to 5 minutes just to get a menu. This has happened to us on so many occasions, and it's super annoying. Its sooooo much easier to have a menu to look at while your waiting for your server to greet you, and be able to order right away,  instead of wasting 5-10 minutes. Hopefully they will change this practice

UfNZcGyOCY3J-_Bhwq2M5g.text: We have always enjoyed great service, (thanks Rigo) and wonderful food. Nice ambiance, and good location!

EDnPGWRpylYYiQw-Pp6F0g.text: The ambiance, food and especially service were spot on.  Brought a friend visiting the area for the first time.  We decided to hit the casino and dinner Saturday night.   We enjoyed a variety of apps and enjoyed people watching and listening to the evening entertainment.   This would totally be a spot I'd come to eat on my own, or bring more guest.   Great evening.

0-YdWTfCHEYdYj4AUrleMA.text: Really nice brunch.  The food was good but not outstanding.  The service was wonderdul

MTcd8UYkhofnfGDTqbqz-Q.text: I have been here a few times now, and overall, my feeling is "merh". And here are the reasons why:  The service is shit. Each time, we're seated quickly. But we either have 5 different people serving us, or we have a server that is not attentive at all. As much as they charge for their food, you'd think they'd have better service.  The last time, we were sat at a table that had no menus, dinnerware, silverware or glasses. It took about 10-15 minutes after asking to get some. After the actual server came around, it took him 10 minutes to get us water and over 30 minutes just to get our drinks. It took 4 of us 2 hours just to have dinner because he was seriously slacking. Quite frustrating.  Also, it was not that busy. There were larger parties around us that were in after us a left before us. I'm very observant.   The food here is good. But for me, it's not worth flagging your waiter down just to order things.  The only cool thing is they have some local artists play chill music on the weekends. If it's not that, their DJ plays...but it's loud af.   If you want good food in this casino, Lucille's and Yard House are your best two $$ price range options. The food is always pretty good and the service is almost always on point.

9bjIy2ZEY_SVDc6kvvLFnQ.text: Came here after the Silent Yoga for Breast Cancer event at Red Rock Casino!   Had their beef tartar (sp?) and their chicken truffle pizza and sangria and white whine. The beef tartar was chopped fine and had relish in it. Not what I expected. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't order again. The chicken truffle pizza had bacon bits and it was heavenly.   The decor was really nice! It was a mix of big screens for games and updated charming seating a decorator would appreciate. I really thought it was nicely done and way better than I expected. Sometimes casinos have such outdated decor. This place is nice. Older crowd (40's). Lots of date night potential.

nlnLiYeThYfouieUVqHfOg.text: My friend and I went to a brunch event that they advertised and hosted a couple of months ago. It was called "kegs and eggs."  It had to be one of the worst planned events I have ever attended. Well, maybe that's being a little bit dramatic....This event was advertised for MONTHS. We made reservations via Open Table and closer to the date, we tried to call for information. Neither the hostess or Manager were able to provide any, all the way up until the DAY BEFORE. Perhaps that should've been a warning.  They kept telling us that they were "putting the final touches on the menu," however the actual menu was not any different than what they normally offer for brunch. The only addition was the Nate from Bad Beat had a table set up in the back of the restaurant, where he was giving out samples of beer. That's awesome, but I live 5 minutes from the brewery and didn't need to drive all the way to Summerlin for that.  There seemed to be A LOT of miscommunication. When we arrived to check in for our table, they tried to seat us on the patio. It was hotter than hell and there wasn't a single other person out there. Um, no thank you, we'll take a table inside. They didn't have a table inside and ended up sitting us at the end of one of their high-top large tables. It was really weird.  The service overall was really lacking. Our server was painfully slow and when it was time to cash out, he kept our change as a tip without asking.  I wasn't overall impressed with the food either. I ordered the California Bennie. I think the menu should be more specific and mention that there is NO bread as part of this dish. Instead of brioche or an english muffin, the bottom half is a large slice of tomato. I was expecting there to be bread, topped with a small slice of tomato and everything else. It was really not great.   Anyhow, the decor is really cute and it's bright and open and cheery. Unfortunately, it just came off to me like a place where hipster-ish people were going to be "seen," rather than a place that stands on it's food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California bennie

FZH4izDs239uIc1k1l58lw.text: I used to love this place and their dollar oysters. Unfortunately my experience was a not so good one today. Starting with the unfriendly host staff and getting sick in the parking lot and a again at crate and barrel. All I had were the oysters which are normally my favorite. Unfortunately not even 1 min after pulling out of our parking space I had to stop the car and throw up. And at crate and barrel I barely made it to he bathroom and threw up again. Very disappointed and disturbing.

dJDRKCHLi0dLUNnFDxhsYQ.text: Just had a late dinner after long day of college showcase soccer. Decided to try Hearthstone because it was close, what a surprise find, food was great and service was outstanding , waiter Shane was excellent ! If your by the Red Rock Casino, I stay stop by.

Dzp7o4iWhVy2CuNiZ23KCA.text: I've been here twice now and the place has great potential with the right management. Both times, they have been understaffed and as a result you're left waiting for the menus to be delivered, waiting to order, waiting excessively for basic necessities like small plates, table clearing, your food and your check. Also the ambiance was cool until the music stopped for a good 10 minutes, which shows that restaurant doesn't even care enough to either have pandora going or set a long enough playlist.   The food is good but it had been sitting a while so it came out Luke warm which typically you wouldn't notice but the hollaindaise on the eggs benny started to harden which really isn't appealing. It would also help if the seafood bar chefs were trained well on how to shuck oysters as the oysters had so much shell in it, it was hard to enjoy... not to mention it would have been nice to know what oysters were plated.  It really comes down to management. If management can get their stuff together, this place could really be an awesome dining experience. Instead we waited a while for the menus, then the oysters came out with shells in them and we also weren't explained the type/ order they came in (this is pretty standard for a place that boasts an oyster bar), waiting a long while until we received our mains that had obviously been sitting out waiting to be served, waited 20 minutes for our check until we decided to get up and request it from the hostess, and suggested that we speak to the manager only to be told that there's only one around and kind of ignored the request we had.  To be honest, I don't know if i'll be returning after having been disappointed a second time. It truly is a shame though bc the food is actually quite tasty despite having been sitting out.

2YFu8zOVmXjGQWb3yfJPig.text: I came here with a friend for the $12 AYCE wings on a Monday. The wings aren't the best I've had, but they were good enough for the value. There's an option between buffalo and regular sauce. I liked both.   AYCE wings- 3.5 stars.  Baked Ricotta (truffle honey and black pepper) - 4 stars.  The honey was yummy, but I didn't like the baked ricotta very much. Maybe brie would have been better.   This place had other great items on the menu, that I would come back to try. It's a nice, posh place, and has a cool vibe to it. Service was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE wings with buffalo or regular sauce

Vu4N231XgK-ecohOvs80qA.text: Great food and service. Our server named Ahmed took amazing care of us. Will be returning soon!

mVUbGU3akK9jypI6npgj6Q.text: My friends and I went to Hearthstone for a birthday party with a very large group (25 people) they were very accommodating and the service was excellent. We had the best service in town from Ahmed the server. He was extremely professional, knew the menu and never forgot anything which is amazing for quite a large group. The ladies thought he was very good looking as well I think that's why we kept ordering things. This place has a great atmosphere, friendly staff, amazing food and perfect location. Definitely a family environment, fun for a birthday or a simple happy hour. It's very diverse. Thank you Ahmed and staff. Hope to return soon.

L-6pi4YkJcgrxd6WcN9aqA.text: We love Hearthstone! The food and atmosphere are fantastic! The lollipop wings are the best!  The service is top notch! Our server Gerson took excellent care of us!

Ly4K4U3BnP3T_F8aDgWj3A.text: Ok. Great atmosphere but needs better menu. Had a pizza without cheese.., really. Servers need more education.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d50OO3HWHoq6OdmViZH4Bg.text: Tien has been a wonderful server from the beginning she is knowledgeable on the menu and helped me chose the perfect cocktail yum! The food has been AMAZING!  I absolutely love the decoration of this restaurant feels elegant and homey! I will be back for sure!

frZd16H8KnFr3DB09sb1gg.text: I want to give this place a much higher rating, food, and service was really good, although being off the strip the prices were really high.. Being a local these prices were just to much :(  113$ for 2 people with 2 appetizer's, 2 beers and 1 entree was just ridiculous. Not to mention if you get the steak tartare and want the poached egg they up sell you 2$ and if you want extra toast to go with it, it's an extra 2$ boo!

dmWqIU1buAn3X2mOnbHJsQ.text: Great service!   Trendy/Casual decor.  Roomy indoors and outdoors.  Good food.  Price is a little high (maybe 30% higher than I would expect) off-strip.  Loved eating lots of appetizers instead of one large meal.  Seems like there are several good choices for anyone (veggie, seafood, meat, etc.).  Drinks were great!

ZDZwR0l8MfNrjRgrHmkfwQ.text: AMAZING! My family and I just ate here. My dad had eggs "bennie" and it was the best eggs Benedict I had ever had! Recommended: Traditional egg bennie, salted caramel French toast, and the buttermilk pancakes. All are absolutely amazing! It is so great. Definitely coming back each time I come to Vegas. COME HERE!!!!!!!

KYxsgggXKPveTy6geThoWw.text: we came here for a date night! staff was extremely kind and attentive! the only down side, a little expensive for the portions!

OcQmkmfWfE6_WDuFwzxgCw.text: Best place in town for brunch. My friends and I love this place. Nit only is the food delicious but beautiful as well. Sheena is amazing and knowledgeable

lkAjywkb7XO6MYai925ZTQ.text: Visited this great new restaurant, from the Light Group, in the Red Rock Casino. The food was very good. Everything we had I would absolutely have again. We began with the organic vegetables which we shared. The waitress couldn't tell us accurately what all the different veggies were in this wonderfully presented dish but we ate all of them. The dip was zesty (if you like miracle whip) but there was not enough of if. We moved on and ordered the baked ricotta, roasted squash, grilled broccoli & the chick pea salad. I know it sounds like a lot of food but we took our time and the portions are very moderate so it was not over the top. Everything they served was well presented and very yummy, expecially the baked ricotta with the truffle honey. We hadto ask for more bread!! Service was very good and attentive. I strongly suggest reservations as it gets pretty busy.

awGx0DPKFAqYWf20roilOA.text: Could not be more pleased with the service here! Myself and some girlfriends were excited about trying this place. After having some issues with waiting for a table, we spoke with Shane, one of the managers. Shane went above and beyond for us! Not only was Shane so great to us but I noticed how he went from table to table making sure everyone was enjoying their food and service. Our waiters were also wonderful! And the food...SO good. Love that it comes in sharing sizes. Very reasonably priced as well. I could see Hearthstone becoming one of my go to spots. Five stars from me.

sZ-6z202zZVCyOmlzw53yQ.text: good food, worst service ever. Was in there on May 7 for brunch.  Waited a few minutes at the bar then was seated.  Our waitress came to the table  twice.  She took our order and then we never saw her again.  We had to flag a busboy down on 3 separate occasions to get some bread, some salad dressing, and get the waitress so we could get our check.  The food was just OK.  The hash browns were not good but the roasted potatoes were good.  The salad was a salad.  The California Benedict eggs were bland and the 'chicken' tasted like packaged lunch meat.  We were there for an hour and a half.  You would think in 90 minutes the waitress could have at least stopped to see how we were doing, but nope.  This is the 3rd time I have given this place a chance.  and each time the service has gotten worse and worse and the price is not cheap.  And do not go for the oysters, they are notoriously TINY.  We had 2 shells with nothing in it???  Maybe the shucker was hungry too?  Goodbye hearthstone.

Dfg0l0AXmqU2uJoRPNFNkg.text: Unbelievable...the first time we came here we had a horrible experience where we had someone name drop the owner of the casinos to get in on their reservation on time when we had been waiting for ours for 35 minutes. After my yelp review I was contacted and comped a meal which I really appreciated. We have since come back and had no issues until today when I talked this restaurant up to our closest friends only to have a waitress who doesn't come to the table, won't stay for more than a second, didn't ask how our food was, and what's going on with every person who works here not knowing anything about the menu? I gave this place a second chance and clearly there is a lack of direction, training, passion or even an ounce of consideration for the customer. You're in Summerlin which is probably on par with the strip on what you expect when you drop $200-$400 on a meal. There shouldn't be any issues when you're paying  $16 for an omelette that comes out bland and boring. I'm embarrassed that we brought them here to this. We won't be coming back off of shear principle. Things need to be fixed or this will be the next restaurant to turnover quickly. With restaurants like Andiron less than a mile a way you can't operate how you are.

Q2bB1nKZaTQBtbp0nEO_aw.text: First things, first - Love Hearthstone. The overall vibe of the place is great for an early evening sunset dinner with huge windows that let tons of light in, or a great date spot where you can dine on the patio in the warm, summer air underneath beautiful tea lights. The charcuterie is great with a glass of wine. The bartender Jocelyn was very sweet and super attentive whenever we were in need of a refill and our server Johann's table side manner was genuine and quick. He anticipated our needs and we had a great time. Definitely making Hearthstone one of my regular spots.

FRh7gM4rqsepjpvFQpVKrQ.text: Good food good drinks!   Meatballs are a must have. Beef tartar was really good too. Chorizo stuffed dates, yes plz!   Tried the salmon entree and it was delicious. My girlfriend got the beet salad and she loved it. Staff was super friendly and service was good. Def coming back.

UXPEBlm7oyQbhyruPVx21w.text: Really good food. A bit pricey. But excellent flavor. I had the shrimp pasta. My friend had the parpadelle. Both really great pastas. We finished it off with the peanut butter lava cake-which is amazing as well as the souffle-which was good.

1mqkfDVb-ti4b6um0dTvug.text: I thought we had good food in Texas, have to say its pretty damn good here in las vegas. The chef knows what he is doing and the servers are informed and told us what to get. I got everything they told us, baked ricotta and the truffle honey, to die for. (Make sure to order extra toast with out) meatball pizza with burrata cheese - the server said its the best pizza and it was. I had my boy blue as my cocktail and it went so well with my halibut ceviche with a hint of watermelon in it. Recommend it all. Thank you for a great experience will recommend my Texans over there.

-AoFuX8fqPbFON_rZ-dGpQ.text: If i could give half of a star I would. They should just call it, The Cellar- where we torture people and take their money. This place was truly the WORST restaurant I've ever been to in my life. The service and SERVER made the experience truly memorable and NOT in a good way. My husband and I sat in the patio area on a Monday night at 9pm. The place was nowhere busy whatsoever. The server didn't even greet us until 15 minutes later. Bad sign already. She came to take our order 10 minutes later with a huge attitude. She refused to even look me in the eye, then when I ordered a glass of Torrentes she snapped at me saying they didn't have it by the glass or even serve it there. I pointed to it on the menu and she rolld her eyes at me then said, "fine."  Another BAD sign. My husband ordered a glass of wine as well and 2 appetizers. We decided to just enjoy ourselves and wait for our wine. Problem was, the vapid server NEVER CAME BACK. Nobody came to check on us or anything. Yet oddly enough, other patio tables that got seated after us were getting impecable service from this minles server and drinks and appetizers. At this point my husband and I had it. Finally a food runner comes over with our grilled artichoke and truffled popcorn. uuumm.... no drinks still!!!! WE ask him what's going on and he looks at us not understanding. He said he had no idea we had drinks and hed go check. 3 other people come back to our table with NO WINE but refill our waters. I felt as if we were on the show, WHAT WOULD YOU DO. Only that show always seems to inform people they are on a show and try to make ammends for their actions. We have had at this point and ask for the manager AGAIN!!!  Surprisingly the elusive server comes by and asks what the problem is. We tell her we how is it possible that our appetizers which took 20 mins to make, came out before our wines? She once again, ever so pleasantly rolls her eys and storms off. My husband gets up to look for a manager. 10 minutes later and 3 MORE servers later a manger finally emerges. WE break down everything that has happened to us and ask her what the server has against us specifially since she only seems to be serving all the other tables but us. The manager says, well she's young. REALLY?! That's the excuse you give for repulsive service and night? There is no excuse for her actions towards us. The manager sent over a couple of items on the house and that seemed to be that with them. Words cannot describe the amateur back alley 3 ring circus of a night we had at this restuarant. We definitely will not be going back to be treated like circus folk again.

xuz7VfRAWbhu3Js7QES2uw.text: So disappointing. Tried it out tonight to celebrate Valentine's Day. Food was overpriced and very average. Tried the meatball appetizer which was $16 for three tiny balls in very average red sauce. We asked for some bread which was nice but we're surprised when the bill came that it cost $8!  Hubby had pasta that was supposed to have short ribs in it but could barely find the meat. I had scallop special on shrimp risotto which was about a "B" but for $42 could have had some hint of seasoning. Very average food for $130. Oh yeah, $8 for bottle of beer. Will be surprised if this restaurant survives. Will not return!

od3HUA7jsLV3KUK1s1chvA.text: The food was delicious, and once we did get a server, she was rather attentive.  We sat down, and a bus person came and asked if we wanted water, and we said regular water would be fine.  He walked by our table approximately 3 times in 10 mins, and never brought water, finally i stopped him and asked him about our waters, yeah, he forgot.  Nobody came to our table offering a menu, so I went to the hostess and said we had been there 15 mins, and have not even received a menu.  She promptly gave us menus, but nobody explained anything, and she said she would send over the manager.  The manager start walking over to us, but we noticed it was a terrible service manager, Peter from Vintner Grill, who was awful....to the point that after so many years of being regular customers, we stopped going there.  When he saw who we were, he stopped near our table, turned around to look at us and walked away.  He never did come to our table to apologize for the terrible service.  The table behind us got seated, and within a minute, had water, a table server and menus.  Our serve was very nice, and did bring us dessert on the house, even though we told her not to bother.  Its seems that when the other manager was there, from what my friends told me, the place was much better.  I remember when you had to wait at least 1 hour for a table on a Saturday night.  We walked right in, as so did many others after us without a wait, and there were several empty table, and this was approximately 7 pm.

dRAOapDaESJ_yL4kf2B3Fg.text: First time visiting Hearthstone in Red Rock Casino, WOW is what I have to say.  Im not a big "yelper" and don't really value what most people have to say, but felt obligated to write about this GEM!  First off this place is comfortable to the 10's,  booths are great and super comfortable, garage door wide open never seen that anywhere!! my wife anent  huge fans of open kitchen but watching the cooks work here was like watching the musicians at the Philharmonic, What a show!! The Waitress that handled our experience was super knowledgeable and made us feel special through the meal, We never wanted for anything.  Dessert time!!!  We declined the menus as we couldn't fit another bite.  However our server mentioned the chocolate cake is "to die for"  and if we didn't like it she would remove it from our bill.  OK  we loved it and took some home for later that night.   Octopus Meatballs Watermelon Salad Burger Salmon Shrimp Pasta Chocolate Cake  all Winners and must have's, can't wait to come back.  Menu is quite large and had issues deciding what to have ( not a bad thing ).  Some guy playing live music the night we were there,  set the mood and great vibe.

GZiXg24Sk_PPazkq21rLuQ.text: This is a follow-up to my review from June.  The owner was quick to respond to my post and reached out and wanted to speak with me about our dining experience.  I emailed him back right away with my email address and cell phone number with a willingness to go into greater detail about our dining experience.  I never received any email reply or a phone call.  Makes me wonder if the responses to these poor reviews is just window dressing and nothing more.  Maybe "each customer is a top priority to us" is just for show.

UJJWmqYjL-omN29-TRGz3A.text: Loved our experience with Ahmed!  He totally walked us thru the menu and made killer suggestions.  He was even able to do pairings with their wines!  We had the best dinner with great service!!  I would recommend you go!!!  Yum!!!

1HgDKVJd3djNp5zkfj1Tcw.text: I'll start off by saying that I never Yelp anything because, well.. I think its kind of lame considering most people that have bad experiences blow it out of proportion. That being said I've seen some of the reviews about Hearthstone and I disagree with most. I was in this past weekend for the 2nd time and yes I will agree that some of the food is overpriced, but my wife and I enjoy the environment and have had great service BOTH times. I think the food sometimes does take a bit long but the place is huge and I'm not in any hurry otherwise I'd go to the food court lol. I cant remember who served us the first time but Ryan took care of us last, he was amazing and we basically went with most of his suggestions, we had:  Stuffed Dates which were so good Quinoa Salad was delicious  A few other things and then we had the special NY steak that was on their board. He told us we would love it and he was right!   Everything we've had has been pretty great, a few things weren't my favorite but hey thats at ANY restaurant. Oh and definitely try the Lava Cake! Best part of the meal!! A manager even came by at some point to check on us, so I dont know what some of these people are talking about. Bussers and everyone was great. We'll definitely be back to see Ryan and the other staff

6a5eamyhK6USOAk1YZ9TAg.text: I was expecting better.  The oysters were good for an app.  I had the fried chicken and it was meh.  The girlfriend had the meatball pizza and still just meh.  The best thing about the chicken was the honey, other than that I thought it was flavorless.  I'll eat the oysters anytime though!  2.5 stars, oysters bring it to 3

IC23f03zATD8e8wApySbzQ.text: my wife and I went for dinner and we were surprised with the ambience of the place great food and service

aXaBoAEY7C270oUANfX9eQ.text: Love love this place the food was amazing and the staff was so friendly I can't wait to go back in fact we loved it so much my boyfriend went back the next day to get pizza cuz he wanted it so bad make sure to try the cheese board with honey truffle it is amazing

Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

80TIHGTBvmxw0ZBZa28rTg.text: Friday nights have live music and that dude with his guitar is rather incredible actually.  Love the vibe in here and looking forward to spring for patio time. We tried the rock shrimp lettuce wraps on point, meatballs and short rib wrapped dates. The food was outstanding I was actually pleasantly surprised.  Ending the meal with wine and the honey oil cake with blood orange sherbet and the peanut butter Lava cake. Both drool worthy.   However the service was mediocre at best.  My friends that have been several times before stated its always bad.  She came to the table and would ask if we have questions and mid sentence of our reply would haul ass away. Never refilled water. We had to ask repeatedly for her to clean up the old dishes.  She brought all drinks in front of me and told me to pass them around which isn't a huge deal if she was cooler but she was pretty much just bossing us around. Definitely recommend management to be more engaged bc if someone would have come by I'd have said something. I would have asked her for the manager but we could barely order without lassoing her in.  I'd go again but I'll move if we get her again.

dsJ3h6ZMkAurSoLo2sq3qw.text: Yes it's in a large casino hotel and while the room is sizeable it has a small wine bar vibe. The small plates are really flavorful, the wine selection excellent and the cocktails pricey but worth it. Most importantly the service is friendly professional and efficient and not overly institutionalized. Definitely worth a visit.

tXsrsVPDI3_1kjetfg-bQw.text: Great restaurant Ask for Elgin to be your waiter  You can not go wrong with whatever you order Service is outstanding   Here another night Tien is my waitress She is not only beautiful on the outside but also from within Oh she is also a fab waitress

mDfQ5Bpc8kJaPWdb4SDhDg.text: Another amazing dinner. Sat at the bar, greeted almost immediately! Started with dollar oysters, only on Wednesday, fresh and delicious. If you want some of the best pizza in Vegas order any of them on the menu. This time my friend had the truffle chicken, smelled great. I had the burger w/ bacon, nice thick patty with skinny fries. Ended with my fav peanut butter lava cake... wowwww. Thank you Hstone!!

6NVmiqKqidERjYaKyB_hbQ.text: This is my 2nd trip to Hearthstone. The first time the dysfunction at the hostess stand was way too much to endure so I left and had a hot dog by the sports book.  The dysfunction sadly still remains.  The restaurant wasn't full; plenty of tables, but even with a reservation we waited for 10 minutes. I have to say training the front of the house staff can be beneficial.  We were assigned two servers; kind of odd, but okay.  The appetizer or small plate of jalapeno hummus was good; not too hot.  Our dinners; the rotisserie chicken and DOC Flatbread were average at best. The rotisserie potatoes were delicious.  Our dessert was the apple tart. It was very good.  Tye servers are trying very hard, which is always appreciated. The noise level is deafening, couldn't hear anything our server suggested.  We will give them another chance down the road, but with the many new choices at downtown summerlin it may be a while.
