rVq_exZuNRgJFHe7Sd7eWg.text: Very trendy place with multiple options for seating... Booths, tables, bar stools, and couches. Have come here twice with young kids and do not thing the menu is quite set up for small kids. The food was pretty tasty but on the trendy side. Items are a la carte. Menu changes often, so dont expect to order what other yelpers have posted pics of... It may be gone.

i3S_2P6ZeNFAvuzqNrJ9WA.text: Coming in from Hong Kong, so glad my friends showed me this place. The water is delicious, I am dehydrated!  the food is amazing and the atmosphere, wow.    We did family style, can't exactly tell you what I ate but it's the service that wowed me... I'm so thankful I got experience this before I go home.  I would recommend this place to all my friends and family.   Thank you Tien for hosting us. Ciao Bella...

sQnv4A3Kn-2OR-ora0I2mQ.text: This was my 4th time at Hearthstone & it happened to be the day they overhauled the menu. Which is fun- to see what's new. But it's also a bummer because things that we went back for were gone. Our waiter was awesome... the 1st two times there, that was not the case. These past two times, though,  zero complaints! The calamari was still spot-on but with more deep fried lemons & zucchini & I'm pretty sure the portion was a bit larger (yay!). I tried 2 new items for my entree: French onion soup & adult grilled cheese. My g*d, the soup was incredible. Perfect balance of sweet & savory. The cheese & crouton were easy to manage. The grilled cheese, however, lacked in a couple places: 1) no flavor whatsoever & 2) it was rather dry. It needed more cheese or a more creamy one. I wasn't blown away by the desserts either. Luckily the calamari & soup carried the meal & made it mostly worth it.

xny9bas6RvG4Lp9Ka5NZVg.text: Went for dinner and oysters last night.  Without a doubt, this overrated place has the worst, most unprofessional service you can find. Sat at the seafood counter. There were several empty seats and the staff was not busy nor were they attentive to their jobs.  There were three waitresses/bartenders behind the counter.  They were very busy socializing with eachother and ignoring this customers waiting for service.  While the counter was not full, it took over ten minutes just to get the attention of the servers.  One finally came over just to tell us that she won't be serving us and she let me know that someone else will be coming by soon.  We ordered drinks, oysters and an appetizer.  They were served by someone who appeared mad that they were working there. Their hostility towards their job was obvious.  Our intention was to have diner there but after fininshing what we ordered, we were completly ignored by the incompetent, unprofessional, untrained and unsupervised help. We were not even asked if we wanted a second drink.  Everyone knows that the margins on drinks can make or break the bottom line for any restaurant.  After another fifteen minutes, a rude servered cleared the area, never asking if we wanted to order anything else.  At that point I was disgusted with the horrible service, presented my credit card and was expected to pay the bill, without even being presented with the check to review. I had to ask the server to see the check prior to paying the bill.  Really? The management here better wake up before it's time to close the doors.  If service remains as-is, it's just a matter of time.

2_CWjprYSW0Bb5P6SeXN8w.text: Amazing!... At how a little service and go a long way at any establishment. Hearthstone is a pleasantly comfortable restaurant slash bar on the northern side of red rock casino. But don't be fooled, despite the warm entrance, lies a horrid truth. A dissatisfied empty stomach! Every meal on the list was completely overpriced but even that isn't what motivate such a low 2 star rating from me. Not only was I ignored by 1, but by 2 servers. I came in with 2 others and we sat at our table and each ordered 1 order of their unlimited wings for national wing day. Our friend also ordered 1 steak fries recommended by our waiter to share, having been told us the steak fries were perfect to share between the 3 of us. Laughable. The fries $8, were made from 1 single potato, consisting of 7 pieces. I counted.. It wasn't enough to feed a squirrel.. But besides our misleading waiter, what annoyed me was his lack to keep with our order. I also asked if we could use the check in offer on yelp for a glass of wine.. One that never came! When our food finally came out, instead of individual plates, we were given 1 plate to share the wings. But it didn't even compensate by adding more wings to the plate, it was simply done to make their serving easier on them. And when we asked for 1 more sauce cup, it also was lost along with our Houdini server. So we then asked Criss Angel, the chef who also vanished along with our nonexistent extra sauce as well. I was amazing at their vanishing act but left distressed in the process. It took 3 hours to get 2 dishes of wings.. All you can eat in the course of 12 hours?  The only single redeeming quality in service wasn't even from our host, but the water boy. He filled our water cups and our drinks and even tried to fill in and do the service that our host lacked at one point for him. I think this kid should take over and the waiter be demoted.  **update in case there is a misunderstanding in this review. The wing day deal of 10$ per person was clear to us prior to coming here and we ordered it that way as well, there was no miscommunication on that. But what was disappointing was receiving 1 plate of wings for 3 separate unlimited wing orders. Instead of giving 3 individual plates to each of us, I mean, we did order separately, why are we all sharing on 1 plate for? If we all order steak dinner are we gonna be given 3 steaks on 1 plate or 3 plates with 1 steak? That's my issue. It created a shorter meal, longer wait time for our orders to come through, less sauce for our wings, and horrible service.

-6E3u2nIP1fmsOJH_3Ctlg.text: There are so many things I really like about Hearthstone. Unfortunately, the things I do not like cloud the experience there.  In spite of the major issue I have with Hearthstone, I will definitely come back.  It's the kind of place I want to work. And the issue is incredibly "fixable."  The issue is the service. The employees are very kind and accommodating. My issue is not with the staff but with the system of service. Let me say this was my second meal at Hearthstone and the service during the first meal was abysmal. But the restaurant was new and I was looking forward to getting back to see what changes had been made. While their service has progressed by leaps and bounds, there are still some confusing missteps that keep this place from being an excellent venue.   It begins when you call. I called a few times the same day (for different reasons) and each time the phone was answered with an informal yet relatively friendly, "Hello." I was taken aback each time and had to ask on the last call if I had even reached the business.  I don't know the last time I made a reservation and did not hear the name of the business.  It's an odd experience to have to say, "Is this Hearthstone?"  Then there were issues at the hostess stand. The hostess was friendly and sorted everything out, but there were very serious communication issues at the hostess stand during our first visit as well. This seems to be an area they need to tighten up. We arrived on time for our reservation and were content to wait at the hostess stand to be helped. While we were waiting for the hostess to return another couple stepped behind us. After a few minutes, the man behind us become frustrated and went to go find the hostess. When he returned with the hostess behind him, she apologized to him and his guest and was preparing to seat them without even acknowledging us. We had to tell her that we had been waiting longer and expected to be seated first. She apologized (this time to us) and seated us.   When we sat down we were promptly forgotten and had to ask a manager for menus. People seated some time after us were ordering food by the time we received a menu. Not a huge deal and the waiter was very kind. But it was another odd glitch in service that just doesn't serve this space well.   Once we made contact with our waiter, service was fantastic and we enjoyed our experience. The space has the earthy/industrial vibe that so many places have. But they marry it well with Italian country kitchen touches so that it feels less industrial and more warm. It feels good to be in there. And they get lots of light, so an early dinner means you will enjoy plenty of natural light even if you are not sitting on the patio.   The menu is simple/rustic and thoughtful. Lots of flatbreads, charcuterie, and small bites appetizers make for varied options when ordering. We tasted the meat and cheese board, deviled eggs, roasted broccoli, arugula salad, baked ricotta (OUTSTANDING), marinara flatbread, and popcorn. Everything was very tasty and well prepared. I love that they let the simple ingredients shine. Of all the dishes we enjoyed, only one (deviled eggs) did not reach its potential.  I like the tapas/small plates explosion because it allows people to try more dishes without having to commit to a large portion. The menu at Hearthstone is one of their strengths. It is simple and I love that the offerings all "go together". You can order a few of the small bites, a few appetizers, a flatbread, and a main course and feel a sort of cohesion to the food and ingredients.  Unlike some tapas places, the food items here are generally familiar. They take simple ingredients and prepare them thoughtfully with a small (and very safe) twist. For example, you have had ricotta cheese before, no doubt.  You may not have had ricotta with truffle honey and gouda on toast. Hearthstone offers this delectable dish I want to return for.  Overall: The food is simple, well prepared, rustic(ish), and most importantly, tasty.  If they weren't also attempting (like most restaurants) to offer an experience, I would ONLY judge them on the food. But they are and I can't. I have to look at the totality of my experience at Hearthstone and say that they have the potential to be a really great local restaurant. The service issues are "small" but consistent and frequent. And unfortunately those issues take away from my experiences with the appetizing food at Hearthstone.

ico515JTIr2Pg0GcBCaogg.text: Hearthstone is awesome! I've been here a few times and it's great. Food is good and the drinks are great! There is an area off of the bar with cozy couches and live music that is just great! Perfect date spot. The drinks are awesome and the wine list is great! They have som really yummy wines by the glass which is always a plus! I will be back to hearthstone for sure!!

WHXttfgWXu04vXxrYP61uw.text: I love this place! If you want great food and a fun environment, this is definitely the place!!! It's a nice rustic type of restaurant with plenty of great deals for happy hour and deals on wed! $1 raw oysters! You can't beat that. Beer and wine selection is really great as well. A must try if you haven't already.

ahs-DsnJXTKkK0-dILuXSw.text: Came for my friends birthday and it was so fun. Half off bottles of wine and lots of options to satisfy everyone in our party. Kelli was awesome and checked on us often. Would recommend!

PKfCxrdvMjZFEZuRlhEiiw.text: Came in on a Thursday. It was actually busier than I thought it would be, but we still got seated immediately. Did a couple of appetizers to share, the ricotta was probably my favorite. Kelly was our server and it's rare to find someone with a good sense of humor and fun to make the experience. We'll be back to try the happy hour and $1 oysters!

ksRBzS33I4nTFfDDbVgi3A.text: Hearthstone is the restaurant in the station group that I visit the most. I've been here many times for dinner, and I like some of the items a lot. This location is also convenient to me. Hence, I kept coming back. As for brunch, I was only here once and I didn't like the options nor the entree I had.   The service was decent when I visited this week. It can be hit or miss.   On my recent visit, they changed the menu again and took out some of my favorites including steak tartare and FG&J(it just came back and it's gone again). The whole dining experience was disappointing with some of the new items. I will list them out in below.   1. Baked Ricotta (3/5): this dish no longer came with small jar of truffle money on the side, or they forgot? It did not taste the same with it. This is my must order dish each time, so I was highly disappointed. I guess I will need to ask for truffle honey on the side next time to see if it still tastes the same.   2. Tuna Tartare (1/5): it was sooo terrible. The fish wasn't that fresh. They might as well call this salty tuna. It was so salty that we couldn't psychically  eat it.   3. Brussel Sprouts (1/5): it was burnt and bitter. We had to send this back to the kitchen because it was not inedible. I never had crispy Brussels sprouts this bad.   4. Oysters (4/5): they are $1 each on wed, so not much complaints there for the quality of the oysters.   5. Apple and Quinoa Salad (3/5): it was decent. We added the chicken with it and the chicken was kinda of meh.   6. Lollipop Chicken Wings (4/5): this was one of the new items that I've tried and it was one of the few items that we liked this time.   7. Shrimp and Grits (3/5): I love shrimp and grits. I often order it when I see it on the menu. Shrimp was fresh and the sauce was yummy. However, the grits was not fully cooked and it was still touch and crunchy.   8. Wood Roasted Octopus (3/5): it was decent. Not the best nor the worst one I've had. It seemed lack in flavors compared to before. Also, there used to be two octopus arms, now just one?   9. Upside Down Pineapple Caked (5/5): it was the savior of our dinner. The cake was warm and soft. Not too sweet just the way we like it. I will order this again.   In all, the whole dining experience was terrible to try some of the new items on the menu, and even the existing  menu items were not the same. We asked the waitress to send back the Brussel sprouts. She didn't bother to ask other items so we didn't tell her about the salty tuna tartare nor the uncooked grits. I really want to be a repeat customers since I really liked the place at one point. I hope that they will reorganize the menu and fix the existing items on the menu.i

FKQpBIwtQHcEYJBwZcH06g.text: I had brunch here with a group of friends last Sunday. The restaurant was busy but we had a reservation, so I highly recommend making one ahead to avoid long wait times. We were seated in the private dining room due to our party size. While that offered us less noise and more elbow room, it seemed to also make us easily forgettable. It took a while to get water and drinks and also longer than usual to place our orders. All of us opted for the bottomless mimosas but I would not get them again. The orange juice was sour and there was too much pulp in the mix. The chicken and waffles I had was good, but I felt it was overpriced. Overall, an underwhelming experience for the money.

VIfYBMOOietMK6h1j3oMGw.text: Thanks to Russell, we were invited back to give Hearthstone another chance. We are thankful because it was AMAZING! The hanger steak was cooked beautifully and the rotisserie chicken was moist and juicy. The side of garlic aioli was superb.   Our waitress Melissa was super attentive and friendly. The AGM Russell checked on us throughout the night and was professional and gracious.   The restaurant is clean with a rustic atmosphere. They have the game playing and it makes dinner that much more enjoyable.   We will definitely be back! Thanks again!   PS.. don't forget to try the cherry bread pudding! :)

6FTAhXtyzvxPi0mympAvOg.text: WoW! Hearthstone has become our new favorite spot! We decided to give this place a second chance after hearing they have new management  The ambience-live band from LA (Jill and Julia) played songs and the loudness was perfect, not too loud but enjoyable and still able to have a conversation  The service-our waiter Rigo was on point! Our drinks were always filled and he even noticed when we were out of sauce without us having to ask. From check in to leaving, other staff members were attentive and professional. The manager Russell checked up on us and was friendly. We saw him helping around and attending other tables.   The food-we both had the specials, fried sea bass with lobster risotto and asparagus/steak with brussels sprouts and sweet potato fries! We also had the tuna tartar and oysters...so delicious! For desert we had the banana upside down cake.   We had a great date night and can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E0V2Y5t7FO03qs7D0dI_HQ.text: The food at this spot was dynamite.  The prime rib was hands down the best I have ever had.  The beet salad was so delicious I wanted to take one home, and the fried chicken was crispy and so flavorful.  I can't stop with just the food, though.  The service was outstanding and the atmosphere was splendid.  We sat outside and enjoyed the sun while indulging in great eats!  I will be back...and that's a long drive from Chicago.

TIJ1Q0PXodemYt6R-XqxHA.text: My husband and I came here for Las Vegas Restaurant Week for the first time. This is somewhere we have both been wanting to try but wow were we disappointed! We spent over $100 on very mediocre food. To start we had the apple quinoa salad, which to our surprise, came out much smaller than the regular size and did not have chicken. We also had the calamari which was very tasty. The hanger steak was very small for the regular menu price of $33 and had zero flavor. Even the aioli served with it just tasted like mayo. I had the truffle pasta and while the portion was good and the flavor was decent, it had very small pieces of prosciutto and the sauce was the consistency of water. We were so bummed by the meal so far that we were really hoping the desserts would save the day!... they also failed miserably. Bread pudding is by far my favorite dessert and while this one definitely had a glazed donut flavor as advertised, it was very mushy and just tasted like a soggy donut. The pineapple upside down cake should be renamed dry lemon cake. Aside from the pineapple slice, there was no pineapple flavor. The white tsp serving on top is the vanilla ice cream... The 2 stars I gave were for the ambience (very nice retro farmhouse vibe) and the service because our server was very nice and attentive.

cWvb3uF-_JY-_HLUnsx0mQ.text: Excellent food, beautiful restaurant and good service. I missed happy hour but would return again to try that as well

JLSofxlkaIAOgDl2I5Wa0A.text: Went here after winning at Bingo and wanted to take my mom to a nice dinner.  We ordered food to share, ordered a Cobb salad, pizza and roasted Brussel sprouts.  The waiter told us we made good choices and that they were well known for their pizza.   We received the salad first it was just ok wouldn't eat the chicken it was not appetizing it looked like it was opened from a package and dumped on it.  They finally brought our pizza and believe you me I would not have ordered it, it tasted terrible and the Brussels sprouts were burnt and had absolutely no flavor.  I have been in town for over 47yrs and have eaten at the Red Rock many times, worst meal I have ever had there.  Don't have to worry about me spending money there again.  Had Blaze pizza the next night and it was better than the pizza at hearthstones.  The service lacked after we had our order taken as they had 2 big parties there so I understand that a table with 2 people don't count as much.

R1qn_UZCTzw6_q3CjrMVoA.text: I came here on Tuesday for the tacos and unlimited tequila and margaritas for $25 which is a fantastic deal. Server was nice and we got a free hummus plate for the yelp check in. Unfortunately the hummus was blah and they didn't offer any vegan/ vegetarian options for their taco plate so I had to spend a little more to eat. Overall other than the food disappointment the experience was nice and they kept my margarita filled for the full duration of my time there! I might consider going again but hope that they add a bean/potato/mushroom taco option for their taco Tuesday deal! I bet they would get more business!

vpowdWuNFc7HcmNJ3u8bow.text: Yummy in my tummy! We came here for fathers day with a large party and had a reservation. We called in a week prior, and Michele was able to get our resveration in the wine room. We were seated promptly. The place is a modern bar-staraunt with indoor and outdoor seating. The wine room was dark, but they turned the lights on brighter for us. It isnt FULLY private because parts of the ceiling is exposed so closing the doors still kept the volume outside louder than expected but it was still nice. Since it was Sunday at 2pm we were still in the brunch menu. I had the loco moco and WOW! It was so full of flavor, meat nice and tender and egg yolks perfectly melty. My father in law got the strawberry french toast and he said that was the best breakfast food he has ever had. The kids had pizza, which was eaten up. And my hubs got the french dip. He said the meat was well seasoned and the au jus was a nice addition. We will be back. And surprisingly, even on a busy day, the waitress was very kind and attentive. Cant wait to brunch here again.

zf1IxM2wxCAiD-uYdHFpVg.text: Annie was a great waitress and very friendly! She offered good options to eat and drink. The food was delicious we got the pizza, pigs in a blanket, sweet potato fries, and checked in to get the hummus for free. Everything was tasty and we will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus and fries

qQU4itVPOCjDVgRMSD_jjg.text: Coming again !!  This was my first time dining at Hearthstone and my son and I LOVED it. He's a vegetarian and enjoyed the Impossible Burger and I had the Cobb Salad and the Baked Ricotta that my server suggested. It was amaaaazing. The portions are shareable and the restaurant is beautiful. I will definitely recommend this spot to friends visiting Vegas.  Ask for Elisa! She is seriously the sweetest and was so helpful with my son's dietary needs!

64Yk0ycT_u2oYh69ydJw8w.text: Love this place. Best brunch. Avocado toast is amazing. Great atmosphere. Vegetarian friendly.

SrnOeQc798LuOaNdO3UQow.text: My wife hyped the place up.  The menu is a disappointment and when I got my food. I was right about not wanting to try it.  I ate the fried chicken. The breading was so tough I woke up with my gums hurting. It was super tough to chew. I don't know if they deep fried it for too long but it was juicy at all. We should've went to Lucille BBQ next door. I never been there either. Well I give a shit next time.  Also had a ceasar salad made from Russell sprouts. Nothing special tastes like cole slaw.

VzUaHQ2KHTGvjlhExuA77Q.text: Do yourself a favor...GO TO HEARTHSTONE!   My wife and I went while on a little trip checking out the Summerlin area out and stopped for Oysters and apps.  I had a martini and we ordered the lollipop chicken wings (incredible) and the brussel sprouts.  What most impressed me about this place was the service.  I run a hospitality company in California and we are considering a move to the area and this, by far, was the best dining experience we have had so far.  We had Shane as our waiter and he was INCREDIBLE!!!!  He was knowledgeable, courteous, friendly, and had some incredible suggestions and really helped to guide us through the menu.  He absolutely made the experience wonderful and had incredible situational awareness and EQ and was there when we needed him, but didn't hover.      I spoke with the general manager Russell later on and thanked him for the experience and you could tell through the conversation (and from what I could tell watching him around the restaurant) that he worked hard, and really cared about his team.  The restaurant was well laid out and the music was the perfect volume, quiet enough to allow us to talk, but loud enough to set the ambiance.  I will 100% be back as soon as I am back in town and especially as I move to town!  Thank you Hearthstone!

8fuLEZwk11Uds2Uj5WZCVg.text: Edit: I was contacted by management and offered another meal at their restaurant, that's good service. I will update this review once I eat there again but they're already doing better than two stars.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------  Disappointed.   My sister and brother-in-law flew to Vegas for my birthday and stayed at Red Rock Casino and said that they'd like to take me dinner. I chose Hearthstone for dinner after walking through the casino and seeing shishito peppers on the menu, one of my favorites.  We had a reservation and were seated quickly, no complaints. We ordered two appetizers, the shishito peppers and baked truffle ricotta. We ordered salads to follow, my sister ordered the beet salad and my brother-in-law and I each ordered  an apple & quinoa salad. For our mains my sister ordered the zucchini ribbons pesto, my brother-in-law ordered short ribs and, on the servers recommendation, I ordered the hanger steak.  The server said we could order everything at once and they would stagger the courses, so we did. This is when the problems started.   Someone that we'd never seen brought the salads out before our appetizers. When we were halfway through the salads the baked truffle ricotta arrived, delicious but should have been served first. We expected the peppers (why I even chose the restaurant) to show up shortly, but didn't. We had to ask our server about them and it was clear that they were forgotten or overlooked, and they took at least another ten minutes to arrive, almost as the mains did. Our mains arrived but my hanger steak and shoestring fries, that were recommended, were room temperature at best. I only mentioned it when my sister asked how my steak was. I didn't want to complain about a meal she was treating me to for my birthday. She asked me if I wanted to send it back, but I didn't want it to seem like I didn't appreciate the meal, as both she and my brother-in-law's meals we're both seemed tasty and hot.   How do you thumb your nose at a gift?  The courses were not staggered or served in the right order, maybe if I'd received my steak first it would have been warm, who knows how long it was sitting there. It's hard to appreciate the appetizers when they are served after the salads as promised..and one's MIA. Although the steak was cooked as I asked it was cold. How long was it sitting on the pass??  The food was tasty, don't get me wrong. The letdown occurred between the kitchen and the table I think. The courses got mixed up or lost, and that ruined the whole experience. Normally I would have said something but this dinner was a gift which made it uncomfortable.  IF I ever eat there again I hope the service is better. The food is good, and probably better when it's warm, but I can't say for sure.  P.S. It wasn't busy when we went, so that wasn't the problem.

W2Z778KqAgc1Jo12Oi8tcw.text: This place situated at the Red Rock Casino is a great place for brunch on Sunday with the option of bottomless mimosas.  I went here on a weeknight and sat outside which had a very chill vibe.  The menu is pretty varied but provides a good options even for the pickiest of eaters.  I decided to go with the pizza with smoked salmon and caviar and although it may sound odd, it was really good.  This place is good for groups.  Not sure if its the best place for kids.  If the weather is good,  I recommend sitting outside enjoying a good drink amongst your friends.

wF15fQTK0LCI7pEWvaWLuA.text: My girls and I came here for the first time on a Sunday for their brunch and bottomless mimosas. Made reservations the day of just in case it got busy. The set up and layout of the restaurant was super cute. It had a rustic feel to it. We sat outside on the patio and the weather was nice. The server always noticed whenever we needed another pitcher of mimosa when ours was empty. Food seemed a little pricey, but reasonable for the portion. We will definitely be back!

_Cnr6tIqgEAGuTKsdQXBEA.text: We live in the area, came for our first visit on Sunday after some shopping. We arrived at 3:25pm and was told that the brunch had ended and that dinner doesn't start until 5pm. We were given a very small menu (approx 10 items between appetizer, side and entree). They said it's a down time for the kitchen (between 3-5pm).  Wish we would have known before parking in this busy parking lot. We were looking forward to their steak and lobster roll, but oh well~ we tried.

qFeWL6-I0pk7vvJAdQ1MtA.text: I've heard good things about this place. I've seen pictures of what seemed to be delicious food from here.  This place is spacious but it gets really noisy. The service was just alright. I guess they change their menu every season so, whatever items I took a mental note of for me to try were not available. And the roast pig has to be ordered at least 24 hours in advance.  Bacon-wrapped Dates: We've seen this so many times before. The bacon wasn't evenly cooked - a portion is nice and crisp, and some portion is pink. 3/5  Octopus: Beautifully grilled, nice and tender. There's hummus at the bottom. 3/5  Brussels Sprouts Caesar Salad: I think this proves the reason why people think healthy food is pricey. It is pricey for what it is and what it tastes like - uninspired. 1/5  The other dishes we tried and we're just ok: Calabrian Shrimp Pasta: 2.5/5 Lobster Roll: 2/5 Fried Chicken: 3/5

7Nn0fd4u6mdDEzWTi8d8XA.text: I love Hearthstone we also eat here once or twice when we stay at Red Rock. They took off the tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwich which was a staple in our ordering. Please put this back on the menu!!!!  Service is always good along with their yummy pizza and creamy shrimp and grits.

DiE03I0gZpgp-UB84_p5_w.text: Friendly staff. Great wine selection. Kim the bartender offered a great red blend. I appreciated that it wasn't the most expensive offer which is easy to do. Great ambience. Food was pretty delicious. Overall great experience.

bBiCW5Jfb_tmuJDrdQ-kLw.text: This is by far one of my favorite places to go! Amazing food, yummy drinks and a stunning atmosphere. Love sitting on the patio on 1$ oyster nights and watching the sunset.

e4meYTe6CYnxoAw_E2G_lg.text: What's good: The atmosphere. On a nice day, this is a great place to go if you're trying to enjoy the weather with a glass of wine. It's air-y and some nights they have live music as well and service was fairly good.   What's bad: The food. I was there for happy hour so my review is based off of a lot of the happy hour bites. The jalapeno hummus was accompanied by a "crispy lavosh", which was really just a bland cracker. The harvest quinoa salad was OK (I did enjoy the dressing) and the chickpea chopped salad was just not good. The wings were tinnyyy (so get two orders if that's your dish of choice). To end on a positive note, the one satisfying plate was the sweet potato fries, mainly because of the Harissa yogurt that came with it. It was creamy and light!
