Wlk15nF6hhzTBRPJclqa5A.text: The service - Not great! The waiter was snarky, dismissive, and inattentive.  The food - Excellent! Especially the prime rib dip and the fried chicken.   The ambiance - Cool!  The menu - Limited.   The prices - High.

mV8UEcuZyiw-xeN8i0r9pA.text: I decided to give this place a try for Father's Day because they were offering one free Entree for dad.   Dad and I almost always get two different plates and then share. After feeling very indecisive over all the good sounding options, we finally settled on Chicken & Waffles and the Pimento Cheeseburger. I felt like this took a little while to come out, but I was very hungry and they were pretty busy due to it being a holiday.   Unfortunately, when I food did arrive, we had a problem. We were pretty sure we'd been sent the wrong burger by mistake. There was no Pimento Cheese in sight. When I asked about it, they insisted that it was the right burger. I apologized, but said I didn't understand. Where was the Pimento Cheese?? They explained that it was underneath the patty....Well, all I saw was a mayo sauce that might have had Pimento in it. But the only Cheese was a slice of Cheddar on top of my burger. So this wasn't a burger "with Pimento Cheese" as the menu explained. Instead, it was a cheeseburger with a Pimento sauce. Again, I apologized and explained that we ordered this burger with something completely different in mind and really weren't interested or impressed with what came out and asked if we could possibly get something else. Thank goodness, the waitress said yes. So dad picked the adult grilled cheese.   While we waited on the new sandwich. We dug into the Chicken. It's served in the form of sandwich - one fourth of a waffle on the top and bottom with the chicken in between. I happened to take mine apart so I could put syrup all over to find something odd. While the top of my fried chicken looked normal, the underside was naked.....the meat was pulling away from the crunchy skin of batter and looked dry and unimpressive. So strange. And again, another problem of an inaccurate menu - the menu said the plate came with a wheat waffle. Nope. This was a regular waffle. And unfortunately, not even a good one. The whole thing was over soft and cakey. No crisp on the outside and fluff on the inside.   But finally or Grilled Cheese arrived and it made up for a number of sines by being pretty awesome! It was absolutely oozing a thick layer of cheese out the side. And the sweetness of the bacon jam perfectly paired with the soft, round flavor of the truffle.   When the bill came, I saw that they only charged us for the least expensive Entree! I appreciated this considering the food, on the whole, being less than impressive. Also, while out waitress was never rude exactly, she always made me feel like she only ever had two seconds to talk and something much more important to do. In the end, I'm going with a 3/5 because of the awesome grilled cheese and the good deal we were given when it came to price. But I can't say that I was given any real reason to come back and try something else. Especially since you can't trust the menu and dot actually know what you'll be getting.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger that was supposed to have Pimento Cheese. Nope. Just a slice of Cheddar and a Pimento mayo (in which I saw no pimento)
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; &#34;Whole Wheat&#34; Waffles - nothing whole wheat about it
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The underside of my fried chicken from Chicken &amp; Waffles. Not impressed....

hBnyotrv56VQvEUrg_qX8w.text: Surprisingly pleased with the food here!  I'm always skeptical of restaurants linked to hotels.  The hallmark is usually mediocre food for expensive prices.  The prices are still expensive here but the quality of food allows you to justify the price.  We tried the hummus and buffalo wings for appetizers, those I thought were just mediocre.  The real star of the show was my lobster roll with brown butter aioli.  Yum!  I've lived on the east coast, so I know my way around lobster rolls.  The bread was nicely toasted and the lobster was generous and the brown butter aioli definitely helped elevate the flavors.  A few ladies ordered the pizzas and those also looked delicious.  I'm already planning my next trip back for the prime rib sandwich!  We were afraid that this place would not be kid friendly, so my husband and I have not come here with our daughter.  However, I saw quite a few families with kids and this place is loud, so screaming children can be drowned out by the noise.  Only knock, is it almost takes an act of God to get water refilled....

23BRNGSLvtenc8wdKyaZlQ.text: Went for happy hour and they had their $1 oyster special. Save your dollar.  Not only were they tiny they smelled like fish so it was a sign they are not fresh The pizza was as tiny as the oysters and the pigs in a blanket were a joke. This was more like a happy meal and not happy hour considering the prices paid. I forget the name of the bread and cheese but it was good. If the happy hour menu is any indication of what they serve normally then count me out.

BpH96Ta1L3_fD8Dc_sqyXg.text: Amazing service.  Rigo was our server - very impressed by how well he took care of us.  Food was great at well.  Loved the atmosphere and had a great conversation with the manager.  You can tell they care about their customers.  I will be back.

iFZEOma3bJOJRofBBnlSCQ.text: I tried Sunday brunch and went to a wine event here. The food is pretty good, but I am not sure it is worth the price. I have ordered a wide variety of  dishes from the menu, but they seem to have expensive decoys like Fruit compote. I feel like they call it a compote and charge you $6 where if it was just a fruit bowl it would have been $4.  They have an extensive and yummy wine menu. I like how when I checked in with yelp I got a free glass of wine. I will be back for the alcohol.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit compote

Mjhx0uQExrzeglII3-YNOQ.text: This is my favorite brunch place in summerlin. They have healthy choices, bottomless mimosas for $15, great tvs for NFL football Sundays, and any other sport for that matter, the best bartender Jay and the best waitress Jade! Ask for them! It's close to the sportsbook if you want to make a bet and when the weather is nice it's all open to the outside unlike all the other closed bars. So you can enjoy the weather, watch football, and have a drink all at the same time. I highly recommend Hearthstone at any time of day.

8JgLQaq76PTKPPz2_vMLjQ.text: I've been to Hearthstone loads of times and here's what I love about it:  1. I can show up in anything from shorts and a tank top to a full on "going out" outfit. 2. The wings. Believe me, order them, they are delicious. 3. So many oysters! 4. Happy hour 5. Solid service - both at the bar and at tables. 6. Great vibe. 7. Brunch!! 8. Great patio dining  Things I don't love:  1. A little overpriced for the quality of what you get. 2. The menu isn't insane amazing and doesn't have a lot of variety.  3. Some of the dishes are overcomplicated for no reason. I'd love some more simple dishes done well (like the wings, trust me).  Overall - great place for a date, brunch, a happy hour, or a pre-movie dinner (and did I mention their wings)?

BSEQ5u6jo-s81LHoKlTgRw.text: This place had great food and the waiters were super friendly. We got a ton of appetizers: Mac and cheese (Best dish hands down), oysters, cheese dip, poke (which my friends raved about), meatballs, and a cheese and salami plate. We were so full off appetizers, but the dinner was also delicious. Nathan was our waiter, he was super friendly and attentive to our requests. We're definitely making this place a regular, since we're new in town from CA.

tqhg9lmjo9yYB-Y3ivXvBQ.text: First time at Heartstone...had an AMAZINg time. Kelsey, Denzel and Jordan at the bar were GREAT! Look forward to coming back soon! Outstanding service and perfect ambiance.

6njgfPQhTO13zvo-txbRzg.text: The restaurant is in a good location, and it's very spacious inside. Good for large groups. I went for brunch. I had the chicken and waffles with a side of bacon. I thought it tasted good, someone else thought the chicken lacked flavor. But everyone's taste buds are different, so you be the judge. I was disappointed that the free check in offer is only valid for dinner. Here's the issue: I don't know why restaurants don't separate the checks, it just makes it more difficult on the staff and there's ALWAYS a problem. I had a $20 off of $60 purchase coupon which helped, that I was able to use. We had about 17 people in our party. Thank goodness we all brought cash. For some reason, there was an extra amount of about $90 on our ticket and management couldn't figure out why. So what ended up happening is, 1 of the girls in our party was given a business card from accounting and would be notified when the issue was resolved. Never would've happened if they just gave us each our check with our own order. I'd probably return, just in a smaller number, so maybe, just maybe I can get my own individual receipt.

0nN7NGiCsfaiSXiIXMmqxA.text: Love the atmosphere, the food is amazing, shuffle board is a blast. PATIO! It's a great place to go without being in a bar atmosphere.

Glw6AaTUcP4nEU1awlgsgA.text: It was a great place to go to in Vegas the service was awesome but the cheese on my pizza was sliding off of the slice

NNWV_KenHDtD2rFJPU_M_w.text: We came here for happy hour/ lobster boil. We were seated outside but opted to go in since it started drizzling but as soon as we got inside it's like we didn't even have a waiter anymore. We were seated by the pizza bar and no one bother to came and checked on us. Our waiter from outside came once to give our check we had to ask the hostess for more water and more food we wanted to order.   Chicken wings happy hour came with 4 pieces lol never even seen that before. Lobster boil was ok. I didn't get potatoes on my plate but my bf got like 5 lol it was nothing special i mean it's lobster. A little overpriced!   Decor was nice but the whole experience was just not good. Service was terrible!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eYsvwbgdKEw3i-wpNwynyg.text: The restaurant was amazing great food and an awesome atmosphere. What made our dinner better was out server Ahmed. He really knew the dishes and what might go with it. Will definitely be going back because of the great service he provided

Ua3P3PC2jrG6xrdjTHwKFA.text: In red Rock Casino.. American food with a twist vertu delicious definitely will go back .. great ambiance an staff especially Travis he was very helpful on what to order an he certainly didn't let me down..

IzuS4n3zxRQmLH5X4-bx4Q.text: I am compelled to write this review having only eaten our appetizers/tapas. I am waiting in anticipation for main course--which I am certain, if as great as the rest of the food and service, will be superb.   The atmosphere is perfect--enough bustle and background noise for a great group outing but not so overbearing that you cannot engage in intimate conversation with your table.  The Baked Ricotta is an ABSOLUTE MUST HAVE if you are here. you'll never have anything like it again and you'll be wanting more of it!!   service is great--you're in Las Vegas and that's what we're known for!   Kaleo (the GM) has this place running the way a restaurant SHOULD...the behind the scenes details that make the experience top of the line.   I'll be back my next trip home to LV! Looking forward to bringing friends and family back for another divine night out.

0GzGkpG8qntyAs4UoyDkLg.text: We decided to meet some friends for cocktails and apps and wanted to give this place a run. Well very unimpressed, food fair, service...not so much and the drinks..joke. Get this Tito's and Goose $15 bucks, really!

iFgLo1E2ESVabqG9xEXz8A.text: This is hands down my favorite place to be for brunch. It's a bummer it's not closer to me - the decor is modern and rustic and it's just gorgeous. The food is amazing!!! And the staff is friendly. I love the menu, I really just love everything about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichokes!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s pick!

xKy8Z3Yc4TkC5Canm7vYMw.text: Hearthstone is located in Red Rock Casino which is so close to my new place so I was excited to try it out. We came with a larger group for cinco de mayo and actually planned on going to Mercadito, but Mercadito was slammed so we went next door instead.   Hearthstone is gorgeous!! Totally my scene, with big comfortable chairs and great ambiance. We decided to sit outside because it was such a nice day. I can totally imagine going there on a warm Vegas night and sitting outside enjoying myself. We had dinner reservations late on the strip so we just wanted to order a few apps and a couple drinks. However, I loved the variety of unique food options. They have flatbreads, jams, but some heftier dishes, as well.  I ordered a sparking sangria on drink special. It was very tasty, but at $12 it was less of a special and more of cocktail-on-the-strip prices. I also had just got the sparkling sangria a few days before at Kona Grill which was twice as good at a quarter of the price. I got the parmesan/truffle popcorn and the mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was just ok. I prefer stronger flavors and it was somewhat bland. However, the popcorn was so yummy and it was a large portion, enough to share with an entire table. I also enjoyed their presentation of the food on their menus. The service was attentive and friendly and the prices were somewhat high, but you have to remember that it is a casino restaurant.   I can't wait to come back with the girls for happy hour. Such a gorgeous place!

_7ytUoDvztSoQXAbl_YHdg.text: Love the ambiance! The menu is unique and full of fun items with bold flavors.   We grabbed some drinks and small bites here while waiting for a table over at Mercadito. The white sangria was refreshing and the perfect amount of sweet. The bacon wrapped dates were on the larger size, placed in a red sauce and the flavors were both sweet and savory. We also ordered the truffle popcorn, chicken wing lollipops and macaroni and cheese. I loved the wings! They had just enough buffalo sauce on them, the meat was tender and they were easy to eat without the typical chicken wing mess. The popcorn was a great snack layered with Parmesan cheese and just a hint of truffle oil. The mac and cheese was a little on the dry side for me but the noodles were cooked perfectly. This is a fun place with an open concept, eclectic furniture, a nice lounge area for quick drinks and socialization and a great patio. I will be back to try brunch or more of the menu.

HfEilNox-qIMlpqTJV-0GQ.text: Meh. Cool setting and the patio area is very nice. The staff is slowww. When we arrived it wasn't very busy and they were adequately staffed but we still ended up waiting 30 min for a table. There were many unoccupied tables but they are not cleaned. The staff are laid back and doesn't hustle. After we finally sat down, we waited another 10 min for someone to come give us the menu. The food was not very good, I got the loco moco and had to send it back because the rice was not cooked. For how expensive this place is I expected better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We waited 30 minutes for them to bus these tables, is not even busy.

XORtBZj3BfWpvPEmhPEPmg.text: amazing meatball and ricotta pizza. Best pizza in Vegas in my opinion, also a great happy hour drinks and apps for 6 bucks, can't beat it! A must visit place!

biAk8KzylhEVdwPOqkBicg.text: The food is good but the reservation process is horrible and neither management nor the hostesses really care about your patronage.  We have tried a number of times and every time just to get a table it's so painful.  First time we had a reservation at 630 and they didn't sit us until 730 the hostesses were completely indifferent when mentioned. Worse yet when we finally did get in one hour late there are plenty of tables available.  Second time we tried to make reservation by calling ahead but it went straight to voicemail which indicated leave a message and someone will call you right back one hour later still no call back.  We arrived and mentioned this to the hostesses (both exhibiting a16 year old mentality with no clue) and basically got the "oh duh", "the phone doesn't ring to us" response. "Sorry 1 hour wait".  Wow.  We walked in looking for a bar spot .. Found a manager asked to help us..  Told him the entire situation .. His response was he asked us to sit on a couch for dinner. Thats not dining.  No thanks.  He wasn't even concerned about the experience we just had.  We told him we were going to the competitors. He said okay thank you.  Third attempt more of the same.  We spent some time talking to the hostess about our poor experience.. who said her father was a VP of such and such and that's why she got the job there. She admitted to having no experience and believe me it showed. She admitted they purposely stack reservations just to try and create a hype. Ridiculous.  Bottom line if you want to go somewhere where they don't care about you this is your spot considering there are dozens of other great restaurants in the area for both service and food (T Bones, Honey Salt, Echo and Rig, Wolfgang Pucks, Vinter Grill, Flemings, etc), the Light Group should really get their act together here.   We'd recommend staying away and leave it to the tourist to be forced to eat here with sub par experience.

CFsJmEtDOupJvqbVWM6gmQ.text: Amazing place! The truffle appetizer is so good. The shrimp pasta is the best pasta I ever had. The service is so good too. The kiddie make your own pizza is good too. Would definitely come back to this place for the same food.

8DG3UUcC5GzqvzpB9NQ8dA.text: Had a great experience. All the food we ordered was amazing. Cooked well, favors were there, and good sized portions.   Price isn't on the cheap side. But it's a good spot.

7SzuF24R2AoAJip_nrDwhg.text: Delish! A big thank you to the GM for making room for us at the bar in front of the pizza ovens. We came by on a Saturday night without a reservation and it was packed. Every seat was filled, including in the bar/lounge area.  Service was a little choppy. Everyone we interacted with was pleasant, but sometimes few and far between. Management was great. The food was delicious:  -Deviled eggs -Baked ricotta (MY FAV!) -Pepperoni flatbread  We also had some cocktails, champagne and a moscow mule-type of cocktail. The baked ricotta was my favorite! It came with crusty bread slices and a little pot of honey. The perfect starter.  End result, I will definitely return!

_M7sWc2LLYBzH4LiINRLTg.text: Oh boy, where to start..  The wagyu beef burger - seriously, that is not.  It was a perfect copy of In-n-out.   Three hours to get through dinner.  There is a big disconnect between the look of the place and the end result.  Needs a kitchen manager bad.    Not gonna be back. No way.  The staff was friendly, service was fair, but we waited a very long time for the "American" styled tapas.    A few sparks of potential, but the team just could not pull it off.   I lament spending $21 for an In-n-Out burger. When my wife leaned over and said; "Nice cafeteria burger..." I knew this was not gonna end well, and it didn't.   Ugh.

C7XKtTh3veC7F0nl0kkBYQ.text: Came here for a lovely start to my husband and I's anniversary and we were super impressed. Nathan was our server and he was super attentive and always had what we needed before we even asked. The food was great and we will definitely be back again!

gxStMRhcVjV0MC1cWHrRbg.text: They have a great wine tasting event every Thursday.  I also really like the food here!  The only reason its 4 stars instead of 5 is because its a bit smoky from being attached to the casino.  Happy hour menu is also excellent.

Wzbm3-TGy3YAwLp35C1Zsw.text: We wanted to eat here after attending a movie at Regal Theaters. At 6pm the hostess would not seat us because the restaurant was booked until 9pm.  Funny...the restaurant was completely empty many tables available and open for a group of 4 people. There were people at the bar, not sure why we were not offered to sit at the bar for cocktails. Being in the business myself, you never turn away customers when all your tables are empty.  A local in Summerlin and highly educated in customer service and training of employees. I was surprised that that the hostess would not seat us. The Yard House was packed and we were seated right away, The food was awesome at Yard House. I wish my first experience at Hearthstone would have been more favorable, but it was not. I find it very hard the entire restaurant was booked...when tables sat empty at 6pm.

PYmvtWvtYh8jPI_GQj7JzQ.text: Went here with high expectations. Sat at a really cool bar counter right in front of the stove ovens. Great ambience. Really gorgeous restaurant. First we ordered oysters... Delicious! Then we Ordered the fp & j  (foie with pnut &jelly) and a charcuterie board. Thought it was a little tacky you had to pay extra for bread/ honey to come with your meat and cheese board, I have never seen this before but it was only 1$ so hey, whatever.. So we added on truffle honey and bread and purchased a bottle of wine all at the same time.  The food was fabulous! Cheese was perfect temp. Foie was so yummy. But no bread...we were Sat right next to the kitchens expo so I felt guilty bothering here but had to inquire about bread a few times, 10 min later our server shows up with 4 tiny pieces if bread. I ordered more right away. We had cheese, foie and rillette all requiring bread. 10 minutes later our bread order came, I ordered another right away.  Keep in mind we never got our bottle of wine. After the 3rd round of bread we cancelled the wine and told the server politely that we paid 15$ in bread and have waited over half an hour for wine and we weren't even able to finish our charcuterie board. She sent a Manager and they offered complimentary apps and we're really nice and apologetic but by that time we were over it. They comped our charcuteriebut our Bill was still about 100$ for the foi, some oysters and a glass of bubbles.  We most likely won't return. Any place that charges for bread that takes 10 min to get to your table and wine that takes 30+ min is not my cup of tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fp&amp;j, charcuterie board

7z3bB-NNAbLMJMfJdzJlsg.text: Went to happy hour at 5 pm for the first time. During This visit there was great service and awesome food. The second visit was breakfast on a Sunday!  Unless you have 3 hours to wait and complain, save yourself the aggregation!!!  Servers and busers were undertrained. The food was good but at that point I had forgotten what I ordered! Too bad, this could be a good spot if they trained their staff. Btw, the staff was friendly just undertrained!

ntXic4xebq-yCkp0W5YdsQ.text: We have heard nothing but good things about the food at Hearthstone, and we were not disappointed there.  We tried several of their cocktails, as well as 7-8 tapas dishes, and we liked all of them.  Mushroom flatbread and Stuffed dates were both favorites.  Atmospherre was also great.  Very large open space, great decor.  Outside seating.  Best part is, the whole end of the restaurants opens up, to give the room an open air feel.  Can't beat the atmosphere.  The issue for us was the service.  We had a 6:30 reservation, arrived promptly.  The hostess said an outside table was available, and she would come get us at the bar - it was just being bussed.  20 minutes later she still had not come.  I went back to the hostess stand, and she apologized, saying the table still wasn't bussed, and this sometimes happened.   5 minutes later, a different hostess, with a different story, came to seat us, saying it was simpy a miscommunication.  Next issue - once seated, it was 10 minutes before anyone said a peep to us.  No menus, no "I'll be right with you", nothing.  Once the server came, she was very friendly, and excellent.    Final issue, we never got one of our tapas dishes.  We said somethning about midway through, and server checked, and said somethning happened.   Did not arrive until after we were done everything else.  As they are relatively new, we can certainly understand these issues, and will try them again.  Also, consideing how nice the atmosphere was, the delays, while they should not have happened, did not ruin the evening.

6kx7DzJC_9-xT-hrh7sQLA.text: I'm totally into this place! We had seen it on TV a couple of times and we ended up going for dinner. The whole package was great, The decor was great and they had a band playing music. All the food was great and I was very happy when we walked out. I wanted to go back for breakfast the next day but our flight didn't work with the time they opened on Sunday. I can't wait to go back.

QJAxlTkzMNI1JWRnVhddeQ.text: Best ambience, service, & food!!! The ricotta toast, broccoli, macaroni n cheese, & peanut butter lava cake were awesome!!! As far as drinks go, the Pimm 50 was on point! First time here, loved our server.

9XihGC0uXqO9Y-Wm6tK5-Q.text: Beautiful place. We had the heirloom watermelon salad which was fantastic. Our waitress was a joy and knew the menu very well. I had the hanger steak with truffle aioli and crispy potatoes which rocked. Over all a very positive experience. Would go there again and highly recommend a visit.

gBTuOUFdrfqdQYT7ENJqIQ.text: This place is pretty good!! I really love the design of the space. The main complaint I have is the noise level.... it is ridiculously too loud that I could hardly hear anyone at my table. It's quite annoying. I ordered the kale salad, which at first, was pretty dry. After I asked for extra dressing, the salad was amazing!  I would come here again! :)

mqLsJWF0dep-GOtSc-wKyw.text: From the great atmosphere to the awesome food and the wonderful handcrafted drinks this place is a sure hit! They also have a great kids menu.

sPC2h3fEC29VZqlfjarzyQ.text: We were there for an event. Decided to eat there and had their flat bread I wasn't impressed it was doughy.  I also hit my leg on the corner of the step up to their booths. The platform for booths, caused me an injury that I still have not healed from think it could have chipped my bone in my leg. Will not be back to this place.

7gPWtrZfLDa2UyaOE8RBJQ.text: This place is absolutely delicious albeit extremely overpriced. We came in for a few small bites and enjoyed every dish.  The steak tartar was amazing - the truffle bread really made this dish special. The beet salad with goat cheese was probably my favorite.  No, wait I think the mac and cheese was my favorite! I really liked how light the cheese sauce was and the crunch of the cauliflower.  The grilled octopus was also delicious.  I'm not a huge fan of octopus but my husband is and he said that the texture and combination of flavors was really good.  I would definitely say give this place a try because the food is delicious but be prepared to be befuddled by the prices.

74dwp-qXnDXnAbOY5eYgqQ.text: Crab Cakes are the best! A little expensive but worth it. Customer service was very good. Good selection of wine and crafted beer.

Ic0TaSTHltTULJ24uzU5fw.text: I was disappointed.  Service was very slow:  it took over 45 minutes for the waitress to get hummus to the table and it was over two hours before we were served our entrees.  The jalapeno hummus had no kick to it at all:  it just tasted like regular hummus, nothing special.  The chickpea salad had too much of a vinegar flavor for my taste.  The roasted chicken was OK, but the juice that was served with it was sweet instead of savory, and I didn't care for it very much.  The presentations were nice, but the flavor didn't hold up.  We were seated at a table with chairs, and after the first hour of waiting for our food, the seats were very uncomfortable.  Our table was next to a carving station where they cut up the whole suckling pigs that are an option on the menu.  While some people might enjoy watching a pig get carved up, we did not.  And the smell of the roasted pig detracted from our experience.  Hearthstone was loud, had poor service, and mediocre food.  We won't be back.  There are too many other great places in Las Vegas for great meals.

L8BqcYePVN6GgL10OenevQ.text: Had a great meal outside. Service is a bit spotty all throughout so I knocked off a star but food and ambience makes this spot a go to!

mnVwqGy1EsSC7BPl2SsIdw.text: My first time here and I must say the atmosphere is absolutely amazing! I love the customer service and the food! Omg I don't even know where to start!

ub2z8JRQ77VlgKXOHAQZKQ.text: I was so excited to come here.  Two of us arrived at 4pm and the place was very slow with 2 people at the bar and 4 people near the shuffle board area.  The bar was the only area that was providing service.  We were ignored by 2 bartenders for roughly 8 minutes.  They were speaking with the server and did not bother to great us.  I have them the benefit of the doubt and 7 minutes later there was still no greeting.  The experience was very disappointing.  My wife and I walked out disenchanted.

keEZCvZDl5F7IkSlgTmTgQ.text: I don't totally get this place... It seems like it wants to be an upscale nightlife kind of place but falls short... The seating is awkward and not well thought out.... The games encourage the barely 21 crowd to get stupid drunk... Not enough of a vibe to have an actual "scene" and it's efforts to have a "scene" ruins the restaurant vibes...good for a drink and that's about it.

avwRdZ6cTY_N5s0Sjhzxiw.text: awesome place, good ambiance, great food. The service is alittle slow though.

1LjOg04ebxzLbs6q7snKkw.text: My daughter and I went here for Christmas and found that it was a pleasant choice to fit in with an excellent film that we had seen earlier. The service was excellent, perhaps because the restaurant has a large staff to unobtrusively take care of all diners. They had a "Christmas Menu" that seemed high priced at $55.00 a person for almost no choices and food we didn't like. We decided on less expensive a la carte items from the menu which turned out good. I pictured the restaurant being cozy, in keeping with its name. Actually it was a large dining room with widely space tables, a few booths and a counter with views of the kitchen. At first this was disappointing since we were hoping for Christmas decorations. After a few minutes the dining room felt fine, except we were near an entry from outside. Whenever (not often) someone came in, a blast of cold air momentarily hit us. I'd say our experience was very good. Our modest dinner was about $100 with tip and without alcoholic beverages or dessert. Not bad in Las Vegas these days.

FZ17L9s3hwVKUJtyRKd_kQ.text: Website says 10:30am open... Went and said they open at 11am... Fix your damn website. Not only did my husband and I walk away but so did 6 other people... All of which said, they thought this place opened at 10:30 am. Going somewhere else for brunch... Here we come Wolfgang Puck... That also opens at 11 am, so we will go there.

wqn0sXBvDglr_fU3mKILIg.text: Food was delicious but our service was horrible. It took over 15 minutes for anyone to come to our table and greet us with a menu. Then it took a few more minutes to get water. We had three different people come to the table after saying they were going to be a part of the team helping us. The food came out pretty quickly and again the food was yummy. After we were done we waited about 45 minutes to get our check. Then it took another 15 minutes for them to pick up our payment. Horrible horrible service!!!

o29bHy5kjQsvo7oTCrb2gg.text: This place seems to get a lot of buzz on food blogs so I tried it out last night before seeing batman v superman (kill me). Ultimately, while the menu sounds pretty good the restaurant is truly nothing special. The big issue was service, which I will mostly attribute to dining outside but who knows. Long wait for the menus, for the drinks, for refills, for the check...etc. Food came out quickly though. But then of course the food was nothing to rave about. Three things ordered: truffle chicken pizza, hanger steak, and lobster roll. The pizza was good but basically just tasted like a white pizza, the hanger steak was fine but nothing special, and the lobster roll was also fine but kind of bland. Food portions were pretty small and the bill was upwards of $100 which seems like a lot for what we got. Ultimately, if I have a choice between this and ordering 50 quesalupas from t bell I will choose the latter.

6fP_h6StZYHsadgB40Insw.text: The bar staff is great the seafood platter is awesome and unique and tasty dishes. If you're looking for a pizza think Ferris Bueller and try the Abe Froman the sausage king of Chicago

bx_v1Ed9CZpoEWybPsw_Yg.text: This is a great restaurant.  The cuisine is unique and a must for people who love food and not afraid to try something new. We had the jalapeno hummus (complimentary), short rib meat balls, kale Caesar salad, steak tartare and the peanut butter lava cake.  Wow, as mentioned everything unique and delicious.  As for service, we were greeted and sat promptly.  During the evening we were visited by 4 different servers all friendly and helpful, Derek and Chanelle were outstanding!  For those that rate 1 star, cut them a break, they just opened a few weeks ago and Rome wasn't built in a day.  Can't wait to come back for the oysters next Friday :)

Dl_m7WCEX57lHehqJ54Wuw.text: Stopped in with my wife, cool vibe and casual with great food. We shared octopus, tuna carpaccio, steak tar tar, crabby toast, Fb&j toast, lobster polenta and a peanut butter lava cake w butterscotch pudding and roasted banana brown butter ice cream...., yum!!

CtqrEOuk3d6ZMP9kdjhAOw.text: The service was the worst I've ever had.  It would be one thing if the place were busy, but there were no more than 5 or 6 tables full of people in the entire restaurant.  We ordered bottled water.  Someone came around 5 minutes later and gave us tap water, then the waitress showed up another 5 minutes later with the bottled water - surprised that someone else had already brought us water.  The drinks were overpriced and did not taste good, as well as the food.  I would not recommend this place to anyone at all.  We were there over 2 hours because the service was so slow - not because we wanted to be there that long!

MtCpzCz8ubXsCHMrs8Ou7g.text: I'll try to break this review down a bit more than my last (first). I went with a co-worker from the UK.  The atmosphere/look is great, one of the best I've seen here. It doesn't feel like a Strip restaurant. I went at 7pm, around 8 they lower the lights and turn up the music, unnecessary but not bad.    The service was strange, we didn't have one server, so this left us trying to grab someone when we wanted to order an additional item or ask a question. The bartender was the only who made a suggestion. I tried the margarita with carrot juice, a little spicy but very good.    The food was good--not great. We had a meat and cheese board, we opted for the "chef's choice"  because there were so many cheeses and meats to choose from. I thought it would give us an exciting variety but for the price it was underwhelming and a small amount. We also had the stuffed dates which were delicious. I had the rib dish for my entree which was fantastic and my co-worker had a pepperoni flat bread dish which he wasn't a fan of.  For dessert I had an item no longer on the menu which was the only chocolate option-- it was so bad! The server covered it in this almond sauce that then drowned it and made it mush -- steaming almond mush...    so overall I think a three is pretty good, I will definitely come back but I will switch it up and see what else this establishment has to offer. I would still recommend it.

vWP3s5KXhyHeY001owdVMA.text: Has dinner here last night, it was delicious. Items ordered: Charred Octopus, Short Rib Meatballs, Meat & Cheese Plate (Artisanal Meat & Cheese) NY Flatiron Steak with Bone Marrow. Great Service and Wine Selection. Orin Swift "The Prisoner" was ordered for the table, amazing wine.

eCxPXHyW_yomYIg9Ky_h4A.text: Love the decor of this restaurant. I have only had one bad service experience there and it was due to a new member of the wait staff that was a little overwhelmed. It will not stop me from going back. The manager handled the situation with class :)

fRJMWvxYtM6xTa_6mQsu4A.text: The bacon-wrapped dates were pretty good. I loved the peanut butter lava cake, too. My favorite thing was the Honey Badger cocktail; it was amazing! I may have forced my friend to take my so-so Blackberry Bliss and taken his Honey Badger. lol

r1hJtVSiGZKxboVIP3zdqw.text: My wife and I came here a month ago. The service was terrible including the fact it took the server 10 minutes before we were greeted and took our drunk order. We ordered our food immediately with the drink order. We ordered the charcuterie it was pretty lame. I feel that it was compared to store bought lunch meat. The crackers were fresh from a box oh and the whole mustard seed mustard. It was close to what I ate when I was 5 years old and ate a lunch able except the lunch able was much fresher. The entree we ordered was the pizza which some smart expediter put a fist full of salt on the top of the pizza which, made it near impossible to eat. The sides we ordered were potatoes which were the best thing and the Mac and cheese which was undercooked pasta (not al dente but raw). I was told by many people this place was great! Not sure if I would give this place another shot.

b3jh9EV539faMhqxLfYOPA.text: Amazing food & atmosphere!  Great customer service.  This place has the feel of the fun San Francisco restaurants we go to on vacation.

Fc-FCKqNpBL4SR634cfh3A.text: I went to Hearthstone last night with my family for my birthday. Food was good, service was absolutely off point. First off we started with one server and then 29 minutes later had another server. Second round of drinks took three times asking about them and 40 minutes to actually get. Manager did come to table and apologize and took care of those for us. That's fine. Good recovery. Hoped things would get better. They did not. We ordered the roasted potatoes, we asked about them a few times and never got them. Ended up asking them to be removed from our bill. The wrong flat bread was brought to us because our waitress pressed the wrong button. Then the Bronzino we ordered with our entrees to share was also never received because it was never written down when we ordered it. It was a mess. Which is really sad because the food was pretty damn good! Apart from the jalapeno hummus. This was bland. There was no jalapeno flavor and needed salt. The wood fire clams were very good, but are served in an amazing broth and no bread to sop it up with. I did ask for bread because it was a very tasty broth. Plus the items are shared so you can't really pass the bowl around to eat with a spoon. We had a lot of other items that were all good. Drinks were very good, however I got the Pimm's 50 first and then the blackberry drink and then another Pimm's 50 which didn't look like the first one I got, so there was some inconsistency there.   I know this isn't the most eloquent review but I just want Hearthstone to know that the restaurant is beautiful inside. The menu is lovely and the food is very good for the most part. What ruined it for myself and my family was the service and all the mistakes made last night. We didn't even stay to look at or get dessert, and I'm a pastry chef, I love to check out other desserts and menus. We just wanted our of there. Will I go back? Yeah, sure, not anytime soon though. This place needs to get their service in order first. Which is really unfortunate because the food is worth coming back for.

tFNDbdI6DxFP65k8axMVDw.text: First of all, I love the atmosphere inside the restaurant! They did a really good job with the lighting, which is always important to me when eating at a restaurant.  Everything we'd ordered tasted great! We ordered a bunch of stuff and shared family style.  I also want to give a big shout out to Tien! She was very attentive and sweet!  Definitely a great dinner spot to hang with your friends and family!

hhPO4fkZTX_UP_cQx9C0rw.text: I went there Friday night. From chef to a chef your food was Amazing!!! Didn't try everything on the menu but what I did try was WOW!!! Umami was what every chef is looking for!! The oysters were very flavorful, the tuna tar tar was excellent!! Very big fan of oysters!! The waitress did need more knowledge. The wine went perfect with the oysters. The octopus was very flavorful!! Very good with the potatoes and peppers. The prosciutto with the blue cheese and mustard was superb!! Compliments to the chef!!! Thank you for the experience at your restaurant and can't wait to come back to try more. Thank you Chef Ryan Rees & Lorena

n6VByfH2s0mUPXy5LHDFOQ.text: Came here for dinner and it was good but I wouldn't come back. The taste was good but the price wasn't justified. Atmosphere was cool but dinner for 3 was $135

gOAQJqqOPGY8_dMCER7MFg.text: I'm not sure why this place has generated the buzz it has. The food, while good in taste, is overpriced off a limited and rather bland menu. The staff was friendly but clearly hired for their looks. However, I found it hard to have a conversation in here since the music was really loud. Personally this place seems to be an attempt to bring The Strip restaurant experience to Summerlin. Perhaps all the Summerlin and Summerlin wanna-be folks that are into the scene will keep it going. However, I can think of several places to eat nearby that are two-thirds of the price or less.

lCUwOYX7AS5o2DE6k-_80g.text: Delish!! Food never fails to disappoint! So yum

G4ESTPvCWpLwQRHoeHnJRQ.text: Two words: Truffle Honey. As an avid fan of cheese plates and great wine selection this place blew me out of the water, literally my favorite meal. They have so many selections on the cheese and charcuterie and still haven't been able to try them all. They have a great wine list, and by great I mean affordable to high end. Now back to the truffle honey... you have to try it!

vfeIjGhuJS67cKYBUyf_Jg.text: Terrible service!!!! The other servers do not help each other out. It takes a long time for the food or alcohol orders to be dropped at the table. The food is alight for the price. Although we sat inside and a bug was found in one of our drinks and our waitress (Danielle) did ask if we wanted a new one, when we said no bc we were going to try something else the server never came back to take our order for the new drink. Meanwhile when we were finally done and asked to close out our check we waited over 10 or so minutes until for her to come back with our check. Will not be my first choice to come back when visiting Red Rock. Giving them 2 stars bc the food was the only thing worth being there for.

knFa8CxE6aoSZYKfMuQFjg.text: Went here for a business dinner this week.    The look of the restaurant is trendy and okay but in no way inviting for an extended meal.  Tables for a party of more than four are high-tops with exceedingly uncomfortable bar chairs.  One of our party has had knee replacement and couldn't have her leg hanging from the stool/chair for and extended time.  We asked for one of the lobby stools to be brought over for her to rest her foot on; the wait staff was unable to accommodate this and told us it would have to be a manager (the manager never showed) but the wait staff kept coming by to find out if the manager had satisfied our request (we were there nearly 3 hours it never happened).  Everything in the restaurant is hard surfaces which leads to a very LOUD room, the only saving grace to this was the staff didn't increase the volume of the music with the volume of the patrons.  As it was it was so loud you could only hear the person immediately next to you, forget about having a cohesive group conversation with the 7 people we had there for dinner.  The wait staff is done "team style" which is good in theory but leads to a lot of disconnect between what we asking for versus what we were being given.  Regarding the food: Its billed as rustic American cuisine; however, its very French and Italian - sorry but this gave me a chuckle as I was reviewing the menu.   Cocktails -   Mojito - she returned it as undrinkable Red Sangria - she said it was alright but rather weak in flavor. Bottle of red wine - unsure of what it was but the others started doing internet searches on its value and rating which led me to believe they weren't overly impressed with it. Appetizers -  Abe Froman flatbread - was told that it was good but way to heavy with fennel for my taste. Carbonara  Flatbread - was alright, I've had better. Roasted Artichokes with Black Truffle Yogurt - this was pretty tasty and we all seemed to enjoy it. Dinner - We had several with duplicate food orderings. Rotisseri Chicken & Roasted Fingerling Potatoes with Jalapenos  and Roast  Broccoli- Chicken was okay, moist not dried out, could have done without the charred thyme stalks. Potatoes were tasty but randomly seasoned.  Was told that the broccoli was not worth ordering again. Wagyu Burger Special - he said it was good but only ate half of it so I was left wondering. Wagyu Short Ribs - he seemed to be satisfied with his. Pesto Shrimp Pasta - was told it was good but she felt over priced. Desert -  Peanut Butter Lava Cake - everyone said this was good but they couldn't have more than a couple of bites. Apple Tart - was very good according to all. Blood Orange Sorbet - was really looking forward to this and sorely disappointed, tasted like it was made with Tang and red food coloring.  All in all I'm glad someone was able to put this on their expense account.  I don't see that any of us that live here will be returning for another meal.

89vVKCbw8bAcJb_Ua5T1-g.text: The first time I came here, the food was amazing and service over the top. This time not so much. We had to find someone to come take our drink order. They finally decided to take our food order. Forget any drink refills. Food was just ok, it was a shame because they set a standard when they first opened and did not come close this time around. I will not even bother going back.

Yn7c00aEuz3uV45IdfnNhg.text: I've been here twice. The food is alright. Nothing to really write home about. I like that it's super close to my house and not too loud of place to go and catch up with friends. My only real complaint is the almost mandatory 20 minute wait every time, when half the restaurant is empty. I don't get it.

yYjLDX-0dVUsZK17aIZmng.text: I am a Hearthstone addict and proud of it.  It happened slowly, unexpectedly and now I just can't stop. When I first started coming here, about a year ago, I really wasn't too overly excited about it...but something kept drawing me back and now I'm loud and proud and don't care who knows it.  I love the sharing plates, which are just the perfect size for 2-3 people so that you can sample several items at a time (the meatballs, the lollipop chicken wings, stuffed dates, meat and cheese boards).  And, with the updated menu items like the shaved brussels sprout caesar salad, lobster roll, chicken pot pie, baked honey truffle ricotta (I dream about it, I do) you're ensured happy tastebuds no matter what you choose.  My favorite standby is their cheeseburger, made with pimiento cheese.  I can't stress enough how delicious that burger is.  Also, try happy hour with the mini menu items to get even more for your mouth.  The staff is always friendly and the service pretty efficient, and the atmosphere open and inviting.  Whether you want to go for a drink and a game of shuffle board, or sit in the comfy couches and chat with friends, or sit on the patio and enjoy the Summerlin outdoors, you'll always find that there's a spot depending on your mood.  Oh, and don't forget about Sunday brunch.  It's spot on, with limitless mimosas, amazing baked goods and various sweet and savory offerings guaranteed to please.

xHRow9lNIp-2GV8OVSUVDQ.text: I have never written a bad review, and I really wanted to like this place, with the cute and trendy decor, but it was extremely disappointing. Service was very very slow and the server was abrupt and couldn't answer extremely basic questions about menu items. As and server myself, I try to cut everyone some slack, but this was pretty substandard, especially for a restaurant with this price point. I went for Sunday brunch for a friend's birthday. I ordered the bottomless bellinis for 24 dollars, which I only got 3 of over the course of 2.5 hrs, while having to wait 15-20 min after I finished each beverage. Also, even though the waiter said the bottomless drinks were pre-made, every drink I received tasted extremely different, with one being all champagne to one being extremely sweet and juicy. The same inconsistencies were applied to the other bottomless bloody beers my friends ordered, the first one being extremely tomato based, and others being beer heavy. I also ordered the D. O. C. Pizza (18 dollars for personal sized pizza), which is basically a margarita pizza. I would say that 4 of the 8 pieces had just plain marinara and nothing else (not even cheese or herbs), and the other 4 pieces had small circles of lukewarm cheese and about 5 small pieces of basil over the entire pizza. My friend ordered the California Egg Benedict, and the egg whites were translucent and runny and inedible unless you like mostly raw egg. We wanted to send our food back, but since we were at the restaurant at the request of our friend for her birthday, we didn't want to complain or cause a scene. Overall, my extremely awful excuse for a pizza and drinks were 42 bucks before tax and tip, and I honestly can say little caesars take out pizza is inifnitely better. I feel like the trendiness of the decor coupled with the wine/charcuterie vibe of the place is giving it hype, but I would never return to pay this much for food or beverages for brunch or any other meal. Try Mercadito next door. Really great food and delicious cocktails.  I've been a server in high end restaurants for years and spending money has never been an issue for me as long as the food/drink quality and service were worth it, but definitely not for hearthstone. I wouldn't pay half of what I paid.

voeHYhk1y6E7gsu82_r-Sg.text: Jessica G. was our assistant, she was attentive and very friendly.  Awesome meal!!!   We had the chickpea salad which I questioned ...but oh my goodness it was delish!  Then we moves onto the primavera pizza!  Wowzza it was yummy! Be sure to save room for the chocolate chip cookie souffle !!!  Holy cowabunga it was so yummy!!!!!!

QwD6q3RTCObwv4t56sdi8w.text: Service was mediocre. Food was delish, but a tad over priced. Atmosphere was amazing. Hip. Trendy. Disappointed that ALL the wait staff was young and thin.  NO substitutions...not even salad dressing.  Waitstaff could use additional training.  We will give it another try.

HZmlZF7BdoCDobaKwa-4xw.text: Third time's a charm.  They finally do not over book reservations and their staff is well running now.  Beautiful looking restaurant, really pleasant patio and the food is very good.

iHW6lc_psunAGpc134UUhQ.text: Hearthstone Kitchen and Cellar is located in Summerlin, inside of Red Rock Casino. I personally find it the best restaurant that Red Rock has to offer. Happy hour is offered everyday from 5-7 pm, then reversed happy hour is offered on Saturday night. The happy hour has a good variety of options to offer... cant beat $6 bucks for good, quick food!  This restaurant has a lot to offer during the week as well. On Mondays, they have a special which offers guests half off of a $100 priced bottle of wine.. and they have a LARGE selection of red and white wines. On Wednesdays they offer $1 FRESH oysters. On Thursdays they have a private cellar for guests. Live music Friday and Saturday (great acoustic singer) and an overall fun environment to be in. On Sunday, brunch is offered. They also are open on holidays and offer special menus for each holiday... amazing.  The staff is very polite, kind, and caring. The servers offer great service, the hostesses are very sweet, and if there is a problem, the managers are extremely helpful. They are a joy to dine with!  The food is FRESH. It is an American Rustic style cuisine, has a lot of variety. I absolutely love how this restaurant has a fresh shellfish selection. The shrimp pasta, fried chicken, and hanger steak are to die for. Excellent quality food.  The design of the restaurant has a good feel to it. I really like how this restaurant has couches towards the back of the restaurant, it makes a more cozy environment. They have a bar, pizza counter, dining tables, nice booths, and hightop tables. I like how there is a variety of options of seating.  Overall, one of the best restaurants I have dined at and enjoyed everything they have to offer! Definitely recommend!

UuJS0h0wKjokAA753ZkBAg.text: You are paying for the decor, not the amount of food. I ordered the Quinoa salad which was a joke for 13.00 greens and Apple's and chickpea. Save your money and irritation and go next door to Libre and get what you are paying for.....the food.  To put the icing on the cake our service was great, until our server ran our card for another tables tab! 33.00 for more than what our tab was... Now we wait 3 to 5 days for a 33.00 credit.  A sorry apology and no empathy or compensation.....will mean we won't be back!

Sq8833lwwreIKmOH27Qxrw.text: 3 stars only because the waiter was nice and I got a free glass of wine after my yelp check in.  Thank you Yelp!   The food was good, don't get me wrong.  As soon as we sat down I couldn't help but enjoy the aromas of different dishes being led to their destination.  We finally got our menu and to our surprise, it felt like we're paying for the ambiance.  OVERPRICED.  The flatbread pizza we shared was $18 and equivalent to a personal pizza, let's say CPK.  We settled on that because we only went in with intentions to share an appetizer, but found that the flatbread was the same price (I'll let you imagine what the prices were for entrees, which were the size of appetizer dishes!) .  Once again, good food, but needless to say we will not be coming back.

Sv5FCRRiYOD7GQ_PU_kxOg.text: Came here last night with a group of friends. We got seated outside near the fountain which was perfect. Nice ambience with modern decor, very spacious. Food was good, I had the ahi tuna salad and crab cake. Will definitely come back to try other times.

Ei4ewmTR9K43FnYJP0-lzg.text: I was more excited to go to this place than I was impressed.  I loved the decor and whole set up of this place. Its huge with plenty of seating and some casual couch seating as well. The waitresses had cute uniforms with suspenders. Our waitress was very attentive and nice.  We started with the grilled artichoke appetizer which was pretty good but not overly impressive. We ordered the deviled eggs which were alright as well. We also had the bone marrow which I loved. We ordered a cheese and meat board which is their thing there. We weren't overly impressed by this either.  For an entree I got the Salmon Carpaccio which was really good.  Their sangria was excellent along with their Blueberry Bliss cocktail. Our meal experience didn't feel like it was really worth the cost however. I would like to come here for brunch some time and enjoy the nice outdoor seating.

g5P7g_Ct3gHL8BSLBY-fBA.text: Let's just say, I love this place. Walked in from the casino entrance and was immediately greeted by a hostess ,with a smile, asking how my night was going? She offered to seat me at a table, in which i declined . I prefer to sit at the bar so I sat myself! Sat at the bar and was immediately greeted and dropped menus. One for happy hour (who doesn't love happy hour) a full dinner menu and a drink menu. After looking over the menu I ordered the happy hour buffalo wings as a recommendation from the bartender. WOW. Simple, to the point and SO BOMB! I don't like spicy food so I was hesitant but tried it anyways. Six bucks how can I lose? Not too spicy, little tangy and mouthwatering! Should have taken a picture before eating because they were gone before I remembered. Next I ordered the shrimp ceviche off the dinner menu. It's a different twist on the traditional ceviche I am used to but another winner! Easily! This one I got a picture of first before devouring! Has little chunks of watermelon in it. Yummy and very refreshing! Paired this one with a nice Pinot Grigio  by the glass, they carry one of my favorites Santa Margarita! Have j told you how I love this place? Lastly I ordered the Hanger steak, medium rare! I got it and was impressed and also thankful! Yes... Thankful lol They cut the steak for you before sending it out! Saves you time and you can just get down to business, lol! They cooked it to my liking and the steak fries that come with it.. YUM! Sarah the manager came by asked how everything was I told her I love this place and can't wait to share my future experiences with friends! See you again real soon Hearthstone! My experience tonight was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger steak
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp ceviche

QQlU8tLtAx5JZdyuYRnf4w.text: I absolutely love this place! In a city where I could go to a new restaurant every day, Hearthstone has an incredible atmosphere and great deals that I just keep coming back for!

29ObABWMFMMnfO5lhIe0PA.text: Portion size was horribly small -- time it took to get the small portion was very long. Food was good.

NxLQAFM50e3VP-L5Qj77AA.text: I really love Hearthstone. My first experience with them was last Thanksgiving as our plans fell through to go visit family, so we were left wandering around looking for where to eat a Thanksgiving meal. We saw that Hearthstone was doing an endless turkey dinner, and my husband and I LOVED it. They really saved Thanksgiving for us. If they do it again this year, and you don't feel like cooking, you have got to try it!  I've been twice for brunch. Their quinoa salad is great, and last time I splurged calories wise and got the egg sandwich. The thick buttery toast is sooooooooo good. My husband usually gets the egg bennies. My bottomless mimosa glass is never left empty, either.  I planned a girls' night at Hearthstone last night, and that finally pushed me to write a review. I swear they must hire the nicest, most adorable people to work here! From the hostess stand to our waiter, everyone is so sweet. And I always feel so super bad for having to itemize receipts on a group dinner, but when I get the $39 halibut and someone else gets a $13 salad, it is what it is. They did it with a smile though, which is sincerely appreciated as I know it blows when you have 5 girls throw down 5 cards with various amounts needing to be charged.   Dinner is on the pricey side (depending on what you order), but I got a hearty portion of halibut, so I consider it a girls' night treat. Their brunch is really reasonable and comparable if you want to dip your toes in the water first.

ewmsnNFhQns-FX0Jea5OKQ.text: The reason for the 3 star was service was poor. It started at the door with hostess Ashley, she kept ignoring us & kept helping the other people even if we were there first. The other hostess Savanah was apologetic when I told her we were a bit upset about it.   Dinner was very good! But i don't think we will be going back anytime soon. We only saw our server Tori 2x. When she got our order & to give our check. I had to ask for water refill from the chef.   I hope management look at this review not as a negative but as a feedback from actual customer.

4lSQBTn9A4lnQQxhEYsKcQ.text: Went to Hearthstone to watch the football games yesterday and was treated great by Sarah, Travis and Jasmine.  They reserved a table and couch for us and the service Jasmine provided was great.  Sarah, the GM, kept checking on us to make sure we were taken care of.  Definitely, recommend checking this place out and we will be frequenting this restaurant a lot in the future.

gZwqiUJDcEu0Qrb24BRvdQ.text: This place is so cool! Came here to watch the game and enjoy some great food. The service was great, our server Jose was awesome! The scallops were literally out of this world, they were the freshest I've had in Vegas, and the brown butter really complimented it. And the peanut butter lava cake was one of the best desserts I have ever had. Awesome place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OoUa_8px91nJDzvkwY3M_g.text: I came here with my husband on a whim Sunday afternoon and it was interesting and odd to say the least.  I'm giving Hearthstone 3 stars, because the service was great and I love the ambiance of the place.   The only thing that I'm still not sold on is the food. I'd have to come again and try some of their other items to really see if this place truly deserves a thumbs up or thumbs down... we will see.  I had a Sangria, which was pretty darn strong and the waitress was nice enough to remake it for me.   I also had their braised short rib meatballs in tomato sauce and it was a bit spicy for my taste. It was still decent, but I've definitely tasted better. Waaaay better.  My husband had the chocolate shuffle and he wasn't really impressed by it not 1 bit or should I say bite. He also had their house cabernet and we both agreed that $16 a glass seemed like a rip off.  Overall our bill for 1 dessert,  small meatballs tapas, 1 cocktail, 1 glass of red wine  for $60 and then add a 15% tip was a little overkill. I really don't mind spending a good amount of money on fancy food, but it has to taste good and this just did not.  In a nutshell this was a little too high for food that was very poorly executed, but this won't be my last visit. I still look forward to seeing what else this place has to offer.  At this point I would only recommend this place for drinks and thats about it for now. Until next time foodie friends!

SBZCywY9mx_DL0vCnBYPmA.text: This review is strictly for their Brunch. They do bottomless Mimosas for a slight extra charge, but if you're going to brunch and you're not drinking, you're doing it wrong. The service has always been excellent and the ambiance can't be matched in the area. It's got a rustic American feel. They do Oyster towers for brunch as well as their famous wood-fired pizzas. A must try is the Huckleberry Caramel French toast with banana bourbon syrup. It's on the sweeter side, but mind-blowing. Have an Uber (shameless plug) on standby after this Boozy brunch.

2q6Q9-5kzafpfA4F9rdw4g.text: Arrived to Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar at about 5:30pm. The hostess asked if we had a reservation and when we said no they quickly said that they were "fully committed," but could put us on a waiting list. We were completely fine with the wait until we started looking around and there were A TON of open tables. After asking about the open tables the girls repeated that they were "fully committed," and we could not be seated at any of the open tables. Disappointed, we decided to go eat at one of the nearby restaurants. Our car was parked in the Red Rock parking lot so we walked back through Hearthstone and (not to our surprise) they STILL had a bunch of tables opened.   Knowing the restaurant business turning away business is always a bad thing to do. I give Hearthstone 2 stars because the decor was right up my alley. Maybe one day I will be lucky enough to get a table and be able to update my review. As for now I would rather stick to my favorite restaurants.

4ZTzKq6xz5PJOKSGecTN6A.text: Just had brunch here with some family and friends. It was my first time here and I had heard good things. However, I wasn't really impressed. The service was slow as far as food coming out. Finally we asked the waiter just to bring the dishes as they were ready.  Also- ordered an omelet with bacon, mushrooms and cheese. It came out minus the bacon but I didn't even bother to mention it since the food already took forever. I noticed another table complaining about the wait as well.   Not sure if this is how they usually roll... I'd go back for another try but definitely didn't live up to the expectations I had based on other people's reviews.

bJDcHDWQOfKJd2Henv0nxg.text: My best friend and I went to Sunday brunch which was an amazing deal, it was $15 bottomless mimosas! It's surprisingly hard to find a deal that good for bottomless mimosas in this town. My food was also really good! We sat on the patio and there was a view of the mountains to look at the entire brunch. Before we got our food the manager came up to us and said there was a seating issue and asked if we would mind moving to a two person table (we were sitting at a 4 top), and of course we didn't mind. But beyond that, he said he would take care of our mimosas for the trouble. I have never had a restaurant do that before. Amazing hospitality!! Will definitely be returning.

XKPP_oXbsZCRfXFIT5GLVQ.text: Where do I begin!! Our server Jason AMAZING!! The other servers that assisted where great too. The jalapeno hummus was delish! My son was able to make his own pepperoni and cheese pizza, which he throughly enjoyed having the opportunity to do! He had a root beer float as well... yum! We also has the crispy brussel sprouts which are a most try.. super good. The herb green salad was good as well. The sweet potato fries were great as well. Best to make reservations. This is a must try place!!

2RNCC8UvvFshRFmlPkZSMw.text: This place is great, only ever sat at the bar a few times for a drink but bartenders know what they're doing and are acomidatting.  Reason for the 1 missing star is because/ from another guest/patron but all was good they compensated for with a free beer

w79GlhuhQz1iXC-jlB93Sg.text: Don't get confuse with taco Tuesday advertisement , it doesn't apply in this restaurant.  It's a wrong advertisement. I won't recommend this place,  specially where the staff is so rude with the customers.

WmfBiUTGbqPP0heKBumLcw.text: When we arrived we were told there was a 30 minute wait but there was at least 10 open clean tables.  They called us about 15 minutes later that our table was ready. After sitting at our table for 10 minutes watching others getting seated, menus, water, etc. we called the hostess over. She brought us our menus and told us our server will be right there. Another 5 minutes until the server came over and thanked us for our patience and asked if we wanted water. We ordered water. We then watched her go to another table (that was seated after us) and take their order. At this point we walked out.

3OagOf98nDPP1nYCeMxxMg.text: Russell  I just spent 5 days in Las Vegas visiting my daughter obviously eating out!  The Hearthstone Kitchen topped everything from the service by Shane and the food was absolutely delicious!! Thank you for the great experience.

xDE75LqiR4h8cBFDGtcFRw.text: Ahmed was an amazing waiter ....Very knowledgeable and friendly .....Me and my family had an awesome Valentines Day dinner and he made our night ....Thank you so much

qs3zG49PZmzxdwfXMDtKag.text: I came here the other night with the girlfriend because of all of the great reviews and fantastic looking food. We were definitely blown away by how good this place is.  The open kitchen and bar idea is really cool. Definitely a cool vibe and ambiance inside as well as outside. The only thing I didn't like about the outside were the tables and chairs. The inside is very open with lots of table and booths along the wall. However, I did feel like this place had an identity crisis. Open atmosphere and great intimate lighting only to be thrown off by a bunch of big screen TV's all over the place with the football game on. A mix between a sports bar and a really nice restaurant.   Service here was impeccable. Hostess, server, waiter, down to the restaurant manager. All very nice, attentive, and on top of everything.   The food here is where this place really shines.   We ordered pretty much the entire menu:  Bacon wrapped stuffed dates - awesome  Meat and Cheese board - great!  Baked Ricotta dish - my favorite!  Calamari - great  Chicken Truffle Flatbread - great  Meatball and ricotta flatbread - delicious  Apple and quinoa salad - great!  Scallops - Cooked perfectly  Hanger Steak - good, next time I should order it medium.    Peanut butter lava cake - Fire! So good!  Chocolate Souffle - good, not worth the 15 minute wait  Great place with great food! Will definitely be back - especially to try the brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Ricotta - So good!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat and Cheese Board
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari - great

ObKSDX1NO9b2YSBr_Ov38Q.text: An amazing looking restaurant, has a real Industrial  feel to it with an eclectic feel to it. It was really nice for a sit down last minute brunch. Wasn't to busy so we were able to get right in. The service was okay, but very slow. We waited 15 minutes for water to come to our table and another 5 minutes for our bloody Mary's. We ordered and it took another 20 minutes, and by this time I was starving. The waiter was very apologetic for the wait , but I tend to be very patient with the staff as well. They food was okay, too pricey for bland breakfast. Food looks great, but again just bland.

0cRanh7YKcEgMWJ7yqmn7w.text: I love the ambiance, the decor and the $1 oysters. I savored every bite of the pizza, artichoke dip and oysters that we ordered. Absolutely delicious. One of my favorite places in this area.

gIX00JfHR4rjJKU46tq1tQ.text: Love the decore and atmosphere at Hearthstone. Great menu options and excellent daily happy hour. One of our top pics when we are at Red Rock Casino.

mrGsMKlheZp8D26_YRCeVA.text: We enjoy Hearthstone for these reasons:  the friendly & professional service & the organic & unique ambiance.  I like that you can see outside almost anywhere you're seated, & if a sports fan there are enough not-in-your-face screens.  It's great to see all ages represented here, thus also making it feel community-oriented.  On this visit we had the quinoa salad for two as well as the sausage/fennel/garlic pizza.  The salad is delectable & crunchy, but didn't have any of the Gouda cheese listed on menu (though we'd definitely give it another go).  The pizza crust is just right, not too thick, & actually flavorful.  All ingredients were fine also & the only complaint is that of before:  too salty.  The pizzas are also listed on the happy hour menu but are only big enough for one @ $6.00.  Their house red on happy hour is a good one & wine & beer are $6.00.  Note:  A number of restaurants with excellent happy hour pizzas are full size, for $6-8.00.  Just sayin' Hearthstone.  If I have a complaint, it's what  they can't remedy:  the noise level, at any hour of the day.

JpZrjDV98duKUHpSOPxQ6g.text: Cool decor and great environment you would expect at a casino hotel in Vegas.  Seabass was cooked to perfection.  I definitely was all in on the fried Brussels sprouts.

IEVQzSkWVQiejfF0CLYAmw.text: Food was good. Service was good. It's pretty noisy once it fills up. Calamari was top 5 for sure, French Onion soup as well. A nice new find.

8YPVhW8rCFT-4o8UOS2e6g.text: Gerson was the best server ever !! Super nice and personable. The establishment has great vibes and I love coming here with my girls on Tuesdays for Taco Tuesday's !!

SO_NQRrPN3MycRLOz2P-tg.text: This place was amazing! My husband and I came for the Monday night lobster boil and were not disappointed! The spinach artichoke dip was phenomenal and the half priced bottle of wine was an excellent compliment. Our server, Gerson, was attentive, charismatic, and made our whole dining experience amazing. We will definitely be back!

BSX1x5DYfs6jw8npIw9pgA.text: Came in for bunch with my girlfriends. I made a reservation for inside but after walking past their inviting patio we decided to dine outside. It was about 90 but there was shading and misters keeping the temperature tolerable. We got an array of random dishes and shared everything. We enjoyed a brussel sprout Caesar salad, California eggs Benedict, the adult grilled cheese, fruit parfait and salted caramel French toast. The flavors were better than expected. The sweet dishes were indeed sweet, so we enjoyed it like a dessert.  If you have a group of friends I would definitely recommend what we did and experience the menu but sharing a variety of dishes.

tdykZ2ACJAyUp6TJJZHncw.text: My boyfriend and I had an amazing time at Hearthstone. Not only was the food fantastic,  but we had the best server named Ahmed. He was delightful and made our experience the best it could have been. I look forward to coming back!

uy7F-Si9HmUCtxv2kjNKuw.text: When we arrived last night, I immediately noticed the beautiful interior of this place. With the rustic charm of the decor, this place has a cozy and lush ambience. We were seated outside on the beautiful patio. This place has a prime time location if you are looking to see a movie at Red Rock or go to the casino afterwards.   The service throughout the night was 5 stars. My server was very knowledgeable and helpful and made sure we were satisfied.   Now to the food. We ordered the buffalo chicken wings happy hour deal, which were buttery and well coated. We also got the Wood Roasted Octopus which I really enjoyed. There is a smoky flavor to the octopus, so only get this if you like that charbroiled taste. The Tuna Tartare was nice as well with the accent of the apples and hazelnuts.   For the main entrees, we shared the Lobster Roll, the Catch of the Day Halibut, Truffle Chicken Pizza, Truffle Pasta, and Lamb. My two favorites were the Lobster Roll and the Lamb. The lobster roll was well toasted and buttery against the cold lobster salad medley inside. The lamb was super delicious and had that gamey fresh lamb flavor that I love. It came with two big portions of lamb rack over buttery mashed potatoes, grilled veggies, and what tasted like a red wine reduction.   I personally did not try the Halibut, but someone in my group did not enjoy it too much because of the "fishiness" of it. I personally love truffle anything in general, but I was let down some by both the truffle chicken pizza and the truffle pasta. The pizza was on the drier side and needed something extra, and I also could barely taste any truffle on it. The truffle pasta was better since I could clearly taste the truffle, but the sauce was on the clumpier and heavy side. I think I would have enjoyed it more if the sauce was a bit smoother.   For dessert, we got the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding. I loved the bread pudding part of this dessert along with the ice cream. It was dense and moist and not too sweet. I only wish they accented this dish with a flavor combo other than cherries. I think caramel, white chocolate, or even blueberries would have been better.  All in all, I had a really good time. I would definitely come back to try other dishes.

It was one of the best dining experiences I have had and it is all due to Annie and what great care she took of us. Will definitely be back!

5CpuuJVhc0HOzF38MlcxOQ.text: The reviews here is what got me check this place out. I mean, American food is all the same to me. I had the burger and it was nothing out of the ordinary. Some day, but probably not any time soon.

nACnmEEUUyBkWKi0ls-Bcw.text: The ambiance and service were spectacular. The food was okay, not excellent. The menu looked promising but the food lacked that extra finesse to make it amazing. I'll try it one more time but it didn't live up to its potential.   Con parking is hard to find.

f2qXtKsiheFV-MyKSdt1Eg.text: Was decent. Food was the primary reason this review got 3 stars. The best thing about this restaurant was it's atmosphere. It does have inside and outdoor seating which you can request. There are lounge booths, barstool tables, and dining table to eat at.   As for the food, we ordered the lobster $24(?) Special, and the lobster was not super flakey, was very gooey, and reeked of salt water. Undercooked. The Truffle Pasta, was a little dry but had excellent flavor. I was told by other members in my party that the brussel sprouts weren't the best they had; but the fried chicken had an amazing sweet batter it was fried in.  The most disappointing part for me is that it was my birthday, and the birthday cake that came out was EXTREMELY soft, melted, and droopy. Honestly, this is the worst birthday cake I've had at a restaurant. I'm surprised they would even think it's remotely okay to display a cake in that condition. You could see the frosting melting down the sides. The cookie that came with it I wasn't a fan of, it was hard as a rock. I took the puddle of cake home with me, but there was no point in eating the bed mess, so I threw it away with when I got home.  I'm not really sure if I would go back to eat. Probably not. Wouldn't recommend either. For such a small menu, they should focus more on their quality. But it is a great hangout spot, as there are also TV's around the restaurant.

gFedTFqoHlM3HPs0gEhB1Q.text: First time visit for dinner, 4 stars for food 3 stars for service. The lady serving us was very flirty and too touchy feely so she gets a thumbs down.   Second visit for brunch, we choose the patio and were seated with the sun beaming on us. We asked our server if we could move to a table with shade. He came back and told us we could move but that table is booked in 1 hour and 15 mins so we need to be done by then. Um excuse me but there were tons of tables still available on the patio and I just felt that comment wasn't needed by him. (They offer bottomless mimosas that are premixed with heavy pulp OJ, not very good, but bottomless) Good thing he wasn't going to be our server any longer. Our new server was fine. Food though no bueno. Had bread pudding French toast that was so soggy on it's own and they even had a side of syrup? Like it wasn't soggy enough.   Overall the service blah. Food could be awesome or a complete miss.

uKwTjJV-0A9goUTW2IyKHw.text: Great view out on the patio! Brunch and bottomless mimosas were fantastic. We got the avocado toast and lobster Benedict. Both were amazing. Outdoor patio has nice fans and mist as well to keep you cool even in the sunnier spots

Kw0R5eEdaWjOZVz_2Oe9Tg.text: Return this evening and had a great experience. We had the ricotta and gouda appetizer with toasted bread, highly recommend. I had the prime rib dinner that melted in my mouth. Will be back for that again. Special thanks to Russell the manager for making our dinner, better that we anticipated.
