Sexton for invite back, bravo!!

0NsU5q82B3ezzOOPWjcVeA.text: Hearthstone is the place to see and be seen in Summerlin for Sunday brunch. The restaurant has a rustic yet feminine feel to it and the servers are consistently warm. Their only downfall is the food. It's overpriced and underwhelming.   My first visit to Hearthstone was during brunch. I am a firm believer that's it's nearly impossible to ruin breakfast -- until now. My breakfast potatoes were over cooked and bland. Even drowning them in ketchup couldn't do the trick. The breakfast sandwich was decent, but I could have ordered something similar for a fraction of the cost at Kneaders. Granted, you have the same ambience that Hearthstone is known for.   My husband ordered the French toast, which sounded better than it actually tasted. I thought that maybe my husband and I just ordered the wrong items, but until our friend was disappointed with her eggs Benedict.   I figured I would give them another shot, so I stopped by for happy hour/ $1 Presidents Day pizzas. My hummus lacked flavor and the pizza sauce was too salty. They offered veggie sliders (plural), but it was actually just one lonely slider. My husband devoured his, but my tastebuds never had the pleasure enjoying it because there was only one. Even our server was shocked to see only one slider. A new set of friends joined us, but weren't impressed with the food either.   Hearthstone reminds me of a really attractive guy or girl with no substance. It's just plain disappointing!

zKCTT6ESeDCcqYtbHZpxnQ.text: Gave Hearthstone a second chance and had a much better experience! Went on a Saturday night and it was less busy than their $1 oyster Wednesdays. Our server Jade was really attentive and we were seated at a nice both in the middle of the restaurant. Also, they have live music on Saturday nights. My bf and I ordered the raging bull and flower bomb. Both drinks were very good. For the appetizer we ordered the small shellfish platter (came with 3 oysters, 3 shrimp, and one lobster claw), 3 oysters, bacon wrapped dates (just okay), and a ricotta dip (highly recommend)! For the entree we shared the special which was a branzino with lobster risotto. Honestly, best fish I've had in a while. Fish was cooked to perfection, nice and flaky flesh with crispy skin. For dessert we had nutella and chocolate pot that came with two warm cookies. Great way to end the dinner

PYx4nkPrQpjCx48LESOWUQ.text: What a great place to go for celebrating a birthday!! The ambiance was very chill and the private room was definitely a must with the kids there!   The service was top notch. Everyone was very personable and attentive. Our server, I think his name was Amit/Amir (if you read this please forgive me for not remembering correctly) but man he was AMAZING! He gave great suggestions and had quite a sense of humor, and with our family that's a must!  Drinks were so good and refreshing, I suggest trying the flower Bomb!   Started with the baked truffle ricotta and that was nice and creamy with a hint of sweetness from the honey.  The shrimp and grits was absolutely delicious. So creamy and silky, it didn't look like a huge helping, but I couldn't finish the last two shrimps which is unheard of for me!  The fried chicken was crispy and juicy with a lil honey to top it off. The cheddar bacon biscuit so soft and flaky.   The sea bass with lobster risotto...are you kidding me!!! So good!!  The s'mores dessert was different than I've ever had. A cake with marshmallow fluff and chocolate chips.   Everything was so deelish I cant wait to go back for brunch!

8sEF-bq7btYSEANd10X4lQ.text: Had a GREAT Mother's Day experience at Hearthstone today.  My husband and our two children surprised me with lunch today. Our server, Al, was absolutely amazing. She knew the menu very well and also made our dining experience so much better.  Our new Mother's Day tradition is Hearthstone!!

QLA_Ex2C0nufuw3bZz1JWA.text: Well, they look the part of a nice restaurant. But alas looks can be deceiving. Very, very deceiving.  I ordered a burger ($17) and a dollar pizza. I got an egg added on for $3 (!) extra. They forgot the egg initially so I ended up with a fried egg side.  So, let's start with the least regrettable, the dollar pizza. It was terrible, in taste and texture.  Like something you would find at a chuck e cheese.  So how on earth could this be the least regrettable? Because it only cost me a dollar, which is only one more dollar than it was worth.  The burger on the other hand, was a $20 mistake. And terrible, lifeless, like something that came out of a frozen package. The $3 egg wasn't even good. The burger left a bad aftertaste, too. Yuck!  I can't think of a single good thing to say about this place. It was dreadfully bad. One of the worst meals I have had in vegas...or anywhere else.

The kitchen scribbled initials on the wax paper to know what goes where though they did not obviously illustrate to us what was what. TBQew7pZ2mVSRPe5iNh_vg.text: Unable to give a review on quality of food because we left. Wanted to try out the the chicken wings yesterday for the all you can eat. Was in town from Chicago visiting family, so my brother wanted me to check it out. Once seated and drinks ordered, we placed out order. To our surprise we were told that everyone at our table had to order wings. Well one of us doesn't eat chicken and wanted to order something different and double the price of the wings. We were told " no can do ". Which I find completely ridiculous.  Believe it or not,  some people don't eat chicken. How this restaurant couldn't accommodate an individual that doesn't eat chicken is bewildering.  If you are stead fast in that policy, then make sure it's posted or noted prior to patrons entering your establishment.  Very disappointed, I was looking forward to the experience

jtlDCoyHLm_L6tZZXDWwLQ.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. So I'll start with the good. The food? Excellent. I've had the charcuterie board, Mac and Cheese (basic but amazing), pizza, salad, fried chicken, and beef tartare. I absolutely love the food. Not sure if anything there is bad.   Ambiance. Is so awesome. I love the layout, the TV's are everywhere. Perfect place to watch a game. Just a really cool spot to eat or drink at.   Only bad thing...is the service. I've never waited to long for a drink. Each drink takes about 15 mins. Our server Shahenna never once asked how our food was. Mind you the 4 of us in the bar area had a $250 bill. It would of been way more if someone wanted to help serve us. We would of ordered more food or drinks. She was definitely not feeling us that night. The group of guys behind us got their water before we got asked if we wanted anything. They got refills before we got a drink. Seems like the table that was spending money would of got faster service.   Either way this place is awesome. Service is something that can easily be fixed.

XhLcZ-Fdz_w2xA3hN7Eu6w.text: The staff is incredibly attentive and service was timely! We ordered the truffle ricotta/honey app and for dinner, my husband ate the meatball flatbread and I had a delicious scallop with cauliflower puree and risotto. We ended our meal with the PB lava cake and banana ice cream... YUMMO! Everything was exceptional! Last, kudos to Johann, who was an incredible server!!! :) We'll be back!

RGssJzKSYbyG3nxtgPp2mg.text: The atmosphere was great and the food was tasty. I went here for Sunday brunch and sat outside on a gorgeous day. I had the egg white omelette which was a healthy yet filling meal. The Bloody Mary that I ordered was great and the girls got bottomless mimosas for just $15! A great brunch place for both indoor and outdoor seating.

S-hJ8Im2RocWwskyAlF0UA.text: Decided to go for dinner before are movies starts. There is 4 of us. Wife and me and another couple. Showed up at happy hour just are luck as this was are first time at the restaurant. Hostess sat us outside patio awesome. The waiter come over with menus we asked for the happy hour menu then he informed us there was no happy hour on the patio. We told him the hostess told us happy hour was patio friendly he checked with the manager (kinda weird) he came back with happy hour menus and said we were good to go. Noticed only certain cocktails were listed for happy hour no problem. Appetizers were half off same as certain cocktails and a couple of red wine selections. Told the waiter other than the cocktails and champagne we would order food from the Happy hour menu. Order jalapeno hummus was awesome.  Pigs in a blanket also good. Chicken wings also good. Waiter was very polite. Time to go movie starts in 20 min. Asked for the check the girls notice it was a little high. Paid the bill then noticed we were charged full price for appetizers and the red wine. No big deal a honest over site we thought. Well we were SO wrong. Waiter began telling us the red wine he brought her was not on happy hour menu (how would we know)and instead of $6 per glass it was $13 per glass. The red wine he brought (Cabernet) was not on the happy hour menu. The appetizers we ordered from the menu he doubled the orders we had no idea cause the waiter didn't inform us. When we asked him he told us that he would talk with the manager to try and straighten it out. Well 25 min later (now late for the movie now) the manager appears and explains what happened. They partially reduced the check. Waiter not seen again. The waiter new exactly what he was doing "really" doubling orders and not informing the customers. 6 appetizers and 5 titos and 2 glasses of champagne and 3 glasses of wine Original check $210.00  Check reduced by $12 dollars as manager explained she forgot to reduce the 3 glasses of wine from $13 each to $6 each.  That some of the appetizers were not from the happy hour menu (again how would we know) Wow super disappointed. As we're are locals and seen many restaurants come and go. Let's check back on this place. As it was Saturday night and maybe a 12 tables in the whole restaurant had customers.  Seemed to be classic bait and switch.  So absolutely NOT recommend save the aggravation and explaining to the people that work there how we feel really miss lead, how we couldn't of be any more clear to the waiter.

T77ijhLISTOD-Rg_u0C4QQ.text: Great experience!  My Sister-in- law and I went on Saturday for a little girls night out. The food was amazing and the service was even better! The atmosphere is so cute too!! We sat at the bar and Taylor took care of us all night.  When you go here you have to order the Blackberry bliss! We left after dinner and sat down at the middle bar and ended up leaving to go back and get another blackberry bliss made the best by Ms. Taylor! Jose and Taylor were so great and we had so much fun with you guys! I can't wait to go back with my husband . Until then, I'll be dreaming about that Blackberry Bliss!!

zUVCWQXVk42u2S5SWOo-5Q.text: Hearthstone is awesome! The food is great, especially the new items they added to the menu. So many choices and varieties. The staff is equally as awesome, especially Jocelyn, the bartender. She is always friendly and attentive. If you need a recommendation on something, she has got you covered! I will definitely be back and would recommend this place to everyone!

pUkhVzyy4M02W7jLGRL77w.text: Everyone needs to try Hearthstone! You will not be disappointed! All of the staff has a smile on their face and are ready to help! The atmosphere both inside and outside on the patio are super fun and lively. I have been to both their dinner and Sunday brunch and both were amazing!!!  For dinner we started with the pigs in a blanket and the charcuterie board which were both very good. For my entree I had the apple & quinoa salad and split the D.O.C. pizza with a friend. Both were so yummy. The pizza is made in a wood fired oven and it makes it taste so much better than normal pizza!  Hearthstone is one of the best brunch places I've been. The pancakes are soooo good and the croissant is very good as well. Everything is a pretty large portion which makes it even better.  If you haven't been to Hearthstone yet, you need to go!!!

IX1uqAhgbfw-aOcTgeL7TA.text: Hearthstone is one of my go to places for good food and great service. Last time I was there, Jocelyn served us at the bar. Needless to say, she was amazing. She was very diligent to us and made sure we were well taken care of. Great service makes places like this worth coming to. Thanks, Jocelyn!

iFBCt6nGZCEKzw3axW3Hew.text: Horrible service! Came in around 11:30 this morning and was told we should have had a reservation because they were full. Then 2 seconds later she says we can follow her to the table. Waited for the longest time for drinks. Ordered the kids each a pizza which we had to find someone to take them to the oven after the kids made them. All of the other food came out and they forgot about the pizzas. None of the food was worth it at all! The chicken sandwich from the lunch menu had barely anything in it served with a pile of cold fries. Asked the waiter numerous time for refills and never brought us more until we got the attention of a bus boy to refill them. Definitely not a good experience on Mother's Day! Will not be back!

VCXZGR_ki7JEWf83y16eQw.text: Very very impressed with this restaurant!! Staff was extremely nice!!! I sat at the bar Jessica was my server she was extremely nice & welcoming. Kyle working behind the bar was working hard and fast getting food ready and still being able to answer questions I had about the restaurant being my 1st time eating here. Mason also was very nice checking with to making sure I was all set. Great staff, food was amazing, and the music was great. I had the burger. Next I plan on coming back with a group and having dinner.

E8VsyYeqJNIGEqyp-n9F9g.text: We had $1 Oyster on Wednesday.  They were so good and fresh.  Like the appetizer hummus and chips.

1Zeuj0KCWAxDPzWq6Cwk2g.text: great food, cocktails, and atmosphere. Service was great on all every time. Will absolutely be returning.

R8kER325nyoJW9sd_Z9amw.text: This place is horrible. We ordered our food which literally didn't come literally 35 minutes past and the server asked us if we wanted our check. Mind you this is after we waited 20 for someone to bring our party waters. No cocktail order was taken, which really sucked. The table next to us sent back their pizza, when we left they too still had no pizza. Left an email for the manger and of course NO response, can't be surprised at this considering the shit show they were running. The food may be good but I literally wouldn't know since it never came. So if you're looking for a restaurant, that takes your order and never brings your food, with zero cocktails, and an absentee manager that won't respond then knock yourself out. I never write reviews but I just had to, this place sucks

msBDVVCZHwPe31NK6-A3ug.text: Hearthstone lost four customers for False advertising and terrible customer service. My wife and I went with another couple to last Thursdays Wine event 9pm till 11pm. It is a RSVP only event. We received a invite by email and printed tickets for the event. This was our first time visiting this new Restaurant. We have been looking forward to it since it opened. The Restaurant is beautiful but customer service is terrible. The music was way to loud for a wine event, no one could really talk to each other without yelling. The real issue we had with this place was the terrible service by the two waitresses serving the event area. I asked one young lady where the free appetizers  were. She informed me that they don't do that anymore it was something they did when they first started the events but have stopped. I explained it was in the email and on the tickets and that was not a good way to do business. I then asked her to bring us menu's. It took about 15 minutes to get them and from another waitress. I then asked this young lady about the appetizers too and she had no clue and was going to ask the manager. I told her please do and that we were going to order something off the menu either way. She never returned. We watched her and the first waitress wait on only certain people around us. The people they waited on were younger people about the waitresses ages. The older customer seemed to be ignored. Not sure what that was about. So after 2 very good glasses of wine that they did give us free (separate wine server) as part of the event. We all were very hungry and decided to go next door to Mercadito and order food and drinks. We were not disappointed. The service was outstanding and the food and drinks were great. We bought a couple bottles of wine at Mercadito too, which we were going to buy a few bottles at Hearthstone but never had the chance. So we highly recommend Mercadito and would suggest passing on Hearthstone until they step up their game. Very disappointed because it is a beautiful place and the menu and wine list looks great but it does not matter if service sucks.   One last note. We commented on this issue on Hearthstones facebook page under the Wine event post and they deleted it and never commented or messaged us back. So remember, only positive feedback will they share on social media. That is why I decided to go to Yelp and post.

mpv9okLCWxRC3V3ulCmi0A.text: I am so annoyed I have to come home and review this restuarant and if there was an option of 0 stars that would be my rating. We dined here on Friday excited to go to a new fun restuarant and all parties agreed it was "ok" for the price.  Beautiful restuarant, ambiance, but service, food needed much work.  So....here is the reason for my 1 star.  Tonight we took a friend for a birthday dinner, I was the only person in out party that had expierence Hearthstone and I was the one that suggested this restuarant.  The service was incepredibly bad, they were out of the crudites which was on the menu so subbed for "everything alacart, which totaled $20.00.  The cheese was suppose to be bri and was a mixture of goat cheese and something else and  amounted to a teaspoon of cheese.  We ordered roasted  beets, carpaccio, fries, a ricotta dip that looked and tasted like glue.  I recommended the pasta which took about 40 minutes and actually we thought maybe they forgot about the order.  We requested a glass of wine and after 20 minutes I went to the reception desk and asked for the manager.  I expressed my displeasure  and embarrassment for bringing my friends here, he took the wine off (big deal) but never came over to talk with us about the bad service and believe me; you would think after expressing your displeasure things would get better...they got worse.  Here is a summary of my back to back dining experiences.  1) bad service 2) very high prices for the quantity/ quality of food  3) after addressing my concerns with the servers and managers...NO ONE really cared!!!  They all looked at you like a deer in headlights!!!!  Not exaggerating!!! 4) A manager never came over once and said I'm sorry for your bad expierence, what can we do to make this better....hey at least a BJ's they train the managers to "act" like they care! 5) I called when I got home to discuss this with the manager who never came on the phone which left me no other outlet but to write this review. 6) I am not looking for anything "free". If you are going to charge these prices you better have the quality and service to support your restuarant. 7) you have just lost 6 people in 3 days that will never return....Im surprised the Fratitas have you on the property....I know they have higher standards than this!

DqE6509s98_IqMOGKng4rQ.text: We enjoyed a most unique and fantastic dinner at Hearthstone tonight. The menu is filled with an assortment of delectable small plates, entrees and the wine list is superb. Special thank you to Brain Massie (executive chef), Tien, Lisa and Donovan- your outstanding, attentive service was well appreciated. Hearthstone is an American rustic design restaurant, with a beautiful outdoor seating area, bar area as well as, cozy leather sofa seating areas for tapas!  Hearthstone can also accommodate families at large high top tables as well as booths. There are also many flat screens great for sporting events! The menu is quite diversified. The meatball short rib flatbread with buffalo mozzarella was perfection, as was the grilled octopus and calamari plates! The house-made sausage was excellent!  Hearthstone offers a variety of oysters, lobsters and clams! For a most cozy, relaxing and comfortably delicious dining experience- visit Hearthstone- you will be glad you did!

bTpeCMiyqUKZHWDLdtz_gw.text: Great dinner and ambiance. Service was fantastic and dinner was delicious - gazpacho and tuna tartar are a must, as are the roasted chicken and chicken pot pie entrees. Will definitely be back again!

q1xZXIIiVJx5oKpXX53X5w.text: I visited hearthstone the other night with my family, And we couldn't have been happier with the service. Our waiter, Ryan was super polite and very handsome!

UP79LrmOeLW95umWlB-fgg.text: @Tien our server was amazing! She suggested some delicious drinks & a mocktail since I wasn't drinking tonight. The vibe in this place is very cool! Definitely coming back again soon!

nFT2lIVCE1dzxE7E2NOl0A.text: Amazing appetizers at the bar until 7. Service was amazing! steak tartare and oysters were my favorite. All happy hour apps are $6. So good!

ScVe1XTuVpz47jLxpPj0Jg.text: We had a great dinner and Jeff our server was great. The east coast oysters were very fresh and tasty. The steak frites and salmon dish were prepared perfectly and were very tasty. The ambiance is unique and very comfortable.

1q3kld27AMfpL7vy6OVckA.text: This place is an excellent choice! Everything is great. Jessica G was my server and she rocks!

wHwkQspWFDkwbUWMpMhIUg.text: The food & service were excellent!  It was our 2nd visit and we will definitely be back again.  The restaurant is upscale, but not pretentious.  Every item we have ordered in our two visits have been delicious.  We had the filet & short rib tonight.  Perfectly seasoned, perfectly cooked!  Highly recommend Hearthstone!

2VZymauyowpmX1mceAWADA.text: Great atmosphere, awesome service. Our server Taylor was great and her recommendation of the lox bagel pizza is a must try!

46TESjS2zSmezN0JfNpsew.text: Excellent food, great service (#johann). Salmon was incredible, bone in filet melted in the mouth.  Peanut butter lava cake was over the top. Can't go wrong. #hearthstonelv

Fyoy7ygExHbIuwkiIaTTZQ.text: What an awesome place to have a great time. Music was great, service was excellent, ambiance was also great. We had Tien as our server and not only was she attentive but also very friendly and easy to get a hold of. It was super busy but yet whenever we needed service she was there. Will be going back soon to try out the food. Keep up the excellent service Tien and great attitude It's hard to find that now these days. Will be asking for you again. Awesome Place!

aax2WHT-nLcRC9SGGsOYRA.text: The atmosphere is warm and inviting, the food is very good but the downside are the prices.  Your entree does not come with a side so on top of the $30-$40 entree you are paying $7 for a side dish.  Although I can appreciate the concept, I wont run back to eat here in the near future.  I ordered the short rib, it was very tender and flavorful but again I cant justify the $30 price tag when I've been to other restaurants who offer short rib dishes with choice of sides for less money.  I typically do not base my reviews on prices as I appreciate quality but these portions were almost appetizer size.

sfKKfH-4VvobN-etSzBaXA.text: De. Lish. You can small-plate your way through this place, and I highly recommend that strategy. Between two of us, we had the best salad, tuna carpaccio, roasted artichokes, and polenta. Each one of them was amazing in its own way. We were only sorry we couldn't try dessert.

ur5ed-RKc2EcjBQldQcwJQ.text: This place is amazing!  Miguel makes super pizzas!  Peter is awesome at the fire oven too!  The salads are great!  The people are terrific! I went two nights in a row! It even won over my picky husband!  Cannot wait to rerun- just wish I lived in Vegas!

gabTr_99UQTfArXu16nY1A.text: Found the food to be good.Interesting and imaginative and of very good quality but definately a little to pricy for the neighborhood.Ive worked at Red Rock since its opening and uless there is a drastic change in,or a new influx of clientele this restraunt will probally only survive as long as its predessors,Hachi,oyster bar,salt lick,cabo and terra rossa.Its a very good restraunt lost in a not so very good neighborhood.

y4VkuCe86yHOmSN_cSV7xg.text: Love the Prisoner wine with hanger steak. Delicious. Lisa the server is fantastic :) great ambiance... And wonderful live music many nights.

4LvCjYJCbZSGlmNV_RmWtg.text: Hearthstone is a great place to take your friends and enjoy good food. I have a lot of business meetings here because it's a wonderful venue to unwind at. Come on Mondays for their all you can eat wings and pitchers of PBR. Ask for Josh or Jessica- they've been great energetic servers every time I've come.

CYPouye3upE2r39H_mI_Ow.text: Ambiance. Is so awesome. I love the layout, the TV's are everywhere. Perfect place to watch a game. Just a really cool spot to eat or drink at.

fbmHIhKusWdJDfIwM5XOcA.text: I've been here numerous times and always loved it. This is a review for my most recent visit. My friend and I came here for Valentine's Day. We just walked in and though we couldn't get a table, the hostess told us we could sit at the bar. There  were only two spots  so we tried to sit and the bartender quickly said nope, reserved.   That was slightly annoying, but we were able to sit at the pizza bar. Enrico was making the pizzas and he's super friendly and made us a heart shaped margherita pizza...Delish!  We ordered oysters caviar (bomb....love fresh oysters that taste like the sea) and the octopus (texture soft and on point). A food runner tried to give us the fois gras but we said we didn't order it. Then our server, Alex, came back with it compliments of the chef. I can never pass up fois!    Loved the server Alex, she was super sweet and knowledgeable. We wanted to order more but got too full.   Bonus points for half off bottles of wine under $100 that night!

Of1dfBstWsr-A4s2jIMIVw.text: Had a great dinner on Saturday night. No wait for patio seating.  Was great sitting outside with the misters.  Sandra was our waitress 5 stars!!! She was great.  Wonderful dinner and the desserts were awesome.  Espresso vanilla martinis the donut bread pudding and the peanut butter dessert were awesome!!!! Would go back again, just don't live in Vegas.  Staying at red rock you should try this place

RESHO4wKMNhOh8fvNJC6iQ.text: I went for brunch today and it was awsome, I had an amazing server named Ahmed and he made our day   Great service Awsome place  Good food

JP9mElU5rHYefqjkP0Xceg.text: I really like the vibe here. Trendy spot, beautiful outdoor patio, nice lighting and great food. We got the truffle pizza, truffle pasta, lollipop chicken, ricotta toast, cranberry bliss drinks, and wine. Everything was really good. The waiter forgot a couple things otherwise it was perfect. Looking forward to coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cranberry bliss drinks, frisking, and a margarita. All were great

rIGxIzCM7qsUEui723Ibyw.text: We live down the street from Red Rock and Hearthstone has become an easy favorite for dinner or drinks. The menu is diverse and the staff is always nice. We've been served by Kate a couple times and we LOVE her! Dollar oyster night is a must too

AGGohjFSNwnEhBMnClQn8w.text: Went here for happy hour and it was great!  Lots to choose from and the prices were very reasonable.  I got a delicious vegetarian slider with a ton of sweet potato fries for about $6.  The space is relaxed and open.  Great place to hangout if you want to watch sports as well.

v6iLYlCIgDemRrYAzC_ESA.text: The establishment is beautiful. They get an A+ in that department.  After the initial great first impression. The rest went down hill from there.  The food was good. We had a picky teenager there, if we go again, we will not take kids. I have 4 kids...I wouldn't recommend taking kids. (Not all of the kids are that picky, I still won't take them).  The service was weird. It was very hard to get our servers attention, and when she made deliveries...she barely stopped at the table. It was like a drive by. And then the bussers took food before we were finished.  All in all...I may go back and try happy hour. Maybe. If I have a coupon.

VkaJezF3qNMslAYq6S3x7g.text: This place is phenomenal! I had the steak and it was very delicious!! I was afraid that it might come out dry or flavor less but I was wrong ! It was tender and cooked exactly how I asked. The place itself is very inviting it has a modern rustic feel! They play live music and it's great music so soothing and relaxing. Perfect for a romantic date or a friend date! Love it!

RHFozwHDMI-mfY-AOrsNpw.text: This place is strong.  Food I have has been great, service is strong, actually has real managers overseeing the establishment.  My only criticism would be that their very fresh oysters and clams are accompanied with salad forks and not cocktail forks--what is with that? I hope they rectify, in the meantime that one issue is not enough to downgrade this rating from five stars.

GdcMEzTk6jUPbOkNU0WAOQ.text: This location is located in the Redrock Casino in Summerlin. You can enter the restaurant from the outside without having to go through the casino.  Quinoa Apple salad - Excellent! $13  Chic Pea Provolone Salad w/ chicken - Was not that great. Too much lemon and bland. $19  Charbroiled Octopus - excellent. The lemon taste with the char gave it great flavor. $16  Baked Ricotta - Served with toast and honey with truffle oil. Sooo good!! $16  Hanger Steak - The steak was brushed with a truffle oil. Cooked perfect (med-rare). Excellent cut of meat. $33  $105 for: 2 salads 2 apps 1 entree  Overall it was an excellent meal and I would definitely recommend this place. It is quite pricey here though and the portions are small.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger Steak (med-rare).
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charbroiled Octopus.

qknN2jOy7sQO60iRFK2gPg.text: The decor and atmosphere are great. The buffalo chicken lollipop wings were amazing. Everything else was meh, especially the service. I had to ask what the fish of the day was and the server dug through her notebook to find a scrap of paper she had written it on a read it off in a bored tone mispronouncing many of the ingredients. Besides that she was barely around and incredibly hard to get the attention of. The fried chicken was tragically overfried and $4 for a soda water is unbelievable. We live close by so we're hoping to make this a regular spot but the cost for the lackluster quality and service will be a deterrent.

lNVDtpJfRuwTMYyRH-O9bw.text: First visit to Hearthstone Kitchen! Great service and great food! Ahmed was awesome sauce!

7sasawGJPvAXT8tY6zrKbg.text: $1 oysters on Wednesday's are amazing! Food is delicious and our server Ahmed was awesome!

RtdRYaquUpUSHcu-TPyXxw.text: I came here for a work Christmas Party recently and I love the ambiance here. It kind of reminds of Honey Salt which is also in Summerlin.  While I think it is on the pricy side I was there for a Christmas party so I didn't have to worry about paying :)   The service was very good. They came over several times throughout our meal and checked on us and made sure we were enjoying our experience. They also took our picture a couple of times when we asked which was nice of them.  I have to say I enjoyed their appetizers and small bites more than my actual meal. I would love to come back and try more of them because they were hard to choose from because they all looked so good!  We decided to start off with the hummus, mac and cheese and the dates. I have to say the dates were my favorite out of all three. They were served with red sauce which was a great pairing. The mac and cheese was great for splitting since it was very heavy. The hummus was good but my least favorite.  We then also decided to order the deviled eggs. OMG they were probably the best denied eggs I have ever have and they looked so pretty when they were served.  If I came back I would have to order the dates and the eggs again.  I then ordered the tomato basil soup. So good and creamy. It was also served with a tiny grilled cheese sandwich that was great for dipping.   I ordered a pasta dish but I don't recall the name. By that time I was pretty full and probably didn't need to order this. I took it home for my uncle to try.   I did, however, save room for dessert. We tried the Honey Olive Oil Cake and the Milk Chocolate Souffle. The souffle was just ok to me but I really enjoyed the olive oil cake. The olive oil made it very moist. It was served with blood orange sherbet. Which felt kind of odd as a pairing but still tasted good.  I enjoyed the dining experience. I will be back to try more apps and dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5 sangria pitchers on Wednesdays!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken truffle pizza. Yum!!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate soufflé

YTZOUlhLSJkscvwzBwZSyg.text: What a great place to go with friends or family!  I loved the atmosphere!  The food and drinks were incredible! Most importantly however, was the outstanding service from Ahmed.  He is by far one of the most amazing servers we have had; very personable, thoughtful, fun and delightful.  We left saying how impressed we were that someone cared so much about one table.  He is amazing!  I hope you get to meet him!  I would say go for all of these things but mostly go for this quality service.  Thanks, Ahmed!

brqZ7PdRMA28id40qOwMVg.text: Kelsey at the bar took great care of us. Perfect place for Sunday football. Service was great and food deals were awesome. Will be back for more of football season. Be sure to ask for Kelsey. She was hard at work even on her bday! And makes a great mimosa :)

vBc34BYrX3nNH3mJ6RF13w.text: Ahmed and this restaurant were amazing!!! I'm not sure which was better .. the service or the food.,, possibly a tie - phenomenal!!! I would come back to this spot every time I'm at red rock!!!

1voRLVaf4su0BtCm0QKdGg.text: Pizza and whiskey make this a must visit location. Hearthstone has many attributes. First among them is the pizza. Chef Enzo is a pizza master straight from Italy and specializes in Neapolitan style thin crust pizzas. They are amazing. The crust is well done with a hint of smokiness from the wood fired oven. Try the meatball pizza for a touch of salty protein goodness complimented by fresh cheese and tomato sauce. If you're feeling adventurous, ask for the pizza of the night. It's a special pizza creation which changes regularly.  All of the menu items are amazing. The lollipop chicken wings, prime rib, and pork shoulder are phenomenal. The meat and cheese board is great for sharing. The roasted jalapeno hummus makes for a wonderful non-meat snack.  I could eat here everyday.  While Hearthstone is light on beer and wine by the glass options, they shine with their whiskey selection. It's a showcase with Woodford, Elijah Craig, Sunntori, Crown XR, Red Breast and other whiskey favorites. I haven't seen a collection like this in quite some time.  The only real downside is that the restaurant is not usually busy. On the odd occasion when it is, the staff gets weeded very easily. Then it's hard to get service. The servers aren't used to high customer volume.

cPWE2ssLCffu_JH_JQvXzQ.text: Not bad, not great. Hearthstone is an extreme hipster bar and restaurant located in the red rock casino. Bartenders make you feel like a total idiot if you ask any sort of question. We felt so uncomfortable we moved to a table. We tried the steak tar tar and popcorn. Both were mediocre at best so we decided to leave and go to yard house instead.

KwGqkal_-ywQHjYEQOAOLg.text: I have been here a couple of times for brunch and every time was excellent. But I am writing about our specific experience for dinner last night. After a long work week for both of us, my husband and I wanted an easy dinner with our 8 month old daughter. We decided on Hearthstone to have something a little different than our usual spots. We were seated right away, even though the restaurant was full and bustling. Our server Ahmed was attentive and friendly. We shared a DOC pizza which was as good as the best pizza places in town. Thin and gooey deliciousness! I had the apple and quinoa salad. Extremely filling, refreshing, and tasty. My husband was in the mood for a burger, but decided on Ahmed recommendation of the French dip. Amazing choice!!  With all of this and two beers the bill was $85 with tax and tip. We will definitely be going back soon. It is a fun, hip atmosphere with delicious food and excellent service. Who needs much more?

pi9i85d-eCmGf9UUrPixGw.text: Wow! The food was delicious! I was extremely impressed by the presentation of the food, and the flavors were on point. The staff were extremely friendly, patient, and helpful. I like that the manager came by and asked us about our experience. He made us feel like our opinion on our experience was appreciated. I plan on returning soon!

C_BNw358l_f8oh9k4nna5w.text: Great location inside Redrock casino.  Its a great stop during the Royal Pub Crawl on Fri nights.  Staff is very patient with our large group of usually at least 12 people.  I like the seafood sampler and the cheese pizza is awesome.  I could definatly make a meal out of just the appetizers as well.

hoPnuQcBGUORLz2AYa-jIw.text: Great place, great ambience , great servers. And, oh, food is good too. Every time you are greeted and treated at this place as if you have been a regular, although I show up once every two months. Jayde is a great waiter /ess , very polite and helpful with the menu. I will try to stop by more often.

cQwMlhj--KF4KBTIzXHZ4w.text: My wife and I wanted to try a new place for our anniversary. So Hearthstone was the spot.  Made 530 reservations, showed up at 5, no problem they sat us at a table.  Our Server was Rigo and he was fantastic. As were all of the servers that had any interaction with us during the meal. The service was the only reason there's 3 stars.  We started with the Bacon Wrapped Dates. There was nothing special or interesting about them. For $14 we were given 3 dates stuffed with chorizo, wrapped in a chunk of bacon, and set atop some red sauce that was too close to RAGU from a jar, to be called anything else. Literally $2.50 worth meat and produce sold for $14. My wife ordered the Burger $17 and added bacon $3. It was good, not great, bacon was top notch.So again, $20 for a burger??  Myself after seeing what $14 got me with the Dates I ordered the Froman pizza. $19 for 10"-12" of paper thin crust with about 8 slices of garlic sausage, and I could see more sauce than cheese.   I had 2 805 draft beers with dinner and they were spot on. Cold, clean and crisp, you could tell they were doing simple drink preparation right.   I get it, the build out for this place probably cost a fortune, and the rent Stations is charging is scary to say the least. At the same time $73 for a burger, a tiny pizza, a few pieces of fruit and a couple beers???   We could have spent $40 more and went to Echo and Rig and had a legit meal.   Oh and the desert special was sweet potato pie.. 2 days after thanksgiving. Just what people want, more sweet potatoes.   Won't say won't, but highly unlikely that we'll be back.

YZovMpxnQE9U8I_IV6p2Zw.text: This place over all is amazing! THeir brunch though is to die for!!!!! IF you want somewhere tasty with a great  atmosphere, go here!

2jSOtadVGdAgJb4pKtVKIg.text: Went for happy hour after the pool, perfect variety of choices on the happy hour menu, and our server Nate was the best!

UKuri8lQ1yM8F9X36s-0eA.text: Awesome service & Amazing environment. Sat at the bar and got amazing service from Kristen & Jay were so awesome. Personalized service even during the busy time. This is officially one of our new favorite local spots.

0icHfke-yzL0DpeE5Q1HRQ.text: My wife and I have been here several times, but had a bad experience a few months ago. The manager Russell invited us back and we were happy we made the choice to take him up on his offer.   Gerson was our waiter and he was extremely attentive and the customer service was fantastic. The food was good and we will definitely be returning again.   Thanks again Russell and Gerson. We will see you soon.

gO5oxL00c4oiWyy2AKxV3A.text: I would like to start by saying my rating is no reflection on the environment or staff, both were great. I have order food to go as well as now dined in as the food left much to be desired. I had the prime rib and my dining partner had the hanger steak, both were mediocre and lacked seasoning. If you are looking for a great place for drinks, great service and maybe a meat and cheese plater, this is your place. If you are looking for a great meal, not so much maybe try Echo and Rig!

swweXl9S82VJhIBVHK3UHQ.text: The staff was amazing and extremely friendly. On top of the gorgeous ambiance, the food was high quality. I tried the wings which were subpar, the burger which was great and my sister had the prime rib that was literally the best thing I've ever tasted. Seriously. The best thing. Ever. Go eat it. Now.   Great place but it's a bit pricey so beware. Thanks Hearthstone!

YNDOZcVlDumoZPYCNhyuqw.text: I've been to this place twice. The first time I was there for dinner and the most recent time I was there for brunch. Both times service sucked, you are seated and then you wait forever to have someone notice you're sitting there. Let's focus on the last time I was there though and the last time I ever plan on going here. We sat at the bar, it was like 1pm and we were starving. We ordered the crispy potato waffle - there's a HUGE difference between crispy and burnt. There was absolutely no flavor to it. It was dry and unappetizing. We sent it back. We also got their donut thingy and it was way too sweet plus by then our remaining tastebuds had committed suicide so didn't even finish that. Needless to say we don't plan on going back.

Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is NOT crispy! This sh*t is burned.

Zh_yuC1k3OEVrC03Vnax_g.text: Great food, even better service. Christian our server was awesome. We felt very welcomed by the entire staff.

0W6VvIfgfKpxtY2M7yi8kA.text: Excellent Place for good service and delicious food ! I have had dinner several times here ! I love the booths and the ambiance ! Thank You Russel,  for providing a excellent eating Experience , worth trying often!

XcFABcgfvi1QQvgCyUTlAA.text: Love this place. We've been twice for 1/2 off wine on Mon. Great choices. Happy hour food menu is very good. Service has been good both times.

ZaPwo4lc9HhunuoC1lHtlg.text: Everything was delicious. I had the chicken & waffles. My husband had the donut bread pudding French toast. My son had the cheeseburger & fries. OMG! The cinnamon sticky bun was melt in your mouth delicious. The service was excellent.

Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Donut bread pudding French toast

elEyV2G_Xt6yeHuU7H9saQ.text: My favorite local restaurants! The atmosphere is really cozy and comfortable. They have a wide variety of dishes, and delicious dessert! I highly recommend their pizzas, oysters & the pineapple cake for dessert. Also if you're at the bar ask for Josh. He is the most kind & caring man! I absolutely adore him!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i6zJYLZY-CMd9bvj7gqwkA.text: Hearthstone is a great place for all types of dining experiences. My friend and I came for their happy hour and enjoyed both drinks and food off the happy hour menu. The food exceeded expectation, as did the service. Our server, Natalie, was prompt, friendly and always checking in on us to ensure our food was up to par and that our drinks were always fresh. I'll certainly be coming back to enjoy happy hour and hearthstone, and I hope Natalie is our server!

poo2Sff7-VMhifngJS8W7A.text: I just went Hearthstone with 4 other GFs for Happy Hour (5-7pm) & had a wonderful time!   We sat outside & the weather was perfect.  I ordered the Flower Bomb cocktail & it was delicious.   My favorite of all the appetizers was the BAKED RICOTTA TOAST.   We also had the following (but nothing atop Jalapeno Hummus  Harvest Quinoa Salad  Chicken Wings Pepperoni Pizza  Oh & their Nutella Something dessert with cookie. Good but nothing I would order again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GuroT_vjC74Ex3RCya0Z-g.text: The food here is delish  We got their wings before and they are lollipop style. Perfect for me since I had a vsg done and can't consume much food.   I've also tried their short rib dish and honestly everything on the dish compliments each other harmoniously.   Their dessert, the butterscotch dessert Is YUM

GKf0gl4470O1fSl-LKSENQ.text: Hearthstone's food was average, but the prices are ridiculous for the portion size and flavor. I came here with a group and here are the highlights:   For a grilled cheese and fries on the kids menu, it's $8. Not worth $8 especially when the fries did not taste that great.   Beverages like a fruit juice or iced tea is $4  The chicken and mushroom pizzas were good, but for the price and portion size (individual size) at $20+, you're better off going somewhere else.  Service was great and the decor of the restaurant was nice. It got a little too loud though for me. Overall, not sure if this restaurant made the list of "restaurants to go to", but I'm happy we came out to check it out.

dVOe3mPm6G4nvXgMHMTA8w.text: First impressions: The place is huge! Loved the ambiance. Definitely want to go back for a date night and have drinks on the patio or the couches up front.  Service was pretty good. Our server was quick with our drinks/refills and starters.  The pimento cheese deviled eggs were great - tiny, but delicious. Entree portions were small. I ordered the lobster roll - good, but was missing something. I couldn't help but compare it to Cousin's Maine Lobster food truck's lobster rolls, which are my favorite. I think the bread needed more butter or a sauce... I don't know, it was just missing something. But still good! I got the mac & cheese as a side, which was delicious - hot and gooey.  We had our young son with us, and there was plenty of space that allowed us to pull his stroller up beside our table. There were plenty of families with kids there - while I wouldn't say it's a "good place for kids," they are definitely welcome.  I'll definitely be back, but probably won't order the lobster roll again.

2J4fAwqWlvjHGGkhLtctbw.text: Very Eclectic servings of twisty takes on American cuisine!  As a Vegas local, we come to Red Rock often, and this is a nice edition to the local's casino :). Thank you to Alexandra, our server for a wonderful night!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nPGUydBFPsGCJ9Mrei2o-g.text: Had a wonderful time at hearthstone. Great service and appetizers for happy hour were all great too. Had some great wine selections too. Nice to sit in their outside patio where there is water outside of it. Enjoyed it and can't wait to return.

qACBEirXN9mjIj0407Kmtw.text: Asked for a seat outside. Got seated outside by the hostess. After 10 minutes nobody came up to us. Another group was seated and immediately got service. We left.  Reply to Andrew P: we were seated around 8:25 PM.   Reply #2 to Andrew P: we did not seat ourselves. We walked up to the hostess' desk area in the front of the restaurant and were seated by 1 of 2 hostesses working that night - peculiar how it is stated that the the hostess was not aware of this.

rM-9PUhceYhvPKrTOLdQIQ.text: Came in on a Wednesday evening with my friend and were seated right away. The atmosphere and decor were really cool atmosphere. The servers uniforms were also pretty cool!  Service: really good. They were on top of everything and very friendly. Pierre was our server and made some great recommendations. Our Busser Jose was also very sweet and made good recommendations as well.   Food: everything we had was great. there are also of more items I would like to try.

-xTYYD7HXI333yCTFy4H8g.text: Beautiful venue.  Decided to take my girlfriend here on date night and it was the most fun! We actually tried the happy hour sliders and jalapeno hummus, great portions for being happy hour food. Bartender Chelsea and barback Carlos were nice and sweet.  Will be back.

KMl6XVdKdAOCtPkuquiWLA.text: Great food with some unique flavors.  We ordered lots of the family style dishes so we could share.  The kale salad was excellent.  The flatbread pizza was cooked perfectly.  The tuna carpaccio was my favorite.   The servers need to pay closer attention to drink refills.  I am a fan!

nDaFjAic8P3zFGDoKwHbtg.text: Nice live band.  Great to meet friends and perfect vibe.  Pizza very tasty too! We had a fabulous evening together!

kJXav0RbQgpuf5UJB059Ig.text: Walking around during the life is beautiful event and saw this situated in front of the stage where Echosmith was getting ready to perform.  Two large pigs rotating on an open fire, fresh garlic being mixed in their specially blended sauce and hearing the skin break as the fire traveled deeper into the pig was enough for me to try this place out.  I got their pig wrap which was fresh pulled pork in a bed of their creamy garlic sauce and vegetables. Packed a lot of flavor and definitely was the food highlight for this years life is beautiful event.  Next its off to the restaurant to try what else they have and if it was like that pork wrap then i know i won't be disappointed.

sgdZ3FJhQbQeVck-DYeSeA.text: When someone specifically says - I'm a vegetarian. But my friend will eat the ham. Can you please put the ham on a separate plate? Then the server runs away after throwing your plate in front of you, because they clearly realizes the issue and you try to ask for another plate to cut half of your food off. Never came back to apologize, ask if everything was ok, etc. have to ask another server for a plate. End up having to eat when you get home. Yeah, great place.....

aTAHPWmhQuWDw8Gn_sacYA.text: Pretty good place overall.   Service was A+ and even the managers bus tables.   Drink prices feel like the strip but food is pretty good.   Calamari portion was alittle steep for what you get.

O7tLY4_oQA0c4tkbtWy53A.text: I would say this is Red Rock's best restaurant. This place is over the top. The restaurant is half inside, half outside and it's awesome. I don't mean that there's a section inside that leads to an outside patio. Literally half the restaurant is inside and the other half is outside. There isn't really any border. It's sick! The restaurant has such an amazing vibe, in and out.  Also, the staff is very friendly and very helpful. They are always coming back cleaning up as soon as you finish an appetizer or drink which is very convenient. They are really are quality staff. The only thing I'd warn anyone about this place is that the portions are a bit on the smaller side. I wasn't shocked, seeing that this restaurant is a bit on the pricier side. That's to be expected of a place like this, but all in all, this place rocks. Definitely a great date spot and/or higher end hang for a group of people.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TQUxSyX4UYB8tuBTycd6eA.text: I'll be honest, I was pretty hesitant about coming here bc of a couple of the reviews, but when I went there last Saturday, I did not experience any type of hiccup food-wise or service-wise.  - The servers were able to recommend some amazing starters and entrees - The portions could've been a little bigger, but it wasn't too disappointing. - I LOVED the carbonara. Fried egg on pizza??? So good.  - The only thing I do wish is that we sat in the outdoor area!!  - My family and I met the manager, awesome guy! Really made us feel at home.  -The servers were accommodating and VERY on top of things.  It felt like we were eating at a restaurant with The Strip quality, but with the local feel that I love most about Vegas.  Highly recommended for us special locals!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara - fresh egg cooked on flatbread. Delicious!!!

wJieEpNjISh0FepkMUdOAw.text: So sad, I hate to do this but worst service ever! Was so excited to go to brunch with a group of girl friends, looked like a great atmosphere, sat outdoors but after and hour and a half and our brunch still not served when tables before us had been there had to take the initiative and ask what was going on (waitress did not come to explain on her own) was told was on way but still took quite a while, just left like we were ignore entirely ... eggs were cold when came out smh.... so disappointing, don't go if hungry

s4Dp8cEhBtnvbZy2AjG3Qw.text: I've been wanting to try this place and last night I finally went.  It was quite busy, since it was Saturday night and it is a new place.  The wait for a table was one hour at 8:00 p.m., but there was open seating at the coffee table at the back, so we went for that.  I love the decor and ambiance. The feeling is like being at a very laid back wealthy person's suburban or country home. Not flashy, but luxurious while remaining casual.   The service was good but the food was just OK.  My friend and I each had a cocktail ($12 each, which is the going rate these days) and we split the hummus, meatballs, and stuffed dates.   The hummus was served with flatbread that I liked, but the dip itself was NOT good. The texture was oddly fluffy and the flavor was lacking. Not bad, just bland.   The short rib meatballs were OK. Not worth $12 for three mediocre meatballs, but not bad. Just not special or very good.   The stuffed dates were OK. I have had these at a lot of other places (Firefly and Cafe BaBa Reeba, among them) and I think that they were also overpriced and just OK.   Our tab, with the above was $60 before tip. I would go back for a drink and maybe to share different small plates but I am not in a hurry to go there again.

2088-SqpjGg8PUjclAfVoQ.text: Yummmy.   Diverse and interesting menu. I've had many items and they're all delicious.   My faves are truffle oil popcorn and the stuffed dates.   Yummy drinks and wines to boot.

jbg8vXMBxnbiwttxpFJZ5A.text: Hello, and welcome to Hearthstone Kitchen &Cellar. This was our first stop for restaurant week 2017. #helpoutdineout. We hit up 4 this year and I have reviewed them in reverse order. We had reservations through open table and arrived early. We were seated immediately and drink orders were taken. The first thing I noticed is how loud this place is. we were seated not far from the bar and close to a couple group tables. Hearthstone is a Clique Entertainment group facility they have Baracha and Botigla in GVR. We are a fan of their product so Hearthstone seemed like a natural choice. Plus it's in a local casino not on the strip which is a plus.  We received both the regular and the restaurant week menus and took a gander at both. We decided on restaurant week menu as it gave a great sampling and helps out local charity.  First course, Chef's Meat and Cheese Board and crispy calamari.. We also ordered a Cheesy bread off the Happy Hour menu. So, this is where the meal takes a left turn. I start to notice that other meals start to come out at the tables seated around us but after us. I stay silent (for a change) and just wait. Every time waitress comes by she says it should only be a few more minutes. The meat and cheese area where they make stuff is visible and we can see what is coming out. Not our stuff. The cheesy bread was good, but I am ready to order a second beer and on a 3rd water. Finally our Calamari comes out and the Meet & Cheese Board. I am on my 2nd bite of Calamari and my main dish shows up. More on the mains in a moment. I must have had a look of confusion on my face because the manager comes by and asks if all was okay. I stated that the timing of the kitchen is off because our apps and main dishes just arrived almost at same time. So something is going to get either warm or cold while I eat the other. She stated that she would talk to kitchen and take care of our drinks for the night and our apps. Since its restaurant week apps are part of the all inclusive, so that is not an option. However, drinks were taken care of and the one off menu item we had was deducted. Good recovery. we heard from others that this is an on going issue. Back to the food. Since it is a Clique facility we had High expectations. Was not disappointed. The apps were Calamari and Meat and Cheese board. Calamari was seasoned and cooked well just as it is at Botiglia. Meat and cheese board, Excellent slices of meat and fresh cheeses. They use Cabot Sharp cheddar which is one of my favorites. Has a nice sharp bite and is a white cheddar which as we all know the natural way to have cheese. Board also contained a couple different salamis and one other cheese, not positive what that was at this time.  Very soon after came our main dishes. I had the Prime Flat Iron Steak, Josie had Shrimp and Grits. Botigla once offered the flat iron but had removed it before I had the honor of trying it, so I was elated to find this on the restaurant week menu. Served with an earthy peppercorn sauce. Cooked medium rare as requested. Slicing through was like butter and it was melt in your mouth delicious. Served with a side of mashed potatoes that are really nondescript. Josie's shrimp and grits were equally enjoyable. Shrimp cooked perfectly and a slight spice added for taste and a good bite. Grits were pleasantly cooked and creamy. Overall, despite the timing of the two first courses the meal took shape flavor wise.  Desert,  we ordered the Nutella pizza. It's simple, Nutella on crisp pizza dough.If any one of the chefs are reading this; a nice banana or strawberry would go great on top of this. It was good and rich but needed a sweet fruit component added to the top. We stated that to the waitress and she added that many people have said the same thing. Maybe the customer is right.  Thank you for Dining at Hearthstone kitchen and Cellar. After a rough start they recovered well. I must add if you use the Yelp app there is a free glass of house wine. Our drinks and one app were all covered after the timing thing, so customer satisfaction is definitely paramount.  We will probably go again and try some different fare on the menu. We are fans of the Clique group so most likely will happen. If you are in Red Rock Station and want a good meal before or after a show or bowling the food is good and the beer is great and has some local stuff on tap.

FKzXObxkXCmu4yr0Zc6Bdw.text: The food was above par. My boyfriend and I are chefs at fine dining restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip so I feel we have a higher level of expectations with where we dine. The food here was delicious. I've been craving good food since we came back from Chicago and the food at Hearthstone satisfied that craving like no other. I'll start by saying the atmosphere is perfect. I'm one to judge my experience by multiple things; decor/atmosphere being in my top three. Second service was on point. Our server Taylor joined in on our tipsy conversation about going to a Bieber concert just because "the girlfriend wants to go"  debate. He was super friendly and had good suggestions on the menu; which made it more difficulty to select something.  I really enjoyed my endless and free mimosa this Sunday. This will be a place I will come to weekly.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crouque Madame... A mouth watering experience for sure. My petite lil self ate the shit out of this.

95ZYPZ07QVbz5U5OjKGlGA.text: Yeah so this my second time going to Hearthstone. Me and my friend came for the AYCE wings and happy hour for Monday Night Football.   Let me tell you this, this place was awesome. The wings came out fast and they tasted great. Our server Kate was outstanding! She made sure our drinks were filled (5 pitchers of PBR throughout the night) and anything we needed she brought to us very quickly (it got real busy that night). Oh and Crystal was great too! Lol  All in all, I would gladly come back again to either eat/drink, or even to hangout. Lol

Aw0O0aL_8Zk9M6lFRmvsZw.text: My dad and I are staying in the Red Rock Resort so naturally after a day drinking and gambling downtown and along the strip we were happy to do something close and easy for dinner. Hearthstone seemed like it would hit the spot, and that it sure did.   My dad opted for the fried chicken with an apple slaw and biscuit while I went with the lobster roll with skinny fries, we shared the green beans which were cooked in bacon and topped with almonds and were legit the best green beans I've ever eaten, albeit probably the most fattening.   Fried chicken was delicious and moist. Huge serving with a biscuit that had melted cheese over the top. The apple slaw was also quite good, even to my father who proclaims his distaste for any type of cole slaw.  Lobster roll was buttery deliciousness with huge chunks of lobster perfectly coated with whatever their mayo mixture is. The whole thing was devoured. Fries were fries - good but everything else was great.   My dad got the strawberry margarita while I sipped on the endless refills of water. Drink was okay, I probably wasn't the best judge of drinks at that particular moment, I was alcoholed out.   Service was friendly and super fast as well as informative. Our waitress recommended the green beans to us and as I already expressed my love for them, she did not disappoint.   Seems to be a bit pricey for what you get however. $25 for friend chicken, $28 for a lobster roll (the lobster did taste very fresh and was cooked to perfection however). Not sure if this is due to being in the resort or not. I would recommend for hotel guests absolutely, locals however probably know where to find other quality food that isn't as highly priced.

6Iotj2NsxSSqbJu74v-8rQ.text: Came here for brunch and to watch the Knights game. They have a TON of TVs, which makes it a great place for a game. Also, they do bottomless mimosas for $15 and they are not cheap about them. I will 100% be back!

TA16nYAjFdB9f1Cz5SbJBA.text: Lisa was our server today, she was amazing!! Totally hooked up us with the best drinks and she's baller af!! 5 stars

70ce7t47D8MD2APcKRgI0Q.text: Super cute place. We went for brunch at got bottomless mimosas- that are pre mixed so you can't mix if yourself. My friend got Th doughnut dough French toast which was amazing!! And I got eggs Benedict. My eggs and bread weren't right but I still at it and they were so nice and actually took it off the bill! Amazing service. Our server was super helpful and nice! Coming back for sure!

8XqGePMw76sHYWj6FqYLRA.text: Hearthstone is a cute and trendy place to have happy hour or a birthday dinner!  I've experienced both, but have to say their service is kinda slow so prepare to sit down and wait not just eat and leave in a jiffy.   We've gone to celebrate my mom's birthday with a party of 10. We ordered so much food for the table we had leftovers. Ive tried the Rotisserie Chicken, Fried calamari and Tuna Tartare all were amazing. Plus they had a live performance on Saturday night while wining and dining. Kudos to that!  As for Steak tartare bites, cheese pizza & wings for happy hour they're totally worth it for the price! Plus wine on tap for half the price equals double score!

dmuXdrpgd1D-qfNjMP-R2w.text: I like their appetizers here. Some of my favorites are their Brussel sprouts Ceasars salad and their watermelon salad. I also love their kumamoto oysters. They have live music on the weekends. Sometimes the music is awesome, and other times it can be painful while waiting for the food to arrive. Lol

0qT6D_Im9n9SkSn1P24_eg.text: Ok so I give this place 3 stars because I wasn't a fan of what I got but I do want to go back and try the pizzas because they look really good and seems like the kind of pizza I would like. I really enjoyed the ambiance and the service was on point. I got the prime rib French dip and it was a bit on the salty side and the meat was like shredded which I wasn't expecting. The sandwich was ok. Will definitely be going back to try out the pizza and will update when I do that. FYI they do half off pizzas on Sundays :)

lZDYNx3OvOJWJyYMpdsT9A.text: This is the best steakhouse  Everything from the appetizers to the desserts and everything in between. The food was amazing very good. taste was on point thank you to waiter and manager excellent job  The service is outstanding top notch from the minute we got there to on our way out making us feel at home

EclIr7buYBNGt8mIw81Xlg.text: I highly recommend this place to anyone staying at red rock or even people in the area. Or if you are willing to drive a ways and get out of Henderson or Vegas. It's well worth the trip.   When you first walk in there's this weird gallery wall that I'm not a huge fan of, but the rest of the decor throughout the restaurant, including the patio is very homey and well done. I wouldn't mind living there.   The service was great. We had a group of six people, two of which were kids and one baby. They accommodated us very well. Not to mention they had kid's menus. It's rare you go to a restaurant like this and they actually have a tangible paper kids menu (No doodling space though). I tried the deviled eggs and the beet and arugula salad. The deviled eggs were so fantastic. I wish I could replicate them. And the beet salad was very refreshing and light. Although, I do wish they put more than just 3 leaves of arugula on it and transformed it into more of an actual salad.   The kids loved their Mac & cheese, chicken tenders and grilled cheese and tomato soup. Also: honorable mention to our waitress who allowed us to convert the fancy adult Mac & cheese into a kids version even though it wasn't on the menu.   Check it out if you're ever in Summerlin, or not... Just check it out. Period.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled egg. So amazing.

0Udp5_OpTePk_4GfMHFrww.text: 3.5 stars  We stayed in red rock hotel for a whole week so we decided to give this place a try. Everything was solid here, no surprise, no disappointment. We ordered baked ricotta, meatballs, king salmon, and peanut butter lava cake. The best part of the meal was the dessert recommended by our server. Service was friendly but a little bit slow. It took about 20 mins to get our lava cake.

Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs

yhbnxg-wzTQiG0GcLWnYag.text: It was okay.. the atmosphere was great and they had live music at the time. The food was not bad; 3 stars just because both the calamari and my prime rib was a bit on the super salty side. They were busy and I'm not much to complain; was probably one bad batch out of all the meals they do. The price point is also somewhat high for the atmosphere and the food. This dinner and cocktail for 2 cost me more than my visit to Joe's Stonecrab and steakhouse at Caesar's the prior week. However, I would still recommend it just because it is a good feel. I will probably try a brunch and happy hour next time.

rS78CXmAQcCQaDGXFKwgbQ.text: Walking into Hearthstone on Saturday evening, I didn't know what to expect. I'm conflicted about the service, but the food was definitely solid.   At the beginning of our dinner service service was a bit of a mess. Slow refills, staff that wasn't entirely informed on the menu and a hostess that was clearly hired for looks over substance.   As the evening progressed, the quality of the food more than made up for the lackluster service that started out our evening. Service became much more attentive once we were ushered indoors when it got a little gusty.   My favorites from the evening were the charred octopus, FG & J, steak tartare, crabby cakes and roast.   I look forward to utilizing that patio again soon for brunch before the weather gets too warm. Great meal overall. Full disclosure, we were not presented with a check at the end of the meal, but we tipped very generously.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charred octopus
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crabby snack
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare

tcaKWjKokfj4ceRxgKSkHg.text: I came to hearthstone for brunch and let me tell you, what an experience! I sat at the bar and was served by Jose and Sara and they were spectacular. They made my experience wonderful and made me feel very special. I will definitely be back soon.

7uMmKaRzCYPY04TQ2EwVTg.text: Probably the best restaurant Red Rock has to offer. The interior is super cute and they have live music on the weekends and last night (Thursday) they were having a wine tasting. This place is an ideal first date spot.   The menu has a little bit of everything. Pizza, salad, pastas, lobster roll, Mac n cheese, hangar steak, and everything had a funky little twist and presentation. Our group ordered their cheese/meat plate last night, such a cool presentation (I don't eat meat so I had never seen this one before). Was a great appetizer for a big group.   Everytime we have been the menu has changed but if the tomato soup is on the menu get it! It's delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese/meat &#34;platter&#34;
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato soup with a mini grilled cheese

tDjEVYP2pErtZJivyyvnVA.text: *****Update****** Sarah from Hearthstone contacted me and asked for an opportunity to make the poor experience up to us. On Saturday we decided to stop in and eat with a group of friends. When Sarah heard we were there she asked if she could possibly make it up to us by bringing us some complimentary appetizers. I told her it was completely up to her because we were now a party of 7 vs the party of 4 when the incident occurred and I did not want her to feel obligated to do so. Well let me tell you...................I think Sarah may have brought us close to every appetizer on the menu as well as multiple entrees off the menu in addition to what we ordered. Our server Jeff went above and beyond to make the experience absolutely amazing. When the bill came we were fully expecting to pay for the dinners we ordered and we were shocked to find out they had comped everything and even asked us if we had room for dessert! We were stuffed. Needless to say we tipped Jeff well and thanked everyone for their attentiveness and willingness to make up for the bad experience. Sarah and Jeff are amazing and Thank you for making things right.  Please go visit them and say Hey!!! We will certainly be back.   So this just happened!!!! 4 of us just went to  Hearthstone for the $10 bottomless chicken wings. Since I don't eat chicken I ordered a separate meal that was about $22 while the other 3 decided to get the wings. The waiter proceeds to tell us unless everyone at the table orders wings they can't honor the $10 bottomless wings for the other 3. I explained I don't eat chicken and if he could get the manager. The manager tells us sorry those are the rules and they can't accommodate. Are you kidding me? Since I didn't order the $10 bottomless wings and instead I'm going to order a meal that's 2x's the cost plus we all ordered drinks from the bar. You just lost a group of paying customers that would spend a minimum of $100 plus tip for a possible group of 4 that may spend only $40 plus tip. Dumb business practice. Oh and by the way there's no ****special restrictions listed on the promo.  We'll take our business somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ICNLFLNKyMvckkthKRKgBg.text: Now this place was a True hidden gem! Secret now discovered!!  Hearthstone has been some of the best dining I've had at Red Rock Casino. It's incredibly cool with a rustic theme, the service was awesome - at the bar and the dining room, the drinks were enjoyable, and the food was delicious.  Happy Hour starts at 5pm and ends at 7pm, Mon-Sun. Can't beat that!! It was an incredible deal and certainly one that will keep me coming back to the restaurant.  The Pinot Noir on the happy hour menu is decently good and pairs well with the chicken wings on the happy hour menu. Finger licking good!!  The server suggested the Watermelon salad special: It was decently portioned out and had feta cheese, hazelnuts, avocado, thinly sliced red onion, and arugula. Amazing!!  We also ordered their DOC pizza, jalapeno hummus with a side of sesame lavash, and a dozen oysters.  For desert, we had the chocolate ice cream that surprisingly came with a warm home made chocolate chip cookie and their chocolate souffle which was absolutely worth the 20 min wait time.   Hearthstone has definitely lived up the hype! I'll be back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XJVFBa_nCwA739VuxK_rIA.text: Great place inside the red rock hotel and casino for full heavy meal or just a light meal. Healthy and savory options so there will be something for everyone including those with gluten allergies ! This is great space feels like a European market vibe. The happy hour menu is great to make sure to ask for it. I have been here several times and never have had a bad experience
