qmbNb9k4oaudKXBf9LhE5Q.text: This visit we came for the suckling pig. One of our friends is a vegetarian and the chef prepared a special plate for her. Communication with the manager was awesome. She made sure everything was special for all 6 of us. We named our pig 'Ham Solo' and what a surprise, when we were seated, and saw the Star Wars masks! Nice touch! The whole experience, especially for our out of town guests, was fantastic. The whole staff went above and beyond. A night we will always remember.   The food was superb! We started off with the meat and cheese tray and some specialty drinks, flower bomb, Hearthstone margarita and sangria. All delicious. Next, Ham Solo was rolled out on a cart and placed on our Star Wars themed table for the knife. The prep was something to watch and brought in a few of the surrounding table guests for picture ops. The energy of the room changed dramatically when our pig entered. And a team placed our plated pig and all the sides on our table for the feast. Then the chef personally came out and presented a special dish to our vegetarian  friend. We had friends from out of state and locals with us. It was so memorable. And Hearthstone just made some new friends for life.   There wasn't much of the suckling pig left after we tore into it. It was, by far, the best pork we have all ever had. Juicy, flavorful and the sides complemented the meat perfectly.  We all talked about it for hours after we were finished. That's how wonderful the whole experience was. We'll be talking about it for years to come and have already started planning our next one.   Thank you Hearthstone team. Each and every one of you! See you next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chef and our veggie friend
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The masks were awesome
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Star Wars chop sticks for pig feast

cXMuk6WDf5FRdhASD20vyQ.text: I want to like this place more than 3 stars since I'm really feeling the location and layout just outside of the Red Rock Casino. The service is even decent especially at the bar inside, however the reason I'm only giving them 3 stars is because after all it is a restaurant, meaning a place the should be 90% judge on the food. And I must say that unfortunately it ain't all that. I've been here a few times now & had several of the items on the menu, most not so great. Sig drinks are somewhat average too. I did enjoy the nice size whole lobster meal they have for $24 despite the corn being over cooked. In the end it makes for a cool indoor/outdoor venue to stop by if you live in that general area, just not worth going too far out of your way. Still rooting for it to last tho!

-8H5gUq23p6owGQMv-r6Ug.text: I had the Chilean Sea Bass. It was prepared perfectly and melted in my mouth. Thank fir an amazing meal.

_oAKkKbMAcZpX7hCH5fWLQ.text: When you are going out for a special occasion, it's always hit and miss when you try a new place.  Last night, we had a group of 8 for a surprise party, and decided to give Hearthstone a try.  It was amazing from beginning to end.  Service - 10, Food - 10, Atmosphere - 10.  The food was great.  Everything that we tried...and we tried about half the menu, was outstanding.  Definitely recommend the burger and the beet salad, the french dip, and salmon.  Artichoke dip was great, as were the turkey meatballs, the bacon wrapped dates, and the lollipop wings.  Food was great.  Great selection of beers and drinks too.  But honestly, it was the service, and specifically Elisa, and the GM Russell, that made the evening a SMASH hit, for our [very] surprised guests.  From the moment we sat down, Elisa made us feel like we were the only guests she was taking care of.  She never missed a beat, and really felt like she was a part of our party.  I used to own a restaurant for 19 years, and I can tell you that it's rare to get this level of attention and service in a restaurant nowadays.  Elisa truly made our evening a hit.  She was fun and friendly, attentive and really on the ball.  She cared.  And it showed.  Her GM Russell was also very fun and helped create the perfect atmosphere for our party.  We will definitely go back and eat there again.  All around a great time, with great food.

VTz37RcyymCe11rjNfaORg.text: Having been here around two times before, I would definitely recommend Hearthstone for their inventive and varied selection of food. Our server Christian was extremely friendly and welcoming, and was swift with our orders and refills. He came back with drinks without needing to ask, offered great suggestions on the menu and made sure to get to know us and the tables nearby. Very rarely have I seen restaurant staff so outgoing, pleasant, and passionate about its customers. Good food and excellent service!

bvl6Yuk1DNc-IFrkqOifog.text: I gave this restaurant 2 stars because of the decor and the ambiance which was nice . My husband and I were looking for a restaurant to have brunch so we stopped by Red Rock and saw this restaurant we asked to look at their brunch menu and the first dish that caught our attention was the chicken and waffle (only reason we entered) the server was nice and polite when we both ordered the chicken and waffle the server made a joke saying  I hope we don't mess it up. Even though I assume it was a joke it turned out to be True. When they brought out our orders my mouth watered at the sight of our chicken and waffle plates. Don't let your eyes deceive you. When I took a bite out of the fried chicken it had no taste. Super bland I had to ask for salt and every bite I took of that chicken I had to sprinkle a little bit of salt on it for taste. This chicken and waffle was not worth the $21 dollars we paid for each plate. It was super disappointed.

KksW5OciP3nL46cQm0-S5g.text: Been here a few times now. There lollipop wings are my favorite. Every time I come here I try something new and I will say I have not came across nothing bad. Food is delicious and the place has a rustic look to it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lollipop wings

1Os3PcPSmrbfIP-yw8TJOw.text: I have not been here for over a year...so glad my friends & I went last night! Great happy hour, ambience & music. AND...hands down, the best server I have EVER had. Ahmed was extremely attentive, friendly & fun. We were there for 5 hours & he continued to check on us & promptly replenished our drinks or food! Ahmed is a huge asset to Hearthstone! I will return...and hope he will wait on me again!! Well done, Ahmed!

yGqpZk-DPOQLFnJKv6LUhw.text: This is an update from my last review and visit. We were invited back as soon as my review was posted which is amazing response time. Since my schedule is so busy we didn't get to go until today.   I must say that they made such a great effort to make this experience a good one. The service was excellent, drinks were refilled and we were checked on more than the last time. We did notice that the menu is alot smaller, which they explained was due to seasonal menu changes and items. Some items were no longer offered, like the infamous "crabby snacks". Let's just hope I don't get harassed again by John M., whose girlfriend works there becuase I didn't give it a 10 stars. LOL. People need to relax, we're giving our opinion about the food and experience.  Thank you to Peter V., for inviting us back as it truly changed our perspective. Everyone was very hospitable and we were rendered excellent service.   We ordered:  Bakes ricotta and truffle honey-  this is a must order and always a winner! Steak Tartar with poached egg- Yes, this time it came (we ordered it on the last visit and it never came, lol). This was seasoned perfectly and just the right amount of pickles, the egg made this dish extra rich and delicious. Make sure to ask for extra toast. Meatballs- They were good, moist and tasty. The tart tomato sauce was a good compliment. Tomato Bisque- the bisque was tart and just a hint of sweetness. They served it with a cheese and salami sandwich to dip. Very good.   Main Entrees  Shrimp Pasta- This shrimp and pasta was topped with bread crumbs that gave it a great texture. The sauce was rich and pasta was cooked perfectly. Hanger Steak- Another great dish, cooked to temperature. We ordered rare. But the steak fries were a bit salty for our taste. Wild Salmon- Poached then oven baked, moist and delicious.  Hamburger- We order two and they both were cooked to temperature. These were really good, but the steak fries were a bit salty for our taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Second visit was excellent

iLGD8YRf9LsgnapNCdlu4g.text: I've been by Hearthstone a few times & always loved the atmosphere. The decor has a Manhattan feel, brown leather couches and exposed brick walls.  Casen was my server; makes a mean Old Fashioned & knows his drinks very well, and I'm a tough judge on bartenders.  Food was fantastic across the board, and came out in less than 15 minutes. Not a bad word to say and highly recommended, especially considering we arrived 5 minutes AFTER the kitchen was meant to close and they still managed to squeeze the order in.

kyeADESy0kwLl00C9_eXag.text: We were going to Red Rock Casino to see a show and wanted a place in the casino to have dinner. I looked over the Hearthstone menu and saw the entrees ranging from $20 for a flatbread up to $46 for filet mignon.  This seemed to be about the right level of restaurant for what we wanted for the evening. The ambience could be described as informal (see the photo). The room is quite large. There are large screen televisions everywhere playing various athletic events. Tables without tablecloths. There is an open kitchen on the left as you walk in. And there is a very large bar towards the rear. The music is loud but not obnoxious. Overall, it has the feel of an upscale Gastro pub crossed with a sports bar. The service was really outstanding. Jesus, our server, came to the table almost immediately to take our drink orders and to explain the menu and the specials. Very friendly, making us feel welcome. During the meal, our water glasses never got even half empty before he was there to refill them. The pace of the service was just about right. A very nice touch was when the chef brought out our steak to show us what it looked like before they sliced it.  We ordered a chickpea salad to share. It was very good, not great. My wife got the meatball flatbread to share with her friend. This turned out to be a very thin crust 12 inch pizza with very flavorful ricotta cheese and somewhat spicy meatballs. The flavor was excellent. However, at $23 for a 12 inch pizza, it was a bit pricey for what you got. My buddy and I decided to share the special porterhouse steak. It was a huge steak. It was served with a small amount of potatoes on the side. The steak was cooked to perfection and was absolutely delicious. The potatoes are also quite tasty. My big gripe however was that the steak cost $120. I almost fell off my chair when I got the check. I had figured that with the filet mignon costing $46, the shareable porterhouse would be in the range of $60 or $70.  I never would have guessed that in an informal Gastro pub type restaurant that a steak would cost anywhere close to that price. Clearly this was my bad for not asking before ordering. And it was quite good in terms of the taste. Just not $120 worth of good. Overall, ambiance, service, and food were all five star. However, when you consider value for the dollar spent, this was not a 5 star dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bone in porterhouse steak special at Hearthstone Kitchen. Great presentation, great flavor, ridiculous price
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meatball flatbread at Hearthstone Kitchen. Very tasty but very pricey.

JX6mEqPmJ5rfJGwipmh3Iw.text: The vibe in here is really cool! Very chill and then as it got more into the evening it got more busy and alive. The staff is super friendly and didn't mind us splitting the check, or that we had ten minutes before happy hour and gave us our drinks for those prices. I only give it four stars because I feel like the portions were a little small-but it is the happy hour menu but still! My salad was treat but I wanted more, and the vegetarian slider is very small, however, it is delicious.

yXMOb6cEpB6dC5sQXgt-Dg.text: Wow!!! All I can say about "guys night" was we were gonna start at yardhouse but the wait was wayyyy to long, so decided to come into your establishment and so glad we did!!! First we thought about a booth but ended up at the bar and that was the 2nd best choice of the night because the bartender Jocelyn had us laughing all night long. And definitely wasn't bad on the eyes! So thank you for starting our night off with great drinks appetizers and lots of laughs.. we will definitely be eating and drinking here again.

aTRX9SlDPMJN9s-WQQpoVQ.text: Love hearthstone, especially their brunch! Jocelyn is my favorite bartender, she's always smiling and gives the best service. I can always guarantee I'll have a good meal/drink & conversation when I walk in and see her behind the bar :)

gn4wEAUeLHaqmB2UVmEj8w.text: What a great experience! From the moment we got there our server Ryan was amazing. We had a joined birthday for my girlfriend and her daughter. 10 kids age 5-9 and 10-15 adults. With the intention of keeping it simple and fun it was the perfect set up to keep everyone happy. The kids all made their own personal pizzas and they let us bring a cotton candy machine. They played shuffle board and had a scavenger hunt in the hotel. And we adults had the luxury of partying in of the greatest spots in Summerlin. The seafood platter was perfect! Everything we are was! Chef Brian and his team went above and beyond for us.  If you are looking for the roe of party where it's easy fun and just on point this is a great idea.  Not to mention Tuesday's are half price bottles of wine under $100!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids table! Making pizzas and having a blast!

XphWVx5lCvhSUTASagQpkQ.text: 5 stars isn't enough! My husband and I visit Las Vegas 5-6 times a year and never fail to frequent Hearthstone. Not only is the food fabulous but the assisted chefs make it a point to remember their guests by name and get to know them on a more personal level. Case in point, Friday night we dined at Hearthstone, sat at the bar, our favorite, and walked in to hear Peter say welcome back and Javi to announce that it was good to see Debbie and Steve. This type of repoire is unparalleled. Again, the food is off the charts however it's employees like Peter, Javi and Alex, who treat us like family, that have made us the most loyal customers!

mV6HJ81BL6lpjA5V6KOZ0g.text: We had the greatest time at Hearthstone today for NYE!! Our server was Lisa, she was awesome and the bottomless was BOMB!! Happy New Years Eve

jwaF4fHPPHWmfNuJhgP6Zg.text: Me and my friends went to this restaurant last night and sat at the patio. Ahmed recommended we get the Branzino fish and it was to die for. He did really well with serving us. Will definitely come back.

AXo0zMkGI39a6ljVAgP4Lw.text: The food was very very good even though it was a bit overpriced, bad service not due to the waiters, the waitress did everything she possibly could to cover her sections and have to cover for original server. The place was basically set up for service failure because they have servers managing odd sections. Our server ignored is constantly and NEVER checked on us. I recommend sitting inside for preferably better attentiveness. Their weekly deals are really great like their 10$ lollipop chicken weeks all you can eat on chicken wing day. Their drinks were really really good and strong. I definitely want to try their cheese and meat plates sometime when I get to it. I was also not please for being charged $4 for club soda.... Lol  Lexi their hostess is amazing!!!! She was bright and bubbly :)  Overall they need to hire more staff, their bussers however are fantastic and friendly and checked on us more than our server did... It was impossible to get a refill on water and ask for the check.

Q5H0OCzavsN3Y7sWX6nL9Q.text: Definitely not suitable for networking events . Attended event there , which they had double booked the space. They tried moving us to an unsuitable part of the restaurant . The GM never apologized for the double booking blaming it on the staff who never communicated it ....really you expect us to believe that ?  I have no idea how the food or drinks were as after an hour no one had come offering anything . I got hungry so went next door to get something .  As a networking event organizer myself, I would never use this venue. Not upset about the double booking, although that is bad in itself, more upset about how they handled the situation.

ST8mR0rgydjwaX9ziC86zA.text: Amazing food. You have to try the hanger steak, brussell sprouts as a side and souffle  for dessert. Ask for Ahmed. He will take great care of you and make amazing recommendations.

Comparing a pizza to a main course meal was actually hilarious. Their pizza is out of this world. Their service staff and outdoor patio is like no other, we had a blast. Great service and great vibes on a hot Vegas night.

BriXWV_8_T3vL61uSoo6sQ.text: Great food, great service. Food is on the more pricey side, but worth it if your willing to spend the money.   Best time to go is Wednesday's after 5 when they have $1 oysters. Very fresh oysters and come with all the compliments to go along with them.   If you are going any other day, or don't like oysters, I recommend the burger, which has to be one of the best burgers I have had ( it better be for 20 ). Also I highly recommend the lobster roll. It is very light creamy and flavorful.

daEhkqq5oBsYPHWNo4r75w.text: Well I've been to this establishment a few times for the wine club but haven't eaten there before. So we decided after the wine club event we'd have dinner. Our server was nice although it was so loud we could barely hear anything not even each other. Maybe it was bc if the wine club lol. Nice outdoor seating but I along with other ppl who I heard asking-really wish you would put servers out  on the patio. It was nice outside perfect breeze before the 118 degree weather kicks in. Anyway we got sat right in the middle where ppl kept walking behind me and bumping into me which was frustrating but oh well now I know to ask for a different area to sit in. On to the food: I checked in via yelp so we got the free jalapeno hummus appetizer ($9) it was good but omg the pita it came with- it was SO hard we couldn't even eat it. I had to ask the server for bread I'm telling you that someone WILL break their teeth on those things yikes! No can do- I love my teeth,Sorry. But the hummus was delish; first time trying that Jalapeno hummus flavor. We both ordered the fried chicken meal and Sub'd the slaw for mashed potatoes instead. I should have read but it was tiny print and so dark that it came with some type of sweet honey syrup glaze on the chicken. I was hoping for a salty crispy chicken taste but it was soft skin & sweet. I will ask for it without the sweet glaze next time. The jalapeno biscuit was good just tried a small piece and we brought the rest home to go. Someone is getting a nice lunch tomorrow lol. Good size portion for the price ($22). I'd go again maybe for All U can eat Wings on Monday if they still do that. Still iso some good crispy flat wings here in Vegas! Had to give it one less star bc I thought I was gona lose a tooth with the hummus crisps otherwise it was a decent meal. I'd go back.

2B4XJ-tW0zyH5oRmIY7Aqg.text: Amazing food and amazing service! We were visiting for Taco Tuesday which included unlimited margaritas and tequila shots. Gersom was our waiter and was on top of everything! The food was delish and he made sure we never ran low on food or drinks. An excellent experience!

0_g4wEBqzw3eBlyGb7RbxA.text: So today was the day we were going to have lunch with the girls and have a mini reunion. So it was important to have bottomless mimosas ..   We screwed up by having them here. First of all they bring out the pre-mixed version and it was full of orange juice. When we asked the server for a bottle and for us to make the rest he refused. That made no sense since it was supposed to be bottomless anyway. But he actually did us a favor because it was the cheapest champagne ever and we all got headaches afterwards.  Other than that the food was average nothing fancy.  We won't be coming back here for brunch...

They accommodated our large group by putting together two big tables which was great. The server was nice and gave us good service. I gave this place a 3 star because a lot of us felt the prices were overpriced for the portion size and quality of food and being it's not even a fine dining setting. $17 for a burger is a bit overpriced and it was very small and the patty inside was so thin and tasted like it wasn't freshly made and tasted like it was a frozen patty. NU-ksnzfu8dk0_0BSlrbgA.text: Well, mixed updated review from my sunday brunch visit today at 11 am with 5 friends.  Our server saved the day...  The Bad:  We had a 11 am reservation and the hostess seated us at the high top table inside right next to the bar.  A server from the bar asked who was doing bottomless mimosas and got us started with a glass. All good then for 20 minutes, not one server stopped by the table.    Finally after trying to wave someone down, our awesome server stopped by..on to the good part..  The good: I didn't get his name but our server was a bald gentleman who was awesome.  He observed that no one was assisting us and took the initiative to take care of us.  He apologized for the wait, he didn't know what happened but he was going to take care of us the rest of the way.  He did a great job, he brought 2 carafes to the table and they were never empty.   All the orders came out correctly and quickly.  The Summary: My food was great, I had the loco moco this visit and I loved the chicken fried rice that was used vs white rice regularly.  Maybe we caught the staff on a bad day.  However, it was early so the restaurant was only at about 20% capacity which makes this even more mind boggling.  I hope the service is better on the next visit as I love the food here, but that's another Yelp tale.  Enjoy!

1xFUPj9ycpZaTdSxPNva4w.text: Great place! Was recommended this location and took a few sales reps out with me. Food and service was great! Was offered patio seating...litter worried as Vegas is very hot but it was great! Sat at a large table near the water feature snd since the misters were on it was the perfect atmosphere. Sadly I only took a pic of my main course but the appetizers were great. I'm a big octopus fan and it was good. But we had the honey ricotta appetizer which was delicious. Normally not something I would order but our server,Melissa, recommended it and it was excellent!!!  Split the seafood platter for dinner and it was very fresh and amazing!! Enjoyed the entire ambiance. Our poor server,Melissa, kept apologizing for the table next to us, who might of had too much to drink and were getting a little heated. But we found them entertaining and not too obnoxious that it ruined our night. Highly recommend this location and Melissa!

nybJzUo0uZpcrGg4F9a5pg.text: I was excited to see that Hearthstone's had hanger steak on the menu, it's tender like a filet but because it's more marbled has a great beef flavor.  I ordered the hanger steak for $34 and it came with fries and truffle aioli (which tasted more of vinegar than garlic so I think it was mayo with truffles).  Unfortunately the steak I received was the toughest meat I have ever tried to eat.  I didn't finish my steak, not because I was full but because I was so tired of chewing.  Maybe they confused flank steak (a flavorful but tough inexpensive cut of meat) with hanger steak.   I've eaten at Hearthstone's several times and the food was fine.  Not great but not bad, expensive for what it was but that's the nature of casino restaurants.  But this time the steak was so disappointing I don't think I'll be back for a while.

qEJzKv4JXaMqV02Cwqs__g.text: Nice spot in Red Rock casino. Very open feel to it. Came for dinner with a friend. Food was good. When ordering drinks I had to ask the waiter if there was a Happy hour and he said oh ya there is but its over. It ended at 7. I said, it's 615... Other than that, great atmosphere, great food.

ESXyj73Md8sSohlzlhwD6w.text: This place came recommended . But for whatever reason they had an off night . No cocktail fork with seafood asked for butter & lemon several times . Ordered  the featured lobster boil & it was a good portion & gd 4 price . However ,  it was served .  raw not 1,. X but 2 . Seems 3 is a charm still under cooked there was not very good service . However the manager did come over n gave us a glass of wine w/being very apologetic . So bottom line go after happy hour ends as they were running around like crazy . We will give them another opportunity due to the manager our dinner  was on mon June/24. @6pm

KmsKswNgtl73arBXUxOmMA.text: Generally, I prefer to write reviews after experiencing a business at least twice; this review is being written after my third visit. My overall rating likely would have been closer to a 4, but the recent addition of multiple vegan options to the regular menu definitely increased my impression of Hearthstone.  My first visit was solely for drinks at the bar. It was busy that night, and service left a bit to be desired. Our bartender was great, but a female bartender I asked to bring the check was incredibly rude for absolutely no reason. I'm glad I didn't base that experience on whether or not to return, because I probably wouldn't have, and I would have missed out on the typical experience I have since come to really enjoy.   Visits two & three were for happy hour drinks and food in the lounge. There are several very  comfortable couches bordering the area between indoor and outdoor seating. The ambiance is relaxed with a great vibe. I also have had incredible service the two times we've sat in this awesome area.   Being a vegan who requires gluten free due to celiac disease, I really appreciate being able to enjoy an Omission Lager and Vegan Slider with lettuce wrap. Although I'm not 100% certain, I'm pretty sure the patty used for the vegan slider is the Beyond  Burger, which is super awesome since that burger is quite realistic and super flavorful. The vegan quinoa mayo also is phenomenal--way to go Chef! I also was super stoked that there is now a vegan section included on the regular menu. Clearly Hearthstone is receptive to suggestions and feedback from their guests. A big THANK YOU from me and the entire vegan community!  Another awesome perk is the free Jalapeno hummus with Yelp check in. Although the lavosh typically served with the hummus is not gluten free, our server was more than accommodating and offered vegetable crudites as a complimentary substitute. He also brought lavosh for my BF since he's not GF. For a free appetizer, I really felt the service was exceptional.   All in all, my BF and I really enjoy coming to Hearthstone and will continue to return and enjoy the great service; yummy cuisine; and comfortable, chic ambiance.

KD_wD_M7_6BzdrKOI8EDWQ.text: We met some friends for dinner.  Took advantage of the happy hour great options. The cheese platter fell short other than that great experienc

xMKged8yn2UXrU3JyeGV4w.text: Hearthstone served my favorite meal in Vegas a couple weeks ago. We decided to stay at the Red Rock resort instead of heading down to the strip on our night off, and it ended up being a wonderful decision. We had the choice to sit inside or outside, and decided not to risk being chills and stayed inside.  Of course we started with drinks. I had a delicious old-fashioned that was super sweet and brought a big smile to my face.  My friend got the prime rib and loved every bite that she could finish. She also said she loved eating her fabulously smooth potatoes with a spoon.   Although I've lived 'up north' my whole life, I decided to go with something far from regular Michigan cuisine - shrimp and grits. So, so yummy. As a side, I got the broccoli. Seriously, if healthy tasted that good all the time, my whole life might change.  The decor and atmosphere was also cute and quaint. I can imagine enjoying any meal there, as it was like sitting in someone's cozy kitchen. I'd love to go back on another trip to Vegas.

h4S4dx5rRWJ2mLdq8cT0fQ.text: Stopped in for happy hour which by the way they have a great HH menu and sat at the bar we had the pleasure of meeting a young lady name KIM who absolutely was the boss lady behind the bar. KIM  handled all ticket drink orders including keeping our drinks coming and other people sitting at the bar so I ask her " hey are you in training" because she was on it and "she said NOPE just working" I was very impressed not only was she the boss lady she had an Awesome personality great conversation. Thank you Kim   Annette   Definitely we will be going back

2s2nBQ1EeJ9O1fEDgAXxkw.text: Great atmosphere! Awesome bar and restaurant. Everything I have ever had here has been excellent. I had the lobster roll for the first time. Wow!  A must have even at the price. Phenomenal.  And the Abe Froman pizza is equally good. Anything named after a Ferris Bielefeld character must be good!

E-Gs5rtKJsslK6AMtR-Wbg.text: First time here. When You walk in you'll noticed the casual comphy couches to the right, bar & pizza oven with the Calcutta marble countertops. It's a California like atmosphere there's 2 shuffle boards in the corner. Now most importantly the food.... meatballs were delish!!! They were tender and moist, ricotta with truffle honey was sooo good it was served with toast. The rotisserie Porchetta was mehhhhh it was the chef special of the day recommended by our waitress... I would give it 2 stars not super horrible but nothing good about it.  Shrimp pasta was good. The chocolate souffle with ice cream and chocolate cookie was a great, Brussel sprout Cesar salad didn't have much flavor . Apple quinoa salad was yummy and refreshing. All in all I would come back again. It is definitely overpriced food.

lhLJu-lktcZMpMbaYyJUpg.text: Saturday night, patio table, 9/15/18 at 7pm. Nice establishment. The food and service, on the other hand, I've experienced better. In regards to the service, the waiter was not very helpful in menu selections. The appetizers we ordered were forgotten about with the waiter stopping by to ask, "did the appetizers come out yet?" The food items ordered, pizza.... the worst I've ever had (ABE Froman). The crust was soggy and burnt on the bottom (made no sense). My daughter ordered the pizza from the kids menu and received a regular menu pizza. The fries we ordered came out on a plate that was hotter than the fries and not freshly made but tasted as if sitting under a heat lamp.   I was very appalled, to say the least. I was not impressed and will not be revisiting this restaurant for a second meal that falls so short of the glory the other reviews and ratings give it. I chose Hearthstone Kitchen Cellar over Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill and was hugely disappointed as I spent a great deal more at Hearthstone than I have at Mesa Grill, Hell's Kitchen, Giada's, Masso, etc. What a waste.

jTzHfqvkfDVycTL6bv3vRg.text: Very disappointed!!!  Service was awful. Food was just ok for the price. Had a better Mother's Day meal last year at Mimi's Cafe. Everyone told me that Hearthstone had a great brunch.   When we were seated, we waited 20 minutes to get menus. No one ever took our drink Order. I had to ask for lemons 3x. My GF got bottomless mimosas. She has two half glasses before we almost finished our meal. While we were finishing up, they finally brought her a canister.   The table had the Loco moco, eggs Benedict , burger, shrimp cocktail, sticky bun, kids pizza and croissant sandwich. They brought the pizza out for our daughter to make it herself which was very cool. The sad part is they came to take it to cook while we all were getting our food to eat. He pizza finally came out 10 minutes later. The sticky bun was the best. Too bad it came out when we were almost done with our meal.

rfsT2ulUk9GD8y16viZTKA.text: We had a reservation for four on "Lobster Boil" night on June 20.  After making a call to the restaurant, it was recommended that we come at 7 pm, since they "never " run out of lobster until about 9 pm.  When we arrived, we were told that they had run out of lobster.  We took our business elsewhere!

r1pRqFpG62MVeq_9TlJc6g.text: Great hamburger. One of the best I have had in Summerlin; a fun atmosphere and professional service people. I've been there many times. Everyone always enjoys their meals.

Q3i2gyTh8OTJm9wx2Z6jZg.text: How do they get the chicken wings to glide right off the bone?! I guess they're called lollipops for a reason!! Despite the waiters wearing weird suspenders and being a bit uninterested in serving me and my wife, the lollipop chicken wings and the calamari are to die for! Some of the best we've had in Vegas.

n9Tx62x71GetIKOTvbTxcQ.text: This is definitely my favorite restaurant for taco Tuesday! Awesome setting to come hang out with the girls and also nice enough for a date. Definitely recommend Gerson as a waiter. He accommodated all of our needs and he was very polite. Definitely recommend this place 10x over!!!

VRyIiHZXATNmUtblNERSUQ.text: We met some friends at Hearthstone for dinner. They are located in the Red Rock near Yard Bird. We went on the weekend so the "see and be seen crowd" was there, which made for some pretty interesting people watching. I must say that I didn't care for the restaurant. First, it is extremely loud, headache-inducing loud. Now, I expect a popular place to have some noise but when you can't hear what your dinner companions are saying, that's a problem.  On to dinner. We had the Charcuterie variety to start, which was a variety of meats and cheeses with toasted bread on the side, $15.00. It was a large portion, enough to feed a party of 4. The guys had halibut with risotto, shortribs and I had the fried chicken. Portions are very generous, but Hearthstone is pricey. Four entrees an appetizer and 2 beers ran up a tab of over $200.00. And while the restaurant was nice, the servers were attentive and polished and everyone else enjoyed their dinners, I've had better for a whole lot less money.  Here's my tip, AVOID the fried chicken. Heaven knows that they give you enough of it, the server brought out a steaming plate of 1/2 a chicken, which could easily have served 3 people. So why am I griping? There is a trend in restaurants nowadays to bake chicken until it is 3/4 cooked, cool it, bread it and fry it. I am fully aware of why they do this, it takes a long time to fry chicken and they need to turn tables. But if you aren't going to cook it correctly, don't offer it.  This monstrous hybrid was coated in a 1/4 inch thick layer of breading that was as hard as a rock. Worst, when you actually removed the breading, the chicken wasn't seasoned and was rubbery! Here's a tip. Brine it in buttermilk before you bake it and it will be more tender!  Anyhow, the rest of my party had a good time, when/if you go just be prepared to pay a lot, hear a lot of noise, and avoid the chicken!

ltBlYfEX9MezO-MsHywA-g.text: What a great Sunday brunch we had!!!  We are transplants from the OC to Summerlin and never had such a fantastic brunch destination. Met another family today for the Labor Day Weekend complimentary mimosas and had the BEST food ever!  I was expecting to argue or beg for the mimosas instead our server Nathan just kept it flowing.  It wasn't just about the mimosas, it was management and the wonderful service that just kept checking to see if everything was fabulous.  I am the BIGGEST fan of Hearthstone, this place never disappoints.  Whether you are with the fam, or with a girls night or just Sunday football, this is the jam.  Nathan our server was fantastic, smiled with our 3 kids being bratty, kept the adults happy :-)  I hope this place stays open, most of the Red Rock restaurants close after 2-3 years, can't wait for fall ball and outdoor good times there!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous Cobb salad!!

dR5ipOPQ2bgeXTqH_gkcSA.text: Our server Gerson was very knowledgable and helpful! We will be definitely be back. We came for happy hour and everyone was very nice. Drinks and food were awesome.

hCQmYICHef-kwY9z84MeYw.text: This was my families first stay at the Red Rock Resort.  Hungry and exhausted from our long travels from Mexico, we were looking for somewhere to eat inside the resort.  Luckily, we stumbled across this restaurant and oh my were we pleasantly surprised.  This restaurant was amazing.  We were seated very quickly and shortly greeted by a very kind man named Gerson.  He was AMAZING!!! The food and service was great!!   We will definitely be returning to eat here again before we travel back home and we will be requesting to be seated in Gersons area again.  GREAT place to eat!

7AXpReqtgmu1pa2y6GV1uQ.text: Great atmosphere, nice wine list, great pizza choices.  Salmon was fantastic  and the waiter super helpful.  Bravo to Gerson our waiter!

aYpnpSyDtYmEDVxSKAzyXA.text: Came here a few times -- the most recent was for a mom's sunday brunch.  Great location.  They have both indoor and outdoor seating. We took advantage of the beautiful fall weather and sat outdoors. Seating was comfortable and not too noisy so we could easily talk and hear each other.    Ate a delicious prime rib french dip, but switched the french bread for a croissant, yum!!  Skinny french fries needs improvement - wasn't hot and crisp so it was sitting for a bit.  They have bottomless mimosas for $15.  The server was slow in providing this. They were great in making separate checks.    Oh, and for checking-in on yelp, we got a free hummus. It was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2AjT1jvqVOd3ggUB0wbIWw.text: I really wanted to love this place as much as a few of my friends do. But sadly, they have everything going for them minus the customer service. We came after the Sunday brunch rush & sat at the bar. The place was a mess, as you could tell it had been packed for brunch. There were plenty of employees bustling around us getting the place back in order.   Same thing was going on with the bartenders. While I understand you have to catch up on glassware and prep work; your most important task is to FOCUS ON YOUR GUESTS. The bartenders were obviously over being there for the day, and that was felt by us on the other side of the bar. We tried having conversation with them and they were pretty cold, not that I expect you to entertain me and be my BFF, but you could at least act like I'm not burdening you by chatting with you. And when someone gives you a compliment, it's polite to say "thank you".   I was impressed by the food, it was very flavorful & nice portion sizes. The ambiance was nice and the place is decorated well.   Then as we got closer to shift change, service went from cold and mediocre; to nonexistent. It was obvious they were ready for us to leave & we obliged. I just was disappointed given how much everyone talks this place up. Might come back, or maybe I'll just stick to DW.

2WuTnpe2Qsdu04NOiQ_wUA.text: Shane was hands down the best server I've ever had on Taco Tuesday! This man was so personable and really took an interest in getting to know his customers. This establishment is lucky to have him keep up the good work Shane from one server to another your doing a great job!

1lurCvTOS63yTEyz410gSQ.text: My wife and I love the Happy Hour here not only for the price discounts, but also for the opportunity to just kick back and relax on one of the several couches in the great casual atmosphere of The Heartstone at the Red Rock.

pU3gCUuYhPXoKSsmlvrAcQ.text: It was mother's day but they were not too crowded.  I know why. The most awful service I have ever had in a restaurant.  No menus or waiter for 15 minutes.  The waiter was obviously overworked if that was our waiter.  Hard to figure out who our waiter even was since at least five people delivered things.  Unlimited mimosas were just orange juice and you had to beg for refills.  Poached eggs were hard boiled.  Food was served cold and had to be returned.  Sodas were never delivered.  Hollandaise sauce was not.  We waited 48 minutes for food.  Table behind us sent their food back twice.  Will never go there again.

iVeu8zlLWZXfKdVz_1eepQ.text: Food is good and drink prices are great....lets start there! I had the breakfast sandwich and it was huge on Texas toast yum!!! My friend had an eggs Benedict and said it was awesome too. Breakfast potatoes are good....id rather have hash browns. Bottomless mimosas are $15 for Mumm.....that's awesome and good call on whoever lowered the price from $24!!!! Didn't get to partake in the table side cart or bubbles for breakfast but we will be back with more people for that!! Now.... Service.... I waited at least 5-10 min for a hostess (as did another couple) when we finally decided to walk in and have someone seat us. Food and drinks came out a little slow but the waitress was very pleasant so that was great. Will definitely be back....with a larger group so we can get the Bloody Mary cart!!  Updated to a 5!!! Aleks was awesome and paid attention to detail! Food is still great but the bottomless mimosa is not Mumm as menu states but J Roget!

-wEIDOnRQ7BW1H9SRcAQAg.text: We were excited to finally try this restaurant. We got there at happy hour and there were happy hour menus but when we requested them we were told by our server that he didn't have any to provide us with at the moment but he listed them off to us. Is this a method to get you in the door and then discourage Happy hour menu items orders? We ordered a dozen oysters to start along with two happy hour items and two off happy hour appetizers, shots and drinks. We also ordered our main dishes. I had to ask the server if they had specials - turns out they did - I've never before had to pry it out of a server. We ended up ordering the specials as well as steak and a child's menu item.?First out were the oysters. Oysters were small but ok but they were served with one tiny slice of lemon (like how you would find on the side of a glass) and a small container of cocktail sauce with weak horseradish sauce topped on top of the cocktail sauce. Presentation could have been much better.. We saw the table next to us order the small seafood plate and we were glad we didn't order it. It was small with only a few pieces of seafood for the price. We got one of our happy hour items and then our meals came. They completely forgot our other 3 appetizers. The main dishes including the specials were ok nothing special. When we told our server that our appetizers had been lost in the wind he apologized, gave some nonsensical reasoning and then brought us out two complementary desserts neither of which we would have ordered anyway.  In the end we were really disappointed. We love to enjoy ourselves at Red Rock and that includes spending many dollars at the restaurants there. Hopefully the resort finds a more exciting option than what is being offered now which is simply mediocre in every aspect except possibly the decor.

zwpkbbVVRygp3co4TYg7Rw.text: I was somewhat disappointed. The decor is very farmhouse, and from the photos, I was expecting a nice dinner environment. Instead, there were loud TVs on, and terrible loud music playing. It felt like it was a sports bar, and the decor and atmosphere did not match. The food was bland. The quinoa salad was good, but the pizza and steak were flavorless. Would not go back.

jb_nDTn4HOJunIYDCE1jTA.text: Went for a business dinner with a large group, during a busy hour.  The food was excellent, and service was solid.  You'll have to try the truffle popcorn when you visit, as we went back for seconds and thirds.  My favorite dish was the watermelon salad.  It's done other places, but done exceptionally well here.  Add avocado, feta, some greens, a mint vinaigrette, and it makes it super delicious.    I had the petite filet (not my normal selection), and it was superb.  Really well prepared.

hDBNTsD4BGbot45DsaLI9A.text: The service was good. Staff was attentive and ensured we were taken care of. The reason for the two star rating is because at the price points of the food, it should have been much better. My wife and I ordered the calamari and bacon wrapped dates for starters. The dates were only ok. They were stuffed with chorizo but the chorizo didn't really add anything other than filling and texture, there wasn't much flavor to it. The calamari was fine and the dipping sauces were good but other restraints serve equally as appetizing calamari at a lesser price. My wife ordered the scallops and she loved them, so that was a plus. I ordered the fried chicken. Just like the dates, the chicken was less than inspiring. Very little flavor and it was not hot and on the dry side. I felt as if it had been sitting for a while. The slaw was the best part of the dish as I did enjoy that. Again, for the price of the meal, I had higher expectations. There are plenty of soul food places in town where I can get tastier, juicier, and hotter fried chicken for a third of the price.  I wouldn't say that the place is awful, but in Vegas, there are way too many options to spend the amount of money we did to walk away feeling only ok about your meal.

KxyP18fk3OCkIvbEuBWfkQ.text: My new favorite local restaraunt! Shrimp pasta, carbanora flatbread and baked ricotta all to die far! Great wine selection amd perfect ambiance. Will definitely be here once a week.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the dining room and bar :)

Uhuhsq8jQ4ULWrOWZD82TA.text: First time here, came for the reverse happy hour and good music. Hostess seated us and sat at the booth about 10-15 min, the band played about 3 songs. No one acknowledged us not even the busser who came and got the extra utensils that we weren't going to use. Walked out. Worse experience  ever! The place wasn't even busy maybe less then 40 people

0pwtdPGpjJ-p3fu7uKuxqQ.text: First impression was breathtaking. This place is absolutely beautiful. With the low reviews we still wanted to give it a shot. To start things off our waitress told us she didn't know that ham was pork lol & wasn't sure if the beef short rib meat balls were pork or beef. . Reviews read that portions are on the small side & priced a bit high.  I think it's True, but well executed. Only downfall was we found a huge chunk of white plastic in our mushroom pizza.. Didn't stop me from finishing it though. The situation was handled professionally and we were offered dessert and the pizza was on the house. Overall a great edition to the city and I'm 99% sure will be back.

NvMn65jM8jdVgnbiUjob9A.text: Hearthstone is awesome! This restaurant is very unique and can not be compared to other restaurants in Vegas! The ambiance of the place is amazing. Everything is clean, the lighting is perfect and the music is great! The food is delicious and has so much flavor and creativity! The service provided by the staff is quite the experience, they treat everyone like a VIP, provided knowledge of the menu and accommodated my every needs. Heartstone is one of the best restaurants I've had the chance of dining in!

D10Af1w25YBG_IlZGI517g.text: Cool venue and great menu, but poor execution and negligent service. Everything we ordered - drinks, appetizer and entrees was average or below average.  Came here for a nice dinner out, left disappointed.

Ul8g7tZAUXPjZuVVQQN_gg.text: Great location. Great wedge fries. Deviled eggs were good. My son liked his chicken fingers and fries other than that we weren't happy with our service or choice of meal. Kale salad was Caesars but a pretty poor version. $21 cheeseburger - nothing special. Grilled calamari was terrible. I didn't eat it. It soaked in some heavy sauce. Why bother grill it if it's going to be drenched. After eating it, it was also pretty clear there was no value at all, except that it's close to my house. Told manager who tried to make it right. Regardless, not worth trying again for us. Maybe you'll have better luck.

i-vCdVQhculj79RqU4TS0g.text: My boyfriend and I came here while on a stay-cation at a Red Rock to celebrate his birthday. Very large restaurant, perfect for large parties celebrating something special. The atmosphere was fun and lively. We tend to share things when we eat, so decided to order a bunch of appetizers instead of individual entrees so we could taste more of the items. The portions were very large and food came out quick.  We got the: Grilled octopus: amazing! Super tender with the perfect amount of char.  Tuna tartar: not your typical tuna tartar. Was more on the brighter citrus side (but not too citrusy) with pieces of watermelon. Really random but it worked and was really refreshing to eat. My boyfriend is not a fan of anything citrus or tuna tartar but he seems to really like this one.  Charcuterie board (2 cheese and 2 meats): standard. But they have you a lot of meat which I liked and appreciatedt  Ahi salad: good. Standard. But hey had these little tangy sweet peppers the size of a chickpea, that I was obsesseds with.   Steak tartar: by the time we got this we were stuffed, but it was really good. Not sure what was in it but there was a creamy ingredient that pulled it all together and made it so delicious. I'm usually picky with steak tartar but really enjoyed this  Highly recommend this restaurant and would go back if around the area.

ikO1zU8f6KbxMMrNZlulhA.text: Excellent food with delicate taste all around, no complaints there. Value for money is iffy IMO!  Just found it hard to stomach the prices and $210 bill for small bites and 3 glasses of wine. Specially extravagant is the tomato toast (another name for bruschetta) which basically has 1 OK sized piece of toast and was $14, we didn't see the prices and just ordered 2 plates instead of the bread basket, OUCH!

pdLUFQBp-3dW1Fp1J3IM6w.text: Great service and great tasting food. The service was fast with very nice employees. The scenery is very hip and modern. The menu had a wide selection of food making it very easy to find an option to eat as well has having gluten free and vegetarian options. My dining experience was wonderful!!

NifysCSA_qb-AZV-Dz2j2A.text: Went in earlier tonight and it was pretty packed. From first walking in we noticed how nice it was . The atmosphere was great we loved it. Our service was amazing the whole time. Everything was always taken care of and our server was so sweet. Everything about this place is amazing and I would recommend it to anyone!

gxKX5bSazORwcsFkpGQPLg.text: Love the look and Vibe - Came for happy hour and it was nice! kind of pricey but to be expected in a casino restaurant. Hear the brunch is the best- have to come back for that! Overall good place

ZA6fisEyuo8rUHl2V09IBQ.text: Went there last night to meet friends, have drinks and appetizers from the happy hour menu.  Told the water right up front that's what we were doing . Two of us ordered call vodka and we're informed it wasn't on the happy hour menu, which we were fine with.  This showed that the waiter understood our interest in the special menu.   Imagine our surprise when we get our bill and most everything on it was priced for the regular menu. When questioned the waiter explained how everything we had was either larger or better from regular menu!  Even the wine was not happy hour.  He knew exactly what he was doing and tried to Upsell everything thinking we wouldn't notice.  We complained, waited forever for the teenage "manager" to attempt to fix it but were late for a movie. Finally got appetizers adjusted but she "forgot" the wine.    The whole thing seemed to me like recent Wells Fargo situation.  Low lever employees are pushed to do things to improve the bottom line at the expense of the customer.  Never going back.

j4hWO6T3rbnyVQiL64KXzw.text: Everything was amazing! From the hostess to the waiter to the food.  We had the oysters for appetizer, the arugula salad to share, before dinner.  I had the rotesserie  chicken, he had the black truffle  hangar steak- both were really good.  The steak was so tender, it melted in your mouth. We are now just waiting on the peanut butter lava cake.   The environment is very relaxed.  Good shuffle on the music.  It's also a Sunday evening so it's not so busy right now.  This place is highly recommended for a nice night out for dinner.

LeGXGbcI3lHcezaNZsEvVA.text: I really wanted to love this resturant but it wasn't all what I wanted. Why is it a sports bar? There were huge tv's everywhere showing Monday night football. But the setting for everything else is not a sports bar! It has a very nice classy relaxing feel, but the tv's are horrible. Our waiter started out great, but them as after 10 mins of when I asked to have food boxed up and my husband had left to get the car and my wallet is in the table he comes by to refill my water and ask if I wanted dessert, it takes another 5 mins for the box and our check. What was really neat is they brought out a small cooked pig and prepped it in the dining room for the people in the lounge. I would return knowing what to expect, and still think the tv's should not be there.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs, not bad have aome apice to them.
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0Nxa00DkpDj_-ghDSZSPVg.text: We had a pretty disappointing experience here for Sunday Brunch. They got us through the door with free bottomless mimosas, but I personally didn't think they were very good.  First the good: +You can enter the restaurant from the outside and don't have to go through the casino. +The food was pretty yummy. +The people that were there were generally having a good time.  Now the bad: -We didn't make reservations, that's our bad. The restaurant was full when we first arrived, so we made reservations and left for an hour. The problem with bottomless mimosas is that people tend to sit around drinking them for hours. We would have preferred to sit outside, but when we got back an hour later, all the outside tables were still full with all the same people that were there when we left. -Very small portions for the food, which is overpriced. I paid $16 for eggs benedict, which was very tasty, and had a side of potatoes which were also very tasty, but the plate was basically less than half full. And they tried to charge me $21 for it (more on this later) -When we sat down, we got two different menus. It looked like they had old menus mixed in with new menus, and 2 of us got the old one and 2 of us got the new one. This is why I got charged $21 for half a plate of Eggs Benedict instead of $16. They apparently increased their prices even MORE on the new menu, but forgot to pull their old menu out of circulation, so a few of our prices were not rang up correctly. They did get it fixed for us, but it was frustrating. -My Fiancee ordered an omelette that was supposed to have broccoli, spinach, and cheese. She received it and the only thing inside of it was broccoli. She asked the waitress if it was missing something and the waitress immediately said "we'll make you a new one." When her omelette came back, it was the same exact thing - only broccoli. We gave up after that. -Service was SLOWWWW. I mean, I get it. They were busy. But they were also very understaffed. We waited about 45 minutes for our food, and then when we wanted to pay and get out of there we waited almost 15 minutes for someone to come and take our payment. That means our entire dining experience was over 2 hours not including the hour that we left to come back. If we had known brunch was gonna take that long, we would have gone somewhere else. We won't be going back.

vzGiSjfFPOL8KALJ1oRkKw.text: Tien was amazing!!! Thank you for the awesome service and delicious recommendations! We'll be back for sure. I recommend the Steak Tartar and the Jalepeno Hummus! Brunch is a must at this spot. Found them through Unlokt!!!!

TNgBF3k2wL8Yvp1O-w4n8A.text: Hearthstone has pretty small portions but the food is tasty. The ambiance is amazing and they do free wine tasting on Thursdays! Tien is the best. She was so attentive and sweet! I will definitely be requesting to have her as my server next time! Thank you Tien!

nDL7K6LV0hAcIXkBJwY6eg.text: Not impressed. Ambiance was great. Service was great but food was nothing spectacular. Small menu and a little pricey.

AJa_zlfpiP7FYaPdnHO7zQ.text: So far they served the best flatbread and steak I've ever had here in Vegas. Their wine selection was also nice.

MeGD-CvgSnEdppjVussuSQ.text: I love Hearthstone! Our waitress Thein was amazing! She has very nice attention to detail and is just a pleasant person! The food is great and the atmosphere is funky, eclectic and laid back.

KHjBW6La96TQm7587jZQ2Q.text: To start, the food here does deserve to be noticed, as it was the only thing good about our time at Hearthstone. My party and I all agreed that the service here was unacceptable. To start, we had no idea who our server was because we went through four different waiters throughout the night, not including the bus boys. Further, one bus boy accidentally put water in one of our parties' drink. He only gave her an excuse and failed to ask her to replace it. Additionally, we had to ask for water on our first glass 3 times (from three different waiters) and lastly one server spilled water all over the table and a wallet, however, it was not acknowledged and not cleaned up. To top it all off, the ants and cockroaches weren't the most appealing. This place only deserved two stars because of the music.

RgcBJcYcHDr9859kRUgeUw.text: Worst customer service ever!!! Very Unhappy!!! Everything starts with the service! Unfortunately, it would have had been a perfect night for my husbands birthday if it wasn't for the waitress awful service. When I asked her for a red wine she automatically says that they don't have red wines. Really??? she didn't even know the menus or how to help us with the menus. That is unacceptable!  The food was good and the place is nice. The other servers were very nice. more professional waiters and this place would be a 4 star.

mmKmkQb5ppoF0qKeKs21Kg.text: Tried this place for Sunday brunch and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. They have a nice indoor/outdoor space and the weather was perfect so we got a table on the beautiful patio. It's nice that Red Rock has more outdoor dining options now. We had the PBFJ appetizer - it was light, but the peanuts unfortunately overpowered the fois gras flavor. We also shared the crab cake benedict, which was great. The crab cake didn't have a lot of filler and served as the "muffin" on the bottom of a traditional benedict. We topped it off with the French toast, which was a little disappointing. It was way too sweet and didn't taste at all like salted caramel - mostly berries and frosting. We will probably return and try some other items on the menu but maybe not for a little while because it was also quite pricey.

5nrhNzXuGwZ7696MHFTwvw.text: So thank god for the good food and music because this place was crap on service?? My group went through 4 waiters some how in the matter of 2 hrs where we had no idea who to to order from.

CKutk5WBPGFNUzbxnHJA0A.text: Everything was over priced! YardBird is definitely better - service, food and pricing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Milk chocolate soufflé

V7zDnIR_kSJ8yZRECDOLEQ.text: Don't waist your time! Unless you plan on going home hungry. The portions are so small. The food isn't even that good. Not worth the money. We went there for dinner and we were disappointed and thought we would try their brunch and I had to ask for bread because the eggs benedict was so small. I get full so fast and never eat an entire meal but this was ridiculous.

3aBar-suISmCtuQD87waHw.text: This place is amazing!! All of our food was outstanding, and our server Tien was the best!! Great service, and ambience!!

CDTQeTDh-oVZNjOqVwnfQg.text: This is my second review because I've tried many many more dishes! My favorite thing by far was the baked ricotta wow it was really amazing. Especially with the honey on top! Great flavors and even the toast that came with it was good.   The short rib meat balls were very tasty. The steak tartar with the poached egg was really great but I actually wish the toast that came with it didn't have truffle. Usually I love truffle but I think it overpowered the tartar a bit and was hard to finish it all with that. Next time I'll ask for plain toast I think! The lollipop wings were cooked perfectly nice and crispy but I actually think the buffalo sauce was too thick and tasted too ordinary (like something from a much cheaper place) to be on such a good cut of wings. We had the bacon wrapped dates because they said they had an extra and gave it to is (very sweet of them) and it was good for what it was but I wouldn't have ordered it because I'm not crazy about bacon and dates are a bit too thick and sweet for me. I had the shrimp pasta since multiple waiters had recommended it and I was surprisingly not loving it! I can't put my finger on what it was but it just did not "wow" me but the shrimp was good quality. We also had the truffle hanger steak which was good but not incredible.   For desserts I have had the chocolate chip souffle and the peanut butter lava cake. The souffle is definitely good but not amazing enough for me to actively crave it. The peanut butter cake was good as well but again not perfect. It comes with some sort of butterscotch (pudding I think?) which I actually think did not go with it very well. It actually interfered with the peanut butter flavor and sort of overpowered it all with it's sweetness and butterscotch flavor. I'd say something similar for the roasted banana ice cream. If it was just banana ice cream that would have worked better because the roasted ness made it much sweeter (like more saccharine) and didn't pair as well with the already really sweet cake.  Once I pushed it all aside, the cake itself is really good well made and good flavor.   Overall I am leaving my rating at 4 stars because although I enjoy many things here I am not obsessed with enough dishes for how expensive everything is. The price mostly reflects the quality but some of the flavors on each dish could be tweaked to "wow" me more and really deserve my money because some dishes were a bit unbalanced with it's flavors. I'm sure I will be back though!

o9BtYqvNqQWtnocOIfxG7A.text: Great service, great atmosphere. If you enjoy a glas of good wine away from the strip, this is a great place to do it!!!

C_0poto7Ma8BX9SavOb28Q.text: Friends from Las Vegas brought us here, it's so WORTH driving out here. We're staying at the Aria, and the drive is 10 mins or so. The food is to die for!!! I recommend everything!!!  Thank you Tien for taking care of us, you made us feel so welcomed!! Mary the manager made sure everything was perfect which it was. Thank you for that. Baked ricotta all the way.

tz3_J08kOYNPzfBBJG86BA.text: After a long great weekend with family and friends, it was great to come to Hearthstone to unwind and enjoy GREAT food and GREAT service. Ask for Johan - he's very courteous and provided great service to the table. This place ranks a 5 star in my book and I'm hell of picky when it comes food and service; just read my other reviews :).

lw61nOcY5Q4dNnKiqsMnfQ.text: Amazing! It was everything I wanted it to be. Delicious. Great service. Beautiful atmosphere. I'm a picky eater and I was completely blown away. Not a thing to gripe about.

1PIDAy8iA0h2PT2sktRGWQ.text: Had the flower bomb drink, recommended by the waiter, it was delicious! Our table shared a ton of different items from the menu. It was all so good! Things that really stood out was the ricotta appetizer, spare rib meatballs, Mac and cheese and the D.O.C. Flatbread. Just about everything we tried was really good! Service was great and were really good about us asking a ton of questions. I also really wanted to try the bacon cheddar biscuit and they were kind enough to give me just one to try. Can't wait to go back when we come back to LV.

8WZPaLgnQyPmlaTDnO_lVA.text: Our party of five was promptly seated for an 11:00 brunch reservation. Our server, Jessica, was attentive throughout our meal. We did have an issue with the delivery of our food. Three of our party of five were served their meals while 2 others had to wait about five more minutes. When their food was served, one of the orders was incorrect and had to be sent back. We asked to see the manager regarding the food delivery. She went above and beyond by removing both meals from the bill. Overall, all of us enjoyed our food and bottomless mimosas. We would definitely return.

mg_lhumnKo-D14_0xQ-UHg.text: I can understand why Hearthstone gets the mixed reviews that it does. A few friends and I had dinner reservations at 6:30 on a Sunday. Coming up to the hostess podium, I could see that there was not much action going on in the dining room. I was early, went to the bar and grabbed a drink. The specialty cocktails are on the sweeter side. The service is was nice. The back area is pretty sweet. With two shuffleboard tables and a comfortable sitting arrangement, it could definitely be a place to chill with your friends, grab a few drinks and light bites.  It caught me a little off guard was when the hostess came to find me at the bar and asked if I wanted to cancel my reservation. I told her that I was just waiting for my party and they should be here soon. It was only 6:20. I was informed that if I wanted to be sat, I could without them, otherwise they would be giving away my table. Okay... I will be sat then. Good thing another friend had shown up and we began to order. Apparently the chef's special meat and cheese board sometimes does not include a cheese. That was when we went about customizing our own board. Sadly, the pickles were probably the best item we got on the board. When I think about charcuterie boards, I think about a small variety of different items to sample. Especially if there is an option for the chef to highlight his best items of the day. The oysters were decent. Nothing spectacular. The foie gras with strawberry jam was fantastic. I could eat that all day. I ended up scrapping the container clean. The harvest quinoa salad was a nice balance of texture and flavors. The charred octopus was tender and a hit. When it was the time for mains, we were all getting full. Instead of doing multiple entrees, we just did their special 40oz tomahawk ribeye. This was probably the worst part of our meal. I was shocked when it came out 20 minutes after we ordered. Yes, we asked for medium rare, but that would have been a record in cooking time. No sear or car on the outside. I cut into it near the center and sure enough it was raw. We sent it back and it came out medium well. Oh, well. You can't win them all. We did however get the lobster polenta and the roasted squash with burrata. Both side dishes outshone the steak itself.   We left stuffed. I just wasn't sure if I would order some of these items again. I definitely liked Hearthstone enough to go back again. Maybe just for casual nibbles and some drinks.

Euw_SOk7Tj4M7vit3-UcAw.text: We were looking for a nice place to have a date night. Called ahead and the host Natalie was able to put our names down for a call ahead/ reservation 20 minutes before we arrived. She was very pleasant and we were so happy to be able to enjoy a dinner on the usual busy Saturday evening.   Once sat we weren't able to decide what to get. Being our first time there we asked our server BRADY what he would suggest. For myself he suggested the lobster roll, which was absolutely delicious and for my boyfriend the hanger steak. Both selections were stunning and Brady's suggestions were greatly appreciated.   The staff was very attentive and friendly. Our server was OUTSTANDING, the best service I've EVER received in a restaurant. We will ask for Brady again when we come back in and you should too. You are surely in good hands.   p.s. get the oysters!!!!

h7ZgAIzcnGek67SjTj05EA.text: I have been coming here for quite a while now. My boyfriend and I initially came here to check out the Sunday brunch, and we have been hooked ever since. We always try to get Kate as our server. She is legit the best! When we don't have her, sadly, service is AWFUL! I am a waitress myself and have a lot of patience; but it is bad if we have anyone else. The greet takes forever, drinks take forever, and the food takes even longer. The GM is usually the one to take our drink orders because she sees us waiting. Kate always makes sure to get us our mimosas right away, even when it is busy. And she always refills my glass for me even though we have a picture on our table.  The unlimited mimosas are a steal and the food is bomb. I absolutely love the California Benedict! So good and way healthier than a normal Benedict. Also, the lox and bagel are so good and fresh. Also, I like getting a side of the turkey sausage. #yum!  I want to check it out for dinner one day, but I always forget. Maybe on a Wednesday so that we get $1 oysters.   But if you are going, ask for Kate as your server. She's beautiful and funny and amazing.

GsXeKCXpRACqZVXcV0bj9w.text: I went during Happy Hour so they had a few items and all draft beer, house wines, and wells for $6. The wine was surprisingly good for the price. I also had some hummus which was good for the HH price but not sure full price would be worth it.   I like Hearthstone. They had a few shuffleboard tables, a ton of tvs and good service. As far as HH goes, pretty solid for a nice restaurant.

63vSwFnTrY4Js2-NCuptMQ.text: Very disappointed.  Service was slow.  Food didn't live up to description.  The jalapeno hummus had no jalapeno in it.  Short ribs were good.  But the shrimp pasta was blah.  Such a mixed bag.  But we decided, we won't be going back.

Q4gVCObCD_fVu9zFUk1gDA.text: Way over priced for an ok and unimpressive meal. Ordered the bacon wrapped dates for an app. Took a long time, a portion of 3, and served with an odd combination of marinara sauce. The main dishes (French dip and burger) were just ok. The French dip was mushy, a bit bland, and came out slightly cold. The side of mashers were also bleh, too runny in my opinion and didn't have much flavor. Ordered the pineapple cake for dessert and was ok. The best tasting item was the specialty ice cream that came with the pineapple cake. Overall I felt like this restaurant couldn't decide what it wanted to be, upscale or casual, but definitely charges the upscale price for mediocre food. When you live in Vegas there are far better tasting options!

nmqk2k4No16dcal6n57Ayw.text: Everything started off pretty good. We ordered the wood fire octopuss and meat platter to start the night off. The kids, my wife and I were all happy. Then my one son ordered the build your own pizza, which he was excited to do. They  brought out the made dough with the pizza sauce on top, a side of cheese and pepperoni. That's it. No other toppings. That's not really building your own pizza at all. We were disappointed.  My wife ordered the Hanker steak( which was fantastic) and I ordered the fried chicken. As I was eating the chicken we noticed that it seemed undercooked and were a little concerned. We talked to the waiter and he said he'd speak to the chef. Then the service stop. No refills, no stopping by and seeing if everything is ok. We had to flag the waiter down to order dessert. We finished the rest of the meal and then 2 new pieces of chicken came back. Lol.. We were done at that time and asked to just have it boxed up. Are desserts came and we sat there for 5 more minutes starring at them because they didn't bring silverware and we could not get anyone's attention. The other funny part is, my 2 kids wanted build your own sundae's. So we ordered 2 of them along with the peanut butter lava cake and the chocolate souffle. The build your own sundae had the ice cream with chocolate chips inside and chocolate syrup on the side. That's it. Pouring syrup on the sundae was build your own sundae. Are you kidding. We didn't complain and waited for the check. It came to 171 and change and I left $40 dollar tip. My wife said I shouldn't but I work for tips and it's hard for me not to. But as the days go by I become more upset at my experience. Just so I'm up front. It was on Valentine's Day at 5:30pm. You would expect it to be busy because of the special occasion. It wasn't. At all. It was pretty slow in my experience. It didn't start picking up to around 6:45. There was a ton of empty tables.  Thanks Steve R

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Srsxrh_EyIpe0cgQ8vud1w.text: Came here for the happy hour! I enjoy it. We order 2 dozen of oysters, pepperoni pizza, wings, ricotta toast and the steak tartare bites. I checked in and got a free glass of wine I also ordered a Stella. The waitress we had she was very nice and attentive so that made me want to come back just wish it was closer to my house lol. Will definitely be back

ffmNub6842Db04hOY1AKcg.text: I went to the Hearthstone Kitchen with my daughter and baby grandson on Father's Day. There was a Father's Day special of a BOGO free entree. The restaurant is very attractive with an outdoor patio and a spacious and modern decor. The menu is almost overwhelming with great sounding descriptions of all the food available. The place was on the busy side and our server checked back with us frequently during the meal. However she came across as a little curt most of the time. We ordered chicken and waffles and a pimento cheese cheese burger. The waffles cut into pieces  to create a top and bottom bun were not whole wheat as described by our server. The chicken had a crispy coating with an acceptable flavor but oddly enough the bottom of the chicken had no such coating. The burger was another story though. There was not pimento cheese on the burger. There was a light sauce on the bottom bun with supposedly pimento cheese in it. We requested a substitute item which they did give to us. We tried the adult grilled cheese which was delicious with bacon and jam on it.  The bill had a good surprise as the higher priced entree was taken off not the lesser priced one. The grilled cheese was worth going there for but I am so so about the rest of the menu.#yelpcincinnati

pcdO1IbTYDegY4H0OBYz5A.text: Got hungry during their happy hour at the bar last night.  Had no idea the food here is so incredible!  We shared everything (two of us) - had the chick pea salad, tartar toast, ricotta toast and shrimp cocktail.  Every. Single. Thing. Was. Delicious.  And I mean it was really good!  Going back soon to do this again, didn't realize we could make our own little taste testing right at the bar.  Great service, very clean, friendly and nice people work here.  ***UPDATE:  We keep going back!  Had happy hour pizza and have now tried the entire happy hour menu at the bar.  AWESOME FOOD!

0VN_pJoLJ1cRYIVabfGyvQ.text: I wasn't very impressed with this place. It looks beautiful but that's where my praise ends. I went with a group for super bowl Sunday.  Unfortunately, they decided to do a pre set menu with very limited options.  They had an option of AYCE for $35 per person but your entire group had to do that which was kinda ridiculous.  The options I can remember for food were buffalo wings,  meatball sub,  cheese burger,  french dip,  buffalo chicken sandwich,  pepperoni pizza, fried mac and cheese bites and a truffle popcorn.  They also had a seasoned popcorn for free.    The seasoned popcorn they put out was so salty we couldn't eat it.  I asked for a bowl of plain popcorn which was much better. I also tried the mac and cheese bites and pizza.  The only reason we finished the pizza is because i was starving.  It was thin crust but had a soggy texture. For $21 I was really expecting a good quality pizza not some frozen mess.  The mac and cheese bites were flavorless,  we didn't even finish them.   Shortly after I regrettably ordered my pizza the waitress came and told us that they would be opening the full menu shortly.  Wait,  what? You told us earlier that this was the only food options and they couldn't be modified because they were prepared that morning. They told my friend she couldn't change the cheese on the burger because of this.  I'm not sure if it was mixed in the burger or if the waitress was just not properly informed. We received mixed answers for different questions depending on so we asked which was quite frustrating.    The place had a great atmosphere but the service and food left much to be desired which is why I probably won't return.
