Q88bMtCwXNbtJLp1gGeBgw.text: Came here with my parents who live in the U.K and my in laws from California and the general consensus was that the whole Hearthstone experience was absolutely incredible. Sarah the manager was superb, she welcomed my party at short notice and made us feel so welcome. She really went the extra mile!    Jose, our server was impeccable. His knowledge of the menu and his expertise in being able to match my parties taste preferences with dishes on the menu was second to none.   We ended up ordering a variety of appetizers. Lollipop wings, baked ricotta (amazing) steak tar tar (the best steak tar tar I've ever eaten by far) soft shell crab, tuna tar tar and truffle chicken pizza. We then had 3 various desserts between the 6 of us and the peanut butter lava cake is to die for!   All in all you HAVE to visit this restaurant, amazing staff, the best food I've ever tasted and the decor is outstanding. We couldn't have had a better experience anywhere.

vO_ePSkZZqUb1O09RtJSEQ.text: Serious decadence, in a fun and relaxed setting. Our waiter was fabulous, the food super relish and the ambiance fun! I would definitely go back...super tasty!  Salmon, check. Asparagus, numeeeeee. Rotisserie Chicken like are you hungry? Sweet potato fries, hello! Steak tartar like I've never enjoyed before. Dang this review is making me hungry!

FpiGMVeeQuEnzN6sCEaU3g.text: Came out for a nice dinner & to enjoy some $1 oysters & the service here literally turned my stomach sour. Upon greeting we were asked for indoor or outdoor seating & went with outdoor, after 10 mins we asked a food runner for menus & after another 5 went by I saw another couple get sat & promptly greeted with menus by a server. We decided to return to the hostess and get reseated inside. Maybe we would do better with the inside servers.    As soon as we sat down the server came over and greeted us and gave us menus.  However his knowledge of the menu was sub par.  Here's the worst part!   The manager finally came over and asked how everything was, we politely explained what happened and he stood there in silence.  It was so awkward he finally left.  Without apologizing or expressing any type of emotion.  Seriously you're the manager and you couldn't say I'm sorry for this and I'll make sure you have a better experience.   Nothing came out of his mouth!   When we saw our server next we asked for the check.  Why would I ever spend my money in an establishment that doesn't even have a manager that can apologize and think on his feet as to how to resolve a situation. They comped half of our check but all we were asking for was an apology.. would not return to this establishment even if I was paid to do so.

Is5BLsJgePUBCXm_rpJEWA.text: Delicious. Might be the best fried chicken I've had. Definitely returning and worth cheating on my keto diet.

6MVE3nTH4XeJEywBt8fAcQ.text: Came in here on a steady Wednesday night with my mom and sisters. I was really impressed with the food and service. Jeff was great and really attentive. He recommended some go to dishes. My favorite was the calamari and baked ricotta. Ommmmggg soo good!!   Definitely coming back to try more! It can be a bit pricey, but so worth it. Perfect spot for a date or nice dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari was really tender! One of the best in town!

2gcoiGmXDWs2B92qV9mkiQ.text: Ugh 3rd time, we had to have Alex as our server.  She's so unfriendly and not a pleasure to eat with AT ALL!!!  Food is great, never complained about the food, but everytime I get this girl Alex, I remember her for being nasty.  What's odd is my 3 girlfriends sat with me, and one said "oh not that girl, she's such a B" We kept the talk short.   Today was just awful. The girl checking people on the outside sent us to the pizza bar. No chairs, 45 min wait. Then the girl at the hostess stand said "we can seat you after 2:30" (2 hrs away)  I said "what she said 45 minutes"  So she asked for my number. I wanted to leave  We go to the car, on the 215 and I get a text that the table is ready! What the hell is that.   This place went downhill fast, it's the service, not the food. And I feel bad leaving this review, because this is a good restaurant. But it's the kind of place that makes you not want to tip a server, and I'm not that type of person.   We had salmon, california Benedict, 2 nonstop mimosas, wine, chicken salad, no complaints about the food or drinks...

LCe23G9Y6jNpfom4vA5G8g.text: This restaurant was very inviting. The lobster boil was really good and was a good price. I well definitely be visiting this place again.

fhYcoCgQ7HEv78ozoloGew.text: AMAZING!!!! I am a local and love this place! Delicious food, fantastic service! Ahmed has been our server a few times and is always so pleasant and takes care of us. Dollar oyster night is . You would never realize you're in a casino restaurant! Can't say enough great things about this place!

D7LYQqUv8dbkz6_g5H323A.text: Ahmed is the guy u wanna have take care of u at that place. Food is amazing as well lol

wD2La6NQ65fJ0ZMfrYzNZA.text: Ahmed took great care of us. And we loved the salmon special.  Great atmosphere and good food.  Highly recommend dining there.

KqpVEyPwBRncDLTKl3wRtg.text: I made a reservation the day before, which the hostess informed me was never made. Luckily we came right at opening so there wasn't an issue getting a table.   Server- Jessica and other server were friendly.   Food service was WAY off. We were a party of 5. We ordered porchetta and eggs, French toast, steak and eggs, loco moco and poutine.  We arrived at 1030. I'll give them some leeway and said we ordered at 1045. We started slowly receiving our dishes at around 1115. Only two dishes at first, the poutine and the steak and eggs, which were both delicious. Then we got the porchetta and eggs, which we ordered before the rest of our meal as an app, but received it with everything else. We got the loco moco cold, I'm assuming they were holding it till everything else was ready. We received the French toast at 1130 and it was RAW. The batter was leaking out.   I was hoping that this place would be as great as it looks. The food is great. They just need to work on their food timing.

2Mz_cq1eptkEded5z-O0WA.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review for hearthstone yet. I had to give this place 5 stars because I think the food is hot, atmosphere is hot, and the girls are pretty damn hot. And by the way guys, all the girls are taken because I tried. Haha  I love coming here, we have a friend that serve us (Tien she's the best) and everyone else is always so welcoming and pleasant when we come especially the managers. VIP!  I will post my regular entree, you must try when you come in. I've never had a rib cap, never even heard of it. First time had it here and it melted in my mouth. Tried all the apps, not one thing I do not like. Happy eating!!

Jy9zd28Soq_VrXJmcqCR5Q.text: My updated review is long overdue. It's been a couple months since I re visited Hearthstone & let me just say they blew me away ! I can still remember my servers name, Jeff. He was so patient & gave excellent recommendations on food items. Bravo to him, he was also very informative and knew the menu like the back of his hand. This is my new favorite restaurant! Whatever I wrote in my other review I forgot lol! That's how excellent my customer service was & the food of course, amazing. My go to restaurant from now on! Thank you to Hearthstone team.

XTrgKdssbyonZ444T7kUHw.text: The atmosphere is amazing.  I had the $1 oysters and they were bombastic. Tried the octopus and gave it 8 out of 10. Salad was above average. Can't wait to return...

8LDeuTsL-dXh5DRTVTm4Cg.text: One of my favorite places for Monday night football. Lots of Tv's with lounge type seating for group watching. Happy hour 5:30-7 with drinks and appetizers at $6-7 and all you can eat hot wings for $12 During half time they do a complimentary roasted pig chopped right in front of you.  Very nice staff

Also when they have live music it just makes the experience even better I had such a great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zuZsEWTmvI3KNVrKUTUj0Q.text: Came to hearthstone for oyster Wednesday! Dollar oysters ? Come on how can you beat that! I was being taken care of by Jocelyn the bartender! She was so awesome. Will for sure be returning soon for dinner!

7VKnPvlenbDiW0UaJdRD3g.text: Came in in Saturday for wing night. The wings were awesome, atmosphere was fun and most of all our server Kate was the bomb! It was super busy and she ran her tail off but kept great care of us the whole time. Can't wait to come back in and try some other stuff on the menu.

J1mrMQOynIWKp0DTWHNq1Q.text: I literally drive out here from green valley every other month or weekend just to eat here. We really enjoyed coming here to hearthstone. I have nothing but good things to say about this place, always a good experience when we are here.   We have been here numerous times and nothing has ever disappointed me. Everything here is on point. From the cocktails to the service - down to the management. Thank you Mary for always taking care of us.   From brunch: my favorite is the duck and waffles and salted Carmel French toast (and bacon to balance the sweetness of the French toast) and all you can drink mimosa, need I say more.   Dinner: my favorite appetizers are halibut ceviche with watermelon with a lemon vinaigrette. Watermelon salad with feta avocado and mint vinaigrette.  So fresh in the summer time. Meatball pizza - to die for. And for entrees - I switch it up all the time. But tonight I had the black truffle hanger steak with aioli and potatoes. Only 33 dollars! Such a steal, way better than the steaks next door.    And if you have 20 minutes in the end, order that souffle.  Amazing!! (Burned hands by touching glass so a beware!) lol

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take pictures before food is all gone haha. This is my hanger steak with the potatoes. Medium rare all the way. Mmm

qOevGqs4sDxchCF7F9MfAA.text: I've been fortunate to be graced with a medium sized family however local dinner spots are not always accommodating when you bring the shorties with you but this is not the case with Hearthstone.  The dining room is very large so you don't hear other people's conversations while still being able to enjoy your own.  They also have a PDR (private dining room) at the front of the restaurant if your party requires privacy.  Hearthstone is another venue managed by Clique Hospitality and it shows.  From the start of the meal, you are greeted in a way that is the signature approach imparted by the owner Andy Masi.  Like all things in life, you want to feel comfortable and treated like a VIP and that's what happens at Hearthstone.  One of the best dishes at this venue is incredibly unassuming and ordered every time we dine and that is the Atlantic Salmon.  It's been discussed around the table as the best salmon dish our guests have tasted on multiple occasions.  My go to appetizer is always the lollipop wings (best wings ever) as well as the octopus.  The flatbread pizzas are all delicious (Abe Froman has the best flavor).  Management is always present and professional (touching tables throughout our dining experiences).  The GM, Sarah Bryner, always has a bright smile and is there to accommodate any request to enhance your dining experience.  Whether you are in the mood to listen to some impressive live music (Daniel Park) or enjoy the recurring Thursday Wine events, this is a great local restaurant offering a wide range of items to satisfy almost any mood.  Can't wait to go back as writing this has stirred up a hankering for some of those tasty wings!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special pizza. Butternut Squash with goat cheese.

T8zT_Jp64IuA6F8GS49u5g.text: Hands down the best place in Vegas. It's comfort food with a western vibe. So many flavors in each dish. And the great thing is when you order the food and share it all its not only an experience for your taste buds but also such a great social experience as well.  Favorite dishes: Stuffed Date wrapped in Bacon and stuffed with Chorizo. Charred Octopus. Mushroom flatbread. Steak Tar Tar. Honey Truffle.   This is only a very small list of the dishes that I love.   My favorite drink MY BOY BLEU this drink is so amazingly perfect. It has Rosemary infused vodka, egg white, citrus liquor and does not disappoint. This is def worth going to Hearthstone for.   Give this place a try. I love it and I bring my family in every time they come here and they cannot get enough. Great job!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atmosphere of this place is amazing. Such a great venue.

QzehsxnDErUIey4iaW49lg.text: Tried out Hearthstone for the first time.  Menu is a bit complex for Tweens who would be more interested in a burger... Be we pushed through it!  Deviled eggs were good with the pimento cheese buried in the bottom a nice touch.  Crispy fries were more like logs and could have been passed over as other dishes were far batter.  Charred octopus was tender and perfect.  Lollipop wings were just perfectly spicy with a nice buttery flavor in the batter.  Sauce for the wings cooled them off just a bit.  Abe Froman flat bread was ok, but when you put mozzarella on a pizza you risk the bottom getting soggy.  Needs a crisp crust to make it killer!  Mac and cheese was a very nice creamy note and the meatballs (spare ribs) were just a touch of home!    Finished it up with the olive oil cake to top it off.  Service was good with many friendly staff offering to clear or help.  With tapas I would have liked a little more time spread out for the food to arrive, but in our case, it all showed up at once and the table got crowded.  Decor and atmosphere was an 8 out of 10 and would appeal to yuppies, metros, and folks walking in from the casino.  Would come back again without the kids next time.  But really enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fantastic dinner!  Charred octopus was really tender.  Lollipop wings were amazing!  Terrific meatballs and mac&amp;cheese!

RDM3zLuKAvmQ3McaRnCWOw.text: I absolutely love this place,  I will say it. Rustic place with such great food,  nothing wrong with that. The farm to table concept makes me happy,  organic,  grass fed beef,  suckling pig ,  house made everything. You don't get that in most chain restaurants. My boyfriend came into town from LA so we thought it would be fitting to come here. We got seated at the lounge first because we didn't make a reservation and they were super busy so we didn't mind. Shaheena greeted us, recommended us the red rock sunset - which was amazing!  My boyfriend got the pimms which was interesting but. Yummy!   We finally sat down at our booth,  it was entertaining watching everyone running around. Every single server was welcoming,  Mary and Peter came by and also checked on how our evening was and it was sweet.   We ordered the baked ricotta with truffle honey on the side. To die for. Didn't think it sounded great but our server highly recommended that dish. That stuffed dates,  wow. Chorizo center wrapped around dates and fat bacon. Then we also got the crabby snacks,  hand picked crab.   For dinner I got the hanger steak, truffle on truffle Wow. I want more right now please. My boyfriend got the halibut with the black rice, forgot what else but it was great. Don't know what else everyone else got,  it was just good!  The average person was 60 dollars,  so definitely put a dent in my account but was it with it!??   Yes this is where memories are made and foodgasim happens. This is no yard house,  this is not TGIF. Everything is on point.   So make sure to try everything,  family style for apps. But entrees get your own because it's amazing. Save space  for desserts because we were full by then!    Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut.

CSa0-t8xj8gkctFbJSqWDg.text: I wanted to like this place as the decor is great and the menu awesome, but it didn't live up. First off, the place was maybe 20% full and it was the slowest service I think I have ever experienced in my adult dining life. I always order my daughter's food with our drinks, so she won't have to wait as long. Over an hour after placing that order she was teary with hunger and when asked if it was possible to get her meal soon, and being told it was coming right out, we waited another 15 minutes. I wish I could say the food was worth the wait but it was not. The deviled eggs are decent, salad less so, and the lobster roll was not one of the better ones I've had. Our second round of drinks didn't show up until after we had finished our meal and asked for the check. Seriously- get it together. This place could be good, but you have a major service problem.

GTzk7xATSlJrGnOX3b90Yg.text: My husband and I came in and our server recommend a great bottle of wine paired with the most amazing scallops I've ever had! Will definitely be coming back on Wednesday's for dollar oyster night!!  Great food and great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VpOyiglr9Lyz823-eFq8_A.text: Probably the worst service at all the restaurants at Red Rock casino, Downtown Summerlin and the plaza across Charleston combined. Shame on me for trying his place multiple times hoping the next visit would be better. The food isn't bad but it's not great either. Based on food quality alone I'd rather eat at the franchise spots like Yardhouse or BJ's. (Both less than a few hundred yards away)  Last visit, I say with my wife and two kids. First we were given 1 menu...about 5 min later we were able to flag down our waitress to ask for other menus. Then was brought a 2nd menu. A few minutes later she comes by to take our order where I in turn ask for a kids, happy hour and a beverage menu? We watched the tables next to us get seated after us and have their orders taken and be on their way before we got all their menus. We order a handful of items and a couple of drinks (beer/wine). Food came out at a decent time and plates were bussed in a timely manner as the water was refilled with regularity so I can't knock the buss/beverage staff. When I wanted to order another round of beverages our waitress was M.I.A. And when we wanted to call for more food only god knew where our waitress was. When I finally got my second glass of wine I already Asked for the check and didn't bother to finish my wine. I spoke to the manager just to let him know if my experience. He offered the usual free dessert or drink but I told him I just won't be back.   There are so many other restaurants on par that are in literal walking distance from this one. I will just wait until this place runs out their lease and the next restaurant concept moves in. For other options I would suggest anything else at red rock. Even their sister restaurant Salute has their act together.  After restaurant's generic response: Oh yea, I was just reminded by the restaurant's response that it was a "bottomless" wings promotion. My wife and I both had to opt in for $10 each which is no biggie. They bright us "refills" once. So it was basically $10 for 9 wings. Hardly bottomless but I was already done with the place and don't want anything else to do with this place. God forbid they kick down napkins to a table with kids too. I can go on and on about the garbage service of this place... I think the service at the concession stand inside the theater is better than this place.

KKcYAVHVZeEexHH9bxkZmA.text: My husband and I come into Red Rock all the time but we stopped into Hearthstone the other night for Happy Hour. The food and drinks were all amazing! Our bartender Jocelyn was so friendly and fun! We'll definitely be back.

-TQmZpgz3pLXn-_TUiEW-A.text: We went here for the first time on a Monday night to celebrate our anniversary. They have an excellent happy hour menu from 5 to 7pm. Everything on the menu, including select wine and beer, is priced at $6. Also on Monday, they have half priced bottles of wine. We got a bottle of the bourgogne for only $22. We ordered the truffle pasta with chicken and the shrimp pasta. Everything tasted delicious. They also have us a complimentary "Happy Anniversary" dessert. Our waitress was very friendly and all of the staff were professional. This is going to be one of our regular places.

ncuVLqEUXHX9-khjD1fr2A.text: Amazing food and great wine. Kate was a great waitress and gave us great suggestions on all our dishes. Great place to chill and relax.

BtBU8wLJYPMTpqas0Sg5sQ.text: Came in on a Friday night with my hubby. One of my friends recommended the place. They have live music that starts at 8 on the weekends. The performers were great. Cool atmosphere. It seemed slow for Friday night. That's what our waitress said. I believe her name was Crystal. She was really attentive and friendly. She told us to start off with the baked ricotta. Omg it was amazing. I would go back just for That!  We also shared a meatball flatbread, oysters, and the salmon. Loved the salmon!  The oysters were so fresh too! Definitely coming back for dollar oysters on Wednesday!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

icsId5S_lZwozKf7qChRJA.text: The food was good. I started with the chicken wings then had the Brussel sprout Caesar salad and finished with peanut butter lava cake. Also went during happy hour so had two drinks and they don't skimp out on the alcohol. If I were to go back I'd skip the salad and wings and just get drinks and dessert. The staff was friendly though so that made the experience more enjoyable

wPHPLq7X7Zp5vMl_bWnx-w.text: I'm writing this review as I sit here at our table. We are just not happy at all with the service here. Our waitress literally came to our table ONCE to get our order then she disappeared like a rare Pokemon. After a half hour, my boyfriend tracked down the hostess to complain and get our waitress. Oh and now finally the rare Pokemon appeared five minutes later (insert eye roll here). Oh what did we order though? The French toast, California Benedict, pancakes, and corner beef hash. There was four of us lol anyways, tell me WHY MY FOOD WAS COLD when I got it. I didn't know corned beef hash was supposed to be cold? I felt like it had been left out or someone returned it and now I was getting it. After a few bites, I just stopped eating. My boyfriends french toast was cold too, not warm at all. Oh and my sisters pancakes were cold too. We've come here before and really liked it but today was a disaster. Horrible service and cold food. The place wasn't even busy for crying out loud. We decided to go to fatburger in the food court now instead of eating this.  Not sure if we want to come here again. (OH the family of four in the booth next to us ended up leaving because no tended to them AT ALL).

FmvjXruEnsXhQbK6SFCG1Q.text: Atmosphere A plus  Food A plus  Service A plus   Really nice place, great music and ambiance, we will be back for sure.

2bRxCDw7PHEEEDh4Q5E2vg.text: I came here for Sunday brunch and i could have sat there all day! It took me so long to decide what to order because everything looked so good! I ended up getting the parfait with cocunut cream which was a delicious starter and the eggs Benedict which I also loved! Besides the great food all the staff is welcoming and the ambiance is great !!

bAyFSt2ZH6W8T6XS6peXZA.text: A must try! Beautiful ambience and terrific terrace. We had the shrimp pasta, baked ricotta and deviled eggs, all all of which were delicious, but the ricotta was one of the most delicious morsels I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked ricotta, shrimp pasta, deviled eggs

JMjQGO4qbE_Ha0gpRY1TdQ.text: I'm so glad I ignored the semi-bad reviews and came here. Fantastic ambiance, and the decor and vibe was on point. Happy hour specials were great, and our server (Johann) was extremely attentive and super friendly. If you're anywhere near Red Rock Resort, this place is a no-brainer.

sHMJ0Hyw4xPoMPaXJ8VVAg.text: Very hipster and trendy; the entree and appetizer descriptions lived up to the ambiance but the flavor was lacking. The decor was homey, yet inspiring. Probably a more appropriate place for appetizers/ happy hour.

K3MFvfv7NRfg8nScM0qalA.text: Four of us and a baby went here for Christmas.  We had reservations for 6 pm, but they weren't able to seat us until almost 6:30.  It was a pretty busy night.    We had a booth shaped like a crescent where we sat with our backs against a wall.  It was comfortable except that it has really hard to talk to each other. The music was really loud and my dad couldn't hear me as we were sitting on opposite ends of the booth. For a holiday with so many families there from out of town, they could have turned down the music.  Nothing like a blasting of the song Sexual Healing to get you in the Christmas spirit! :)  The food was good. Two of us ordered the price fixe menu and two ordered a la carte.  Our bill was about $200.  The only thing that was bad was the Christmas cookies for the prie fixe dinner.  They were hard as rocks, not good, and didn't seem fresh.  But, we did enjoy the complimentary egg nog served in cute mason jars.  The service was mediocre.  We got sat 30 min after our reservation.  The servers have a really long intro when you sit down.  It made our eyes glaze over after the first 30 seconds or so.  We also asked for two modifications-no goat cheese under the meatballs and no cookie in the ice cream.  Both were completely ignored.  We didn't complain, but if you have an allergy Id be extra cautious. We also had our 3 week old and they didn't want us to keep her car seat on the stroller base and requested we keep the stroller in the entryway.  It's a small stroller.  Yet the table next two us had two strollers at their table.  Not so much an issue but I was nervous about the stability of their upside down high chairs considering the traffic in the area where they sat us.  Decent place with the potential to be great with some tweaking here and there.  There are so many great options in Vegas...even in the same casino.  Living in the area, I'm not sure it'd be our first choice next time we went out.

YGJ2XH4oWlOZXtlKebWouw.text: This place has a fabulous ambiance. I had the Lobster Roll with sweet potato fries which was soooooo good. My daughter and boyfriend shared the Apple Quinoa Salad along with chicken pizza and they loved it. Very good service and can't wait to come back to town and go here again.

8PGc-7J_UgmGn_-27wuXNw.text: Awesome, great for happy hour. Seeing George Clooney sitting at the table behind blew me away! I guess it's a popular place for celebs to have a drink off the strip. Fun bartenders. I love this place.

JfdtMYCJu2El6PM8kR_QiA.text: Wow!! All can say  is wow!! And also I guess Kate is amazing!! The food was great I got the lobster boil and it was only $24!! Like what the heck is that for real!! They always have great specials like wine night on mondays and Wednesday $1 oysters!! Can you believe it!! Food is quality and service is outstanding!! Kate always tells the best deals and the best time to come in, which all the time!!! If I could add more stars for kate I would ... she's hip and intelligent and really knows her stuff about food and wine!! I will be back!! And will be telling everyone to come!! See you soon !!

tKK6yvQX5yV9Z9uAesR0Ww.text: We celebrated our anniversary there and can't say enough good things about the food and service! Everything was fantastic and Annie, our server, was awesome. Thank you to her and Russell, the manager, for the free dessert and for making our night so special. We will definitely be back soon!

PhQxAu8o1Lt4NP4BIix3_g.text: Excellent food and Service from Jessica G. !! She's awesome!!!  Great wine selection too.

M-1r_sMi5-N3EeWM19Iyhg.text: Fantastic atmosphere! And not to forget....the food and drinks are amazing  as well. To top it off, the staff is very knowledgeable, very friendly and courteous. If you are looking for ANY of these things ...... then this is the place to go !  Live performance by Daniel Park and every single song he sang was amazing.  Our server, Johann was very knowledgeable with every question we asked and super friendly throughout our experience here. My boyfriend and I are definitely coming back!

v14ClyzdebxQ3VWPcePkFA.text: Hearthstone was great! The service was perfect. They were friendly and very accommodating. My water glass was always full and the food came out in a timely manner. They had great drinks at the bar it was very clean. I highly suggest to anyone who is visiting red rock casino.

1TqoXgvgMyP4jbBfo9cQ_g.text: I would like to give Alexandra shot out for an exceptional service. She is great! Please give her her recognition and a commendation from her management team. Please give Russell a shot out too....

RL9XYitltA5BirwOW1Mrww.text: I would like to send a shot out to Alexandra at Hearthstone. For continues best customer  service ever. Please stop by and have Alexandra  to service you. Five Stars all the way!!!! Please ensure that management recognizes her. Russell was excellent  as well, please give him a shot out as well. Thank you.

bQOGKAvN-XB6XjJdxilcfQ.text: Interesting Decor in this restaurant bar located inside Red Rock Casino. Food is pricey but some delicious and different choices. Appetizers were on the small side but variety and quality present. Pizza is very good

01W-071WPP9JUmtgsXUMpA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to give their brunch a try last week. We loved their dinner menu, and its difficult to beat $15 bottomless mimosas. We both ordered California Benedict, and while the eggs were expertly poached and the chicken and avocado very good, we were very (unpleasantly) surprised that, rather than being served upon an English muffin or other bread, it was served upon a tomato. The menu said nothing about the tomato, and I would never have ordered it if I had known (mostly because I hate tomatoes).  We asked for an English muffin instead, and not only did they replace our tomatoes with bread, the manager also came over and personally took care of it on our check as well. Hearthstone was genuinely concerned that we had a pleasant experience. Their customer service and food deserve five stars, but I took one because I feel the menu could be made more clear, so as to avoid situations like this in the future. I very much recommend this place, and can't wait to go back.

ZDRmCFpq9P6DcNw7nJXIAg.text: Great taste wonderfully done  menu, small portions Jeff our server was on point. Hanger Steak with aioli was excellent.

E22m-J0hXPj6lU7LF3xGgg.text: My first Yelp review.  Aesthetically-beautiful venue.  Large outdoor patio for dining.  We sat at the "Chef's Bar" which is basically a "bar-style" counter directly in front of the main chefs - the executive chef worked right next to us and chatted it up with us along with his second-in-command.  A very cool dining concept if you want to be at the forefront of the culinary action with the actual top chef(s).  Food was very good.  THICK Tomato Bisque Soup with a nice side Grilled Cheese Sandwich (the sandwich being a nice surprise).  The Flatbreads (we had the "Abe Froman") was very delicious as well.  Wait staff was decent - friendly.  I'd go back.

D4jfzLceBXle-WiWsjKfgQ.text: The food was fine.  However,  when I told the server I had a food allergy he assured me  he too was allergic and had not problem.  I spent the night and next day very sick.  Everyone makes mistakes....but after leaving a personal message for the manager I have yet to get a phone call or message.  I'm not asking for a free meal just an apology.  I almost ended up in the hospital!

Lag-rQXVQTC4zABsFa_rQQ.text: I love the atmosphere and the band! I could hangout here for hours! The only reason I'm giving it a 4 is because our food was mediocre at best for the price!   Taylor was our waitress and she was so sweet! Even though the food was okay I would still come back

Z04wDuTN4iKZVhtoCifzfA.text: I ate at Hearthstone last night. I Loved the feel of the place. It felt homey and rustic. The staff were very friendly and knowledgable, I started my meal with their steak tar tar and let me tell you, it was to Die for!!! Then I moved on to the main course, Filet Mignon! I mean Wow if everything in this place tastes this good I may never eat anywhere else Ever Again!! Definitely The Best Food In Town! Hearthstone is an All Time New Favorite, if you've never been I recommend Going Tonight!!!

GBNhPcCYbeEdsqnWrwcAng.text: Great restaurant with lots of great options for anyone in the family food wise. The staff were all friendly while the service was maintained at a very professional level. This made the experience overall pleasant and encouraged myself and my friends to return. Give it a shot!

DF94cYlRUvNTJZgItlX0HA.text: Came for our first time and had a wonderful experience food was great! Burger sliders happy hour we ordered a few orders! Pizza is so good too! The little lollipop wings are good too!  Our server johann was right there every time we needed him thank you for such a great first time experience we will for sure be coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside atmosphere

wyJNBPc8WwYUssnYj5LEsw.text: Jeff was our server & was everything you would want, super nice, attentive, had great suggestions & overall made the entire dining experience amazing. I had the vegetable salad with shrimp & my friend had the shrimp pasta, both were good!

3LcHPF6NZF8anyBDYrAwxA.text: 4 of us came for dinner on a Sunday night, we made a reservation and had absolutely no issue getting our table. The only downside to our table was that it was the first one by the door coming from outside...so every time the door was opened we got a blast of freezing cold air, but it wasn't very busy so it's not like it was a big deal.   Our server was AWESOME. Hopefully you guys get Danielle if you go. She's great.   Here's what we ordered: -Wine: they have an extensive wine list, I tried a sip and it was good. If you're a fancy wine drinker, I think you'll enjoy the selection. -Cocktails: I had the Blackberry Bliss, VERY GOOD. My husband had the Babymaker...I hated it, he LOVED it. He's kinda like an old man trapped in a young man's body, if that helps.   -Truffle popcorn to start.    *It's great. Everyone is on the truffle-train right now with adding it into everything they can think of so it's kinda played out...but this was still good. And it's not a tiny serving either, which makes it feel like it's worth the $7-$8(or whatever, I didn't pay attention to the price on it) you're paying for it. The one serving was split between the 4 of us and we didn't finish it, so it's a good size.  -Pepperoni flatbread, the Abe Froman flatbread, Salmon, and the rotisserie potatoes.     *Flatbreads were good, but nothing spectacular. The salmon got the job done, wasn't fishy like it can be, and had a great sauce to go with it. The rotisserie potatoes were AMAZING and I recommend them to everyone who can handle jalapenos.   I would definitely go again. It's got a super hipster environment, so you're gonna feel like you're not cool enough to eat here at first. It's worth it to stick it out though.

gtW5OHV-Tokp5tMZxmVBlA.text: Not often does one have a dinning experience as exceptional as ours on Christmas day. The knowledgeable host was the reason we decided to try it. The atmosphere was unique and pleasant. The servers , Sheena, Jose and all the others, were beyond exceptional and the food was absolutely delicious. We will make a point to return every time we visit Vegas.

3XFccfVwNwBoOwf2EMq-fg.text: First time here...our waitress was Jessica G and we had a coupon for 4 restaurants at Red Rock Hotel. We decided to try this one. The atmosphere is very Restoration Hardware and because the square footage is huge, you don't feel like it's crowded. I love the eclectic, trendy feel. When the waitress brought the menu, she seemed like she was doing us a favor being there. She was just awful ..bad bad service.  We ordered orange juice /they don't have fresh squeezed oj , it only smells like oranges/, coffee, the sticky bun, 3eggs omelet and California Benedict. I got the egg white omelet with a side of fruit instead of the regular omelet with a side of toast. I was too hungry to argue about it and just had whatever the waitress decided to give me.The sticky bun wasn't sticky at all..it was in need of moisture..it felt like "yesterday's left over bun".  The ambiance was nice, but i do not plan on returning here..food was decent..service not good.

NsmeqIksR_80Ix6eTxqvhA.text: Came here for my bachelor party.  We ordered 2 whole suckling pigs (we had a big group).   Honestly, I was really drunk so my details of this night are not too great, but I will say a few things that I do remember:  1) The service here was not that great.  We had a room reserved, we were spending over $1500 here for dinner, but we had to on at least _4_ occasions go out and look for a waiter to ask the status of something (usually had to do with the drinks).  That's really unacceptable.  If we're dropping that kind of money on a meal, the guests shouldn't have to play hide-and-go-seek with the wait staff. Apparently the bar was "backed up", but I have no idea what that means.  At no point should it take 45 min to pour a glass of whiskey.   2) The suckling pig was really good.  If you have a big enough party, splurge on it.  I can't unfortunately give you too much advice on the portion sizes.  I don't remember how much we ate. I do know we had leftovers to take back.  We ordered 2 pigs for about 12 of us I believe.   3) If you're staying on the strip, beware that this is a very long taxi ride over.

ut9N_SIOTwgPVZ_Yt0BGVw.text: Hearthstone has taken a page out of the HoneySalt playbook with a look full of rustic and homey elements that make for a cozy dining environment. The transformation of the space formerly occupied by Hachi is remarkable. The space is more inviting with its dark decor, open kitchen, two long bars, a lounge area and patio.  Small plates dominatef the menu, allowing diners to sample plenty of eats. Several salads are available. The wild arugula ($12) combines some wonderful flavors with citrus poached leeks, toasted hazelnuts, and ricotta, although the leeks were my least favorite element with it's crunchy texture and slight bitterness proving offputting. A much better option was the roasted heirloom beets ($14). Tender chunks of beets sat atop a bed of whipped ricotta with goat cheese and lemon thyme adding some brightness to the dish along with a bit of crunch from the pistachios.  Dishes are all beautifully presented, but not always successful. The tuna carpaccio ($14) lacked focus. An overpowering sweetness from avocado and plenty of acidity from tomatoes drowned out the flavor of the fish while the flower petal garnish didn't add anything to the profile of the dish. Thankfully more savory options like the butcher steak tartare ($14) and meatballs ($13) delivered in making the main ingredients the stars with supporting elements that heightened the flavors of each.  For those that want larger portions, entrees are available as well. The wagyu short rib ($28) is a dish perfect for cooler weather. The hearty, savory, stout braised beef and vegetables is comfort food at its best.  Their dessert list is full of options I'll have to return to sample. The lone dessert I've tried has been an almond chocolate chip souffle. Restrained sweetness and a silken, warm texture made it perfect for soothing the soul and tastebuds.  Hearthstone doesn't forget their younger audience either. A kid's menu is available with plenty of favorites. A pizza is available where kids can add their own toppings at the table and the resulting dish is then brought back to the kitchen to be cooked. Chicken fingers are on the menu, but unfortunately my kid found them to be too hard and underseasoned.  Expect higher prices due to the quality of ingredients and overall superior quality of food as compared with most other Summerlin spots. It may not be for everyone, but the Light Group has created a restaurant unique to this part of town with dishes more commonly associated with the Strip than the 'burbs.

t_QzvbvCCjXIB6r5YB5PtA.text: A group of us came all the way from the strip to come dine here and we had the worst experience. The management was terrible and treated us poorly. So after an hour of waiting for our table we ended up leaving. I highly don't recommend anyone dining at this restaurant.

OuCsmmjOJr25ZThx75Gtag.text: Fourth of July is busy! I get it. But the first impressions at the host stand before even going into the restaurant? Incredibly poor & rude! We just wanted to know how long the wait would be without a reservation would be, & no hesitation after we said no thanks rolled her eyes and gave us a dirty look! Super disappointed.

kWuUabpxa5ShNm8qawvtMg.text: Very nice atmosphere.  We went on St. Pattys Day just before we went to YBR (Yellow Brick Road).  The entertainment in house was a gentleman and lady who were very good!  So, why the three stars?  My wife's veggie sliders were very good and my cousins rotisserie chicken was also delicious.  Still, three stars???  Here's why...the rotisserie chicken took very long to come out, so we waited for that and our food, which was already out, started to cool.  The server said it should only be a few minutes after recognizing that she didn't have her food yet, but it was much more than a few.  My cousins husband and I ordered the burger and a beer special.  We ordered it medium but it was closer to rare.  We didn't tell the server because we needed to get over to the YBR show and, due to the wait for the chicken, we needed to get going.  Plus, as I mentioned, it was cool because of that wait. Oh...speaking of waits...  We originally had a wait of 5 minutes for a table, but we cancelled that because we wanted to get to the show, but we came back because we were hungry.  When we came back, the wait became 15 minutes, which was fine...we understood because we originally cancelled.  But, that 15 turned into 20, 25, and then 30 minutes as we sat waiting for a table.  The hostess kept us posted and we appreciated that.  She also showed us which table would be ours when another couple, just finishing up, would leave.  However, once they left, we waited even longer for the table to be cleaned and finally I  believe the Manager had to clean off the table.  Then, when we finished and asked for the check, we had to ask on if the bussers to find our server so we could get it and, eventually the Manager had to bring it to us.  So, not bad, but definitely not great.  Thus, 3 stars....

rVtUGbvZZt64Mcnd0qipPA.text: This place would've gotten five stars if the service was better. Let me start off my saying my boyfriend and I both work in the service industry so we know what good service looks like.   I made a reservation on opentable and wanted to sit outside, the hostess was very sweet and let us know that the patio was very sunny and allowed us to try it out before sitting outside. She was very sweet and accommodating and we ended up staying outside. That's about where the good service ended. We ended up having two waitresses because the first one never came back around to our table. The second waitress took our food order and we waited thirty minutes for our food because apparently the chef didn't like the way the food was prepared? Two tables who sat after us got their food before us. Then they had to fix our check three times because there was stuff on there that we didn't order.   I will say however that the food was sooooo good. I had the egg cocotte and my boyfriend had the pancakes and both were delicious! I hope that I can convince my boyfriend to come back because the food was so good but I don't see that happening for a while. Very disappointing considering I really wanted to love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Cocotte

9ARRp1PdgxojeqKKsyPkCQ.text: Hearthstone is a refreshing place to venture to if you're in the Red Rock area. The ambience is almost a country chic with hip decor. I love that the servers wear suspenders!!   I was fortunate enough to enjoy the opening of the restaurant where I got to sample a huge variety of their delicious plates. One of my favorites was the calamari (I want to eat that right now) and the stuffed dates (seriously you MUST order them)!! My most recent visit was for the Yelp Shares the Love Promotion. I enjoyed their Charcuterie (a fancy word for a fine meat and cheese) plate. This is the perfect little snack to enjoy wine with as I did. The truffle honey is to DIE for...I'm obsessed!!   Honestly everything I've tried from this place has been amazing!!! The service has always been spot on. The entire staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. It is a bit further from my home, but it's definitely worth the trek!!

r4N6AnciXJVMvEDjU0EvNA.text: Folks, I would like to share my experience after visiting this restaurant for the second time now. My second visit was on a Monday night when the restaurant was less crowded. When we were seated, we waited at least 15 minutes before we asked one of the staff to get our menus. The food was very good, atmosphere was loud. The service was poor. The hostess was unfriendly and our waitress was very slow and unprofessional. It took at least 20 min for our waitress to come to our table and take our order. There was an incident in the restaurant while we were there, as one of the staff dropped a plate of food on the ground and the pieces landed on my shoulder and our table. Thank god no one got hurt. We never got an apology or a visit from the management team to see if we were OK. We mentioned the incident to our waitress and she kinda ignored the situation by giving us an insincere apology. Honestly, we will not return to this restaurant until there is a major change in staff's attitude and better management engagement with customers. From my experience working in the service industry, poor management leadership leads to poor staff attitude and work ethics.

ILNsBBDxjw47EcVxAgAc3g.text: We dropped in for $1 oyster Wednesday. The oysters were incredible. Had a cheese board which was equally outstanding. Our servers were friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was fun. The decor was cute, and we enjoyed the live music! I'll definitely go back and try a heartier entree! Service was perfect!

Gt5wocURwWDJXEPJ73azMA.text: Drove in from LA and rolled up to the Red Rock on a Friday night.  Didn't want to go searching for a place to eat so we decided to eat in the Hotel.  Hearthstone fit the bill.  It was uber crowded so we decided to snag a table in the lounge and eat there.  Since the seating was a bit awkward, we decided on passed apps and a few drinks.  I love the menu here and the concept is similar to chez panisse or its offshoot camino in Oakland.  The food was terrific and I would definitely come back to sample more.  The FG&J is a must try for foie lovers.  My wife also enjoyed a couple of the hand crafted cocktails.  Service was ok, but I'm not holding that against them.  It was a busy friday night and the cocktails waitress was pretty slammed.  Also, the restaurant is pretty loud, not just in the bar area, but also in the dining room.

3Za5A6tPr6_Gj4EHIYMJ_Q.text: My friend and I got to Hearthstone for brunch a few weeks ago. I've been meaning to check it out, so I was stoked to finally get here.   The decor is gorgeous. I absolutely loved it.   We skipped the bottomless mimosas due to them being quite pricey. And, the single order of mimosas for the price was also a tad much. You can get cheaper bottomless mimosas at other places in Summerlin and on the Strip.   I went with the eggs benedict which was good. It was't the best, but it was good and filling. My friend got the "vegan" version of the benedict, and she was a fan as well.   I would go back in the future to try out lunch and/or dinner.

gCoDixistsemkIyjovwe3A.text: Had a birthday dinner here. Food was fabulous and service was great. They took a while in delivering an appetizer, but we didn't care because we were enjoying our conversation and didn't even realize the time, but the manager came over, apologized, and comped it. Can't go wrong with the French dip prime rib sandwich, braised short ribs, fried chicken and quinoa salad.

IDb83VeIXIZH100A5YMwCQ.text: So I came here with my wife for a last minute date night, we were lucky to be seated right away and of a place of our choosing. We started with fried oysters, 6 raw oysters, bacon wrapped dates, steak tartare, octopus roasted  and later added hanger steak. The fried oysters were very average however the rest of the food was very good. The steak tartare was the best I've ever had even with us having to send it back because the poached egg was pretty much raw however it was amazing. The oysters were good (once we got them) and the vinergrette that came with it was very tasty. The oysters were a dollar each on Wednesday and they were very good, I've done a lot of cheap oyster days and air of the time they use average oysters however these were good and the vinergrette really complemented it. The dates were pretty tasty   And the octopus was delicious so perfectly cooked. The hanger steak was very good as well. I base al my reviews on what you pay and what you get for the price, on this day they were very poorly staffed and we literally had problem after problem with the service, I have to admit the brunette female manager was very very good she was out working with the waiter for the entire area and as a business owner myself I have to admit she did everything she could to fix the situation and make everyone's experience that much better. If it wasn't for her I wouldn't come back because the service was so poorly under staffed however we  now will be.   Oh and the drinks were tasty.

CYy0VQamQ9RTshwR9xATWw.text: We came here on a nice evening and sat at the patio during sunset. The view and ambiance in the patio was amazing. It was very spacious and had a country side rustic feel to it. I enjoyed this place cause I felt as if I was not in Vegas but in the country side minus the parking lot haha Our server was very friendly and helpful! I will definitely want to come back here for their happy hour. The portions here were great to share with a group we ordered   Baked truffle ricotta: very good and tasty it has honey in it which gives a slight sweet taste to it and is served in a mini cast iron skillet. Truffle mushroom pizza: baked to perfection and had the right amount of cheese to dough ratio. The truffle flavor was not overwhelming at all Lollipop chicken wings: small bite size chicken tossed in a buffalo sauce that was not too tarty and had the right amount of spicy kick to it Tuna tartare: I really enjoyed this dish it came with wonton chips and the fish tasted fresh.  If you check in you get a glass of wine on the house and that was a plus! I had another drink called the blackberry bliss which was a very refreshing Moscow mule with a kick of blackberry flavoring to it   Great place and great ambience I recommend dining out in the patio !

0wJK4HBuBJ5Fpvs52PodSA.text: I'd like to start off by saying that I have never written a review, but my experience at this establishment was so bad that I felt like I needed to. I went to Hearthstone to grab a drink with a friend and our bartender, Kelsey, was one of the most unwelcoming people I have ever experienced. She didn't acknowledge us at all. I had to stop her and ask her for a drink menu, and she seemed extremely annoyed that I did that. She shoved a drink menu over to us without saying a word and walked away. It took 10 minutes for us to get our drinks and we were not shown any kind of customer service. Will not be coming back.

Z6OssnQ-A_tIKpklLlpJww.text: I've never liked the food here, but always enjoyed the atmosphere (nice lounge and patio). After our experience on NYE I will never be back. Reservations not honored, ticket prices increased at 9 pm day of, terrible service... I tried reaching out to management to voice my concerns, and didn't get so much as an acknowledgement. Horrible management and service!!

mE3kjOWRpMXH1rZFdKhA9g.text: Always good food. Great ingredients and wonderfully prepared. After living in NYC, Los Angeles, and San Francisco, I'm very partial to farm-to-table restaurants and I'm thrilled to have found Hearthstone after moving to Vegas earlier this year. The service is always pretty good. I have to say, however, that Jessica stands out for her genuine nature and thoughtfulness. She is attentive and friendly without being overbearing. She is a gem even amongst the high bar of service at Hearthstone. (As someone who used to work in the service/hospitality industry, this is a high compliment!!!)

eIGDeU6G7nwggsj90IsjBA.text: I've only been here once but I wasn't really impressed. I went with some friends after playing bingo and we got in for their happy hour, which was half price pizza. It was still 10 for a personal  thin pizza, which I think is a little pricey. I ended getting the pepperoni one and just water. I thought the outside area was really beautiful and the night we went the weather was great but it was a let down. Maybe my friend just hyped it up a little too much. I was expecting something better. I guess I should have tried something different. The service was good, our server was nice, answered our questions and always had our water filled. I need to try some other things and get a better taste of the place. I think the pizza just wasn't the best thing to have.

tTYYe4ecHT0cbVhzXPAEFQ.text: Now that I have eaten here several more times I have to update my review to add that fifth star!   The pizzas are out this world delicious. My favorite one is the Abe Froman (yes, that's the sausage king of Chicago). But they're all quite good.  The wine selection is huge, so you're bound to find something you love.  The outdoor seating is a fun place to people watch and enjoy the beautiful decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Abe Froman
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese plate? Yes please!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy yummy meatballs!!!

DTOQuQ44hovwxGw1-Jji7Q.text: Ahmed was a great waiter. Oyster Wednesday rocks. The lobster in the seafood platter was not great, but the shrimp & oysters were really good. Octopus is very tasty, short ribs were very good too. Service & cocktails were amazing!

2BZaqIR_JkCH1ANV-N-qPA.text: My friends were disappointed to have water served in glasses that smelled. Six glasses placed on the table and the odor smelled like rotten fish.

iWWo83DljBRnwFGvo-BD_w.text: Kelsey and Brooke are THE BEST!! Give them a raise!!! Or we WALK!!!!! Good night!! They treated Tony Orlando very nicely too!!

lJcL7GhTzujJvX-a7IhAEA.text: Wonderful place to brunch on the Westside at the gorgeous Red Rock Hotel. Start with the Cinnamon roll- gooey sinful deliciousness! Great bottomless mimosas and I ordered the newest item on the menu- the French Dip on a soft pretzel hoagie- to die for! The service was fantastic from hostess to server. Fun and yummy! Great decor, too with seafood "market".

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CINNAMON ROLL- to die for!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Cream Granola Parfait
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Truffle pizza!

C94VS_6awuyIZlh-Ut6u-w.text: This is not a favorite place of mine,  the food is meh, the 50% off pizza on sunday(not allowed to pay with points for discount), which no disclaimer on the board and/ or told by the waitress... I was not crazy about the Brussels sprouts Caesar salad- with radishes, I hate radishes, the wait staff was ok. Noisy place, I rather go to yard house next door, better menu.

MQFVYyjGisDCpHWX33NnlA.text: Oyster me crazy!!!!   I'm a huge Oyster fan and Hearthstone has some of the best oysters in Las Vegas. Wednesday they have $1 oysters and its one of my favorite days to come down here, also you can earn Station's Rewards on your Boarding Pass dining here, so don't forget to give them your card when closing out. They also have a great happy hour from 5-7 so get down here. I plan on doing the whole pig roast feast here soon so I'll update and add pics when I do.   Employee's are friendly and service is always great even when their slammed, Jocelyn is my Favorite Bartender, she's a total Doll and makes such great cocktails. The kitchen staff you see behind the Raw Bar always have a smile on their face also however concerning the kitchen, sometimes depending on who's Shucking, it's only happened on Wednesdays I've gotten a huge amount of broken shell in my oysters but I know Shucking at easy expecially on Wednesday when they're a buck a shuck and every guest orders their own dozen, this has only happened a few times and it's hot that big if a deal but super annoying when you chomp down on shell. But that's been my only complaint on over 20 visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lSg6rit1hr1STSB2FcO9nA.text: Had a party of 8 on a Friday night with a reservation. Arrived on time but our table wasn't set. Finally got sat with no menus. After asking for menus we were given them. A little later the waiter came and took our drink order. Slowly our drinks arrived one by one. Same thing happened with our food order. One meal at a time over probably 20 minutes. My wine finally came right before my meal. We spend 2.5 hours trying to be served dinner. As far as the food goes, it was average at best. I won't be going back anytime soon.

QNmThjz-c7n6qa7G2qBFsg.text: If I can give this place a minus stars I would. I Attended a networking event by two of the most  influential people I know, Candy & Charles, they bring anywhere from 50-100 business professionals together. They reserved the lounge area and found that not only did the venue double booked, they gave the lounge away to another group. They had us in their dining area which made it a tight situation. I came hungry because it was my intention to patronize the venue. Our group was ordering meals & drinks while we networked. I was speaking to someone when I get a tap from Sarah Bryner (who I later found out is the GM) in a very abrupt manner, she told me I need to move my drinks from the table because they are moving the table outside, no explanation. Before I can move my drinks, HER bus boy puts his hand on my drinks and proceeds to take it away. I told him to not put his hands on my glass since I was still drinking them.  They also proceeded to move the table outside in grand fashion, with our items still on it, insuring maximum humiliation. When we finally had a conversation with Sarah Bryner, I was shocked to find that she took no responsibility for any operations in her restaurant, including how she behaved towards me, and how she mishandled this whole situation. She didn't book the reservation so it's not her fault it was double booked, she didn't grab my glass so it's not her fault. She didn't bother to really listen to Candy & Charles' concerns , rather, she continued to interrupt them with "I didn't do that, so I can't apologize for that".  Needless to say, I left hungry because I didn't get to enjoy the after networking sit down dinner I had planned to have at the restaurant (would you, after such a treatment?) I was starving, so I ended up at Raising Cane's AND guess what? I got better service from a teenager in a T-shirt. What does that say about Hearthstone?

zlyRAKcj04K6xEDg4bEZ_w.text: We ordered the hanger steak, mashed potatoes, jalapeno hummus, and their special which was the crab. We also had 3 different glasses of their pinot noir.   The hanger steak was delicious and so was the frites that came with it. I really enjoyed their mashed potatoes too. The jalapeno hummus was good but nothing special. I was unhappy with the crab. I had high hopes and was excited but was definitely disappointed. All 3 glasses of pinot were good. It went from okay to pretty good by order of free (yelp check in) and escalating price. Portions weren't that large, especially for the price. Service was great too, very attentive but not annoying.

6LLpGSF9rQ48aLkUlOlOxQ.text: I love this place! Their food is absolutely amazing. Try the D.O.C. Flatbread pizza and Black Truffle Hanger Steak. It's really good! Their whole menu is pretty awesome. Super trendy food and location. Highly recommended!

1uU5MBBTrNsCPxdB5UP7Rg.text: This restaurant is okay, but not worth the money or the wait. We're told 30 minutes and went up and asked after 40 minutes and she took us right back. Coffee was hot, but cream was almost frozen, so immediately made the coffee cold.Toast was served with no butter or jam. Asked for hashbrowns, which were $6 and looked exactly like McDonald's, but with less flavor. Save your money and go to a breakfast place if you just want bacon and eggs.

Npc5GENpFiMAfd-mTQDG9g.text: For starters this place had a sweet vibe! Great atmosphere especially on a weekend which is when I was there. Very unique decorations give it a cool feel and its own sort of pizzazz. TVs all around so you don't have to worry about missing a game! Food was excellent, easily the best steak I've had in town by far! My friend got a pepperoni pizza and I couldn't resist but try it and man it was worth every penny let me tell you! Staff was also pleasant to be around which is a huge plus in my books. Our server was on top of it all night and very friendly!Will no doubt bring friends here on our next time out because this place was well worth it!

hgUd5izAjb2ngu7r7_xsgw.text: So we decided to do a girls night out, and my friend chose this place.  On Thursdays, they have wine tasting (Wine drinking).  It was really cool!  This is a very, upscale place, there appetizers aren't your normal appetizers!  Excuse me if  I spell this stuff wrong!  Duck liver (Foie gras) I looked it up!  lol  And Bacon covered dates, and steak Tartare (minced raw steak).  Sorry, I don't care for any kind of liver, I don't like dates, and I like my steaks med well!  So what they were serving up didn't sit well with me.   Then I guess they roasted a lamb with polenta!    I don't care for either one of those.  So needless to say, I didn't eat anything, but the wine......Which was the star attraction!   Was amazing!  I did know the name of it, but by the end of the evening........I forgot what it was, but it   was so good!  I'm pretty sure there doing it again this Thursday 12/18/14 if I didn't have plans already, I would be there!  Go check it out!  It was free!

0GkySD1pixfc0S4MR9wlhQ.text: came here for a family dinner. the drinks were great, food was amazing. only complaint was the food took a really long time. we got our appetizers after our dinner BUT the manager comped them off the bill and came over and apologized, which is great and very nice. we want to come back and try brunch!

bucqxBLs9bxIIJP3neuk1Q.text: Had a party there for 18 people, service, food, drinks, everything was absolutely perfect! Very accommodating, zero issues!

fnC6T7GiNZmJfxoLoohFfw.text: This place is a waste of time and money. Literally they wasted 3 hours of our night. Thank goodness we made up for it with friendly conversation with ourselves.  The portions the five for the sharing plates and flatbreads are enough for one, however for 28 dollars you would think the Waygu Beef short ribs would be bigger than two measly squared pieces. The flavor and texture was good, but when I spend that much I want more than 4 oz of meat. The pasta dish was I'd guess a half cup for 24. Again not worth it. The biggest problem was the way they handle business. They told us they could get us right in on a Saturday night but needed to bus the table. It took 20 minutes to bus the table. After 8 of us were done eating, they finally brought out our entrees (beef and pasta) for those who ordered it; we felt the need to share our discontent with the server who then got the manager. Rather than the manager being cordial he was a straight up pompous douche. He spent 20 minutes giving us excuses as to why they took 3 hours and how it is standard operating procedure.  Do not go here. Nothing would make me happier than to see something else in its place the next time I am at the Red Rock.

8Ew3ThEovQJ5c-cyUvtMxw.text: I feel like I've been living under a rock, how long has this place been here? It is definitely on my favorite list. If someone told me to drive to Red Rock Casino for a pizza I'd call them crazy, but I will be driving over there for just their pizza alone! Foie Gras: amazing, better than on the strip. Deviled eggs, their salads and breads were all too delicious. Very happy to see such  restaurant off the strip and will be coming back to explore the menu further.

1uixFG-zFkiSkT41IzQ4sA.text: We decided to check this place out because it was off the strip and we'd heard really good things about it. When we arrived we were greeted by a happy hostess...the energy in the room was really good...everyone looked like they were having a good time. We didn't have reservations but were able to get a booth the was facing to the two hearthstone ovens. We started off with the beet salad which was very tasty...I wanted more but had to save room for the authentic Italian pizza we decided to try next...the prosciutto and poached egg on this pie stood out from any other I'd had before! I heard this place has a dedicated world class pizza chef! We tried the crab legs and the NY Sirloin for our main dishes and I paired it with a nice glass of red - Our server was very friendly, knowledgeable, and checked up on us regularly. I will definitely be back!

ecAzqRhcPa_WlAZkU-b9oA.text: Great looking place. Food was good. Ran into an issue where my card was double charged but spoke with the manager and he apologized and took care of everything. Will be going back there soon.

4jLOTg2A-R27sxSoChWHCQ.text: We almost did not eat here due to the 3.5 yelp rating. Good lesson for us! Food was awesome, service was great, and the design is beautiful. All in all (ignore the casino through one door and desert out the other door) and this place reminds me of a high quality restaurant in Manhattan. The dishes are petite and pricey, but lovely and incredibly tasty. Fresh squeezed watermelon juice hit the spot for brunch.

TQC0UuzuvrcH0BdQPedVLA.text: Huge disappointment! When we first walked in to the restaurant I had a really good vibe. Friendly hostess at the front and really nice decor. Our reservations were at 630pm and the rest of our party got there around 645. I'm hoping our main server was new because she seemed afraid to talk and was very unorganized. The second server that was helping was very confident and friendly.  My husband and I ordered the pizza special which was duck and prosciutto pizza, the wagyu short rib burger, the meat and cheese platter and the jalapeno hummus. We were a table of 12 so when everyone's food started to come out at different times at first it was understandable. About 30 mins into the meal glasses were empty and sat empty for a while. No water or alcohol to help ease the pain of waiting over 2 hours for our main course. One of our friends dishes was completely forgotten, our burger was not ordered and another friends cheese dish was not brought out (they only gave him bread, no cheese).  To add to the unorganized mess, our $21.00 yes I said $21.00 wagyu short rib burger was a total waste of money. They did a really good job making the exact replica of  the animal sauce at inn n out burger and it was overcooked. I would rather pay half the price for a black truffle cheeseburger a couple doors down at the yard house. The duck prosciutto pizza which was $19.00 had a few little pieces of duck that you could barely see/taste and a little tiny slice of prosciutto on each slice of pizza. Again not worth it.  To end the 3 hour long dinner the male server asks how things were and I told him it was OK. I normally don't like to complain but he asked me for my "honest opinion" twice more (I guess because he saw we only took a few bites of our $21 burger and not even trying the fries) so I told him in a nice way what I thought. Mentioning everything from the forgotten dishes to the 2 hour wait for our main course and the ridiculously priced burgers.  He tells us "oh yes I heard about the forgotten dishes and the two our wait for food" and apologized to our table offering a couple of free desserts. We kindly declined because at this point we didn't want to wait another hour for our dessert to arrive. When we received our bill the only thing that was taken off was one of the forgotten dishes. No manager came over to speak with us or anything. There are more negative things to add to this review but it is long enough already. I had really high hopes for this restaurant but will never be going back to this place.

hMHWA8wOgs--RSKPihLvXw.text: Everything was wonderful! Servers were great, drinks were yummy, and the food was amazing.

tNV5l0jBjevSx-T2MXWsBQ.text: Good food and reasonable price excellent service we Love the place it is located in Red Rock Casino a good location

bDf0NE8BqSYO8cT3F5I6DQ.text: Beautifully presented bland food. Everything looked and sounded appetizing but after taking a few bites I realized the flavors were not there. I could tell there was a lot of "hidden salt" in the food because I (and everyone else at our table) kept getting refill after refill on our drinks .. I'm still thirsty, now! The Gouda Mac n cheese needed a blend of a sharp cheese to complement the rest of the flavors. The chorizo stuffed dates need a better quality bacon and cooked a little longer for a crispy outer finish. It was soggy .. Gross! The meat and cheese platter didn't excite me either, it didn't provide a wow factor where I could set it apart from other restaurants meat and cheese platters. The service was a bit dusty and could use better training. Many times we had to ask for plates and utensils. The server didn't know the menu very well either which wasn't very helpful as it was our first visit to the restaurant. Aside from all that, the staff was very nice and approachable, the restaurant was set up beautifully and the dessert was UH-MAZE-ING!! It was a Peanut Butter Butterscotch Lava Cake topped with whipped cream, crushed peanuts and a side of banana ice cream. I must say it's probably one of the best desserts I've had , ever! All the textures and flavors were there. The best part is when I cut into the cake and all of the warm caramel-like filling came oozing out. And for the perfect bite you have to get a little bit of everything on your spoon and it's heaven in your mouth!
