qa9cajH1CUMHPv656oqafw.text: Monday night football, the wings, the atmosphere, did I mention the wings?!! You could order anything off the menu and not be disappointed! They have tables with couches, high tops, games, and their happy hour is completely worth it! Highly recommend!

9Ruf89ArtAi9-EXgHi9MUg.text: Came here for the AYCE $10 wings on national wings day. Wings were drenched in butter, not bad. Service left lots to be desired. Our table was constantly ignored and the server had an attitude. Not sure what his issue was but he was being dismissive and generally rude. It didn't help that we came in later in the day where it wasn't as busy.

iTBMY0t9NpfLcEuCAUVDoQ.text: The food is fabulous! The new general manager is making it the new it spot in Las Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poached salmon is fabulous!

6AQDWx89gqXU5Rb8ToLKBg.text: The employees look miserable and it reflects onto their service. I ordered a meal and forgot my burger, and my daughter's burger was missing cheese, so I took it back and it took them 15 minutes to get us another. By that time everyone else was done eating. The service gave my food a sour taste.

RwiZtWOKVy0WiLHRb0H_nw.text: This is an awesome place friends and I visited red rock casino for 3 days and all 3 we came to this place!! The manager Sarah was awesome and the bartender Taylor S really was a delight on Sunday!! When I do come back we will be staying at red rock and dining here often!!

V1NENbcdDru6gqqvhBY-Og.text: Tien is an amazing waitress. Funny, all smiles, and very friendly. Ask for her when you visit! You'll have a great dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The suckling pig tasted as amazing as it looked.

z4OGKqhrF0KrRAAgAB_wqA.text: Jessica G was amazing! We will definitely be back! We had the meatballs, ricotta truffle cheese and everything was superb!

4rVpffO6gq-YYeel-ss_HA.text: What a cool inviting restaurant. Makes you feel like your in your grandmas kitchen with all the sites and smells to go along with it. We found Hearthstone warm and inviting and can't wait for warmer weather to sit outside and enjoy the patio. We had the deviled eggs first and the pimento cheese center adds to the flavor. Next came the meatballs with an outstanding marinara sauce that I couldn't get enough of. A pepperoni & mozzarella flat bread pizza rounded off the meal then a nice glass of Merlot on the couch was a great way to relax and just take it all in. We'll be back to try the 40oz porterhouse for two.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must try is the Meatballs with an excellent marinara sauce.
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled Egg&#39;s with pimento cheese centers are excellent.

SG-m7B8picMQ5eHJUhmFnA.text: Hearthstone is a five-star eatery! The atmosphere is inviting and relaxing. The staff are exceptionally friendly and very nice. The food is amazing! Some of the dishes are cleverly named. I like the Abe Froman sausage flatbread, as does Ferris Beuller!  The deviled egg appetizer is exquisite. The meatballs rock, as does the cheddar popcorn. I've not tasted anything that wasn't spectacular. I didn't particularly care for the sight of a baby suckling pig roasting on a spit but the pork dishes are amazing. Overall, the place seems extremely well managed. Highly recommended and I cant necessarily say that about other Red Rock Resort restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hYH5WyjWqGB1wK-h81Y42g.text: Food is always excellent. The Sunday brunches are amazing . Showed up for Super Bowl without reservations and manager was able to make accommodations for us despite having a full house. They also serve the quality " fever tree" brand of ginger beer in their Moscow mules. Many restaurants use other cheaper brands that are not as good.

ZDCs4-tmQmWiVo7q0zxjaA.text: Absolutely loved the atmosphere and most of our food! Environment has an eclectic, trendy vibe with comfortable seating and noise levels. Seems to be very popular with the young professional crowd.  We ended up trying the charcuterie board, baked ricotta, meatballs, carbonara flatbread and fire roasted clams. Everything was exceptional with some unique flavors, especially the truffle honey. The only miss was the flatbread. It was soggy and the shaved onions gave it a slimy texture.  Service was acceptable. Our waitress knew the menu and made solid recommendations. Timing was good until the very end. We waited way too long for our bill and we were ready to go.  We will defiantly be going back to try more of the very large menu!!!

7NZzne9PSei3p7KMkQC_TA.text: Excellent spot if you want to take a load off outside the Strip area or if you're staying in the surrounding Summerlin area. The space is truly awesome - it's huge with a rustic decor and a slight sports bar feel. Wooden tables of all sizes with options of bar stools, chairs and couches to plant your butt down.  The menu is pretty sinful with some healthy options. We had the chicken salad sandwich, salted caramel french toast and sangria. Such a perfect lunch for a warm day.  Service with a smile, very efficient and friendly.  Highly recommend and can't wait to visit again with a hungry tummy.

jg0n4XJjKy2aJXgVr2JD-A.text: Jessica G was awesome! Excellent food and service. Wine was excellent as well as the baked ricotta and meatballs. We finished off with the meat and cheese plate and it was perfection. If you're looking for a great wine and dine night, this is the spot. We absolutely will be back!

JOdhVbZ3Rzlwfv7-ctTbDQ.text: 3 1/2 stars.   We made a reservation for 4 on Saturday night. We had to wait in the lounge about 20 minutes past our reservation time. No biggie. We reviewed the menu and chatted.   I didn't drink but my dining compadres had mixed reviews of their cocktails. One good, one bad. Pricey, as expected, around $12.   Ambiance is very cool. Decor is awesome. It's noisy and upbeat inside. Casual, hip, and comfy all at once. Nice room. Perfect spot for a drink and some snacks. There's shuffleboard too.   We tried loads of items and shared everything. Grilled octopus, stuffed dates, four gras mousse, clams, tuna carpaccio, pork rillette, mozzarella flatbread, meatballs, squash. They will give you bread upon request which was needed. There was not enough served with the rillette or foie. The stunners were the octopus and dates. The octopus was so flavorful and tender. The dates were big and scrumptious. It was very cool that the server offered to change the serving to 4 so we could each have one. The squash was under seasoned and cold. The rillette was very bland. Clams had a delicious favor but were tiny so a bit dry. Foie mousse was good but very light on the foie flavor. Carpaccio and flatbread were tasty.   Service was over zealous. They were super upbeat and friendly but we were slightly over served. There was constantly, and I mean constantly, someone asking how we were, asking to clear plates, filling water etc. I told 6 people I wasn't done with a plate because I was dipping bread in the sauce. I finally gave up and let them take it away. Arguably, this is not a bad thing. We certainly got everything we needed and had plenty of attention. But, it was to the point where you couldn't finish a sentence in the conversation without being interrupted.   We had the peanut butter lava cake filled with butterscotch and finished with banana ice cream. Absolute perfection. Very clever and delicious.   All in all, a very nice and delicious experience. I would definitely return. Items are great to share for 2 people. Most are too small to share with 4.   6 drinks, and bunches of tapas was $211 for 4, so $251 with tip. Certainly a pricier than usual dinner, but a fun addition to Summerlin.

NLX1rXt2tL3gLqzAkxzFXw.text: Favorite off the strip restaurant. All amazing food with great service. Restaurant has a very modern feel with an at home likeness. Recommend the meatballs for sure. Very tender and flavorful!

ybozFfTrkEf3QYam21PW6A.text: Place is amazing, great chefs, great front house, awesome service.  And the food is so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WIlfOK3WQAs1cmW4hGjhaA.text: 04/10/16 BRUNCH  Some observations.  NEGATIVE: As they were staying on-property (the Red Rock Resort) a friend called to make a reservation for brunch here a few days prior. They asked the hostess for a table at 130pm for eight people, explicitly stating that two in the party were in wheelchairs. My spouse and I arrived minutes in advance of everyone else to find that a high-top was being held instead of standard tables. My spouse told the hostess we needed to change to standard tables due to two being in wheelchairs. It took until after 2pm before we were finally seated.  POSITIVE/NEGATIVE: We were given food menus but not drink menus. There were a few drink "specials" listed in the food menus, one being a bottomless mimosa using Mumm sparkling wine for $24. When I asked about other possible options the server said there was another bottomless mimosa I could order that was only $14 because it used a cheaper sparkling instead of Mumm. So why wasn't the cheaper mimosa listed on the menu? And why wasn't a drink menu offered to the table, with that cheaper mimosa listed? Does management assume since they are located in Summerlin they serve nothing but "deep pockets" clientele? No matter, the spouse and I ordered $14 bottomless mimosas.  POSITIVE: After ordering our food the complementary pastries the staff delivered to the table were lovely.  NEGATIVE: For my brunch I ordered their $21 chicken & waffles, as did one other person at the table. Expecting a rather healthy portion of each, I was sadly mistaken. Later I told my spouse the chicken, as well as the two small round waffles cut into quarters, were overcooked. Also, of the two tiny pieces of chicken given to me, one was filled with gristle. Funny thing is, the other person at the table who had ordered the exact same dish told their spouse the exact same thing I had said, which I discovered later after I spoke with their spouse. This was absolutely one of the worst plates of food I have ever been presented in Las Vegas, and I've now lived in Vegas for over five years. The only reason I did not send it back was because our friends at the table had a limited time to be present, as two had to be on a bus headed to the airport, and we had already lost over 30 minutes with the mistake regarding the table at the very beginning of the brunch.  POSITIVE: The carafes of bottomless mimosas came continuously.  NEGATIVE: My spouse paid our check, but during the process became distracted by the other guests, so they didn't check the prices carefully. Turns out the $14 bottomless mimosas were charged as $15 each.  Considering the condition of my food order as well as the overall expense (after tax and tip it was $89+ for the two of us), I doubt we'll ever return here. Well, except perhaps to drink cheap mimosas and eat comp'd pastries.

RNZ3xbSPZsovLLppe_bzYw.text: Great Ambiance you feel like you're in some upscale spot in LA or New York and they got some table shuffleboard in the corner great cocktails into this Farm to Table with a lot of great seafood and chicken and beef dishes. Cucumber 10 carat craft cocktails were both great along with the cheese plate and the fried chicken

QxSIHFWy1t-2JYLIDaUBYw.text: Had brunch here and it was great! I really wanted to sit outside...but instead took one of the sofa seating options near the patio. The food was spectacular! I had the duck and waffles... The duck basically fell off the chicken bone! I also ordered the cinnamon roll which was pretty yummy. I can't wait to try them out for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck and waffles!

82wJCi3JPjiSohOfDsg_Kg.text: We came here for the free Thursday night wine tasting and stayed to get some appetizers and food. The food here while pricy is excellent. We ordered the baked ricotta which was awesome, the meatballs were good but you only get 3 in an order. We also ordered the meat and cheese tray which was also quite good. Definitely try the truffle honey! Our waitress Jessica G. was awesome! She was super friendly and knowledgable. The resultant overall has a cool vibe and is very modern. It was too cold outside but I would definitely like to sit out on the patio. We will definitely be coming back soon! :)

TEnxZZIM5NuRYiGpc_Tn9w.text: I love Brian Massie's take on the menu at FIX at Bellagio (he has since left) so I couldn't wait to try Hearthstone.   Love the "from-the-hearth"-style social plates cooking. The kale caesar salad was delicious and the charcuterie board was spot on (and served on a cute little wooden piggy!).  The 'toast and jars' is a cute idea and reminds me of FIX a bit. The ricotta and honey jar paired great with the toast.   The atmosphere is trying a little too hard to fit the, 'hipster-we're-different-but-all-the-same' bill...a little inauthentic. And service was definitely shaky; we had two interchangeable waiters that kept repeating the same requests, resulting in neither bringing what was offered.   Hopefully they polish up the service soon because I'd love to come back again.

ABev_MISJHWqhuEH_HEiwA.text: Ordered the steak tartare and it is the BOMB! The only downside, for me personally, is that the music is too loud and me and my friend had to yell at each other. Don't get me wrong, the music is good, just too loud to have a normal conversation. So don't come if you are looking for a quiet environment where you can hear each other, but definitely come here for good food. Shout out to our server Jesus for taking good care of us!

tnjfv2MyrnESqGQFr7QVag.text: Comfy, cozy, warm hearted! We came for Easter Sunday brunch and everything was perfect. They have an entire brunch and drink menu that has great choices! Family oriented or great for a date night. The decor is welcoming and entertaining. Also great craft cocktails! The manager Diane is amazing too! Definitely make reservations if you anticipate it to be busy. Its worth the wait.

WyNHqaVYvbhcbYILzaMhzw.text: Happy hour. Live music.  Really enjoy the singer Ive seen here the last couple times.  This is the place I like to go when I want to hang out and stay a while.  And they have an attractive staff ;).   Meat and cheese plate to enjoy my bottle of wine. They keep it simple. Two cheeses and two meats. The calamari, love when it is on the thick side firm but tender.  Rotisserie chicken with mashed potatoes really filled me up.    I have to say I do need to be careful.  Everytime my bill adds up higher than I anticipate.  I do spend more here over other places.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rotisserie
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

kW4zDvtgKHtJoHCc15CxPg.text: Came here after seeing they offered $1 oysters Wednesday nights on unloktlv. My husband and our roommates all enjoyed this restaurant. The lighting is dim when you sit so there's candles on each table.   We all ordered 2 dozen oysters each and I also had a pizza on the side. The oysters were fresh and delicious. I liked one of the sauces it came with and asked the waiter to bring more of that sauce since I had run out after eating 6 of my oysters. The pizza was a good supplement to the oysters and helped me to get full. My roommates got their chicken pot pie which they raved about. They said it was amazing, fluffy, and delicious.   Overall, we all enjoyed our experience here and have said we would come back and try this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $1 oysters
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dTAZdexGYUORR_NeTDDgVg.text: So I wrote a dinner review and it was amazing. I was invited back by Ahmed for brunch. So we checked it out today. It was amaaaaazing and he was even better. The loco moco is so Hawaiian and great.  Bottomless mimosas at $15 is buzz inducing ;) and well priced. Just go and if u can ask for him  Just went back today for bottomless mimosas and brunch! Had an amazing maple breakfast pizza for appetizer that was incredible with California Benedict that was so unique with avocado and a poached egg and the loco moco which was soooo satisfying. Of course, our server Ahmed took such good care of us again and made sure we had a fabulous time. Always a pleasure at Hearthstone!

-7AyJ8ECaFCXBsvI4G0p5A.text: This was my second visit to Hearth. I stayed at Red Rock for CES to get away from the nightmare on the Strip.  I told my main waitress, Melissa, that if the rest of the world was run as well as this place our problems would be over.  Excellent management as demonstrated by consistently passionate, happy and attentive staff.  I couldn't blink without Melissa rushing across the room to top up my wine glass.  The food was excellent with a well conceived menu that made selecting a dish very difficult.  I chose the prime rib, a super fresh salad and au gratin potatoes.  They brought out two little bowls of coarse salt and pepper at my request. Very nice.  Also their bread is delicious. Do try it if you eat bread. The atmosphere is lively but warm.  You can be comfortable solo (as I was), as a group big or small, or as a romantic couple.  The space is just designed that way.  I chose to sit at the kitchen bar in a very comfortable chair.    Prices are very fair, and I don't hesitate to recommend coming here. On my next trip to RR in LV, I will be certain to come back for dinner.  If I were an aspiring restaurateur I'd work here to learn how to do things right.

rMPiotdNBl9kS5xBzYIWBw.text: Great meeting place w/ people.  Love this place!!  Delicious food & great service!! Highly recommend it as a go to place to meet w/ a group of friends or family ~ FUN !!

p9B-a4pV0aCK7LeSaeD--w.text: Our office had our annual holiday Christmas party here for dinner, and it was a great choose. We had a 4 course meal for the dinner part of our shindig with 3 entree choices. I decided to go with the Filet Mignon, and I thought it was wonderful, but I thought it was interesting that the wait staff didn't ask me how I wanted it cooked. They brought it out cooked a little more-so than I normally have my meat-dishes cooked as I typically like them on the rare side.  Other than that the service was great, I thought that they accommodated our party of 20+ pretty well. Our waiter kept the Macallan's coming.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BoDjCx4xoskLKuTiJI7LFQ.text: Came here with my wife on V-day, The place was filled with people but the amazing design gave each couple there on privacy. Tho hostess with the amazing blue eyes recommend that we sit on the sofa, we listened to her, that was the best recommendation!!!  Service: we had cristal as a server, I don't remember I had such a professional server in a long time. She was amazing!  The food was ok, we didn't eat anything fancy....  Will be back for sure!

QE9BsKwhZCqgr9_yKgx9Bg.text: This place is nice, for sure, but not the greatest.  I guess I had higher expectations for this location. I always look for something different and unique that makes me want to come back just for that particular dish.  The service and that staff were on point. Our server was super nice, and our food was served promptly.  The food was really good. I got the Lobster boil, which I feel should have been served different. I mean, it could have been cracked to make it easier to open so that I can enjoy the meal rather than fighting with the darn thing. I rather get down and dirty to eat like this if I was at a Boiling Crab/Hot N' Juicy where guest are properly equipped to eat in that sort of fashion. The meat from the lobster tail could have at least pulled out. Anyway, the lobster was cooked very well as well as the potatoes and the sausage. My husband ordered the braised short rib. It was pretty good, but the serving was so small. It had this creamy cheese-like thing that was not very appetizing to the both of us.  Overall, this place is just too overpriced for what it is. There wasn't a wow factor about this place that would make me come back. Four-stars was for the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Boil
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very small serving of over-priced Braised Short Rib

jV_W6BZJsrsgWZQFiATNbQ.text: Ahmed was an amazing server and the food was great! The chicken, mushroom, bacon, truffle pizza was great!!! The chocolate birthday cake is the best dessert!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HWzt3hIhxFxFKJNSxVQlbA.text: Let's talk AESTHETIC. So good. So chic. The live music at night was great too. I got the vegan sliders. Ugh. Delish. My carnivore husband didn't know the difference between the plant based sliders and real meat. WIN. Slightly over priced for the amount of food you get, but great quality food nonetheless.

qrwfRapaDOFYovogFK9cOg.text: So, horrendous service & a lost reservation. Started out horrible, had to get our own water and cutlery?!? But once we were served, the food was okay and the manager comped our meal because he could see how upset we were. I'll go back on a non- holiday to give it a second chance.  One note- I made our reservation through Yelp, and the manager told us that system doesn't work(?) so all the confirmations I got were False. So  PS you need to ask for bread! They won't offer it.

1AIw4bWsi-by9QYrqYMBAA.text: The best place in Las Vegas to have a regular meal. And an absolutely great place to celebrate any occasion. Great food and great service.

znxKgrQlykxqDDnBal5bzw.text: Great food and service in a upbeat setting.  Widely varied menu assured that there will be something that meets the needs of your entire group.  Worth a try when at or near the Red Rock resort.

G77W3zVmwQ8JyNQJOGMWnQ.text: I came with my cousin to celebrate my "finally finishing" school. Service was great. They were all super friendly. Food came fast as well!   I had the lobster roll and came home extremely sick and threw all of it up. I've never had a bad experience with seafood before until last night. I had nothing else besides the sandwich.   At the time, everything was delicious and there was live music. I was going to recommend my boyfriend and roommates to come for brunch but I am greatly disappointed after what happened to me.

UidesudMixuO2skxv_wvIA.text: Seems like a nice restaurant but that is as much as I can tell you.  Kids are not welcome here and I made a 5:00 PM reservation, so the place was empty, and said I was coming with a kid and needed a high chair.  When we arrived, we were told the tables are for large parties only and we had to sit at a couch so that equated to leaning down to eat and reaching up to feed a kid.   I get that all places are not kid friendly but can you say so when a reservation is booked ahead? Ruined my evening and had to leave.  We were offered a table suddenly on the way out as well.  Will not be back to try the vegan menu that brought us there in the first place.

2BUZZzLC2V6mrMAwcnFGlw.text: A very cool place for a Meetup event. Our host is a great lady and prior to the event my friend and I ate at the bar. They offer a full service menu and handsome bartenders to bat!!! They had a great happy hour menu. The mini pizzas are fresh and personal with fresh rich cheese and meat if you eatit. So for vegetarians no shortage of options. For vegans there are some good items as well. Reasonably priced for a vintage modern ambiance. Good for a first or 50th date.

GPNCSmyRHkBIh4yd-5hplA.text: Fantastic place! We went here yesterday for a reception dinner after the hubby's brother got hitched! We had a private  dining room and started out with a prosecco toast.  Then came a flurry of apps : the meatballs, buffalo chicken wing lollipops, the charcuterie/cheese board, the Abe Froman pizza and the absolutely delicious baked ricotta! As you can tell the baked ricotta was my fav and if you go here I would say it should be a must on your list of things to order. So by the time allll of that was done oh and drinks too (several speciality cocktails all of which were strong and delicious!!) me and the hubby were way too full to order an actual dinner. So instead we each ordered one more app as our entrees. He got the tuna tartare and I got the grilled octopus.  Both were outstanding and I have to say that might have been the best cooking of octopus Iv ever had. It was sooooo tender it was like butter. His tartare was yummy though the pieces were cut rather large for a tartare. I'd call it more of a fusion poke and they served it with Indian style papper.  It also happened to be my mother in laws birthday so there was a surprise chocolate cake at the end which was a cute touch. The cake itself however wasn't that good. But frankly I didn't care being insanely stuffed full of delicious baked ricotta and octopus. Which is saying a lot for this chocolate lover!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Apple &amp; Quinoa Salad
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The espresso type martini

eRgx46H6jBvC5TEzhdbzew.text: We live in Henderson and went all the way to Hearthstone for Mother's Day. It was busy which is expected, especially on Mother's Day. The ambiance is open and beautiful. They have shuffle board in the back with a cute sitting area. We had Jayde as our server and she was sweet as can be, personable as can be and very attentive. Wonderful server. The manager was very visible the whole time. She came to tables and when she came to ours, we complimented our server and or experience to her. I asked her name and she replied Diane. It's so great to see a manager so attentive to her staff and customers. She was always smiling and nice see happy people. You can tell she enjoys her job. No wonder why her staff is so great, it starts from the top! I recommend this restaurant for sure. Ask for Jayde! After brunch, we stayed for a while, played shuffle board then the musical entertainment started. So happy we stayed because he was amazing! I thought it was a whole band and he's a one man show. So cool! He does covers and does them so well! I got his card, Dan Fester, is his name. He's amazing. Great experience overall!

m2XBR0fb3WIRgjsGJoHaEQ.text: We dropped by on a Sunday evening for dinner. I had a reservation, but we probably would've been fine without one.  The decor and ambiance of the restaurant is very nice. It definitely feels like a classy place. The service was friendly and attentive.  We had some oysters (delicious), the lobster roll (delicious) and the pork shoulder (pretty good too). The food is pricey, but generally very very good.  Overall quite a nice place to dine. It'll cost you pretty penny, but you'll very likely have a very nice dining experience.

Q1O6qMIfdobmco878rm8ug.text: Not good. Greasy. Poor quality. Casino food. Buffet food. Some happy hour. Immediate regret. As my wife agreed, pictures are deceiving. Pepperoni pizza was garbage grease. Fried chicken had the same orange grease. Not feeling too well as I write this review outside on their patio. Maybe I'm being too dramatic but I had some expectation  after reading the other reviews before coming here. We wanted to find a destination outside from the strip. This was not it. This was crap. Don't eat here. Sorry not sorry. Bleh

r1aBmnBWyoAhb5yp8wacqA.text: Back again for breakfast on Saturday they have a really good brunch you have to try it one day

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich I did no ham on it add avocado

VYyQqRUJizYz6WXM-w-s3w.text: This is a great weekend brunch place. They have tons of options and everything is presented so beautifully. This is the Avocado toast, second picture is the fruit plate, and the last pic is the lobster Benedict. It was easy to clean your plate here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit with Berry Compote
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Benedict*
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Toast

0c62pW64sngBP8Fu4StpZQ.text: When we first walked in, I immediately thought of how cute the place looked! Loved the ambiance of everything!   Jose was our server and he was super awesome! He gave us recommendations and would chat with us from time to time. Loved that he took the time to check back with us to make sure we were doing good. We appreciated his awesome customer service and his fun personality. Thumbs up for Jose!  We ordered 4 appetizers in which were the Bacon Wrapped Dates, Crispy Calamari, Lollipop Chicken Wings, and Prosciutto & Arugula Pizza (the pizza was not really an appetizer, but there were 4 of us and we were super hungry). It was all so tasty! My personal favorite were the Bacon Wrapped Dates.   We then ordered the medium size of the Shellfish Platters and it was shareable between the 4 of us. I personally thought it was yummy as well, but then I met the Braised Short Ribs and I couldn't get enough of it lol.   We ordered a couple of drinks. I had the Flower Bomb and it was bomb lol! It took me back for a second lol. Jose recommended this drink! It wasn't too extra on the sweetness. I also ordered the Endless Summer. This drink was also good, but it had a very sweet pineapple taste to it and so I switched back to the Flower Bomb.   As for desserts, we ordered the Nutella & Chocolate Pot de Creme, Kahlua Milkshake, and the Peanut Butter Lava Cake. Jose was awesome and brought out the Pineapple Upside Down Cake and the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding for us on him! Loved all of the desserts! I felt like we already ordered half the dessert menu lol.  Definitely try this place out if you're looking to try something new. Can't go wrong with this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M1cp5SQU3QPyB827EYhkcQ.text: Our resent trip to Vegas included an awesome dinner at The Hearthstone Kitchen and Cellar in Summerlin!  Our waitress, Elisa was fantastic! Very friendly & helpful!  She knows her stuff, helping us to pick the perfect Cabernet to go with our dinner selections. We will definitey go back! Vino Mondays are great!

gmJnVJSqynb0Pm_HJr1c-g.text: It was ok. I ate the fried chicken which was a little sweet for my taste and the breading was also a little too thick. The service was great but can't help but wonder if other selections would have made the experience better. The brussel sprouts were good, but not any better or worse than I've had elsewhere.

1cIlW-vChCnOjJElyJ59xg.text: We came here last night for our first time and it was a great experience! Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and made great recommendations for both drinks and food. We ordered the lollipop wings and calamari for appetizers. The lollipop wings were so good. Worth coming back just for those! For dinner we had the prosciutto pizza and the hanger steak with mashed potatoes and Brussel sprouts. The hanger steak was well-prepared and very tasty! Would definitely recommend trying it. Overall, we had a great time and truly enjoyed the food. Looking forward to coming back for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto pizza
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackberry Mule

t941gfiHXlqdf7Nks-hk1g.text: What an awesome restaurant! Hearthstone is a nice restaurant with a rustic, yet modern feel. It is noisy, but a perfect spot to go out with friends/family for good cocktails and delicious food.   Service - 5/5: Our server was perfectly timely, nice, and knowledgeable of the menu items. He made for a very pleasant experience.   Apps - 4/5: Oysters on the Half Shell (East Coast). These were delicious, however we ordered a dozen and only got eleven.    Cocktails - 5/5: Didn't order anything special. My girlfriend and I ordered Gin and Tonics. My Mom ordered "My Boy Blue" and a glass of wine. She loved them both.   Food - 5/5: I ordered the Hangar Steak that came with a side of steak fries. We ordered two sides for the table; Mac and Cheese and Brussel Sprouts. My girlfriend got the New York Strip and my Mom got the Prime Rib. All of it was incredible and cooked perfectly.   Overall, this was a fun and refreshing dinner experience and I'll definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Brussel Sprouts
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger Steak

Sc1iYzgICIUMyDRY3efFgg.text: Update - I had to change the stars to 4/5 thanks to the GM, Russell, and attentive and friendly server, Jayde.   After posting my last review, Russell reached out to apologize for the slack. My boyfriend and I went back in for dinner tonight and wow, talk about great food and great service.   We ordered the calamari, oysters, New York strip, and braised short rib. Everything was ridiculously tasty!! I had no complaints except for I should've ordered more oysters because those were perfect.   Jayde and Russell both made it a point to check up on us several times throughout our time there which I really appreciated.   Overall, a wonderful dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York strip - cooked perfectly!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glazed donut bread pudding, yum!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. East coast oysters

JXyktgJ-Emx5Wo2K8R0wIg.text: Absolutely delightful! I've only experienced Brunch here, but I would definitely plan on returning for dinner in the future. The food was delicious. I had an omelet with veggies and a side of bacon - every bite was amazing.   And bottomless mimosas for $18, great price plus the server (who was great) left carafes on the table so we truly felt like they were bottomless.

L9wqU5f5MhKQbuOgUZzWeQ.text: We were a little skeptical because they menu is unique and my hubby is a simple eater.  So glad we took the chance and decided to try this place out.  It was super busy for a Friday night so we decided to sit in the bar/lounge area.    I ordered a glass of the Australian Sauvignon blanc excellent choice!! Happy hour menu we ordered oysters and chicken wings.  Both items was awesome I ended up ordered a 2nd order of oysters.  Main dishes - hubby ordered the fried chicken with biscuits, it was very good a little sweet for my taste as I prefer spicy chicken but hubby loved it! With a side of garlic mash potatoes which was just okay.  I ordered the shrimp & grits! Excellent!! Tasty and the dish was pretty filling.  I'd definitely come back for this dish!   We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour oysters for $7
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits

XHk2MtCY6eRJh1BvcpPwgQ.text: We come here often and this review is only about the service not the food itself.  Came here with my family around 520 and was told we couldn't sit down due to not having a reservation. Went on opentable and saw there was an opening for 545.  A bunch of empty tables as well. They weren't able to honor that reservation -- I get it but warn others to call and make sure they can honor it because they stated "we honor those that make a reservation the night before not day of" -- uh?? That's not how it works. But the issue I had was how the lady at the front huffed and puffed about it and gave the worst hospitality she ran to the managers office to bring him out and he also did not give the best customer service.  Work with your customer. Don't give such attitude. I'll question coming here.

N6J7vfzhNKnDPbuHCWSoew.text: It's time to update my review for Hearthstone since I have been there 10 times and have stopped quite a few times since my last time there.  I stopped in Wednesday.  It's their $1 oyster night and it's a good bargain.  I got a half dozen oysters and then their pulled pork sandwich--pulled pork butt, Swiss cheese, ham, BBQ mustard, apple cabbage slaw, and spicy pickles.  It's almost like a Cuban but without that kind of bread and press grilling.  A good tasting sandwich served with shoestring fries.    For dessert, I went for something different on the menu, the Nutella chocolate pot de creme.  This was very rich and very good.  Two warm cookies were served with the dessert.  The heating melts the chocolate chips.  Be prepared to get chocolate on your hands but licking your fingers is quite appropriate!  My server was Ahmed and he was on top of everything such as getting a spoon for the dessert when he realized immediately why I was just sitting there and not diving into the Nutella/chocolate goodness.  Since Hearthstone is very good and so close to home, this is becoming a go to spot for myself and for taking friends visiting from out of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot de crème with warm chocolate chip cookies.
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella and chocolate pot de crème.
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork sandwich.

_n_DAAcgfIQvXBnetEkQyA.text: Noooo. What happened to this place. Going down hill fast! Last 3 times here, the food was very mediocre. Plus an extra charge for a drink that's not on the menu!?

zY8aSsJl2tZjxE_j9_w33Q.text: Very underrated brunch spot.  Bottomless mimosas run about $15 and they are not slow about topping you up. I usually come in larger parties and the servers have no trouble keeping up. Also, it rarely gets busy at brunch so you're not talking over your friends/screaming over the music.   The BEST menu item here is the breakfast pizza (brunch only item) comes with a soft poached egg, bacon, cheese, and maple syrup.   The Avocado toast is okay, it does come with various sprouts and is super aesthetic but I'd stick with some of their other menu items. (I'm picky about my avocado toast)  Almost everything else on the brunch menu is good, better than your average brunch restaurant. Other than the pizza I like the loco moco, prime rib French dip, and chicken & waffles. All the serving sizes are rather large so I like to order a few plates and share.   Come when it's nice out so you can sit in the cute outdoor seating section. This would be a good place to come watch a game as well, they have multiple TVs and bar seating.

dvlHnYlPtVjeqXkz8-x6fg.text: Celebrating is what was happening tonight we found this beautiful restaurant while guests of Red Rock. After all of the attention bestowed to the twins and their party; it was time for them to go to bed.   Twins go down and the adults get down. With my resent Tequila kick we decided to spend the evening with the ladies. Jose was our host and guide to the nights festivities. It was margaritas with salt and lime all around.   The very back of this restaurant has an open space that has couches with beautiful tables for hangin out and sipping cocktails. There are game tables back here too even. It is a place where children are allowed too even. It seems that time shared along side their parents or other family for special bonding is something all ages can enjoy.   The feel of this particular area is so amazing and positively radiant. The happiness of the guests in the restaurant project rays of glee and sunshine.  When we approached the hostess she waved us through to the bar. The bar fills up here real quick I see. But there is ample seating next to the bar. Which include tables (single round tables some here square too) to place drinks only on; plus crouch lounge area.  Taco Tuesday is celebrated here every Tuesday, plus the tacos are amazing. Their restaurant has a menu dedicated to only taco Tuesday too (this is why our tacos were so inexpensive)! Priceless.  The bar has a huge still behind the counter so more sober it is in the bookmarks to check this place out. Wine seems to be the claim to fame here. So many beautiful displays of main of all sorts. My kinda place! The menu does have a dedicated section to wine celebrations. I have been informed that this is the Cellar in their name comes from! Indeed on the list for wine sampling and tasting . If seeking that this is definitely the place.  The staff here is amazing at every turn someone is there to help you. One cannot go wrong with that. I do believe they need more servers, since it was hard to find ours during our visit here. This is nothing I would demonize her for. That is why the five stars stand! Do not remember her name; but if we approached her for another margarita, she waved at our table and brought another round by! Plus she kept our water coming too. One must stay hydrated in our desert "hellish" heat. We made it to round four before we all called it a night.   The decor of the Hearthstone conveys such a strong and powerful name. It has that old world type feel with the Cellar and everything made with masonry. The decor around the restaurant has a post war feeling then coming out with glory and rebuilding for all! The incorporations of the out doors into the decoration as ornamentation immensely reflects as one walks through the door. Do not take my word for it; here is the mental picture now go and see for yourself.  So now you know why to go here; and what it looks and feels like. So check thee old planner and go. Tuesday's seem to be the best days; but it's busy. If little ones go with might want to check into the details of there allowance to the bar type area ahead of time! My next trip already on the calendar! So then that's the end! Hope you enjoyed! I did!   Adieu!

AuaH9mt_nzd0YRl9QdMsNA.text: UPDATED: We've heard several times in our lives the old adage "If at first you don't succeed, try try again."  This is exactly the kind of ideology shared by Hearthstone's General Manager Russell. After realizing that our first experience was not great, he immediately reached out to us and promised us a better experience if we came back. He lived up to his word. This time, we were immediately greeted by Andrea at the front door (outdoor seating side) and we were seated immediately for our 6pm reservation. We were then introduced to Rigo, a veteran server from the original days of Wolfgang Puck, who would be out server for the night. Rigo was very personable and gave us just enough attention to make sure everything we needed was taken care of, but not so much where it went overboard.  Even though our section was busy, my drink never went empty and Russell also stopped by to make sure everything was in order. It is not often where someone running a restaurant pays attention when someone has a bad experience. Russell, on the other hand, made sure that customer service was his number one priority. Hearthstone has definitely gained a couple of long term customers after tonight.

bKOcgCyfByrMfkCpz-LEPw.text: What a great experience for our first time here!! We felt like royalty while our server, Gerson catered to us and insured we were never left without anything we needed. He made our night!! The ambiance was amazing with the weather and the food did not disappoint. We are all in the industry and always seeking great spots for happy hour, brunches and dinner. This is a MUST go to place but Gerson has to be our server when we return!!!

QBXkr8MhMoeQqPW7IKzPvA.text: Food was good and service was good. Only thing was we ordered appetizers and entrees and both came out at the same time. We were sitting At bar so we didn't have much room for all the food and as we ate the charcuterie our pizza and pasta got cold.

RsEzmJwVpKoR4_IV9a8N7A.text: I love this place for shareable appetizers with friends! Must try - lollipop chicken wings, baked ricotta w truffle honey, bacon wrapped dates! I have also enjoyed the fried calamari, crispy brussell sprouts, and raw oysters. Inside or outside seating and always a friendly waitstaff!

LeUIvOWoI_9FaAZbkJKzIw.text: Fantastic meal at Hearthstone with our server Ahmed.  Great food, good crowd and the live music was perfect.

_pSaSqM7yf6KqhV6PjzR_w.text: Great service, great drinks, and great food. Having found Hearthstone was a fantastic find. We have been here several times and have always had great service and great food.  Prices are Vegas prices.

KXE_x9n7EshUgNFZy0o1rw.text: Great atmosphere, great food and drinks.  Ahmed was great and super helpful with recommendations.

0nKq-obVhqK0tyAcjGdcsA.text: Good food. It's definitely a place that's about atmosphere so in turn you pay a little more. For a special occasion it's a nice place to show off.

966eKWWxuoqmPwddwBH-iQ.text: I've been coming here for years, and hands down Ahmed was the best server we've had to date. Food and ambiance is always great :)

86kMTzbfkGCM4rKEp1XVtw.text: Real expensive for what you get. The best thing about this place was there brunch and now they are not open for brunch anymore.

fy59CsqiZH5NXj5sIvc01g.text: I want to declare from the mountain top, "THIS IS A CHILD FRIENDLY RESTAURANT!!!"  Often they'll host holiday/event craft inspired brunches for children ranging from potted plant decorating & potting, Football tailgating to pumpkin decorating, etc; my children love bouncing from dinner table to the craft area then back to our table. Today we dined on breakfast yummies as kids created football paper jersies, made homemade cotton candy, donned their cheeks with football stickers and delighted in Hearthstone's two shuffleboard tables.  My girlfriend and I were able to catch-up, laugh, eat & RELAX all while watching our children keep themselves entertained at the craft/game area just a few feet away. Today we enjoyed the best service thanks to Ahmel, a few months ago we dined al fresco by the water and Christian was our server; consummate professionals with an eye for detail & heightened dining experience, the management is always warm & welcoming, the food highly craveable and the ambiance 10 outta 10 with a casually cool, elegantly inspired, urban vibe. We love the burgers, eggs benedict(s), shrimp cocktail, DIY pizzas for the children, oysters AND whatever specialty dessert they are serving. Highly recommend for family brunch, mama's night out, date night before a movie and everything in between!  Also love their sister restaurant, Bottiglia in Henderson. Can't wait to go back.

6jmPvkgowfwduBiRap88YA.text: Ahmed was awesome. He was able to recommend a fantastic wine paired with great food. We really enjoyed the our experience. Highly recommended.   He brought us a sample of the Jordan Cabernet and we were immediately sold.   Everything was perfect!

_-jrI9cFQCeyJ8SNbJsSEg.text: I have been here a few times for their happy hour but yesterday I Stopped in for oyster Wednesday. The bar was full when I walked in but luckily a couple was closing their tab and we took those seats. Jocelyn was the bartender behind the bar. She was such a delight. Very attentive to keeping my water filled, and kept checking back to make sure everything was alright with my meal or if I needed another beverage. I am also in hospitality and it's so appreciated when little things like having water replaced goes a long way. Oysters were great. She also talked us into having the fish and chips special. It did not disappoint. It's fair to say I will be back soon. Five stars.

QdF8kyuNBoFEsClTZWsTWw.text: Ahmed was amazing, best server ever. Thursday night football is the best!! I love the pig

063lu00CRWYT-8xyJP-Qzw.text: Ahmed was a wonderful server, he made sure my ice tea was topped off with the amount of my white sugar I asked for.  He delivered on all cylinders and we were a very happy bunch. Food was yummy, he even recommended the prime rib sandwich which I was iffy about because I dislike Swiss cheese, but he was right it was not over powering in the sandwich. My group enjoyed the 1.00 oysters that are available on Wednesdays. All in all we will be back and for sure and ask for Ahmed.

DMEP-fjxXP_SPAXWx1p2NA.text: Items Selected (or Selected by Chef): Iced Tea Charcuterie and Cheese with Housemade Mustard and Truffle Honey Truffle Popcorn - Truffle + Pecorino + Chives Meatballs - Braised Short Rib + Tomato Stuffed Dates - Chorizo + Bacon + Piquillo Pepper Gravy Heirloom Watermelon Salad - Greek Feta + Avocado + Red Onion + Mint Vinigrette Harvest Quinoa Salad - Chickpea + Apple + Gouda + Roasted Pumpkin Seeds Abe Froman Pizza - Fennel Garlic Sausage Pepperoni Pizza - Spicy Pepperoni + Basil + Marinara Char Grilled Rib Cap Steak - Roasted Cippolini Onions + Pinot Noir Jumbo Wood Oven Shrimp - Spicy Succotash Whole Beast Feast Grilled Broccoli - Fresh Lemon Crispy Steak Fries - Smoked Sea Salt + Chives + Schmaltz Mayo Wood Rosted Asparagus - Fresh Herb Salad + Romesco Sauce Hearthstone Secret Dessert - Huckleberries + Meyer Lemon Curd + Sweet Ricotta + Amoretti Cookie  A bit underwhelmed by Salute the night prior it was across the hall at Hearthstone that family and friends sat down on Thursday night and although the slow summer season has seen the menu somewhat neutered the experience unfolded just like every other meal enjoyed within the comfortable confines,  Chef Jordan Hoffman serving us carte blanche with only the excessively priced prawns proving a less than exceptional plate.  Having already spoken of service, music, and scenery in several prior reviews suffice it to say that seats at a hightop juxtaposing the pass were as delighful as ever, the salads, shared plates, and pizzas all across-the-board excellent the wood fired rib cap was boldly flavored and tender with scorched onions and reduced wine adding just the right amount balance as well as flare.  At this point unable to pass on The Whole Beast Feast, again served with a crock of creamy polenta and the housemade-mustard/roasting jus/apple-butter trio, suffice it to say that all eight of us were stuffed to capacity with nearly two-pounds of pig leftover even before dessert's arrival - another duo of cakes from Peridot Sweets every bit as good as the first while the not-so-secret pancake balls proved as yeasty and irresistible as ever.  Not quite as perfect as in the past, several favorites stripped from the menu during lean months during which Salute has been a focus, Hearthstone remains the class of the Western Suburbs by a rather substantial margin, the upcoming conference season hopefully to see the return of more innovative items.

yTNZyGVTqtQG63rYb3Fw0w.text: This place was amazing! We sat at the bar and had amazing service along with amazing food. We ordered the bacon wrapped scallops and the prime rib, both were the best we had ever had. We regularly order prime rib and scallops and this place, hands down, had the best for both! The scallops had a sauce on them that really set the whole dish off, I'm in love! The manager even came and checked on us to make sure everything was ok. All the bartenders were fabulous and worked together to serve us. I can't say enough about this place!!

_nwPsCiGGra4bVkRqC4ANg.text: Hearthstone is one of our favorite places to stop and have a drink and some appetizers. The blackberry bliss is a great drink if you are looking for something refreshing. The wait staff is always very friendly and helps to create a casual environment that is welcoming. Elisa has been our waitress several times and is makes great recommendations for drinks and food!! Ask to be seated in her section when you go in!

CvmEHWHJrNlN3m4MxEICDw.text: This is a wonderful place to have breakfast lunch drinks or dinner. The restaurant is clean, stylish and fun. If you want to meet a client there, do it! Really cool place! Friendly too!!

oFi8ivPKdV_H8hwgR8iHkg.text: Horrible pizza, selection of food was poor. Our friends had the fried chicken and loved it.  Waitress ignored us. We never returned. 21NJl5lPIE70zLr_pIv01g.text: We had a 5:30 appointment and were seated right away. The Baileys n coffee was not the best. The fried chicken was overly breaded. The scallops were small in size and was not worth the price. The dessert was nothing special. Good service and atmosphere.

cs4UpIIup31jr_vlldzxcg.text: Our server Tien is awesome and Chef Nick sent out some amazing food.  The meatballs were insanely good.  The atmosphere is comfortable and feels like home.

2Fo9Qy954aNGku8YNUMN2A.text: Always a great time when I come here! Food is delicious and the servers are great!!! I also love the decor and the atmosphere there! I always come for dinner but I want to try they're brunch menu my next visit!!!

YXUBueDxmNC79oKSx59hfw.text: Extremely disappointed. This place has the most incredible juices (which they were out of all 3.) we ordered the bubbles for breakfast with champagne (rose was given) which didn't really make sense with orange juice but after waiting 40 minutes to get it when it's 104 degrees outside we were not willing to complain and wait it over again. We watched multiple couples walk out of the outdoor patio upset because no one had greeted them, ever. Our bill total was $165 as Rachel as our server and it was hard to swallow considering the experience . We are locals and will unfortunately be finding a new brunch spot where we feel appreciated .

GcJBXJAdZiQ-4iRb9cMy6Q.text: Johann was a spectacular server and was very attentive to our needs. The service is half the reason we come here, the other half is the amazing food. The menu is seasonal, everything seemed to be wild caught, grass fed, organic, and house made. You're paying for quality food, memorable service, and quality people. They don't have ranch for their wings but it's still pretty good with the sauce it comes with. I bring all my friends, family and associates that come in to town. A few of my favorites that I like to show off is baked ricotta, stuffed dates, pizzas, and pimms 50 cocktail. I recommend this place! Cannot wait for Salute to open. Great for dates or for a fun night out.

MGcixPDJWy6jDaK5lcITdQ.text: I usually don't feel the need to write a review, but I can say this place is great. If you are dining in you must sit with Emily. She is an amazing server. If you wanted to feel welcome she is the server for you.  If you are at the bar you must talk to oliver. He knows his scotch. He is not your typical bartender that serves you your drink and walks away. He made sure I had the right drink for me.   I have stated the service is great and the food is equal to match. If you can please order the baked ricotta and the meatballs. I went with a group of 9 and everyone said they are the best meatballs they ever had.

fOLfVxXj_TpgvuIoB4N4UQ.text: Love this place, great for any meal, even to have a nice cocktail!! Prices s little high but quality of good worth every penny!! Great staff

KiTnPQSwBW-RoXuK8_z6Lw.text: We've come here several times since it opened. The menu has changed a few times, but the food and service is outstanding. Last time I had the watermelon salad and octopus dishes. Excellent. Our servers, especially tien have been great too.

bgGUdVa0iQrHT8jo6AJA6g.text: Same experience as Alex we were seated out side toke the waitress 3 times to get our drink order when out 3rd person tried to order a cocktail she walked away half way thru the drink order. Which  was water with ice and maybe a half of shot of vodka for $11. We All order the unlimited wings which 3 people had to share while other tables has a plate to each person. We weren't the waitress friends like the table next to use. We had the bust boy doing our drinks and re ordering he had better customer services then the waitress. Wow the wings were amazing but it was pathetic to have to eat one plate wait 20+ mins for the second plate. By our 3rd plate they had run out of wings yet the people next to us had each a plate each for 5 people fresh "out of wings" by 9pm when you open at 5pm. She then tried to charge us $17 per person when the hostess and website had said $10 per person all you can eat. She had the greatest comment of all "you guys ate the most wings out of all my customers tonight" gees thanks 2 grown men and 1 girl  we ate 3 plates that had maybe 12 wings not hooters/Pizza Hut/wing stop/ buffalo wings size these wings are called lollipop wings for a reason they are small! The steak friends were a joke I had no steak on them one full potato cut into small pieces. I also had a issued with my card really!!! Did you try to actually run it. What a miracle you try a second time and have no issues. Well I guess I'll have to keep going somewhere, else. Sucks food was great but customer services was a joke they might as well have a place to order and pick up avoided the waitresses.

O96-A8ZwPZ0MYoE7vORuXw.text: We love Hearthstone! The service is always excellent and the bacon wrapped dates are a must try.

gY63qT4eOd6_nP5IUOuA5w.text: Delicious food, rustic ambiance, and upbeat energy. The service was a bit slow, but my gf and I didn't mind. Their meat and cheese board, steak tartar, and filet was delicious. We really enjoyed the steak fries with truffle aioli.

tZS44SjJdM53jJ3x2b0Liw.text: Three stars is a rating reserved for a place I would return to. Hearthstone is, unfortunately, not one of those places.   My mother received a gift certificate for her hard work to come dine at this 'fine' establishment. However, because she works so hard, she has no time to use it and thus this duty fell onto me: her eldest. I was delighted to come with my better half so we could do dinner and a movie.   Movie was great, and we hoped to end dinner on an even higher note to round out our night but it was not to be so.  Entering the establishment you will see an eclectic collection of items to your right, from white plaster animal heads mounted on this wall to mirrors and signs and photos of varying degrees 'aged' to have that vintage quirkiness that is all the rage these days.  I think it was supposed to be chic but instead it ended up being a metaphor for the theme of dinner this evening: a menagerie of 'stuff' without any True taste to speak of.   Our waitress seated us, was very kind, bubbly, but all of that seemed to disappear as soon as we presented her the gift certificate - something that would later continue to be confirmed throughout the night as she attended to other tables literally adjacent to us much more feverishly. We brushed it off however as she did continue to at least be attentive enough of our table that she made sure we never ran out of water. (And despite gratuity being included in the certificate we left cash for her on top of that.)  Service aside, let's get down to the good stuff (or mediocre in this instance): Food. My other half had the scallops (with cauliflower puree, farro risotto, and lemon) I had the pot pie (with rotisserie chicken, roasted vegetables, and truffle veloute)  We shared two sides:  - Sweet potato fries (with a harissa yogurt dip)  - Mac & Cheese (Brie and Fontina cheese)  I want to start off by saying that it is a sad, sad day when the sides are better than the actual entrees. However, that being said, it was not a meal to remember over all.  You know you're at a good place when you are excited to dig in and continue to eagerly dig in consistently through the evening even if you are full, and this was exactly what didn't happen. Once the initial excitement of having food on the table died down it was a steady decline that ended in us picking at our food in rather disheartened manner.  The mac & cheese despite being initially delicious was far too rich five bites in and is sorely lacking more breading to even out how much cheese and butter and god knows what else it's dripping in -- or perhaps an accompaniment of crostini would help greatly. The fries, as they cooled, began hardening at the centers in a manner that frozen food products do and therein also lost their appeal as the meal sagged on.   My other half, an avid lover of scallops, told me he liked them but that the entire plate as a whole did not feel worth $36.00, rather, $20.00 and he was even further put off when one of the scallops proved to still be sandy and therein not all too properly cleaned before having been fired. It was then he confirmed he would never order the plate again should we ever return.. if we ever returned.   Our waitress, bless her, misheard me when I had been debating between the fried chicken and pot pie so she had rushed a pot pie order for me. She warned me it would take twenty minutes and I confirmed it would be okay so I patiently waited, hoping for a pot pie that would make any grandmother green with envy for daring to overshadow her family recipe.  I think instead grandma would have died laughing at it.  They definitely rushed it in an attempt to get it to me quickly instead of taking their time and salvaging their already crumbling credibility.  A lot of the vegetables in the filling were still raw (like the peas), and at one point I found half an onion (I kid you not) still just in it's freshly chopped form sitting in the skillet surprisingly cooked through. There was supposed to be rotisserie chicken in it but I maybe found a tablespoon's worth (and that's being generous), and it tasted like chicken does when you've cooked it, leave it for a few nights, and microwave it too long. A sham and a shame. To top it all off there wasn't a hint of salt or any other sort of seasoning in the filling. My favourite part of the whole thing, and most flavourful at that, was the crust but I'm pretty sure it was just well seasoned phyllo dough. The plate was priced at $27.00, but I think even $15.00 would have been pushing it.   So, overall, it's a night I'm so glad is forgettable because I don't want to waste a second more remembering it. Maybe someday in the future I'll find the inspiration to try Hearthstone again but anytime within the next year would be too soon for me. Had we been wowed we would have been more than happy to return because if there's one thing we can shell out money for, it's amazing food and a good atmosphere. C'est la vie, Hearthstone. C'est la vie

02Mde7ZPRQPR8_OP6JHyGg.text: Loved the atmosphere of this place! It felt very rustic chic with their decor and loved the open floor plan. The food was delicious, portions are small but since they are a tapas style restaurant you should expect that. I ordered the Salmon Entree and it was worth the price. The side of grilled broccoli was amazing too. Oh and their grapefruit beer is pretty good. This place is a must go if you want to chill and enjoy a drink with friends.

A34iv9Y3-itDChDpk32p6g.text: I really don't understand the poor reviews of Hearthstone. My hubby and I came here for the first time tonight and had a lovely time. The food was tasty and well prepared. My only complaint was the Brussels sprouts were a bit rubbery and the lamb came out MW vs the MR my husband asked for.... But, Flavor was on point. Even with the food being delish, The best part of our experience though was the service. Everyone who came in contact with us from the hostess, to the bartender (Nicole) and our server (Taylor) was extremely personable. My hubby and I come from a service background and nothing ruins a meal faster then poor service. We absolutely loved our first meal here and will be back for more.

OV3Mo0_ANfvGQWtMyELcgg.text: Just had the most amazing meal at the new Summerlin Hearthstone!!! From the Charcuterie, the Crispy Fries, Octopus, one of my favs, the cast iron NY Sirloin and ohhhh the desserts.... The peanut butter dessert, SPECTACULAR!!   But the best, was the service.... from Danielle our server which was exceptional,  to the Shane, the Director of Operations, and the my personal favorite, Mary Ratner the Assistant General Manager, Mr. Massi has out done himself. I will be back many more times.   Happy patron!!!

EooTYjun2x2B56VqcDXdGg.text: No problems with my 6:45 reservation, restaurant is nice, decor is inviting yet casual. Service was ok: server was good but timing of courses was off. Main course arrived before salads, which (salads) seem to be a bottleneck. The salads were slow coming out, granted they were tasty and fresh. Timing issues must be solved quickly or it will become chaos for guests.  Biggest opportunity is the portion size vs the price. Either the entrees are overpriced or the portions are too small, one of those two has to change to succeed. The shrimp pasta entree is a ridiculously small portion at that price. There is too much competition in Red Rock and with Wolfgang Puck and Crave in Downtown Summerlin, small portions could be a show stopper.  I give it a 3 star to start but it certainly has the potential to improve and we will go back.   Manager came to our table to apologize for the salads and bought us drinks and credited the salads. Nice but it's better and cheaper for them to solve those problems.

_mQut7RQBVtQSn4yTjEn7Q.text: One word comes to my mind after last nights experience..."HORRIBLE!" Our sever was TERRIBLE, if it wasn't for the Bussers (did great) I would give negative stars! She, said that she would bring out some bread...never happened...never checked up on us...but yet, she had time to flirt with another table?? At the end of the meal, I asked for a box to take home...and of course that never happened too. Good thing the Bussers were there to do her job. That's just the service alone. The food is a another issue. Food came out cold and soooo salty! Fool me once, shame on you; fool me twice, shame on me.

VhaeLtx53y7U4R9YWua4Kw.text: SO glad this cozy place opened up! Great ambience.. Chic decor... And the staff catered to us well, specially to my 7 year old son! So, don't be afraid to bring your kids and make it a family night. We were sat promptly and our server was knowledgeable, upbeat and welcoming.  The food is a perfect mix of comfort and traditional with a touch of high end and a punch of flavors! Absolute MUST order.. The foie gras and jelly! YUM! I'd recommend this place a million times over.. Either for a night out with the family or a chill evening out for cocktails and good times with friends!  Look forward to dining there again!
