Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras and Homemade Jelly

CYsQLB8Saz9EMJF9lP7ltQ.text: I came here for happy hour last night and was amazed! I loved the open kitchen concept! For appetizers we started with the meatballs, which exceeded our expectations. I went with the hanger steak cooked to a perfect med-rare! I must say service was spectacular! I will definitely be back for happy hour!

R4PXArj2_E6KFRZ7wSghWQ.text: My husband and I went in for dinner last night and had an awesome time!! We shared the calamari and baked ricotta. SOOO DELICIOUS! I had the shrimp pasta for dinner, it was just the perfect amount of spicy, so so good I will definitely be back for it! My husband had the hangers steak and he loved it as well! We've never even heard of a "hangers" steak before but it was worth the try! We finished off with the peanut butter lava cake that we just couldn't resist! The staff was so friendly and helpful, our waitress Jessica was amazing along with the wait help. The manager Sarah even came by to talk to us and made sure we were enjoying ourselves. One of the best restaurant experiences we've ever had in Vegas. We'll definitely be back for more!

6II4DiHm9VbIC3rNJPvyIw.text: This is my first time dining at the Red Rock casino and Hearthstone was a country atmosphere with unique snacks salads appetizers and hearty dishes that were amazing and the peanut butter lava cake was amazing!!

FY_Hd3G_-jNj5A08FCGHhg.text: Absolutely phenomenal service and food!! The chefs are wonderful  and the staff are incredible!! Best food I've tasted in years!! Thank god for hearthstone!! It's my new spot for me and my friends, happy hour is incredible and the servers are so cool!

glb3HmAcNtRZNl8ZwYlYxg.text: I've eaten here a few time but the brunch is a must!! Mimosas and fresh breakfast with fresh ingredients and great service! The patio is also a must for brunch or a late dinner!

MkrmPMm0NoNZQnr3qp4VoA.text: Fun eclectic menu.  Friendly staff. Good food and the roasted Pig is awesome.  Good selection of fresh oysters. Patio dining with fire pit is a great feature.  Look forward to attending wine events to sample their wines

UgosArEfw8XpkzXEl8EBBA.text: I dined here last night for my birthday and the food was definitely 5 stars but the service was more like a 2-3 stars.   Let's start with the service. First they have 2 entrances so I came in one side and another friends came in the other. I was seated with the promise that my friends at the other door would be seated with me as well. However I had to text them to see where they were and they was still waiting? The hostess clearly didn't communicate with the other.   After we were seated, we were served water right away. After 10 minutes our server came by and we ordered drinks. Our server then disappeared. Our drinks came but we waited 45 minutes before our server came back around to take our food order. That was pretty disappointing... But she was friendly and thankfully we had our drinks. The Blackberry cocktail was very tasty.   The food was delicious!!! The Baked Ricotta was seriously to die for, and steak tartare was superb and the meatballs were amazing!!! We also had the Mac and Cheese with the cauliflower which was different and surprising a great compliment. I was only disappointed in the Roasted Squash. It was bland and over cooked.   It was my birthday so we obviously ordered dessert. Can you believe on the dessert menu, they didn't have a single chocolate item?! So we ordered the peanut butter and butterscotch molten cake and WOW!!! It was so different but in a good way and didn't make me miss the chocolate dessert at all!   The price was good too. 5 small plates and endless cocktails split between 4 girls and it was only $50 each. Pretty decent! I'll definitely be back. They had a lot of items on the menu I'd love to try!

tN2PpFxTdigmknzMq0DUCw.text: Super fun place! Went here last weekend while we did a short trip to Vegas. Food was amazing and loved the atmosphere.

V-s49N74OEKI9CReipDJjw.text: Good place, good service. Ate outside. Music was a little loud and Danielle the manager turned it down a bit right away when we asked. Jessica was our server, made sure we knew about the pizza special -- half off on Sundays -- so we got two. The Truffle pizza was particularly good. Also got the DOC pizza, hummus and the Quinoa/Apple salad, which were all tasty. All came out super fast, maybe because we got there early. They kept our water glasses filled all night. Small thing but appreciated. Totally recommend.

0IZA__4I-VDH7558mBm81w.text: Ate here for the very first time. On a Friday so there was live music which was a little loud so it made it difficult to have a conversation but if you are good with that it was great ambiance! The tomato soup was delicious along with the hangar steak. It was cooked to perfection.   I definitely recommend this restaurant but be prepared to pay an extra couple bucks.

6WJ6J1fjAjzyQJnCeRooOQ.text: I went here for my birthday a month ago and loved the meats n cheese w toast spred so much we have been recreating it ever since at home. I also loved the trendy environment.   We had a reservation and were seated immediately.  The price was a bit high for the smaller portions but then you pay for trendy or end up w too many people. So that is the good.   The reason for only 3 stars is the service. It was slow and when we pointed out that they brought the wrong toast they charged us to bring out the right one. They didn't even offer to swap the two.

VoayMaYGM6CuhR0Sl-_z2A.text: Came here on a Thursday evening to catch the happy hour and it was wonderful. We ordered the nightly pizza special (it had ricotta and roasted garlic. Delicious), the jalapeno hummus, oysters, quinoa salad and steak tartar. All of the items were on point and really fresh. My SO loved the quinoa salad and I thought the steak tartar was amazing. We had an awesome server named Alexandria and she was very nice and helpful. Gotta come back for brunch sometime soon.

I9QA4_RUnRdu7-QbXhUx-w.text: The layout of the restaurant is wide open and has an exciting atmosphere. Booths along the wall and tables in the center. I suggest requesting a booth which are elevated by one step and provides a great view of the kitchen and bar. The booths seat four and are very comfortable. Our booth was directly across from the Suckling Pig Rotisserie. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. Service was attentive by checking with us throughout dinner and refilling the water glasses. The menu has a wide selection of small bites as well as a choice of entrees. The Wood Roasted Clams looked interesting but was not available that night. The stuffed Dates with Chorizo, Bacon and a Piquillo Pepper sauce come 3 to an order and were very tasty. The pepper sauce added a nice mild flavor.  The Meatballs,  3 to an order are made with Braised Short Ribs, goat cheese and placed in a pool of tomato sauce. These were juicy and perfectly paired with the tomato sauce.  There are a several choices of Wood Oven Roasted Flatbreads. Really thin crust Pizza cut into 8 slices. The Primavera Flatbread has thin sliced zucchini, cherry tomato's and pesto. The crust was soft with a nice hint of smoke. The tomatoes juicy and tender. 8 slices are enough for 2 people. If the pricing was adjusted I would have awarded 4 stars. Considering the size of the shared plate items the price should be less. The Flatbreads are plenty large but the price is higher than other neighborhood places.  Hearthstone does not have a Happy Hour which in my opinion could provide the means for price adjustment. For now my favorite among the places in Red Rock Resort restaurant row will remain the Yard House.

_xk9KXlEX7wgVy3O6jW0yw.text: Oscar was AMAZING!!! Such a great server! Diane came over and she was also just as AMAZING!!! I will be back soon! Great food, great service!

Y289uTpSaUhxvaYN5WPNWg.text: We went here for the Super Bowl yesterday and was a great experience. Good food and wonderful staff. Our waitress Elisa was beyond great! She was so attentive and sweet. We will go back here again.

7LZW8it3frSijNzuJWc4jA.text: Rating is for the service we recieved. Food was great!  Server seemed rude and didnt really seem like she wanted to be there. We paid good money on food and drinks there, and for a friends birthday.  A couple friends gave their order to the server and she literally asked them, "Is that all youre getting?". Really?? Very off-putting behavior. Ive been a server before and I would never say something like that to someone. Maybe try to upsell in a friendly way, perhaps?  My friend ordered the watermelon salad on the, "Vegan Menu". She asked if he wanted the feta cheese on it. He said no. It came on the salad anyways. Not a big deal really but the whole experience was not great with her as our server to begin with. Drinks came out slow, she came back every so often. The manager cleared the majority of our plates. He asked if everything was okay bit since its my friends birthday dinner, i didnt want to make a big deal out of it.  Service 4/10.

JpwJo6JWpdni0dsGCIrozg.text: So amazing! I've been here 3 times now, and I can't get enough of their pizzas! So good! I had the truffle pizza I shared with a friend and it was amazing. I would go back again just for the pizza. The prices are average, server knowledgeable is amazing.

raQ11UBR1Guff5FRkv99rg.text: I was here for a dinner party. We were out on the patio (at the booth in front of the fountains)!and I was in awe with how beautiful it was. I'm simple when I eat so I my go to was a Caesar salad. The lettuce was crisp and everything was made to my satisfaction. Next time I go I'll order something outside my wheelhouse. Lol

R7VxSrLEL6zvt2jRgYEc5A.text: We have been here many many times and it's always great! However, this time was average at best. Bottomless mimosas, not this time. They "ran outta champagne but the table next to us got a new one after we asked!! Then it took 20 minutes to get the bill.

LR1MLCYRziXRT_26qayLXw.text: Taco Tuesday and AYCD Tequila & margaritas?! For $24. It's definitely worth your money you get to pick from steak, chicken, and mahi tacos with a side of chips and salsa I tried all 3 and everything was really good. I would be more than happy to come here again for that special it definitely was what we were looking for. Our server (forgot her name) she was extremely nice and accommodating constantly checking up on us! Whole experience was amazing. Only reason I'm taking one star away is that it doesn't fill you up so you are only limited to eating 3 tacos lol if you're a foodie like me you'll need more!

TwkqQZcYnbgc9SSk0bAzCQ.text: My best friend has lived here for 10 years and just bought a new house. Her and her husband have always come to Red Rock but have never been here. We came for brunch and this place is Amazing! Our Waiter was Ahmed, and words cannot describe how amazing he is. Between juggling us, a bachelorette party and a table that looks like it's 10 + he's been amazing! I'm particular on my brunch places and I highly recommend this place! Ask for Ahmed

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PODrzN8j85-PbF-I1dlJwA.text: Took advantage of the Restaurant Week deals to try Hearthstone. The interior of the restaurant wasn't what I expected, but I liked it. I thought it would be darker, and maybe a little stuffy, but it was actually bright and open. The staff was very nice and professional. I started with the Apple & Quinoa Salad, which was delicious! From the Restaurant Week menu, I ordered the Crispy Calamari, the Hanger Steak, and the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding for dessert. The calamari didn't really have much flavor, and the sauces that came with it, didn't do much to change that. The Hanger Steak was good, but the temperature of the meat seemed a little cold when it was brought to the table. The fries that came with it were also good, and paired well with the steak. I'm not really a fan of bread pudding, but I thought this would be better since it was a glazed donut bread pudding. Not really much better. Softer than typical bread puddings, but still sucks all of the moisture from your mouth. The flavor wasn't bad, but it's still bread pudding. It was also better than the other choice, which was the Nutella Pizza. Tried a little of that, and that wasn't very exciting either. All in all, I enjoyed my experience, but it not enough to give it the extra star or two. I'll have to come back and try some different items, then perhaps I will update my review.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glazed Donut Bread Pudding
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger Steak
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Calamari

hwMaVZW736ZcTXF6TYizIA.text: Great food, amazing service and excellent atmosphere!! Tad pricey for what you're getting but overall quality of food is noticeable.   I do wish there was a bit more of an option on the menu though.... would make me, a picky eater, come back again and again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Hi8HnY0_6VcM7mlSO4gOA.text: Food is great. That being said, I'm going here to EAT FOOD, not to go to a concert. We sat at an 8 top. Four across. We literally had to YELL. WTF? Why do eating establishments need to have the music so LOUD you have to scream? Better yet, we asked the server if they could turn it down. You know what the MANAGEr said?.........wait for it...........LITERALLY SAID NO. So I would love for the manager to respond to this negative review (which should solely by on the MANAGER and not the eatery). So Mr. or Ms. manager, please tell me why you would NOT turn down the music? Not to mention, music should be something that's in the background, well unless you're at a CONCERT  Russell. I know you advertise live music. Again, it needs to be so loud you can't talk? This is the dumbest thing I've ever heard. I'm not old either.  Music doesn't need to be that loud no matter where you're sitting. That's ridiculous reasoning. Plus, the manager saying NO is a joke too. I'll pass on the free dinner. No desire to sit elsewhere, especially when you seriously think that music that loud is ok?  Won't ever be back because apparently your company thinks an inside concert in a restaurant is ok. You shouldn't have to YELL to eat. Do you?

h7aysxNEAVR_n9EtXqDYIA.text: We had a fantastic dinner/date night.  Stopped here before heading to Regal Downtown to watch 50 Shades.    Everything was absolutely amazing.  We will be back!!!!     Melissa was an awesome waitress and Russell the GM was great.  We had the Meatballs (pork & beef), Crispy Calamari, Baked Truffle Ricotta, Pepperoni Pizza, Truffle Pizza, and some delicious cocktails.  Everything tasted amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zQJCfCHD8PsOAIu3tEGJkg.text: Whoever their interior decorator is, they got their money's worth because  they have done a great job! I'm guessing it's the same person who did Bottiglia which is stunning. They have a beautiful patio that you can throw a special event out there and a lot of seating near the bar where you can mingle with other patrons.   I came during happy hour and I have to say none of the food was worth coming back for. It reminded me of drunk bar food, the kind that's satisfying at 2am but not sober. I had crispy sweet potato fries that weren't crispy and the sauce was bland. Ordered a bottle of sparkling water which had no carbonation and my replacement was flat too. I had a sweetheart of a server but it took me 3 forks to get a clean one. Service and food could use some improvement but the problems here remind me of new restaurant woes and I hope they can iron them out.

WZZIsfjvb5EPj8xNS9f6uw.text: This spot has lots of charm and a super fun menu. Their happy hour menu has great $6 dollar offerings like their pigs in the blanket and the vegetarian slider. The vegetarian slider tastes exactly like real beef, so don't be too surprised.  I'm curious to know more about the menu and excited to come back. Slightly unsure about the preparation of some of the food items, but all in all this is a good new spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeno Hummus
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour &#34;Pigs in a Blanket&#34; and &#34;Vegan Slider&#34;
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters (and what not) bar

ZDqC6vxE9XbQS-Kh5reXSQ.text: Absolutely amazing!!! After a not so great experience a few weeks ago, we were invited back by the GM Russell. We decided to celebrate my birthday at Hearthstone. Our waitress Melissa was fantastic. She took the time to tell us about the specials. My husband has an allergy and she made sure everything we wanted to order was safe. My husband had the special Halibut and OMG it melts in your mouth!! I had the shrimp and grits and it was also really good. The must try has to be the Glazed Donut bread pudding, it is to die for. Thank you Russell and Melissa for making my bday dinner amazing. We will absolutely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner area

7jGcGf1e7XxBPK0f2ORniQ.text: The grilled cheese and tomato soup was delicious! Also the tuna carpaccio. On the negative side, the stuffed dates, shrimp pasta and the steak were all just ok. Will def be back for the soup though!! We had to wait awhile for a table when the restaurant wasn't even busy.

X9oaF3wniScVgPbzhtAGQQ.text: Love their shrimp and grits!! Ahmed is an amazing server. He was helpful with suggestions for food and drinks. We have eaten here several times and the food has never disappointed.  Best drink with carrot juice and tequila! There is a dessert they need to put in the menu, permanently. The ricotta pound cake with strawberries, balsamic, mascarpone, and basil.....AMAZING!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eT6jCtoi4Z3jQSoEsumu8Q.text: First time here and really enjoyed the meal. Our server Melissa is FANTASTIC! Plus she's here working on her birthday! Outdoor patio looks awesome, maybe next time we can sit outside. Don't recommend sitting in the booth though. The constant flash of the screen behind me is bothering my eyes and makes it difficult to focus, bright light. Will take a table next time.

vX17OuFlnyAht8MnggUidg.text: Super spacious and delicious place. Impeccable service from our waitress and friendly environment for the family. Took 4 kids without any problems.

gYpOzZmhE3ToWllao2Sjog.text: Had a couples date night for second time in a couple weeks recently and both times were excellent. We loved the chicken drummy appetizer and oysters were good! Wine selection was just right for a variety of tastes. Wife really liked the decorating of the place, very modern and with the times. Tons of tv screens to watch your favorite sporting event as well. Not the cheapest place you can find, but didn't expect that being located in Red Rock. Overall great experience.

HQfWElcjZqHgB7drrBm5qg.text: I got to experience this place for brunch and recently for dinner... I love the atmosphere. It's very warm and inviting. Although the restaurant is large with a mix of cozy booths, high boys, tables and outside patio it feels very intimate. I felt like I was in a friend's kitchen. I came on a Saturday evening after 8pm and it was busy filled with locals. We were seated in a booth that faced the brick Oven where they make their pizzas. They had live music that helped to keep the energy flowing.   The food and service were great. I ordered the salmon and my babe ordered the New York steak. Our server, Rigo, was super friendly, observant, and attentive. I was torn between 3 dishes and he suggested the salmon. We also had a side of Mac n cheese that was delish. We didn't save room for dessert unfortunately, but I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZuEtkQdAnqfok7wItX2DyQ.text: I've been here a total of 3 times and each visit gets better but there's still room for improvement. Today is national lobster day and I saw an ad on IG with their famous lobster boil for $26 AND it's $1 oyster Wednesday too! I made an easy reservation via YELP for 8:30. I've been excited about their lobster boil all day.   7:30 comes around and I get a phone call that they ran out but still kept our reservation. We arrive there and the patio is packed, tons of people are standing near the bar but there was a lot of tables (in the center) still available. We were seated right away but the host didn't bring any menus.... we waited and waited. I almost walked back to the host stand to ask for menus but finally someone comes with menus. She didn't introduce herself and dropped the menus off but she did point out the beverage menu. Again we waited and waited. I had no idea the person who dropped off our menu was our server! Finally we were able to get some water and order a dozen oysters along with medium prime rib, mashed potatoes, Brussels and a medium cheeseburger with bacon.   The oysters are only $1 but they're on the small side. We've had better oysters but for $1 I can't really complain. We tried ordering another dozen oysters and our server said they ran out (this was at 8:45). Then minutes later, someone comes out with a dozen oysters and brings it to our table. We got confused because our server said they ran.... I guess miscommunication, we were able to get the LAST DOZEN. So, come EARLY for $1 oysters and any other special they offer because it looks like they run out quickly.   Prime rib ($29) was pretty good, a lot of fat but super tender and cooked medium like I asked. The horseradish that came with it wasn't super strong and the au jus was light and not salty which was good because the exterior of the prime rib was super salty IMO. But I'd order it again.   The sides that we ordered were delicious. Mashed potatoes ($7) were super super creamy and Brussels ($6) seemed to never end... which is a good thing because a lot of restaurants give such small portions of Brussels. I do wish however that it was a bit more crispy. The sliced apples on top provided a nice crunch/freshness. Our Brussels looked and smelled so good, the table next to us kept complimenting how good our food smelled and wanted to order the same thing.  Bfs cheeseburger ($17 +$3 bacon) was average. We weren't a fan of the "plate" it came on. Which was like a square board. The string fries kept falling off the edge.   Overall Hearthstone does have good food but service was a bit lacking. I love the decor and lighting but the music is super loud so I would not recommend it for date night unless you sit on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Come early for $1 oysters! They ran out by 8:45

lq3znBC7MJT0BUgxyCVqvA.text: When I stayed at the Red Rock my husband & I decided to try Hearthstone. The decor looked so inviting & the menu looked simple but good. The hostess was sweet, and sat us very quickly at a nice table, our Waiter was kind. BUT- the service was really slow. Everyone was super kind and attentive... you will never be out of water but your food will take forever. By the time our food arrived it was just barely above room temperature. We ordered an appetizer- bacon wrapped dates. They were not in the classic style. They had pork hidden inside the date and a marinara sauce on them!!!! They were NOT GOOD. My French onion soup was not good either. It smelled weird and had a layer of oil floating at the top that smelled burnt. It was also not as hot as it should of been. My husband ordered Prime rib. It came with no sides- that's extra$.... it also came to our table at room temperature!!!  In all honesty We both left with stomach aches.  Our waiter saw that I barely ate my soup -so he took it off my bill. That was kind. It's too bad the food wasn't good because -like I said the atmosphere was great and the staff were all really sweet but we won't be going back.

7H5ANq3HWLH3sAjXmc48rQ.text: Totally surprised by this place. Indoor and outdoor atmosphere was amazing. Pizza is really great. No complaints / would eat here anytime.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belvedere and pizza for the win!

1FG2IdrfyA05t1rUePd_gQ.text: Completed my last review and then submitted it late (just today)  Happened to go there this week for drinks and dessert while family was in town.   Had a couple of glasses of wine, a glass of sangria and a dessert that was Nutella based. (See photo).  The sangria was ok. The dessert was just ok.  (See presentation) the dessert reminded me of glorified chocolate pudding and was though would be served warm, ended up being room temp.  In any case, the setting outside of the restaurant is amazing the service is good, this time though I was disappointed in the dessert along with the sheer price of the wine and sangria was ridiculous.  $20 for a glass of sangria was obnoxious to me.  (Red wine with a few slices of fruit)  Normally I am happy with hearthstone as their food, service and atmosphere is great.  This time I felt taken advantage of.

FDPqSsDSK2aosuh1Uu8XZQ.text: Friendly hostesses in the front and food was great. Got the sticky bun, lobster Benny and friend got the croissant sandwich which she enjoyed.  1 star for our server. No greeting, no introduction. I'm not the one that works here so why am I the one that has to greet you? No "thank you" when dropping off the check. I get better service at the McDonald's drive-thru on Rainbow and Lake Mead. No offense to those guys, just an honest observation.  Not in a hurry to come back if servers doing the bare minimum and just being an order-taker is the norm here.   I dislike writing negative reviews because I'd rather focus on positive experiences and would normally not even mention the bad places. Although the food was actually quite good, the service or lack thereof left a bad taste in my mouth and I just couldn't just let this one go.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Benedict
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky bun

fPaKFkMdeTMbxd5qmTnF2Q.text: Been to Hearthstone on several occasions. The food is decent but definitely not great in relation to the price. The service has always been polite but very slow. They tend to have an almost "we'll get to you when we get to you" sort of vibe. It may be worth a try, maybe coming in sometime and just sitting at the bar. There are definitely better options nearby.

WUIHqVb7giYqvYzgVgfZxw.text: This place is so mouth watering and delicious.There was an hour wait so I would make a reservation or just eat omg the bar area, which we ended up doing. I started with the butternut squash soup what was accompanied by a little gruyere grilled cheese. This portion is def good for a lunch item by itself because I was almost too full for my entree when I was done. My fiance got the French dip which was amazing. It was served on a pretzel but and the Jus was perfectly salty. For my entree I ordered the truffle pasta hold the peas. The noodles we huge and a bit too al debate for my taste but nonetheless I would pour that sauce on anything. The only downside were the my side of Brussel sprouts came out after we were done with entrees and they opened the big partition from the outside without cranking the ac fan so it got very uncomfortable very quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Pasta
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib French Dip

e6BNa1ONIdQEYb-zOSbBqA.text: Beautiful restaurant.  We enjoy coming here.  Beet salad is great.  Pizza,  meatballs,  the oysters,  the salmon.... you can't go wrong! The cheese and meat trays come on beautifully carved wooden pig backs. Clever! Always great service,  too! Many wonderful places to eat inside Red Rock casino.  But this is one of our favorite.  Go and enjoy!

sJaciqrSR8OB-mIc1eqtZA.text: Hearthstone is located right next to Lucille's! The interior decor is inviting and warm. My friend and I came for a happy hour and we are definitely not disappointed!  Happy hour menu is pretty decent pricing and the portions were good. Just the two of us, we ordered 4 dishes and some drinks to accompany and honestly could've done with just 3 dishes. But we were definitely not disappointed (albeit full).  The sweet potato fries stood out the most! Absolutely in love with the Greek yogurt sauce concoction! This is something I highly recommend getting. The hummus was my second favorite and another strong recommendation. It came with crisps to eat with and they were great.   We also ordered the pigs in a blanket which was very filling but my third favorite. Last was the pizza. Although it was delicious, I can't say it stood out compared to the rest of the items we ordered.    Our server Annie was extremely attentive and helpful as well so shout-out to her! She recommended some awesome drinks that I really loved (can't remember the name but I do know I got the blueberry Moscow mule like drink and one with elderberry). She's also super sweet--would love to have her as my server the next time I'm here!  Happy hour was not disappointing. Would like to come back here for a full meal or brunch next time!

jcp0R5C9zjloYHUU2JBzRg.text: I've celebrated Mother's Day, father's day, and a few birthdays here because I love this place so much. From the attentive service, to the delicious menu, to the specialty cocktails. I highly recommend dining here on Friday and Saturday evenings to enjoy the food and the live music!

umgbOxX4oC9pXxnvkD9Peg.text: Forever my go to favorite. The happy hour here is great, they also have weekday specials for oysters and pizza. The brunch is also delicious and offers bottomless mimosas for you and your friends, great for big parties! I recommend trying the steak and fries, the fried chicken entree, brussel sprout caesar salad, lollipop chicken wings, french dip sandwich and lobster roll. Yum!

3d8tTVxPgVDezOKWKMK51g.text: *Update Oscar was such a great server! He is very knowledgeable about the menu and offered great selections. The bartender Sara is extremely friendly and makes a loaded cocktail! The ambiance is so cute and the hostesses are friendly. If you go in for brunch *SHARE* the French toast. So delicious and filling!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shishito peppers and calamari.

UA2Gp_xF8CdTVw91C8HISg.text: Came here on a Saturday night with my family and enjoyed my experience. Food here is good l, nice ambiance, and the restaurant is huge. It's a nice place to try Around red rock casino if you don't want to go to a typical chain restaurant. Service here was great. I was a bit disappointed because the kitchen ran out of 2 dishes we previously ordered but they compensated and gave us a round of drinks on the house and a 20% discount. I felt that was very nice My server Al made sure we were taken care of. I recommend the DOC pizza, hanger steak, and short rib. Overall good experience, food is decent but I like that restaurant went above and beyond to make sure we had a great time.

hBlgYCkQzaW8AmirKhIwAw.text: Food was just okay, I would prefer Yardhouse next door for for similar type of cuisine and dining environment.  Our waitress was friendly but a little odd.  I didn't take off any tips because I could tell she was trying her best.  We were offered free hummus and chips for a yelp check-in.  But the waitress did it in a creepy way: she didn't proactively offer it to us when we sat down, instead, she pointed at my friend's cellphone with the yelp page and asked "is that yelp? If you check in I can give you a free hummus."  Same waitress also dropped a knife in my friend's lap as she tried to set the table from between my friend and her baby.    We ordered: - Crab Artichoke Dip - I wasn't really impressed.  It felt like the crab and the artichoke were just mixed in after they were cooked separately, not cheesy at all. (I made sure it wasn't a dairy-free dip) - Truffle Mushroom Pizza - this was good, I'd order it again.  Not too fancy, exactly what you'd expect from a truffle mushroom pizza. - French Dip Sandwiches - the hip pretzel roll almost ruined this traditional dish! Other than the pretzel roll, everything else is good.  - Lobster Roll - I didn't taste it, can't comment on it - Vegan Pesto Zoodles - best item of the evening despite it being vegan. The pesto with the addition of the tomatoes cut the salt down and provided a very nice balanced flavor.  - Butterscotch Pudding - a bit too sweet for my liking but everyone else enjoyed it.

rtykuiDzi5tK3SQPaZGcWA.text: Hostess was nice. Server was horrible. No personality and not friendly or informative at all.  Rarely came to the table after taking the order. He actually didn't check on us for a half hour after ordered. It took over 20 minutes to receive a drink after ordering. It actually didn't come until after I complained to the manager. Food took over an hour. The food was good but because of the poor service, we were disappointed.   My opinion is if the server isn't happy, he should leave. I'm sure there are many people that would appreciate a job there.

MgAUMJzu9DWIuPvAsxOYSA.text: Came here on Sunday for the first time in years. The design inside is modern rustic with lots of natural light from the outside. There's also a patio, but nobody wants brunch outside in the Vegas summer. My friends enjoy the bottomless mimosas, but I'm not a big drinker, so I can't comment on that aspect. I had the chicken and waffles, which was good. The syrup was the right amount of sweet and the waffle was light and fluffy. I wish the chicken was actual pieces of chicken (drumsticks and/or thighs) rather than strips. At $18, it's a bit overpriced. Nevertheless, I used a coupon from the Stations promo book ($20 off $60), so that brought the meal closer to its True value. Overall, it was an enjoyable meal.

4XuIqj0VK2lwMRv4spTUaQ.text: Bartenders and service is great, food overall is very good but please take the bacon wrapped dates out of that red sauce. There's no reason bacon wrapped dates need to be in a tomato sauce

uI3L4Gx7fHHn0MFGQlysXw.text: The food and margaritas were absolutely fantastic. The atmosphere was great as well as the service. The only issue is, while the service was great our waiter really wasn't welcoming at all. I was a little bit hesitant to ask for anything. We will still definitely be back though!

Jr4yrpJmySNHOyEWRS3a2g.text: I got to check out this place as I was checked in here for business.  You must check this place out!  They got awesome happy hour selection as well as oysters!  I was lucky to be there when there were the oysters!  Fresh oysters for $1.  Cannot go wrong with that if you are a fan of fresh oysters.    Great ambiance.  as you walk in, you are greeted by an array of fresh seafood on display.  We sat at the bar area to enjoy the flavors of happy hour.    We ordered all from their happy hour menu:  White wine on tap - great selection and a perfect match with the oysters Local Beer on tap- you can never go wrong with trying out their local beers  Sweet potato fries - crispy and yummy with their harissa yogurt dipping sauce  Jalapeno hummus with crispy lavosh - their new take on hummus and pita which I find this delicious  Fresh oysters - fresh and yummy  Had fun at this place with some great food and a pretty cool ambiance.  Service was great!

_d2HZz3dInSb-sU5fefmDA.text: I came here for dinner and drinks and had outstanding service from Jesus! He was extremely helpful with tips on good menu items and was very attentive. A friend and I did the complimentary Thursday wine tasting where we each had 2 glasses each. The wine was average but the appetizers were delicious. The octopus I'd say is a 4.5/5, bacon wrapped dates 4/5 and the peanut butter lava cake 5/5. We will definitely return!

FgFvGoi4T9gljXcnoP5_-w.text: Such a great brunch spot! The food is great, the mimosas are tasty, and the vibe is fun! Ahmed was our server, and he was phenomenal! We never saw the bottom of our 'bottomless' mimosas, he was so attentive, and so friendly! We've followed Ahmed to multiple restaurants because he's just so personable and fun! Definitely a top 5 restaurant, and a top 5 server!

RLbjRzx85d-6msMPrsxAHA.text: Great place to hang out, they had a very modern rustic vibe. Nice music to enjoy and have cocktails. We only had appetizers but they were all delicious and fresh. Staff was very friendly and attentive. If you want a chill place off the strip come here!

SLok_TccqITKT4HXGB225Q.text: Finally, gave this place a try. It was a Sunday when I came in for lunch. I give the decor an A+, but the service wasn't that great. The food was good but could've been better considering the prices. I started with the lollipop chicken wings and flatbread pizza. I was going order more food, but the server took too long to see if wanted to order more. By the time she came, I was ready to leave and the I had to flag her down just to refill my water. This is a type of restaurant you just try once, "one and done!"

PXFv8pSjUZp9sNAt8A4zrw.text: Food was pretty good. Service was better. The flat iron steak was below par. The salmon and and the pork neck was by far above par. The chopped salad was SO SO. as for the desserts they were above average, the pineapple upside down and the chocolate dessert (which I don't remember the name) wasn't special at all. Atmosphere is upbeat the decor is refreshing. Cant complain because they had tv's everywhere with the games on!!!! Their specials are intriguing, I will be back!!!

dsl6q-Sv7h7UdEJhjyCV1Q.text: WATERMELON. AND FETA. SALAD.  Let me just lead off with that. A friend had introduced us to it before, but the moment our terrific waiter, Jeff, told us it was a special, I told him he need go no further. That would be the opening salvo for dinner, as far as I was concerned. And I was NOT disappointed. The addition of paper-thin slices of red onions added just the right note of spiciness, along with just a touch of salt and fresh ground pepper.  See there? Just THINKING about that salad got me so damned excited, I didn't go into how we came to have dinner at Hearthstone first!  As intermittent visitors to Red Rock for different dining experiences, we've had various impressions made...some very good, some less-than, (and yes, I AM looking at you, Libre.) The night we came to Hearthstone, we recognized that it was a place we'd passed by several times and been curious about, but never actually ventured in. This visit made us wonder why we'd waited so long!  Jeff was amazing as our server, and made sure that we were well taken care of. As I dove into my watermelon feta salad, (I still DREAM about it), Bear had his favorite, the tomato soup with a salami and brie grilled cheese on the side that was an outrageous-yet-fitting pairing. A single small taste and I swore that I would have it the next time we visited.   Next came the bacon wrapped dates for me, and the chorizo filling and piquillo pepper sauce added just the right notes of spice, heat and savoriness to offset the fruit's sweetness. We divided meatball and pepperoni flatbreads soon after that. I loved the meatball over the pepperoni, because the short rib-based meatballs were especially different...and yummy!  The main event for me was, hands down, one of the heartiest and best chicken pot pies I have ever had. I'm from the old school, and I remember when the 'best' pot pies as a kid were the Swanson brand, four for a dollar at the grocery store, with crust on the bottom, crust on the top and more on the sides. The buttery, golden, puff pastry top on this, however, told me that my 'childish' tastes were far behind me now, and I could be grateful for that. The steamy, creamy filling, studded with hunks of dark and light chicken meat and roasted veggies were a thing of incredible beauty that deserved to be photographed.  But my taste buds scolded me with "ain't nobody got time for THAT!" I surrendered to their whim.  Meanwhile, Bear had the fried chicken platter, but asked for and got mainly breast meat, which was impossibly juicy and tender, the way breast meat usually ISN'T at most places, with a tendency to be dry and overcooked.  With a fresh bacon-cheddar biscuit and all the other accoutrements though, there was so much there that he couldn't finish the platter, and ended up having to box up the remainder.  No problem, of course, because it made a scrumptious lunch for him a day or so later.   The laid-back, very rustic decor, the excellent service, the unbelievable food.  Hearthstone is definitely on our radar for another visit in the very near future, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great example of "New American" cuisine.

ymH16OYSiypu50CPsvkhjw.text: The only reason it's getting this 1 star is because the food is pretty good and the busser kept our waters full since we were on the patio. That was important to me but everything else during my experience was awful. My girl friend and I went for Sunday brunch and our champagne took 15 minutes and then when the waitress brought our drinks, she walked right away and we hadn't even ordered food yet. She was extremely slow and seemed confused and disorganized which led to the awful service. I'm in the service industry and she was definitely not busy. The food took awhile to come out but when it did it was great. When we were finished, it took the server so long to come back to the table that I had to go up to be bar to order another round of drinks and I NEVER do that!. That also took quite awhile because the bartender was busy doing dishes and stocking them instead of paying attention to guests. I understand there is cleaning and upkeep involved throughout the shift but he kept me waiting to long when there were only 2 people at his bar and no drink tickets waiting to be made. After everything, we walked through the restaurant to leave and a group of our friends were actually leaving without getting their food because the service was bad (from another server) and everything was taking a ridiculously long time. It was interesting that we had different servers and different group sizes yet we had he exact same issues as each other. When telling this story to a relative, they also had a bad experience there for a special birthday dinner. This is just ridiculous. I will never be back to this restaurant unless they guaranteed that drastic changes have been made.

iy8-wo0_nCTzM1BpiSjdVQ.text: Ok ok ... I made it a weekend of crunching and although all were great .... If I could give 6 stars it would be here for sure! There was nothing that my table ordered that we didn't like!!!! One day later I'm already planning my next visit! I loved every bit of this place from the food... Prices... Bottomless mimosa... Decor... Even our waitress... (Who's name escapes me but I think it was Kay or Kate and she's married to a man from Ireland or something... She was so awesome!) tip: get bottomless mimosa and also that amazing chocolate cinnamon roll sticky bun ... My BF doesn't even eat sweets and he devoured it!!! I really can't say enough. And only can hope that dinner is just as great

KD2yDyWEqTW38pX2QF0Ugg.text: Our unpleasant experience began at the hostess counter, where we were ignored by her, until I spoke up and asked for a table. She then proceeded to seat us, (without menus). As we waited for someone to acknowledge us, 17 minutes went by and no one had given us a menu, no recognition what-so-ever, we left. We proceeded to eat elsewhere and we will never return.

4XPGp-j_oAPOc9mLVJlGhw.text: Impeccable service!! Jason was absolutely amazing!! I've never experienced such amazing service!! The food and drink were great but Jason never let our glasses get below half way empty, talked over the menu and was great company all around! Will definitely be back for Jason if nothing else!

x3TNRog9u0kQssAxNGNAOw.text: My family and I have been coming here since it opened and it never ceases to amaze me. We've only had one not so great experience but it was due to a hostess that no longer works there and management reached out to rectify the situation.   Absolutely love the food, drinks and the employees. They treat you like family, which is nice nowadays.

wCSh7O9LGyzMhrq3Zto5tA.text: Hmm, serious mixed bag experience. Made a rez for brunch through open table. Arrived five minutes early and was told the table would not be ready for 'a few minutes'. Asked if we could be seated on the patio, and was told we could be seated there right away. Fifteen minutes later we were shown to a table right under two speakers. Ok fine, I'm old and like to converse quietly with my companion, not have to yell at each other.   Server came with menus and asked if she could bring water or mimosas. We opted for water, me assuming we could consider our drink options after perusing the menu. The hostess had mentioned a chicken sandwich served on a biscuit that was a favorite of hers, but I did not see it on the menu. The server came back and I asked about said sandwich. She had no idea what I was talking about. My husband ordered the egg croissant sandwich, only to be told they were out of that. Wouldn't it make sense to mention, as she dropped off the  menus, the items they were out of???  I ordered the nicoise salad. She did not ask if we wanted anything else to drink. After a few minutes I asked for a drinks menu, which she brought. The ladies at the next table were drinking a lovely pink concoction in a champagne glass. I asked what that was and was told it was a watermelon mimosa. "Ohh, that sounds good", I said, and was THEN told they were out of that too. Again, why not tell me you don't have an item before I orderr it???  As a consolation I ordred a glad of rose champagne, which finally arrived nearly at the end of our meal.   On the upside, the food was fantastic, no issues there. Just felt like the service was weird and awkward. Might go back again, might not.

FjrvvFAQiOrX4svegUt6Mg.text: I had the Tuna Tartare to start. Delicious & large portion. Great flavor & a little spice. It was my first time there & the server Jennifer suggested the bacon wrap dates maybe next time. For dinner I again asked Jennifer for her suggestions & she explained every dish to me. I ordered the Calabrian Shrimp Pasta & she asked me if I liked spicy & I said yes. It was nice & spicy how I like it & again a nice sized portion. Jennifer than asked if I was interested in dessert & I had to pass because I was happily stuffed. I will be back & ask Jennifer to serve me again!

r8DqZ_5TnTCtyjuJWF8h-w.text: I made a reservation via OpenTable; simple as always. Six of us got together (my friends like to call us the "Supper Club") and shared everything. I'd highly recommend a group because it worked out so nicely. The space is beautiful with a great vibe. However, all of us thought it was a bit loud as we had to yell at each other to have conversation.   Our server, Tien was FABULOUS! She was the epitome of the perfect server. She was very welcoming. Since we were all first-timers, she explained the menu, made food suggestions, and made sure we knew how much food was in each dish so we had enough for everyone. We really felt like she was looking out for us. She was present throughout our meal and even bought us two of their most popular desserts! As we were leaving, she offered to take a photo of our group as well. Tien went above and beyond her duties and made it a truly wonderful evening! Ask for her and you won't be disappointed!!  Overall, I enjoyed our meal. There were a few stand-out dishes that I would love to eat again. There were also items that warranted shrugs, however, I'm intrigued enough by what did well to want to try the rest of the menu.   Deviled Eggs ($9): Pimento cheese, whipped yolks, and Schmaltz mayo. Three to an order. These were good, but didn't taste particularly different from every other deviled egg I've had as of late.   Charred Octopus ($18): Smoked potatoes, rocket, and chorizo aioli. Fantastic octopus; well prepared. I loved the addiction of capers. The potatoes were nice as well.  FG&J ($18): Foie gras mousse, Virginia peanuts, and housemade jelly. Very yummy! The mousse had a wonderful flavor and was very smooth. Great with the jelly on their delicious grilled bread.  Baked Ricotta ($16): Truffle honey, black pepper, and gouda. This was definitely a favorite at our table. The ricotta was delicious! I loved the caramelization on top of the cheese and the side of truffle honey was a wonderful complement. Amazing with or without their bread.  Mushroom Flatbread ($20): Fromage blanc and gouda. A mushroom "pizza" with some truffle element. Nice crust. Nothing spectacular about this dish for me. Perhaps a different flatbread selection might wow me?  Whole Roasted Pig Rilette ($7): YUM. I liked that this rilette was a little meatier and the flavors were fantastic! I could eat this ALL DAY (I love rilette!).  Bone Marrow ($12): This was also good, but it didn't have any stand-out flavors. It was just plain ol' bone marrow. I didn't go back for a second bite.  Peanut Butter Lava Cake ($9): Butterscotch and Roasted Banana Brown Butter ice cream. The cake didn't interest me, but the ice cream was nice!  Butterscotch Pudding ($9): This was FANTASTIC. So yummy!! We couldn't get enough of it! And that Cookie Butter Crunch in it? Amazing. Home run.  Honey Olive Oil Cake ($9): This beautiful olive oil cake is drizzled (slightly drenched, but I'm not complaining) with honey and served with Blood Orange Sherbet and orange segments. SO GREAT! I absolutely loved this dessert. I may have loved it more than the pudding.

JZc-bZdhfbdO5AGqZPgSyQ.text: Went back and it was wayyyyy better still love the the restaurant set up.

XcoHrWFHWy3a-JwjnX6S9A.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat and hang out with friends when I have the time. I use to come alot. Delicious food and great drinks. The staff is polite and on the ball. Great service the waitresses. Kate was amazing. She was always on time and was super friendly

v9oUXfpxyVvGIFVFnCzguw.text: Rigo is the BEST food server ever. His customer service is outstanding. The food was delicious, but it's Rigo's 5 star customer service that will keep us coming back to Hearthstone at The Red Rock. #sistersclub

uRZUKP9mePw9qCpB8aRn5w.text: Yup, this gets 3 stars for being "A-OK" (according to Yelp's wording). It's exactly what it was. Went for brunch with another experienced diner today, and we had both been eager to try out this place. Due to some of the following experiences, it seems the restaurant could use some polishing.  Being that this was a business meeting, I wasn't registering some mishaps, nor did I want to deviate from the conversation. But, I left unsatisfied from the meal, womp womp:  The patio, where we sat, was quite lovely. (No wait today at 11:30 on a Sunday, but we had made a reservation.) The sun moved its way over over the course of the meal so I started working on a neck tan.  The waitress didn't come over for some time, and when she did, she got the job done. No frivolities. I barely got in my coffee order because she had taken my entree and didn't ask if I wanted any coffee or something to drink.  Menu looked great and I ordered the California Benedict and a coffee. My acquaintance ordered the salted caramel French toast. When the plates were presented, the dishes looked very appealing.  My coffee didn't arrive until two minutes into eating my entree, and the coffee, despite being poured from a server, was lukewarm. (After I asked to freshen up the coffee, there was a server who was attentive to my coffee needs.)  But both our entrees were lukewarm upon service (acquaintance had even commented on her French toast). My Benedict was ordered poached soft (oddly, the waiter seemed surprised that I was distinguishing the egg firmness), and it came out poached medium-hard. There wasn't enough Hollandaise to help soften the toasted English muffin. Half the potatoes were on their way to getting cold at the immediate outset of eating. Hey, listen, it's hard to talk business when you're crunching on your crispy English muffin, dry/shaved ham, and firm yolk.   I think someone who commented below said they really liked the Eggs Benedict they served up here... I'd like to invite them to Victoria, BC, the Land of the Most Amazing Eggs Benedicts... I had my expectations up because there are two EBs on the menu, and it's not a very large menu. The Hollandaise was just fine, but I would try ordering something else off the menu. (I think I just miss Victoria's Bennies. Sigh.)

aqm4iBFmRl34OPtokxK1eA.text: We love Hearthstone and especially Alex! She's a doll and makes our dinning experience special. The food is always delicious and our favorite appetizer is the baked ricotta, a must try!  Inside or out Hearthstone is a beautiful casual dining experience!

LwsclUt4FSE_7ABeTT-vsQ.text: Great yummy "flavor galore" food.   Had West Coast Oysters.  Yum!  Tuna Tartar! Yum.  Prime rib was smoked and crusted.  Best Prime Rib I have ever had. Hands down!  Rotisserie Chix fantastic.   Nice to see affordable food in Vegas since Strip is out of the world expensive now.   Great cocktails.   Totally enjoyed,   4 stars only because of loudness of place.   Maybe some sound proof help?  And kids playing game right behind me acting up.   Can't wait to return!  Service while seemed a bit inexperienced.  Did provide excellent service!

5KnZJb12Qo_PCMki986n7w.text: Located inside the Red Rock Resort Casino this Gastropub surpassed my expectations.  It's among the top places to dine with friends and family outside the Vegas Strip.  Food -Best Fried Chicken I've had in a long long time.  Juicy and moist inside with a crisp and tasty outside, perfection.  They also drizzle a little honey on top that really adds to the dish. -Gastropub is code for 'small portions but quality', that being said I felt that all our entrees had adequate food portion, and the quality was there.  Atmosphere -I was expecting the 'corporate hipster facade' but this place is more than that.   -It has a great energy and the live band was awesome.  They played pop standards but also mellowed them out a bit for a relaxed vibe.  I loved it.  Service -Someone wrote in a review that they only hire 'hot people' which can be a red flag sometimes.  While our server was not hard to look at she was also very informed on the menu and took great care of our party of 6. -Guy with water brought his A game that night.  My glass was always full.  I would highly recommend this place as it is one of the best dinning experiences I have had inside of a casino.

AIkDMxViI5P7lMCQ7w-oKQ.text: Tried this awesome place out and sat at the bar and Taylor was great made you feel as if your a regular here . Wish I lived closer and I would definitely be one . The atmosphere was Great Different then most places you would go to . They have live music on Friday and Saturday very relaxing and chill . Definitely a great place to chill at after a long work week. Great service and great food defiantly try it out and say hi to Taylor you will be very happy you went .

oYEZ1x8V3k9AetCwXoQKZQ.text: My wife and I had our Valentines dinner here and we had a wonderful time!  Our server Jose was very helpful and his timing was perfect!  Now the food...they menu is very diverse and interesting, with that said, the food that we ordered was great!  For our appetizer we ordered the meat and cheese platter...good stuff!  My wife order the truffle pasta....to die for...and I order the skirt steak, medium rare....so good!  We are already planning our next visit.....we highly recommend this restaurant!

3BTHo0yT6vrXa39CdL7NOw.text: A delicious meal and atmosphere. Our server Devon was beyond reproach and provide us with an excellent evening out.   We started with oysters and baked ricotta with truffle oil, followed by the Halibut special, plus Shrimp and Grits closing with the chocolate lava cake.   All in all it was a special experience with good people, great food and outstanding service. We will be here again very shortly!

x-Dhky0zq3O0Gy9Kih2Q9g.text: My friend and I really enjoyed our brunch. Ahmed waited on us and he was more than attentive. We both had the prime rib French dip. It was really good. I'd go back and have it again.

fnovIZUfsmZV9oK6rLrVhA.text: Service was great. Ahmed was very helpful and knowledgable about the menu. The portions were generous. I had the corned beef which was excellent. Everything looked great. Can't wait to head there for happy hour next or Wednesdays for oysters.
