arrEiIwTZ0i7cQ4k-mAAvA.text: So I attended a private function here and afterwards decided to dine. Sadly it was one of the worst experiences. After waiting for 20 minutes for someone to greet the table, I was forced to flag down a busser and ask for my server. After another 10 minutes I had to go to the host stand and ask for someone. No one was there. So I went to the bar and asked the bartender. After another 10 minutes my server finally arrived with no apology for not coming to my table for the past 40 minutes. I should have left then, but wanted to give the food a chance as I glanced around the room and it did look and smell amazing.   I was not let down when I ordered the Butcher Steak Tartare and it was delicious. Very flavorful. So I was optimistic on my entree of the Hanger Steak.  I ordered it to be medium rare. It came out very rare. A cool jelly texture. Normally I can eat a slightly under cooked (or slightly over cooked) meat. I couldn't do that this time. An undercooked Steak is not nearly enough to give a bad review. It happens. I had to send it back. The server was very apologetic. What was bad was when they returned with my Steak. It had clearly been put back on the same plate, but that is not the worst of it. My fork that was on the plate when it went back to the kitchen was returned along with the used plate!  I am sure as the fork had a small piece or parsley from the potato that was on it when it left the table.   I was disgusted and refused to eat it. I asked for the manager who did remove it from my bill. What angers me is although he apologized, it was his complete lack of caring. He said that he was "sorry I didn't like my Steak."  Liking it was not the issue, it was the fact that the same plate and utensils were returned. If this were my home kitchen, it would be different. This is a restaurant kitchen and I have no idea who touched my utensils, where they were placed or what was done to them while my meat was being cooked and put back on the used plate.   Rest assured that in addition to this review, a letter is being sent to the restaurant, Red Rock Casino and the Clark County Health Department.

g8H-ihlUfHP5b6b2_h0yGQ.text: Food was delicious. Jocelyn was great, very attentive and an excellent bartender. Overall very satisfied

2nEyOL0ItYI0xTS9RZuHzw.text: This is my favorite place at red rock. The service is always amazing and the food is outstanding. Particularly, Jocelyn, our bartender was the best! She was quick and always had our orders right. We'll come back just to see that smile. Came for the oysters, stayed for Jocelyn!

RmqsHUdt1Qa959CLZHbBXg.text: I recently ate here for one of my friend's birthdays. The food was very good! I recommend the jalapeno hummus and the calamari. The calamari was on point! Nice and fresh.   I really wanted to give Hearthstone 5 stars, but we were pretty disappointed with the service we received. We had to ask our server for refills a lot of the time and originally our drinks were forgotten about. The server kind of seemed overwhelmed or maybe she had her mind on other things.   Other then that, I eat here again! So I do recommend it to anyone who is looking to try a new place with a twist on beer and seafood.

qcMmmThrh3rz_cge4vQLxA.text: Sunday Brunch was great!  Hearthstone does not disappoint, but the service today made the experience!  Thanks to Ahmed and Brian for taking such good care of us!!  We will definitely be back!

PkAra3Oik1L_1orpupQPOw.text: This was my first time at Hearthstone. Great selection of cocktails and delicious dinner! My server, Ahmed was very friendly and helpful with recommendations. I'll definitely be back to have that Short Rib again! Yum!

vzqV4V7JAVXJvSkCFfJrFw.text: Sunday brunch here with friends was an incredible experience,Michael our server was so nice and our bottomless mimosas were truly bottomless with him..OMG! Food was delicious too. First of many visits. Check hours before coming mostly open in afternoons 5pm. Sunday I believe is only day they open early for breakfast/brunch.

TyNUMv9U6pIqiy7ogsxxMA.text: Hearthstone is awesome.  Kelli is the most awesomest server ever!    The food is great and we were really wowed by how friendly and personable Kelli was.  She is definitely a keeper - give her a raise!

yL6arQgrla3ACL5na4mAnA.text: Had dinner here during happy hour. We had oysters on the half shell, zucchini pesto and a cheese pizza. Being from the NW and being used to getting fresh oysters locally, we were cautious about ordering them. The staff assured the oysters were fresh and they were right. Overall the food was very good.   It's a good sign when you see a Master Chef winner that lives local eating at a restaurant.   More importantly, our server Kelli was excellent.  Not only was she friendly and personable, she never missed a beat. Not once did we have to try to find her. She anticipated our needs, noticed when our glasses were low and made sure our food was what we expected.  Thanks Kelli!

TqgwAJBoa5VDttmY7uAMNQ.text: My husband and I wanted a relaxed atmosphere with good food, and we found it at Hearthstone! He had a mountain of fried chicken, and I had the truffle penne. Both were incredibly filling and tasty. Plus, our server Ahmed was great! He was attentive without hovering, and also friendly and knowledgeable. We'll definitely come again soon!

b2TvveC7EeOR1cYBRnyKHg.text: Heyyyy!i love this place!!the food is great the service is great we had a super waiter ask for him!his name is Ahmed he is pleasant and very pro!!because this is more than just a restaurant its an experience and when both food and service is excellent it deserves a 5*!!!we will def be back!!

QLAG3WThSeCEB8chhI17kA.text: We tried Hearthstone over the weekend for my mothers birthday celebration. Unfortunately we didn't order any steak, but we did have the prime rib, octopus appetizer, and Brussels sprouts slaw. The prime rib was good, but not amazing. It had an almost smokey flavor. The slaw was also good, but not grand because it lacked flavor. The show stopper was the octopus appetizer, which had a charred outside and soft inside. Paired with the sauce, it was exquisite! The martinis were wonderful, but it's a little difficult to mess up a dirty martini. I'm glad we had a coupon because I would have felt like I overpaid. The ambiance of the restaurant certainly made up for the food quirks.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the amazing chocolate cake my mother received (compliments) for her birthday. It was very rich and very delicious!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus appetizer and dirty martini. The patio is a gorgeous spot.

hS-SLci3NCmc4iX9CFgWLA.text: Ahmed is the best and knows the menu inside and out! He's recommended multiple things to us and every time we're extremely satisfied. Hearthstone is great!

AKTg_a60lqxkl7UTIxQIPQ.text: Great date spot specially with the live music the food was good but the service can improve. I've been here before for the happy hour at the bar but today my husband and I decided to go for dinner. While waiting for our table we sat at the bar, no one acknowledged us and I wanted to order a drink but that didn't happen. Once we were seated at our table everything went as expected. The prime rib was excellent except it wasn't as hot as I would like. All in all everything was a above average.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup, Crispy Sweet Potato Fries, Crispy Calamari, Chopped Salad, Prime Rib*

OQNKMTfl2PV_yb57sA2C0A.text: I ate here on 1/21. The overall experience was horrible. I came here with many friends for my birthday dinner. I was initially impressed with the restaurant as the atmosphere is very nice and the servers were also nice. My experience quickly soured. Once my entire party arrived it took about 20 minutes for someone to take our order for drinks and appetizers. After 30 minutes our appetizers came out. We had ordered the meat and cheese platter, bacon wrapped dates, and the baked honey ricotta. They delivered two ricotta dishes to us and no dates. The dates took another 8 minutes to arrive. Our drinks arrived after the appetizers arrived. This was a common theme. We would order drinks and they would either be forgotten or arrive about 25 minutes later.   We all ordered our main dishes at the same time. When the main dishes arrived only half the table got their food. The table waited about 10 minutes for the other half of the table to receive their food. When it became clear that the other half was not going to receive their food the first half started eating. After another 15 minutes passed and having to watch half the people finish their plates we finally received MOST of the other half of food. I still had to wait another 5 minutes for my plate. 3 of us ordered the chicken (It was hyped up to be the best fried chicken 2 years running), The chicken was oily and very bland. Would not recommend.  After we all had received our food we did not see our server again for another 20 minutes. We then asked for our check and asked for them to be split the server initially said they could not split the checks. It took about 40 minutes to receive our check. when we did receive our check the server told us "Sorry for the wait don't worry about tipping". They had already added gratuity on anyway. It took another 25 minutes for them to cash us out. At some point during all of this a different server came in to apologize to us for the long wait. We asked to see the manager. The manager seemed disinterested and did not apologize to the group. Instead, he spoke to one individual in our group. It is my understanding that one dinner entree was comped from our check. In my opinion, the whole thing should have been taken care of.   I will never come back here again. Service is terrible. Food is overpriced and the manager Travis was very disinterested and seemed to want to just sweep the whole thing under the rug.   One more thing. We were seated in a semi private room off to the side. Throughout the night the servers kept coming into the room to grab supplies for other tables. It felt like we were sat in a room that was part storage room.

3XOZx6ECZl2dXaFtzI4b0A.text: If I could give zero or negative stars I would. The ABSOLUTE most terrible experience I've had at a restaurant ever.   For the price of the food, the quality isn't bad. But the service is just awful for no reason either. The place wasn't terribly busy and there seemed to be an adequate amount of staff but for whatever reason they were just not attentive to the tables. Everything came out in slow motion: 40 mins for a beer, 30 mins for wine and over an hour for food.   That wasn't the bad part though. We were waiting 30 mins just to get the check let alone pay for the bill. After everything came out slower than grass growing we asked to speak to the manager to discuss our experience. He came in briefly and turned around quickly when he heard us complaining to the server. I literally had to run after him to even talk to him. He apologized, but you could tell he didn't really care what I had to say.   After 3 hrs total at this place with terrible service, I will not return. Not sure where the 4 star service was today.

FDGNgbSzkNBf-2QFY7muBA.text: The restaurant is outstanding. The new menu is amazing. Management is fantastic. It is a great experience. We love going there.

xurbV7glEi621auV9Mi9bg.text: 5 stars for the waitress service 3 stars for the ambience  3 stars for the food  2 stars for the noise level 2 stars for the host lady  2 stars for the manager  I made a request to place us at a quieter place, the host lady brought us in front of this guy who shouted like some crazy person in front of the sports TV all night long. He is the only one who shouted so loud and everybody was looking at him, yet the host lady sat us right in front of this guy. So we requested to be seated in another quieter corner again.  The host lady is friendly, but didn't pay much attention to what the customer really wants.   The restaurants is big and modern, it's a bit cucina enoteca-ish with a sport bar touch.   You needs to order the suckling pig one day in advance, so no roasted suckling pig for us.   -++ Wood roasted octopus: The octopus is a bit chewy, however together with the nice saba glaze and the other ingredient on the plate, it's a a hearty bites. It didn't wow me, but it wasn't bad either.   --+Carbonara pizza: The pizza smells great, the flat pizza wasn't very thin, the pizza dough is a bit thick and chewy, it's like eating New York style pizza. The pancetta is inedible, because of the extremely saltines. If the pancetta is fat, it could be a nice bite, however the pancetta is lean, that makes the meat overly salted. We needs to scratch off the pancetta from the pizza, it's a pity, because it smells really great.  ---Rotisserie chicken: The chicken meat was a bit powdery, but it's pretty juicy and tender, until we almost finish the chicken and we realized, the juicy and the tenderness of the chicken is not because of their cooking skill, it's because the chicken is raw. The chicken meat close to the bone, about half inch is raw.   We told the manager about it, she came and saw the chicken was almost "finished", she still charge us for the raw rotisserie chicken, because she thought we almost finished the chicken. Well, if I didn't dig into the chicken, how would I know the meat inside of the chicken is raw?  ---Clam with crushed tomatoes: The clam is fishy and tasteless. There is no salt in this dish at all.  And there is no tomato inside this dish, not even a piece of tomato skin. The manager did refund us the dish, because there is no crushed tomato in the dish.   --+ Heartstone secrets dessert: It looks fun, because the balls were black(soaked in berry juice) and it's topped with flower. It was pretty chunky and very sweet.    The service from the manager is off because the manager refund the money for the stale clams, but not for the raw chicken. The reason for not refund the chicken is because we almost finished the chicken. That's not logical.  If the chicken contain salmonella, the money to get a lawyer should be more expensive than the refund I assumed.   Not so smart!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HS
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I don&#39;t recommend for their roasted raw chicken

TAEl4FDgUvxlRJasbJtrEg.text: Unfortunately I don't have a banana for scale- but please do take a minute to drink in the photos that demonstrate the laughable portion sizes of an $18 order of chicken wings. Listen, I'm all about comedy and good company so I'm not terribly disappointed, but if you work way too hard for your money and you're hungry, do yourself a favor and go to....well, basically anywhere else.  $22 burger, $40 for 4 scallops, $25 fried chicken, $46 for sirloin.... See what I mean about comedy?  Ambience- hipster and tired (granted, many may not be wore out yet by this feel) Menu selection- limited Food quality- very good Drink consistency- poor Food quantity- knee slapping funny Service-good

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PYq9f65QzXUd4sldKfXLgA.text: Bottomless mimosas, ham and cheese croissant and egg white omelette are favs on the menu.  Have to try chicken and whole wheat waffles next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OzrcIyKxGbY5e_EoJRy4Dw.text: What an awesome experience! We were here 2 nights in a row. Josh was our sever both nights and we could not be happier with he food and the service. It's rare I feel inclined to go out of my way to leave a review, but we were so pleased with  all Hearthstone had to offer, we could not refuse! Last night was $1 oysters, best I ever had and tonight is wine tasting! What more could you ask for?  We will be back :). Thank you Josh !

VTqtsnXb_nALcWNzAyEQOA.text: My family and I just had an incredible meal at Hearthstone Kitchen. Make sure you ask for Ahmed. He made our evening amazing. Wonderful suggestions and amazing personality. The Brussel sprouts, mac and cheese, fried chicken, and cookie with ice cream left us 100% satisfied. It is a must when in Vegas and and easy to find at the Red Rock Hotel and Casino. Live music was the icing on the cake and the ambiance is warm and inviting.

DlmU0ys5NUtXMybzSVOJkA.text: We had a coupon (gotta love those Red Rock coupons) and we had a great time! We got there a bit early, so we had a chance to enjoy some wine during their tasting. The pizzas were great (I had the DOC and my friend had the cheese) and the desserts were delicious! The service was all right and we really loved the decor and the ambiance. We shared the peanut butter lava cake and the honey olive oil cake. Both were amazing! I will definitely be back!

u8rpiADYRLvxqiLHjWnCQg.text: Ever since Hearthstone opened last year I'd been wanting to give it a try, so I decided to check it out for brunch. On the website their endless mimosas were listed at $24 but they were actually only $15 so that was a great start.  The restaurant is so cute, the layout very open. It's got a rustic ambiance, I think there were even shuffleboard tables in the back.  The waitress was very attentive and kept the carafes of mimosas coming. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros which were very good. I think I would definitely want to come back for dinner because the menu looked really impressive and I love charcuterie.

WSvio2TLUjXl9J36_bEl0w.text: Review is for bar area. Stopped by for happy hour during Monday night football and the place had a nice vibe going. I wanted to check this place out on our several past visits to Red Rock resort but never made it.   The bar was packed, which is good for business. They have lounge like communal seating; made me feel like I was just hanging at home or at a friend's house. The decor is cool as well. And I loved all of the TVs, no matter where you were seated you could catch all the action.   They have plenty of beers and cocktails to choose from. I wanted to try some food here but we were headed to dinner at T-Bones. Everything looked appetizing on the menu.   Our service was excellent. Jazmin was awesome! She was on her game, going around the bar area to make sure all of the patrons were good to go. She made some good recommendations for my wife's drinks. I kept it simple and went with some Stellas. Thanks, Jazmin for being so nice to us. We always appreciate good service.   We will have to try dinner here on our next visit. Good spot for happy hour. Happy drinking!

3Ux0QpUTGn4NqqQVg810BQ.text: We have dined at Hearthstone numerous times and always enjoy a great meal and drinks! We take advantage of the happy hour and combine happy hour snacks with main menu.   We especially enjoy the bartenders and usually sit at the bar area. Aly really takes good care of us and always look forward when we return. We have been bringing friends there to enjoy our happy hours!

HyU2eI-u89v0XYyDRq-s-g.text: Crystal was amazing , we loved it here. My dear friends just moved to Summerlin . This is the nearest casino. We popped in for 2 dozen oysters on a half shell, and dinner . Great crew , good food , super casino . We will be back

PfhxEcFnLfOdCZkxYRqv3Q.text: Great brunch and wonderful service! Ahmed took great care of us. Will definitely be back for happy hour and dinner!

bY7mIm7iaoyiYmlGJlrWzg.text: The bar and happy hour are probably the only things I can really recommend here. Otherwise this is another example of an extremely overpriced restaurant, who thinks they can get away with $40 pizzas (that are good, but not THAT good) just because they're inside the Red Rock resort.   Rock N Roll Wine nights are always fun, but really crowded. Their patio area is beautiful,  but overlooks the parking lot.  The wines are good. The food is good. The service is hit or miss. But what keeps us away is the pricing...You just don't get the quality or quantity that you should for the price.

-nLIE_D5ZiLWbYURJroEeg.text: Drinks and dessert!! Perfectly wonderful every time.  Hearthstone is my go to for dinner and appetizers too!  Happy hours and oyster nights are something I look forward to as well.  I get amazing service each and every time.  Kate Frost has been my server several times and she has made our Hearthstone experience the best ever!! Looking forward to my next visit and meal at Hearthstone

TB_k7HdlwmSr4PFI66jNaQ.text: Literally 8 min late to our brunch reservation and they wouldn't seat us on Easter Sunday. Just me and a friend and my baby. I have a newborn baby getting out of the house and into the restaurant took a couple extra min and wasn't the easiest thing to do! I won't be coming back there's plenty of other places to go. The hostess' where very snide and uncaring not even slightly apologetic. My husband said why didn't you ask for the manager? I wish I would have but I have a feeling they wouldn't have been nice about it. One hostess walked off and the other one had a smirk on her face when she says you can always go to yardhouse. Thanks! We won't come back!

9yQFKAsNYq53CRS140eCNQ.text: Omid (Salah) was a great and friendly waiter. Good times. Definitely stick to what he recommends

EncjOp-lq_FgiK3zwxkqKw.text: Their happy hour and $1 oysters on Wednesday's is the best deal! Everything we ordered was excellent. Ahmed took very good care of us, was very knowledgeable and attentive. Definitely recommend.

ZMTqRvmeMG2_F_dYeb-jwg.text: Enjoyed a great Sunday brunch with good food and bottomless mimosas!!  The potatoes are so yummy, and the benedict is very good... and you can't go wrong with a place that serves the mimosas by carafe so you aren't constantly waiting for more!  Ahmed was our VERY attentive and friendly server!  We will definitely go again.

rvDOE3VfyTVeKnuXsGk6Rw.text: I absolutely love the ambience here. The service is great. Our waitress was on top of things.   The oysters I had were so fresh! Yum! I loved my mushroom pizza. My hubby ordered some kind of steak which was pretty good too. Their peanut butter lava cake though, dzayammmm. So bomb!  Yelpers, don't forget to check in to receive your free glass of wine.

Hcq4J0z5cDR2c0pKfloRqg.text: The interior design, for me, felt like the restaurant was trying a little too hard. I believe they were going with a "rustic/ Italian/ American" kind of feel, but it honesty looked a bit clashing to my eyes when comparing the furniture. It irked me a bit. When the food came, I was disappointed by the portion sizes..  Then the food came and -drum roll- it was not bad and above average.  The staff was extremely friendly. No complaints, just positive remarks to them for their speed and personableness.   Good place, but has potential to be better!

Vw0--vubnNY4Fam4XED8gQ.text: Great place to hang out and unwind! I had the pleasure to meet Taylor, server/friend.  She made it all worthwhile. Great place to hang out during happy hour and for $1 oysters on Wednesday nights!! Highly recommended!! Come and try it out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spent the night with our gorgeous and friendly server...

5ItUueg3dVpG6zAsbSW_CA.text: Our overall best meal in Vegas.  The fried chicken is insane!  Loved the truffle pizza and watermelon salad.  Excellent food.

ysTEGxxczeJfgh9bk7li1A.text: This place gives me all the feels. You like patio dining with great ambience? Check. You like great food with beautiful presentation? Check. You like a great happy hour menu with food and drink specials on point? Check. This is hands down my favorite spot. I love their 1 dollar Wednesday oyster special. I love their complementary wine tastings on Thurs. I love that the chef walked up greeted me and offered assistance when I was looking for a spot at the bar and there were none. I mean can you imagine looking confused and the chef comes and talks to you?! Chris, you rock and your food is drool worthy. Every person you interact with is professional, attentive and totally sweet. My favorite waitress is Alex, hi girl. Last night for the kickoff of football season they brought out a whole pig and made everyone sliders to go with the 10 dollar blue moon pitchers and 10 buck endless hot wings. I could go on and on...just get here, trust me.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork sliders for football season kickoff

kCPWYluErA-QkYLcUTMAaA.text: I absolutely LOVED this place!! My girlfriend and I came here on our date night and had a really wonderful experience. There was live music which we weren't expecting, so that was awesome. The restaurant has a relaxed hipster vibe that we were obsessed with. Our upbeat and fabulous server Alex was very knowledgeable and made some really great recommendations.   We shared the Lobster roll, which was fresh and perfect, the shrimp cocktail, the Brussels sprouts salad and of course a couple of signature cocktails that were delicious! Everything was exceptional!!!! I only wish I could of had the lobster roll over and over again!  We are already planning a second visit because there were so many different things we wanted to try that sounded amazing! Can't wait to be back!   We also appreciated the fact that Management came up to us to make sure our evening was pleasant. Thanks Danielle! :)

YjqxBumXWoSpwRyBKjgKEg.text: Overpriced food. The food is nothing special,just mediocre . I do not know how this place stays in business

i9VHeMJa97ZcVRvtXO1rJA.text: Awesome happy hour and bottomless mimosas on Sunday brunch. It's not a place that I thought I would love but I did but think what made it special is Ahmed. He just made everything right for us. Go and ask for that guy if he's there.

JIe5NDQFurmNZZMkYhBCGg.text: It is so hard no to compare this place to a similar restaurant called Culinary Dropout (located in the Hard Rock). The ambiance, the style, the server's appearance, and the menu make you think (if you have been to Culinary Dropout) that these 2 places are related in someway. Anyway I decided to take my Mom here for Christmas dinner and I think I made a good choice. Made reservations (which I really dont think I needed) for 3:30pm, so kind of a late lunch/early dinner. Overall, was very happy with the experience. There were a few things that could have been better. We ordered Deviled Eggs as an appetizer (which were excellent by the way) but either the server forgot to put the order in, or thought we wanted them with our meal. Our entrees came out before the appetizer and we had to remind him that we ordered the appetizer. Once we reminded him they did come out right away.  Now on to the main entrees. My Mom ordered the fried chicken. The portions were huge (4 big pieces) and the skin was excellent. Good portion of cole slaw and a nice size biscuit accompanied this meal. And she ordered the "Crispy Steak Fries" as a side. There was nothing special about those, except the size. They are very thick. The menu states that they come with a smokey ketchup. I asked the server if that is the case and he stated it was just a regular ketchup. I ordered the Pappardelle Pasta, which consisted of braised short ribs, ricotta, natural braising juices, & piquillo pepper. My only complaint about this meal was the size of the pasta. It was too wide for my liking, but that is just me. It was about an inch in width, and long. You pretty much need a knife to cut it in to smaller pieces. But overall it had a great flavor. And to accompany this, I ordered the creamed corn. This was excellent. Just the right consistency.   What meal wouldn't be complete without dessert. I ordered the peanut butter lava cake. I would have preferred just a plain vanilla ice cream with this. It comes with a banana/brown butter ice cream. Just left kind of a weird aftertaste. But the cake, the filling, and whipped cream were excellent.  I would definitely come back. Maybe I'll try brunch should I do come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed Corn side
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Steak Fries (with regular ketchup)
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Buttermilk Fried Chicken

a2XiglIz7TwCpeqQ2GrWGw.text: Shane provided excellent service for my friends and I, he was polite, attentive, and very knowledgeable. We dinned in for the taco Tuesday special and the margaritas were spectacular ! They also added a special touch by writing my friends name of her dessert (which was delicious ) to celebrate her birthday ! We will definitely be dining in with him again.

c6NHdu28ZOqDx4N5r7D8kA.text: Overpriced and underfed.  The inside of the restaurant is beautiful and very clean. It was pretty empty for a Thursday night in a casino. The table for 2 was big and comfy and our waiter was great and attentive to us .  We ordered the roasted artichokes for appetizer and was shock to see how small it was for $13. We got two tiny pieces of artichokes and tiny cut potatoes. Not worth it.  For dinner we ordered the poached salmon and DOC pizza. The salmon was delicious and perfectly cooked. My partner didn't like the pizza very much and nothing special about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DOC pizza
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poached Salmon
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Articokes

5-zJ3rlaPq54v7wqZpcoeA.text: We had such a nice experience at Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar. I loved the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant. There was a very talented young man singing and playing the guitar, his music choices were perfect and really added to the ambiance. I just had to order the Abe Froman pizza (Ferris Bueller's Day Off is my favorite movie!) and it was very tasty. My dining companion ordered a skirt steak special and thought it was delicious, however when he received the bill he had a little sticker shock. He asked me what I thought the price of his entree was and I said I don't know, $24? He said no, $42! We took our server's dessert recommendation and it was very enjoyable. Overall it was well worth it, we had such a nice time.

xxu5IcDRTNX0dZ5hfS9I-A.text: Visited for my first time a week ago.  Was very happy with the service of Ahmed.   The wings were probably my favorite.   Will be back again for sure.

50v7uyDeEJtRhwSbiUwKDQ.text: First off, our server, Kyle, was great and the staff makes every effort to please you.  Five stars for service!!  Unfortunately the food was awful!  The lollipop chicken wings were drowning in the buffalo wing sauce.  They may have been better if they just served them naked with a sauce on the side.  The mac & cheese was disappointing.  It was more like pasta in cream sauce that they baked.  It sounded really gourmet on paper but then it was just plain pasta with some sauce on it.  Tasteless.  The pancetta on the carbonara pizza was overcooked and the bottom of the pizza was soggy.  The grilled octopus was good but not memorable.  The  Moscow mule was not good (they need to try the one at the Yard House) and my husband sent it back along with the chicken wings.  (Yes, they were that bad!)   On a positive note, I got a free glass of wine when I checked in on Yelp and Chef Massie made a comeback with the secret dessert.  Three little donuts stuffed with cheese or something with a berry sauce that was perfect - not too sweet!!  I almost didn't order dessert because I just wanted to cut my losses and leave.  So glad we decided to try the dessert.  It was truly delicious!!  The atmosphere is open, airy & fun.  Loved the layout of the restaurant.  It would be a great restaurant if the food wasn't so bad.  Chef Massie needs to taste his food and rethink his menu.  I don't see this place lasting very long.  I started giving this place one star but changed my mind when I saw the effort that the staff was making and after trying the dessert.  Overall three stars because the service was excellent but the food was one star or less.

o4183r-ndh4XCYazXTaAPQ.text: This place is off the hook! Ahmed is BEST! He took care of us! Will definitely recommend this establishment to anyone!

FSdq78fAvEuswAoPSYxxuA.text: Came here for national wing day and they were offering$10 for ayce wings. The food was delicious, but the service from the server fell short. He constantly ignored us and always had an attitude. However, the runners and hostess were great.   For being at Red Rock, I expected more. Sure, every table probably ordered wings, but it felt like he judged our table for being young and cheap. This place should learn to cater to all different types of demographics. There's nothing worse than bad customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings and Wine Wednesday

SagieU1e6L3ZuWyqIU7dJQ.text: Now new at hearthstone you can sit anywhere and get the happy hour menu.  It used to be by the bar only. The bar was full so we sat at a table and Oscar was our waiter.  He was very attentive. We had the oysters which were fabulous and and onion soup was great. The small plate pizza was also very good. Again we enjoyed ourselves because Oscar took great care of us.  Will definitely ask for Oscar when we come back!!!

HjorzSfzTH3O0BdftqMxYw.text: This place is absolutely unique & exquisitely detailed.  A very fresh take on a restaurant.    It feels very east coast, almost Connecticut-esque, meets Palm Beach Polo Club... With a touch of the butcher restaurant district in NYC.    Angel was our waitress & she was really in the ball.  She gave us Great advice and print service.... We of course loved the outdoor patio environment, with the beautiful fountains.   We loved everything we ordered. The truffle hangar steak was so flavorful. I have a whole new respect for hangar steak.   The chef, Has a unique palate & for us, all his unique dishes were a hit.   Definitely coming back to taste some more of his gastronomic creations!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty hangar steak...
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras with homemade strawberry jam.

qu9GDYmUVr2cC4DIH-92aA.text: Food and service is always great! I recommend the French dip...absolutely the best in Vegas!! The bartenders rock!!

Eg74mUOAZyRt7-SRRic4qw.text: I love this place.  Great atmosphere and food is amazeballs.   I will definitely keep coming back.

aRXXNJY4FPz0v8pQEYYkIw.text: The food and the atmosphere was awesome.  Very rustic feel. The live music was awesome!  There was a duet. A guy on guitar and singing and a girl on violin and singing. They were amazing.  The food was great.  My French dip came on a pretzel roll!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Oysters
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese thing. No idea. But so good
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib French Dip on a pretzel bun!

csjF_2kSTB-dwyiEYDnxmA.text: I've been here a handful of times. It's my favorite place to go at red rock. They have a great food and drink selection. The service is always good. This place has a relaxed feel so it's perfect for casual dining. I've tried the everything from the burger, pizza, lobster roll, Mac and cheese, and Tri tip.

KiLVNSsTcbbcIbvBLZ1sOA.text: Great food and atmosphere! The waitstaff is super friendly and the jalapeno hummus is fantastic.

PfUpCga9zAVhDr6fPu33CQ.text: We come here on a regular basis because the food, atmosphere, and service are all excellent. Today was an exception. Unexpected nice weather led them to open the patio without all the needed additional staff. We sat for quite awhile with no service. What is important is that when I brought it to someone's attention they immediately apologized and provided their usual great service - only better - and comped our entire brunch and drinks. Way above and beyond. Our server was Ahmed and he orchestrated all of this. Kudos to him for being a kind and good businessman. He turned what could have been a negative experience into an over the top positive that will keep us coming back and continuing to recommend this great restaurant to friends. Thank you Ahmed, for your amazing service and a wonderful dining experience. You made our weekend!

XLHYGrg4eegglfzpJPk3_g.text: Amazing experience !   It was indeed an experience .  I enjoyed my Valentine's dinner here and I'm so glad I decided  to try this place . The atmosphere , my waitress  she was very attentive and great at suggesting items for us to try !   The food was amazing and everything I order I had tried once before but the  flavors the chef decorated the food with were delightful .    The charred octopus is a must try !  OH ! And I can't forget abt $1 oysters ! Amazing ! Fresh ! My steak was so tender and paired perfectly with the aioli sauce .  I cant  wait to return .

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ybcgvg3srTNXkRupET6xoA.text: I was excited to meet up with a fellow Yelper to try their Happy Hour menu.  We came in just as it was starting.  The bartender was very friendly and accommodating. Of course since they were just opening the area was clean, bright and open.    With a glance at the menu we pretty much knew what we wanted.  We decided to split the Baked Ricotta Toast, Steak Tartar Bites and Chickpea Chopped Salad.  Since all happy hour items are $6, why not?  The Ricotta Toast and Steak Tartar came out pretty quickly.  The delicious flavor of the steak tartar on a perfect wedge toast had amazing flavor.  The pickled vegetables & truffle toast combined wonderfully.  The Baked Ricotta Toast was good but not great.  I expected it to be a little more warm.    After we finished those two appetizers, we were sitting there for a while.  I finally asked the bartender about the salad.  She thought we ate it already.  When she came back she told us it was just sitting back there and no one ran it out.  Hmm. Strange that she would say that.  Again this salad was good but not great.    On our way out another waitress wasn't paying any attention which made her almost run into us.  Well, you would think she would say excuse me or something polite.  I guess my mother brought me up with different values.  The waitress was very rude mumbling under her breath with a look of disdain.    With that thought in my head, I left with a very poor image of Hearthstone.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chickpea Chopped Salad
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Tartar Bites
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Ricotta Toast

q96uRhI1_6UzqnEPgU8XQA.text: Hearthstones kitchen always knocks out great food, but it is a little bit on the pricey side for what you get. We like to come here on dollar oyster Wednesday's because they serve super high quality oysters for a price you can't say no to. They have a great red wine vinegar mignonette that I love with the oysters.  Like I said the food is great! Their Brussels sprouts side is amazing with the crispy bacon. Their truffle mushroom and truffle chicken pizza is a yummy appetizer to share. We also tried their special eggplant basil pizza which was good as well.   For main entrees I've tried the shrimp and grits which had great flavor but the grits were still kind of hard. Another time I had the rib eye steak which was cooked perfectly medium rare. My husband always gets the truffle pasta so I would say he thinks it's tasty. House red wine always good and they have a decent selection of draught beer if they didn't run out of the one you want already (which happens every time we've gone)  All in all great food, nice decor, friendly staff, but not somewhere you'd go to on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XuzSY-qs6OnqQ81DIXY6bQ.text: The food.... spectacular. The service..... Extraordinary. Was perfect for my birthday dinner. They even brought me free dessert!  Thank you to our server Nathan for such attentive service!

zwSJ2rk95uCxQEdqsGYS5w.text: My new favorite brunch intown! The shrimp cocktail has amazing! And chicken waffles my wife had was perfect! Nice vibe inside and all the staff was awesome!

Vl50mMyyVuO6a7ydcnHyFA.text: We came here for a quick happy hour drinks and sliders. Espresso martini and Endless summer for drinks. Jason was our server. Great service. Thanks!!
