q-z8yek0puT5KT3Ulo330A.text: Good happy hour. Oyster Wednesday's is where it's at. Slightly over priced but good atmosphere. Cocktails could be a bit stronger but delicious. I keep coming back for more.

-aL3c06dafHnEynBQTtAzw.text: Easy to make reservations online. Saturday night entertainment was really nice, a guitarist. Oysters on the half shell were nicely presented. Loved the beer and the added $5 tequila shot was perfect for me. My fiance's vodka martini was great, he had two of them. Also loved the fried lemon slices in the calamari appetizer. The truffle pasta with peas was rich and creamy, great flavor, not greasy. Only thing I wish they would have served  bread with the pasta. The sauce was so good, I felt as though I needed bread to soak up the sauce.

tpXydOVymdpNvbkip74v1g.text: Was beyond excited to finally try this restaurant. After hearing they have a happy hour, four of us went by last night to give it a shot. We arrived about 6:20 PM. Happy hour ends at 7:00 PM. We asked to be seated and were told there was a wait and they wouldn't be able to seat us until 7:15. There were multiple open tables and it was made clear by the hostess that they weren't sitting us because of how close happy hour was ending... But whatever, we dismissed that and asked if we could hangout at the bar until our table was available. We waited about 15 minutes at the bar with no one asking us if we needed drinks. So we left into the casino and got drinks while waiting for our table.  715 PM comes around and we head back. Just of curiosity we ask about how much longer. The hostess said they were cleaning our table and we'd be seated soon.... LOL. 7:30 PM comes around and everyone around us had been seated (keep in mind parties that didn't have reso's that came AFTER us too). At this point we're all very patient seeing were familiar with the food industry, but this was irritating. We ask again about the wait.. It was very clear with the hostesses reaction they compelled skipped over us & forgotten us.  She apologized to us and said we'd be seated right away. So we waited... and waited. At this point it's 7:47 PM and we're just over it. So we left to a Public School, they were fantastic! While sitting there, they finally shoot me a call at 7:57 PM informing us of our table being ready....   We all understand things happen, wait times change, but there's also such thing as making sure the customer is well taken care of and informed on changes.....  Overall, we were excited to try a new place for our monthly meet ups, but were all highly disappointed with the service and the forgetfulness.  I definitely do not see myself giving this place a second chance with how terrible they went about things.

CC2qwLsBbCi1hnSTZFOAsg.text: Ok ok I gave this a chance.  Now that being said I was really excited to try this beautiful restaurant.  We came as a group of ten for a holiday meal and we were offered cold tater tots with our meals. Like our 40-80 dollar meals. These were  generic cold half cooked tater tots.  So we all wrote this place off and decided to never come back. Well now everyone I know is like; they offered you WHAT? Um yeah no one else I know was offered tater tots. Like cold half cooked tater tots. Not even seasoned or crispy.  Let's just say I won't be back even though their drinks and Brussels sprouts were amazing.

dD-3ly57RN43Y_jjNEa8rQ.text: I almost took one star off because it took FOREVER for me to get my cocktail. My waiter wasn't all that great either. No matter how busy a place is, it shouldn't affect the quality of service. I've been to plenty of places restaurants where they were able to keep up with both. However, both my husband and I enjoyed our food immensely. He got truffle pasta and beer. I ordered blackberry bliss and bacon wrapped scallops. Omg wow so much flavor! So filling too! I was concerned at the portion size at first because it only had 3 giant sized scallops (especially for the price at $32) but it was actually just the right amount and any more it would have been too much. It was cooked to perfection. Mmmmm so good. Can't wait to go back. Service was ok. But the food and drinks made it so worth it! I want to come back when they have live music.  Love the location too...we went and gambled and drank some more after! There is also a movie theater and bowling if gambling isn't your thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seriously so amazing  bacon wrapped scallops and blackberry bliss

SF3je50NYBccm8h5GzLZoQ.text: Food was phenomenal and service was beyond our expectations. Christian was our server and he was very welcoming, detailed and offered great suggestions. He even got to know us a little bit and addressed my husband and I by name - I thought that was a cool touch, something we've never experienced while dining out. Bottomless Mimosas definitely hit the spot and we will definitely be back again!

xi7KSxKUEz2sp4a5f6D_Dg.text: This place is incredible! I had brunch here for the first time and it was so delicious. Bottomless Mimosas?! I THINK YES! Ive only ever come for dinner and that was very delicious. My girlfriends wanted to try their brunch and I'll definitely be coming back again for sure!   The FRENCH TOAST IS A MUST TRY! Its not as sweet as it looks! It was PERFECT!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7n-tZej6yV_t-058CfrxZw.text: $1 (raw) oyster Wednesdays is the only thing that brought me here. We were a party of 6 and while we wanted to order more, our waitress only let us order 2 dozen oysters at a time so that the oyster bar wouldn't get "backed up". You can imagine how fast we finished it. I have gotten better sized raw oysters for the same deal at Oyster Bar in Suncoast so imagine my surprise when upon receiving our oysters, they were extremely small. We also ordered the steak tartare which was bomb. The poached egg and runny yolk was the perfect addition to the appetizer. I only wish they provide more toast with one order. We did extra order toast, but I actually didn't notice if they charged is for it. The other item we ordered was the Rockefeller oysters - at a whopping $4/each. I'm not too fond of cooked oysters, so they were alright to me, nothing special.   Ambience alone, I really wish I could give this restaurant 5 stars however, the food and the service lacked. The service here was terrible. Between the 6 of us, we ordered 3 entrees all with side dishes. All of the entrees came before the side dishes, forcing us to wait while our food got cold. No exaggeration, myself and my boyfriend waited at least 10 minutes before our potatoes came and by that time our prime rib was cold. At a restaurant that wasn't too busy, we spent almost 3 hrs with majority of the time waiting for something we ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters Rockefeller!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Tartare w/ Truffle toast!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $1 oysters every Wednesday!

8NQUdJcgf67lE0XrqiV5_Q.text: I had such a great experience dining here!  The food was amazing, but what made my experience so awesome was the service!  Our server Gerson was great, very attentive friendly. As well as Anthony who brought our food out was so awesome! They both made it such a fun experience for my friend and I.   Definitely coming back!

9Cu-LwOU-Vxb5ZxSenl9lA.text: My husband and I loved this place. We went on a Wednesday for the oyster special. They were fabulous. We both had prime rib--also very good. Just loved the decor and atmosphere. Our server was spot on as well.  Will return when we come back to Vegas.

-5dmD1HrU_8K3YsV0pL9RQ.text: This venue is absolutely beautiful.  The wood fired oven offers an amazing selection of flatbreads, the fresh shucked oysters are always on point.  Sitting at the bar with Chelsea makes for an outstanding experience, and the wine list has an extensive selection to pair with the amazing menu.

HfwHE2zpTs-qaQ1kI8nlCQ.text: We came here for the Sunday brunch. Bottomless mimosas are awesome, and the food is spectacular. I had the eggs benedict, and my husband had the loco moco. He said it was the best one he had outside of Hawaii. The potatoes are delicious too. I can't wait to go back and try more. The service and atmosphere were great.

HwnIXNNacXGcDzG1GLTzPg.text: Since we were staying at Red Rock hotel, we could've had a choice of any property restaurants to eat at but chose Hearthstone because their menu looked good. We made reservations for 7pm & arrived a bit early. No one was at the hostess stand near the back of the restaurant (where the open patio seating is located) so we waited & waited & waited. Finally flagged down a waiter to get someone to help us. This should've tipped us off that this was not going to be a good dining experience (the restaurant was not even busy!). Finally got seated in the patio area and again waited and waited for at least 15-20 min until our server brought over menus to us (You would think the hostess would give menus to us when we sat down?!). The waiter apologized & said there were issues with the kitchen, etc...(but as a guest, we didn't really need to know what their problems in the kitchen or service were). He explained the menu, let us know the specials, & got our drink orders. Drinks came promptly but the meat & cheese board was a bit slower. When we got the meat & cheese board, it had 3 small slices of raisin toast & our waiter said that he would bring us more. Did we get more toast? Again, we waited and waited (we didn't want to eat up all of the meat & cheese before the toast came). The toast never came until way after we received our entrees (defeats the purpose of having an appetizer) & after we talked to the manager.    FOOD - The review got 1 star for the fried chicken (4 pieces) was good (crunchy with a slightly sweet taste) and the cheesy biscuit (fluffy & moist). The apple slaw was bland & tasteless so that was not touched beyond the first taste. - I ordered the Hanger steak (medium) with steak fries (which turned out to be matchstick/shoestring fries). Meal was served on a cast iron plate but the entire meal was lukewarm (as if it sat too long waiting for it to be brought to the table) and the steak (served sliced) was medium rare. I ate a few pieces on the ends that were on the medium but couldn't eat the more rarer parts.  - My daughter ordered the cheese pizza & it was the worst pizza ever. Too much cheese which separated from the pizza dough and it was oily & rubbery (again not hot and because it sat there too long, the cheese turns into a rubbery mess!). I told my daughter to stop eating it (she already eaten 2 small slices) because she would have a stomach ache later on from the oily cheese.   The manager, Danielle, came by to check on us and I told her about all of the problems we had with the service & food. I gave her an extra star for trying to make it right even though it was a little too late. She was apologetic and thanked me for telling her. She immediately took the pizza & steak & brought back a new steak (this time, the steak was cooked medium and both steak & fries (again not steak fries) were hot). We ordered mac and cheese for my daughter & this also came hot. We got the steak comped & desserts on the house, which we thought we would get to choose but they brought over two desserts for us. One was a chocolate lava cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream (which was overcooked since the "lava" didn't ooze out) & the other was peanut butter lava cake (which the server paired with chocolate ice cream instead of banana ice cream, as noted in the menu). The chocolate one was better than the PB but two lava cakes as dessert? One couldn't have been a different dessert of our choice? We left more than 3/4 of each dessert untouched because by then, we were DONE with this restaurant!    Do NOT go here unless you want to be ignored or have all night to sit & wait for service and if you want your food to not be brought to you hot. There are tons of better restaurants to eat at on and off the strip (see my review for Echo & Rig) where you could spend your hard earned money on. Wish it was better as our trip was for my husband's birthday.

dn2zIGjcAe8VBZnvC9vJ_A.text: Love this spot. I bring all my dates here. We love the oysters. Always so fresh. The Baked Truffle Ricotta with truffle honey and the butcher steak tartar with a poached egg appetizers are phenomenal. Masterpiece!  Watermelon, avocado, arugula and feta cheese salad!? So delicious. A must try, hands down. The Abe froman wood oven flatbread is our favorite pizza on the menu. Sausage, buffalo mozzarella cheese and caramelized onions. Nicely put together by chef Enriqoe and fantastic taste. The hanger steak and scallops are my favorite entrees. Very rich and flavorful dishes. Service is always great, everyone is always friendly and welcoming. We have a great time every time we come to Hearthstone. They always feature wine tastings on Thursdays, 50% off on bottles of wines on Mondays and live music on the weekends! This place is DOPE!

F7jUmFV8TucBD_4loDEJyw.text: This place is my new favorite!!! Jessica G. is beautiful and efficient as a server! She took great care of us and was the perfect level of attentive. Her suggestions were spot on. The entire restaurant is both comfortable and eclectic with a tremendous Restoration Hardware style  I'm an audio video designer and noted that they did a good job with the sound and video systems adding to the decor. The food was fantastic. Well timed and wonderfully spiced. It will be very easy to come back again, again, and again.

aLJAFZ4M6FSpskQi4ITP8Q.text: Great new manager. Very nice and helpful staff. Nice spot for brunch and can't wait to come back in the Summer for patio dining. Huge portions so bring your appetite!

pM7Mz8Mk3c9LJz-xzXGSyg.text: From the baked ricotta, red rock sunset cocktails,  decor, hot servers "jasmine and shaheena" would def come back! Met the managers too, Mary and Tim, very down to earth!! Highly recommended!! Managers were so awesome, gave us a round of shots because we were the center attention! Thank you from texas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The manager and server!!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My server Shaheena, very sweet girl!!

MQpH35O1tQXp9FIKaS1k2A.text: Wasn't expecting food and service this good could exist in a station casino restaurant.

TsFNumndFPtSNt3DUdyxuA.text: Delicious. We sampled as much as we could: dates were so yummy with the chorizo, meatballs, deviled eggs were heavenly, honey bread, Mac and cheese was the perfect example of an adult version, and the steak fry sauce was yum. Also had the quinoa salad with apples...so good!!! Will for sure be back!! It was the perfect amount of food for 3 people.   Service was excellent too! Very chill and friendly.

lmBnRVvo5pRf3ijViFk27w.text: I had the Quinoa Harvest Salad last week and it was the bomb.  I highly recommend this salad.  Perfect size too.

7K94pEc9hwGitzXaXorQCw.text: Late to review but such a great spot within Red Rock resort. Charcuterie, fresh oysters, and finally another good place to eat on the West side!

6Oo5oTtVxoVoUehpoVfUEg.text: I can honestly say that the food is paradise on your palate! Love. Love. Love. this place

pkm4oAa1rCWabA_Gm8oJAg.text: We went back to Hearthstone, sat outside and once again the food was fantastic and the service, perfect. The hostess was very pleasant when she greeted us, our waiter, Brady, brought us out menus and answered all of our questions as we wanted to try some new things. The hanger steak was amazing and the onion soup just delicious! Our overall service was prompt, friendly and delightful. Our busser cleared the table quickly and was very nice. The Manager Russell took the time to come over and introduce himself and check on how everything was at the end of our meal, and we were happy to report that everything was great.  We are hooked and highly recommend you make a visit. Want great service with a smile, ask for Brady!

804dGvy7eQPfbAOzOTzmhQ.text: Great place. I am always greeted with a warm smile from the hostess. Atmosphere is awesome. I take my whole family every Sunday. My whole family enjoys the food. Staff is great and on point. I recommend anyone who enjoys family friendly locations. This one is definitely it. Great location. Great food. What else can you ask for!?!

fKEl7bB0iBj38peP76Tgiw.text: Wonderful ambience sitting outside. A date should be sufficiently impressed with that. The food is uniformly high quality. Don't miss the ceviche for appetizer, perhaps the tastiest item I tried. Hummus? Thumbs up!. Same for the burger entree. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their choices. Seems you cannot go wrong here. We had no issues with the service at all.

A3rOHvJgKq8V_Cnsq4ubLQ.text: We took my wife's mom, who was visiting from Cali, for a nice dinner. That's exactly what we got. The restaurant setting was very comfortable with leather lounge sofas, bar seating, wooden tables and booths. It had a modern, yet rustic feel. Modern rustic perhaps? Great interior design. And 80s music playing in the background. Also a ton of TVs. We had 2 servers. Both were pleasant, knowledgable about the menu, and were always accessible. Excellent service. The food: we ordered a couple of shared plates...ricotta bake with honey, wild arugula salad, and lobster polenta. Oh man, the lobster polenta was so creamy. AmaZing. I also ordered the entree Rotisserie Chicken with arugula salad. It was tender and moist and had great taste. For dessert we shared the Peanut Butter scotch Lava Cake. Wow! I'm full. Good job Hearthstone. We love Red Rock and most certainly will be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rotisserie chicken w/arugula salad

iVNXQdxSKWKCL9f4-pRRqg.text: Love this place! 2 nd time this week.   Recommend the baked ricotta with honey, I give it a 10 The grilled octopus & beet salad were pretty good.  And I highly recommend their pizza.   Favorite drinks are blackberry crush & flower bomb

VmWf9L_fbqXMIIf3_3K8Gw.text: Went with three friends last night and ate at the bar. Omg so good! I could eat the quinoa salad everyday. We had east coast oysters, dates, wings and ricotta, all good. Will definitely be back!

9WDCoNL8L-PV2kUe05QsAw.text: Highly recommended! Went for the 1st time on Valentines Night 2015 (2 of us). Staff was very friendly but service lacked. I highly appreciate not being rushed out of a restaurant but had to wait quite awhile to be helped, water replenished-one time which never happened, didn't get all the food we ordered and staff wasnt very knowledgeable about the food questions I have regarding my food allergies and I didn't feel very comfortable eating.   Ambience, food, and staff friendliness were excellent. Please work on service because for the amount of workers running around, not having good service is suprising. I appreciated the diverse menu-can come here more often, not just when I'm in the mood for one specific cuisine. Really liked the sofas and shuffle board located inside. It's a great place all around.  We ordered off the meats and cheese menu. Prosciutto was very good, braesola-never delivered, Cremont and cheddar cheeses were excellent, honey and other spreads were excellent. Would have been nice to have more bread come with it for the amount we ordered. Mac and cheese, squash were excellent. Pizza was great. Hamburger was good.  Will return and try again. Highly recommended.

a-O9EKu1qOZTuE4eSaf5aA.text: Thanks Tien, food was great and so was the service! Will come back again. Weather is perfect for outdoor eats.

HFyrPTlMLWBU2bBMZ13Z7A.text: I stumbled upon this place the other day and I could not be any happier. We were greeted and sat right away with the help of the hostess. Our server Jessica made great recommendations on what to have for dinner. My girl friends and I shared the baked ricotta appetizer, shrimp pasta, and apple and quinoa salad. They were all so delicious, I couldn't pick a favorite. Service was fast and friendly and I will definitely continue to return. I will also recommend this place to all of my friends!

Zz1xjkXe_O1jPKRkCKtR5w.text: We came when it was first opened and got to enjoy the patio. Ambience is great. Food is ok...portions a bit small. We had the pepperoni pizza and the meatballs, both tasty, though nothing spectacular nor anything that has inspired a return visit. We keep checking if they have spruced up the menu because we did enjoy the atmosphere.

A9NhlwhMWhfmkNqfZ5Z23A.text: Really poor experience. Closed when it says it's open. Staff rude. Was looking forward to brunch. Bad communication

BjLMWapbBf67pYHfS1xCcQ.text: We went for reverse happy hour and sat on the back patio during the live music. Service and the atmosphere were great and the happy hour menu had something for everyone and was reasonably priced. We look forward to returning!

63guESmcFC_wJ5xDPo6G6w.text: I'm only give this place two stars because the food was delicious.  Minus the busser that was attentive, our server was non existent. We would have easily ordered more drinks but weren't able to flag down the server or manager. It was pathetic service for the quality and location of the resturant.  Someone clearly spent real money to build this location but not real money to manage it. They were out of all the juices at the opening of brunch on Sunday. We won't be back.

UW6jia0l1ndlWmSeuoqIaQ.text: Summerlin has really come a long way in the past few years. The decor of this restaurant really makes up for the pricey menu, but what can you really expect. I really enjoyed how the seating and outdoor area was arranged so you really didn't feel like you were sitting in a casino. Will definitely be back to order the tableside mimosa + oyster bar one of these days!

10-vt4NdZ3USdD64PTgPtA.text: I am not one who typically writes reviews, but after me and my wife's experience at Hearthstone I felt obligated to. From the moment we walked in from the casino we received first class service.  The hostess was vast in her knowledge of the weekends happenings and gave us an idea of what was going on while accommodating us on a very busy night.  We ended up sitting at the bar for happy hour,  the food was great. My only complaint would be the size of the portions.  However the service we received from Ali, made up for any shortcomings in the rest of the evening. She made delicious drinks and spent an inordinate amount of time making sure my wife ordered the perfect wine. Her service, attitude and general persona made this experience what it was.  Overall, a very enjoyable experience and would recommend to all. If possible tho, I would sit at the bar and ask for Ali...you won't regret it.

jP2JniE942H5_u2ZG2cY7A.text: My husband and I LOVE this restaurant!  We haven't eaten anything that we didn't like!  Sit at the counter!  You won't regret it! The employees are wonderful!

LBDzUetkEpGwIWSl6vDZ1g.text: Greeted by a girl who forgot to button up her shirt- no class Vegas kids. The design and what they did with the space was great.  The food was are good with the exception of the polenta and lobster dish. The lobster was cooked beyond the point of return.  Staff needs more training and is rough but we will be back for the food.

8E-XnXhwxszIKuO8rV9w1A.text: Another excellent choice at the Red Rock.  A relaxed and comfortable place which has a sports bar role. We were there on a Monday nght and enjoyed Monday night football.  Lots of great small plates to share.  The meatballs put grandma on watch.  The flatbread are amazing. Grilled octopus that was prepared to perfection. A carving board that was different and a great choice.  Stuffed dates that were to die for.  We didn't have a main course but they looked delictable.  A huge variety of beers on tap and in bottles and great cocktail menu.  A must!

braLD2tN2nNOPeXzOjXRww.text: Had a great dinner with friends last night at Hearthstone. Our waiter Johann was excellent. He had such in depth knowledge about every menu item. Next time we eat there I'm deff requesting him again! Thanks Johann you made our night an experience! #hearthstonelv #johann

L8FTHcKuqodKNyPD9IOTIQ.text: Met 2 friends for dinner on a Thursday  6:00. Service was bad. Tried to order one bottle of wine. It was not available. Then a alternate also not available. Fortunately, 3rd choice was. Waitress verbally recited 2 specials. One being lamb chops. Said it was a huge portion of 36 ounces.  Realizing she said 3 chops it was probably three 6 oz chops. Which is what it was. Reasonable portion but not 36 oz. Staff is not trained well. Polite but aloof. We all three ordered 4 appetizers. Wings, 2 orders because waitress said they were small. She was right about that. Octopus was slimy and not fresh. Dates were good, again very small portions. Salad order only came out for 2 of us. Waitress no where to be found. Even server delivering dropped salad and ran without asking if we needed anything. Other salad eventually came out with dinner but we had to ask for it. Bus person wanted me to keep my fork after appetizer. No place mat. I guess I was supposed to put dirty utensil on table or just hold it. No check back until dinner was over. This place was more than half empty.  Service is below par because of what appears lack of training. This was my second visit. Friends also stated similar experiences from their past visits. Lamb was very good and a reasonable portion more salt than I prefer though. Friend said salmon was the saltiest he ever had. Will not return. The value is not there. When service is bad the desire to return is lost. It's too bad because the place is a beautiful environment.

GpRC6iwjCoQDPGGeZpO0wQ.text: Jessica G was our server, very friendly and gave great recomendations. Wonderful, fresh food! Excellent service,  fun atmosphere.  Loved the decorations. Will be back for sure

9PMPhx2eCXgLQcQloikspg.text: We went to this place last night for a birthday dinner.   Right from the start we had an amazing experience.   The hostess Sara made us feel special by greeting us right away and seating us in a great booth.   The service was excellent and the food was amazing.  Everything was served hot and it was fresh. All of the bar drinks were amazing even the margarita which I usually am not to fond of.  When we left, Sara told us to have a good night and said thank you.   It was a nice experience and we would definitely come back.  It seems like everyone Es genuine and wanted us to enjoy our experience.

O6kPWVu_trSPxmcqn4OQgQ.text: Terribly disappointed in their happy hour. They didn't recognize my reservations, and the meatballs my mom ordered had to be sent back twice for being cold. She refused to try a third time. Such a pity- my parents are locals and I was in town visiting.

uUQXl1icAuIq4g8HHOZhIw.text: Amazing food and great service.  Try the ricotta cheese with truffled honey.  I would have never thought of that combination but it was AMAZING.

HQqC5Q9vXx9ir2I-c56Hrg.text: Love this place! We went here with the family and it was perfect for all. The kids hung out and played games while we waited for food. Good was delicious! Great variety....perfect for adult taste and kid taste in our family. Great atmosphere. Very relaxed. Service was top notch!

E_x-xpNsZ_1Mh5z84z6pMw.text: Everything was awesome! Truffle honey dish was silly and the ceviche was clean packing a nice punch.

AaynmqV19kM4LoBV_x8ylQ.text: Really enjoy the feel of the restaurant. Overall, great staff with positive attitudes. I enjoy the apple and quinoa salad, calamari, carbonara pizza, and the fried chicken. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is our specific waiter did not check on us hardly at all. The rest of the staff made up for it by filling up our waters etc. Can't remember the waiter's name because I hardly ever saw him, but overall a great experience.

NMYlpEpDp7KnhD6d_deKHw.text: Had my daughters 7th birthday party there with 7 of her friends to make pizzas and it was fantastic! Great place!Great service from Ryan! Great chef!Ty

QxrKIuheNF3QhJpeav0-Zw.text: Ate a $19 flatbread pizza and was starving after I ate it all. Nice ambiance, bit I was hungry. My suggestion is to take a pass on this restaurant.

IcANRJyrlgfOA-ha0Mz4IQ.text: The new gem, not just for Summerlin, but for Las Vegas! They hit it right with opening this place! The food, the genuine customer service, the ambience keeps me coming back for more! It's my "go to" when I want to grab a great dinner, when I want to get friends out together. The lounge, they even have shuffle board! Yes, shuffle board! Such a Classic touch! All time favorites have to be the charcuterie menu (cured meats & cheese), butcher steak tartare, baked ricotta, braised short rib meatballs, pepperoni pizza (add the sausage from the Abe Froman), wood oven roasted clams are so delicious (that sauce is ridiculous). If you're a fan of shellfish the Grand Shellfish Plateau is the business! Shrimp pasta is my personal favorite as far as entrees are concerned. Oh and getting a side of the lobster polenta along with the grilled broccoli. To top things off the peanut butter lava cake and a their house-made pistachio ice cream amazing! They're both change your life good! Coming back for my birthday in March to have their Suckling Pig Beast Feast! If you haven't been here you HAVE to check it out. Red Rock just got a huge facelift with this place! Thank you Hearthstone!

h-1ereOk4JLa1KI2S8ZD2w.text: Hearthstone receives 5 stars from me...when I called ti make my reservation the young lady was more than accommodating in seeing that I get a table that was best for me, my party arrived earlier than I and the hostess was more than pleasant in seeing that they were comfortable in the bar...upon my arrival the hostess at the door greeted me with a wonderful attitude and smile..she said my party had arrived and showed me to our table all the while holding a pleasant conversation! Love the atmosphere here and the rest of our evening was excellent!

2X2xi-W5d5cjl5G7yFFGxw.text: Outrageous. did i mention overpriced. I mean, $20 for a personal pizza. on extra thin bread. Sadly, the prices overwhelm the experience. The food is good by all means. But $25 for a small bowl of pasta which is approx 15 noodles and 4 pieces of small shrimp, that leaves you wondering what exactly you are paying for. Well its the ambiance...its a beautiful setup, but like everything else at the red rock, poor execution. The guy standing there making pizza, hasnt even a smile to spare, while he barehandedly tosses the dough and pulls the order receipts then tops pizza. Fingers crossed, he washes his hands thoroughly. I find the menu a bit over zealous for a local eatery or a low key mid scale hotel. And seeing an entire baby pig roasting for viewing pleasure made me want nothing more than to become a vegetarian. Overall once this place has seen most of its locals a time or two, im not sure who they will keep coming back. Perhaps they can succeed on the one time hotel guests alone.

4IxwscJLyvvi9BXSOOwmvA.text: Please think twice about going to this restaurant.  My boyfriend and I were always curious to check out this place because we are locals and we pride ourselves in finding new places to eat and check out. Hearthstone had a very attractive menu and we always pass it whenever we would go to the movies.  I had dropped off my son to go find parking, this past Sunday. We were going in for brunch and we needed a good place to eat. I parked and went to the front door. My son was still standing there waiting by the wall and when I had asked him if he got a table, he said he tried but the hostess "looked busy." I saw NO ONE around and the hostess was playing around with her computer and she heard me and quickly defended herself, saying she didn't see my son and that it was busy. I asked her why it took her for me to say something out loud in order for her to ask us if we were being helped. She disregarded my question and DID NOT even apologize! She was rude, unkempt and to shut me up with my questions and wanting to get rid of me, she said I can seat you now. She did not introduce herself either.  I was already upset at this point because my son was disregarded and we sat down proceeded to order. Again, no name from the waiter (he was a bald headed gentleman) and he took awhile to get our menus and drinks. The place was not even busy! He did not recommend anything or ask if it was our first time there. You can clearly tell that he wasn't interested in explaining anything in the menu because when  had asked how the meat, cheese, and bread platter worked, he just said "you just order it to whatever you want." I asked him for a recommendation, he said, it depends on what you want and just read me the menu (which I could have done myself). I had mentioned that I wanted to order two types of bread and when all our food came, I had asked him about it, he said, "Oh, I thought you were just asking about it." Um, isn't that the whole point? I ask for the bread and hopefully I get the bread?  The couple next to me was having the same ordeal as myself and was not happy with their order. I saw them sent back their order TWICE and they were still not happy with it. I saw the manager, who's name was Aienrry, and requested to speak with him.  He was very nice and accommodating, kept asking what I would like for him to do, I wanted the name of the hostess because she needed to be educated and trained in customer service. He slyly avoided giving me her name by giving me his card and saying he would email me to compensate for the lack of service that my son and I received, by coming by again for dinner. After such a negative experience, I do not know if I ever want to come back to a place such as this! I still have yet to receive an email and do not plan on coming back. It's so sad that a beautiful space such as this, runs an unprofessional restaurant and lacks customer service.  My boyfriend and I experience new restaurants every week and we recommend places to our friends who come in from out of town. We will not be recommending this place to any of our local or out of town friends. Do yourself a favor, please do not come to this place. Save your money and go somewhere else.

_uXNYlsBUfigSsNjVEjOmg.text: Four of us had a nice dinner & service was both friendly & attentive. Our tab over $325 + tip for drinks & several small plates, no entrees. The only reason I don't give more stars is because 1.) the seating throughout is not very comfortable, all small scale Danish bentwood loop armed chairs, tight for larger framed persons, even the thin teeny tiny guests looked huge in these chairs. I noticed. I could not imagine wedging myself into one of those chairs or barstools. While the side booths were comfy, thank goodness, they were U-shaped so difficult to hear from end to end with our party of four and the bustling atmosphere. How guests climb into those high barstools then scoot them up at the center sharing tables is beyond me? They cannot be comfortable. The lack of comfortable seating via armless chairs is a huge design flaw in an otherwise hip interior space. It's like flying economy at first class prices. 2.) we shared many plates yet were not provided with any serving utensils, extra clean plates, or plates to put our discarded seafood shells off our main plate. So we had to double dip each using our own used silverware. Good thing we are close friends without colds. The sauces left from the first served sides, like runny oyster water, mixed on the dirty plate and wetted the crust of the later served sides like flat bread pizza, which was not a good thing. I consider this a major oversight in dining propriety & service. 3.) portions were small for the price, and we were not offered bread. My husband made a sandwich when he got home....

abTOl2l4kelGt367cUjJVg.text: I came here last weekend with a group of friends for my birthday. We were seated on a couch, a few chairs and 1 big cushiony chair. Really odd mix of furniture and I didn't like having to sit coffee shop style with a coffee table as our table. I was hunched over the whole time trying to eat my food. There seems to be a very common theme to everyone's reviews and that's how horrible the service is. I have to agree, the service is absolutely horrendous. We had this younger girl serving our table with her tits practically hanging out. We had to hunt her down throughout the entire restaurant just to get some refills on waters. The bottomless bellini deal is a sick joke. $24 and they get refilled whenever you can find your waitress and ask for it. If you're not on top of it they will never come back and give you more. The food was the redeeming factor. We ordered a bunch of random things and they were all pretty good. I ordered steak and eggs, they come with pan fried potatoes and onions. While the steak was good, the potatoes were over cooked and hard. My friends ordered the French toast which was good just really really sweet. We also ordered some fries which are these enormous potato wedges that you can literally put back together to form the potato. They were so thick cut that I cut one in half and could pour out the inside and make mashed potatoes. We had to hunt down our waitress for ketchup. We ordered the charcuterie plate and I have to say it was pretty delicious. I asked for the pickled veggies, truffle honey, couple of different hams and cheeses. It does not come with nearly enough bread. We were a table of 7 and she brought us 4 pieces of toast. The Bellini's were pretty craptastic which now makes me think it was probably a good thing she didn't fill them up often. I honestly have no idea why this girl was working as a server. She had absolutely no personality, in fact she was borderline rude. We mentioned several times that we were celebrating my birthday and she never once acknowledged it, no happy birthday, nothing. I don't know that I will ever come back. The truffle honey is to die for but there were too many negative factors. They have so much potential to be excellent but the servers they have are going to run this place into the ground.

xJ8o7mggdDstZZp71iFQwA.text: Nice to have a new interesting restaurant nearby. Great relaxed atmosphere. Still working out some kinks. Highlights included the tuna carpaccio, the beef tartare and the arugula salad. Need to expand the wines by the glass offerings. Looking forward to another visit soon as they get more things worked out.

mWJCAAGtEPz2vePWhkuHdQ.text: Cannot wait to go again. We had reservations for a Friday night, but we're told our table wasn't ready.  Not a big deal, we enjoyed the bar and our table was ready about a half hour later.  Our server was adorable and bubbly, we love the decor and menu options.  We ordered the seafood platter for $90, it was very fresh, but I felt for the price there should be more.  I'm comparing the Hearthstone platter to smith and wollensky on the strip, which for the same price blows it out of the water! I was a little put off with price to food ratio, but the chef sent out a few complimentary dishes, which I felt made the platter a little more palatable. The steak tartare was to kill for and the pizza was amazing too.  I love the draft beer selection and the shuffle board tables.  Overall, despite the reservations and the over priced seafood platter I will be back.  We actually tried to make reservations for last night, but we're told they were full. I can't be mad because the place is really that good.  We were able to get in at wolfgangs next door at downtown summerlin and we had an equally good experience.

sH0TIY7rKkieZqxLYuHQOQ.text: My husband hates it here, we love eating at nice places and are the type that enjoying spending the money on the right meal. However this place seems over priced for the quality food. The baked ricotta pot is good, the tuna is good but nothing that wows you. I'd much rather go to Joes Stone Crab for the same cost but with way better service and quality of food.

JlDjVAo_V9brPUFA89Rdbg.text: First time visiting this resturaunt.  I kept it simple, ordering the burger and my girlfriend had the chicken. Everthing was cooked to perfection and about as good as your going to get. Solid service and great ambiace will keep us coming back.

aVnDxUgePIijLgf-0-juFQ.text: This new restaurant in Red Rock Resort Casino is very light and welcoming.  Hostess and server were friendly and polite.  The items we ordered, however, were disappointing.  First, "Roasted Artichokes" for $15 turned out to be 3/4 of a very small artichoke bottom, on top of cooked parsnip cubes and fried scallions.  You could buy 20 small artichokes in a store for $15.  There were more parsnips and scallions than artichokes, but no mention of them on the menu.  "Lollipop Chicken Wings" for $18 was just so-so.  10 tiny drumettes, drowning in a spicy, creamy sauce, with 4 raw veggie sticks.  "Black Truffle Hangar Steak" for $33 is an ordinary tasting hangar steak with 4 potato logs.  Couldn't distinguish truffle in the steak or sauce.  Not sure we would want to go again to try other menu items since this meal for 2 people with 1 alcoholic drink and 1 iced tea was almost $100.

xYu1ERMMZFDHp-Kgg9NH7Q.text: Food is great. Everyone is very nice, but the delivery of the food is off. First time there, we ordered a meat and cheese plate, and it took forever. The manager came up and apologized. Nice guy and he got us a couple of drinks and didn't charge us for that plate, which was more than we expected. My only real complaint is the hostess. The first time I went, I didn't have a reservation and she tried to sit us a community table, even though the place was empty. Second time I went I had a reservation, and still didn't get seated for almost 20 minutes after the reservation. The place was almost empty again. The waiter said that they want to be the neighborhood spot for locals, so if that's the case, they should let the hostess know not to seat people without reservations at such a bad table. I'm sure that they'll work out the kinks soon and have the place flowing properly though. It's defiantly worth it just for the food.

Y0qsxYULodcbR_DVNAX3ig.text: The vibe here is loud and echoey but friendly. It's eclectic decor reminds me of the beach, France, the northwest and Swedish grandmas basement. All good things that I'm not sure go together. When you walk in from the casino side it has a vintage feel, when you sit down it feels like a seafood restaurant in oregon. Then, he menus has mostly steaks as the main meals. I'm saying all this in a positive light because it needs to be explored. I had crab cakes that were cold, wet and very very tart with lemon juice. Served on little toasts. Crab meat was plentiful. The tomato bisque very very good but tepid. I was so hungry and it was so good I didn't send it back. It was like they added the cream last and it cooled it off because corners were warmer. I would order this again! My husband got the meatballs and I ordered the macaroni and cheese. He ate them so fast so apparently it's a winner he said moist but not greasy. I would not get that mac again. The noodles are small and chewy and not of the macaroni size. They used chopped nuts instead of bread crumbs on the top and all it did was throw off the taste and texture. It also was like cheese soup with noodles floating in it. I took it home to see if the flavor would blend better later and I wouldn't order this again. My husband also had the burger and fries and said they tasted great. The service is amazing and the staff is friendly. We want to go back as the oysters were calling my name.

E8-DEH7dq7ftaHxMUwCdIQ.text: I cannot say enough great things about this spot! The ambience is absolutely perfect, for not only a local spot, but for a restaurant that you also can't wait to take your tourist friends to when they visit! The mushroom pizza and artichokes have the perfect combination of flavors along with everything else on the menu that's delicious! Cocktails are on point... Try the Pimm's 50 and the My Boy Bleu! I'm so happy we finally have a new spot in Summerlin to hang out at that isn't just your typical "bar" spot. OH! And they also have shuffle board! I can't wait to go back ASAP! Trust me just try it!

zAqZs5UIYK_Sd44v8oYOGQ.text: Great food. Cool design. Service was friendly but a bit slow, but its Friday night so thats to be expected.

pnLG7jB3l6cDLYY5T8TSGA.text: Well, where to start. I came here to dine with some business partners much to my hesitation but they really wanted to dine here so we did. What a mistake. The food is not the problem, it is the service! The hostesses while young and very pretty are dressed like they are going to a night club and they are not very friendly. Unprofessional. We waited to be sat around 20 minutes although we had a reservation. Once we finally sat down, Tori was our server but I wouldn't call her that. She was very curt, uninterested in going over the menu, and she never came back to our table. A different server brought us our food and drinks,  and another brought us our check...weird. The food was fine but forgettable and really full of salt, I guess that is how they got us to buy so many drinks. The worst part of my experience was audibly hearing the chef yelling and cursing at the line cooks. How unprofessional for your guests and I feel bad for the staff. You can tell nobody cares in this place and I can't say I half blame with the way I witnessed/heard the staff being treated. The management team needs to spend some time on their skills as leaders because yelling the way whoever was yelling at the staff needs to be re-evaluated as an effective leader. I have never experienced this at any restaurant, including fast food, let alone what is supposed to be an upscale/ fine dining experience. Needless to say my business partners felt like crap for suggesting this place and we most definitely will not return. We do suggest Mercadito right next door though!

rG5MfiJAhBX0gjM0sp9xJw.text: Horrible service! Food is way over priced! Takes forever to get someone to come to your table and get checked out! Check your receipt too they try to put more expensive items on your receipt!

MDCBuUVmK-VkuA6dER-BKQ.text: I don't quite understand this place.   I couldn't figure out the theme, the decor, the music - nothing.  I ordered the Kale Caesar Salad that was described as having cheese, croutons, and garlic lemon dressing.  When I took the first bite,  it tasted like straight anchovies.  I know that CLASSIC Caesar salad dressing has anchovies.   However,  the menu didn't say anything about it being a classic Caesar salad nor that the dressing was classic.  I sent it back and ordered the onion soup.  It smelled like something died in my bowl.  Disgusting.  I ordered the shank steak and it was actually pretty good, however, the steak fries had some creamy drizzle on it and was not good.  My husband ordered the Sea Bass and it was horrible. The service sucked,  too.  The outside of this restaurant boasts it to be a fine dining establishment especially when you look at the prices.  Yet, when I walked in,  I couldn't figure out why they had big screen televisions playing basketball and the music was flashback to the 90s.  I was subjected to listening to Alanis Morissette's "You Oughtta Know" and "Zombie" by The Cranberries while trying to eat.   Is this fine dining, a sports bar, a steakhouse, what??  Everything about this place confused me.  I'm sure it will be closing in the next few months since the place was pretty empty on a Saturday night.  Don't waste your time or money.

rADQINPZzGCvJ_h6DKE77A.text: Went there on a busy Saturday night with my husband and sister.   The food was great.  The service was lacking and it was not our waitresses fault.   It was so busy and she had so many tables.  It took twenty minutes just for our drinks to come out and we had to ask the manager where they were.   If it was a less busy time I'm sure the service would have been better

Takj7NVvrSFQ10KRp8W2rQ.text: We've gone twice, both times on Wednesdays because they have $1 oysters. My 9 and 10 year olds can literally eat 20 oysters between the 3 of them! The oysters are good sized and very fresh. I also had the lobster roll which was also good..I really want dessert but I'm always too full

WJPHuQ8G2w2DsZpBaQFkvQ.text: I have to say that their food and wine selections are phenomenal! It was our fist time in this restaurant and I truly love it. To top it off,Lisa was our server that night,she was very pleasant, polite, and professional.   We would like to commend her performance and professionalism. She deserves to be notice.   Lisa, your company is lucky to have you and you are an asset to your company. I hope every server there are like you! Thank you and because of that we will definitely comeback. -Cristina

497O3iVjoRLjb_fD3U5iPQ.text: This place is great. Love the vibe. Menu is a bit pricey BUT worth it. Had the scallops with cheesy risotto. Doesn't get better. Definitely want to check out the half of wine Mondays.

-4VL76ZGjzXlBmIvD-oYUg.text: Josh was our outside server tonight.  He was super friendly, knowledgeable and chill. Very helpful navigating happy hour menu and wine list. Highly recommend !

mTWHxJvuSsDhs-xt2Vfnfw.text: Thoroughly enjoyable food, atmosphere and service! After a delicious late-night snack (lip-smacking wood-roasted octopus and baked truffle ricotta), we decided to go again the next day for the brunch and bottomless mimosas, as recommended by our very attentive and friendly server Nate. Best advice ever! Jordan provided outstanding service and went out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed, while giving us great tips about Las Vegas. We enjoyed his genuine and professional demeanor. Cayson and Taylor were also fantastic.

GZBczyaptK97NcgQh-Sf3g.text: Wow what a place.  Staff , food , drinks   Love it!!!!!  We wait few min for a seat but the service is quick.  Great food. Great music. Will definitely see you Guys again.

WXpUA8tHtADioSn6dezqbA.text: We arrived when they opened about 5:00pm and thankfully one of the hostesses had the sense to get us started. The waiter was lackluster, no greeting and seemed bothered to be there. No wonders it took so long to get served. In fact, the support staff, I'll call it, did all of the serving. I think the management team needs to get some better help. Not sure if I'll be back when Yard House is nearby and is so much better.

Kue_bK7154ZZO5ba35t9Lg.text: Brunch today was one of the best brunches I have had in a long time. We started off with a pastry basket which was just lovely, filled with some small fresh danishes, banana bread, and fresh bread with a beautiful maple butter. I then ordered the two eggs any style which comes with potatoes and toast and my friend ordered a croissant with ham and cheese and egg and bacon along with hashbrowns. Everything ordered was absolutely delicious. The hashbrowns came with applesauce that was freshly made in the house as well as ketchup and butter on the side. We had bottomless Mimosas which were really good and made it that much more fun. Another friend got the bagel and salmon breakfast which was crazy good and very fresh as well as a fruit bowl which was easily one of the best fruit bowls I have ever tasted, showing up with a cantaloupe that was sliced along with beautiful berries marinated in their own juices to create a sweet and beautiful taste. The service was top-notch with very friendly people and very fast and efficient. It was a wonderful experience and we are totally going back. It doesn't hurt that the restaurant is absolutely gorgeous with a beautiful light air feeling to it as it is large and spacious and it is packed with people having a good time. The restaurant also has an outside area. Reservations are wise and I would recommend them.

3_kW-3eo5HptASNq0ZvlrA.text: Great food, great service & a incredible atmosphere. Was served at the bar by a girl named Allie and a young man named Casen. They we're very personable and informative on the menu. 5 stars all the way!

QNTzYjTtj35R8Zni5HrOiA.text: Great staff, good food, awesome atmosphere...keep it up! Bacon wrapped dates are amazing and so is the fried chicken!

uK4SxsCuo8KgjsILmpRJuw.text: This place is awesome. They have a good menu, service is great and clean. I ordered the 2 eggs any style and potatoes with toast. Was cooked just the way I wanted it. Drinks aren't too pricey and they have an unlimited mimosa special for $25. Will definitely be coming here regularly since I live pretty close to here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California Benedict
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 eggs any style and potatoes

pbS3h9XJwsOMjgZnlJ6O8w.text: Have been searching for a good brunch place and have found it right in Red Rock! Hearthstone has a pretty vast menu for brunch from breakfast foods, too lunch,and different starters too! I came here with a group of friends, upon arrival we were seated immediately. The restaurant was very busy almost full except for the patio. It was a little chilly.  Our party did their $15 bottomless mimosas deal which you can't beat! Our server was crystal and she was very attentive. Our mimosas glasses almost nearly went half empty. I ordered the club sandwich with regular French fries and the portions were huge!! Everyone in my group ordered different things which they all looked delicious! Will definitely be back again soon!

gyHd0kk4wwj_hqL4kXCFQQ.text: Some amazing pasta dishes as well as the meatballs. I;m not the biggest fan of shrimp but the shrimp pasta is to die for.   Fav Dishes Pappardelle Pasta Shrimp Pasta Lollipop Chicken Wings Meatballs & Steak Tartar   Great local spot!

JohU_RVjt0fgihWcfqeqRQ.text: The food itself was good. We went for brunch and I had the Eggs Benedict and my friend had the breakfast sandwich. Both were really good. She had the bottomless mimosas and I had the Bloody Mary. It was delicious.   My issue was the service- the restaurant was less than half full. It took a long time to order and receive drinks. Once we did order, it took a long time for our food to come out. Our server was very nice. I'm not sure where the disconnect was.   I will be back for their happy hour- the menu looked great. I just hope I have better service.

N9L6jzo0lmAoQ9Iriue4xg.text: Had a great time getting oysters last Wednesday!  Jocelyn was slinging drinks and she was on point...she makes a mean martini!  Great service, great food, 5/5, would recommend, get in to Hearthstone today!

-XvbqrHGq5gY8JPNEXyX3A.text: Came here for father's day dinner with wife and adult son.  Hostess seated us right away. Sat and and sat and sat but no one acknowledged us.  Finally notified a bus person about this and finally a server appeared. Bad luck, I guess.  A big party had been taking up their time.  We finally got our dinner about 1 hr and 20 minutes after being seated.  The steak was delicious and son's chicken dinner was HUGE.  Mom's pasta was...okay.  Overall, not worth the price.  Service overall struck us as a bit amateurish.  They appear to need training.  Could be that this noisy place appeals to many and that we just tried them on a bad night.  We won't return but you might have better luck.

bn0vIFlURmXn_ZY5Fy9VPQ.text: We went in Monday and Annie was our server. Sweet as pie. Great food and amazing service. Looking forward to our our next visit

2KKQk1Utxrn29soOyf7-yw.text: This was my first time at Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar. Came here for their $55 Thanksgiving dinner, left unsatisfied and disappointed. The Thanksgiving menu was a 3-course prix fixe. First course was butternut squash soup or roasted beet salad. No complaints here. Butternut squash soup was good, actually the best part of the entire meal. Roasted beet salad was nothing special, but wasn't bad either. Then the meal started to go seriously downhill. Main course was organic herb-roasted turkey with gravy, mashed potatoes, creamed green beans, and sourdough stuffing. In all honesty the turkey wasn't overly dry and the gravy was tasty. Standard mashed potatoes and stuffing, substandard green beans. What really irked me was the portion size, especially for a $55 set menu. This was closer to a kid's meal or appetizer in terms of portion size - very disappointing, especially for a holiday synonymous with gluttony (actually left hungry and I'm not a big eater). Then came dessert: pumpkin spiced cheesecake or apple pie. Little did I know the desserts would make the portion size of the main course look enormous by comparison. The desserts were practically bite-sized, literally the size of the desserts you see at the dessert bar at Bacchanal or Wicked Spoon. Even with all of the above, I wouldn't have felt the need to come to Yelp and leave a two-star review if the service was even acceptable. My drink was never once refilled for the entire meal, even though the server clearly saw an empty glass when bringing the main course, dessert, and extra silverware or when he came to clean empty plates from the table multiple times. He actually DID come and grab my empty glass after I had already finished dessert, but that was not to refill it apparently as I never got a refilled drink and the only time he returned to the table after that was 5 minutes later to bring the check. And a different server bumped into me, dropped a used, dirty fork on the table in the process while muttering an insincere "sorry" as he scurried off. Seriously?  For $55 +$4 for my drink, I feel like this meal was way overpriced and that's not even taking into account the terrible service throughout the meal. You can definitely get better food AND service for $70+/person. Will not be back.

8yogqSCAW8vEVQ44fr4jcg.text: Wow, the french dip just melts in your mouth. Served on a pretzel looking bun but buttery all the way thru. The au jus didn't look to be enough, but it turned out to be more than enough. Better if they served the au jus in a shallower dish so you don't lose so many 'bits' reaching down there. All perfect with a glass of big fruit Napa Valley cab they have by the glass. Great service at the bar.

t78nFeodIJx6wvSGWTckhg.text: My experience was surreal, upon entering the restaurant, I noticed the open decor and well designed layout.  Of course it is Sunday and the games were on, which complimented the atmosphere as if I were at a tailgate while surrounded by games.  I owe my experience to Allie, who was phenomenal with her services and recommendations.  She even knew their best vegan choices, which blew me away, as her depth of the menu was exceptional.  Kudos to Allie and Carlos for making our experience a memorable one, we can't wait to go back to HearthStone!!

obdZuV26V47UMscvZ-ZABw.text: To start, the decor at the restaraunt is amazing. It is very rustic and homey. It feels as though they had large sliding doors they just push open onto a nice patio area. I really like to come just hang out here for drinks to soak in the atmosphere. Depending on what day you come, you will see a bunch of total white washed summerlin yuppies super dressed up thinking they are all that and a bag of chips. Quite entertaining. Or you can find the average Joe- but I did notice a lot of really white people.. So anyways. Haha   The bathrooms are outside to the right in the casino, kinda annoying no bathrooms in the location but at least it is not too far. They also have a semi large room with a private table for large parties you can reserve that looks fun.   The food here is fresh and fun. A bit high on the price point for my liking. Entrees including streaks run from around $33 to $55. I got the $50 something dollar filet that was supposed to be 10 ounces and by the time I cut off the bone, it was a 6 oz steak. It also does not come with sides so you have to order a $10 side to make it a meal(3 sides to choose from). The showstopper of the night was their watermelon salad which may be seasonal. The feta with the nuts and sweet melon made my mouth sing. The peanut butter dessert recommended my the waitress was also Delish.   Service was very slow. Waited about 20 minutes initially even to get a drink. We were not in a hurry really but it was annoying to wait that long initially. Just give me my drink and I'll wait for food. But I need my drink! Overall, don't think I would eat here again cause just too expensive for what you get. The food was great though!

4gyl2AbkFuEZ0XGwu2Fcng.text: I will I did not like pizza but that's ok I have not liked anything lately, even colonoscopy was ok  snd

NIOzD21sL3jA4Pg04CGOaw.text: The atmosphere was very nice. The wait staff was awesome! Very very friendly and helpful. Even accommodated my two children and interacted. We came for the $1 oyster night and this experience makes me want to go back!

13lCXWrK8XThNCfL-zeFlw.text: Gerson is the best! Great service very cool/chill place! The band was great too! The staff was very friendly and helpful with the menu Gerson had a lot of knowledge of the menu and was very helpful. I would recommend this place definitely.

DYB6ZVrWHbzT0jrntDsedQ.text: First time there I really felt that I was treating with amazing customer service the second time not so much.  I love the atmosphere and the live music. First time there food was amazing second time it was not as good. Menu choices changed. I took my parents here they can be very picky but we're upset how long it took to get service. If you go I suggest going on a slow day during the week not weekends

B58VrmRGEbzHo9gEciE1wQ.text: Bottomless mimosas on a Sunday? What's there not to love! The service. That's what there is not to love. It's obviously very hard to have bad mimosas as there's literally two ingredients but I didn't feel like the service was great, it was average and for the price of the food it really didn't feel like service was up to par. We had to ask twice to be refilled and even then that took a while. I try to be considerate that theyre busy and there are other tables but when I can see them not working and purposely not making eye contact that's when it becomes an issue. Overall the food was amazing and so were the drinks. The service could use some training.

T-X4-K_3WXiHJX4D_tH9xQ.text: Man we go here for restaurant week first time food was good or drink sucked we asked how they made it and who makes a mule by putting a huge amount of simple syrup in it we asked for one with out and they just dumped some of the drink out and filled with club soda fricken lame and the last time we went nothing was really that great service was ok but not good .

sEXzZoB-itivqeqJwENmZg.text: The service is super friendly and it really does feel like a home kitchen where everyone's family and just kinda hanging out. I got the shrimp pasta and i was dipping my bread in it. I asked for vinegar & oil for my bread and the server went out of his way to get it for me. I noticed most tables had pizza and it looked like everyone was a couple. The food you could tell was of a high quality. Only downside I'd say about the food is some meals come with fries and some if you want a side you have to pay a lot. Sides are overpriced but the rest the food is prob just about right price wise. I had originally come to eat at libre next door and sadly it's gone so I tried hearthstone instead. If I was staying in Vegas I'd totally come back. The parking is kind of difficult but their is a valet area. Theirs outdoor seating with misters & a nice water fountain. Theirs sadly no actual bathroom you have to go into the casino for that which is why I didn't give it 5 stars. Theirs a step area that is part of the booths that could cause someone to trip so if you have family or friends who are clumsy like me I'd suggest sitting not at the booths. Also the booths you sit so far apart to talk so prob if theirs just two of you get a smaller table. The music is nice and at about the right level. And the lighting was good even for a date type place at night you could still read the menu & see each other but it wasn't so bright as to be blinding. I'd recommend but prob not the asparagus.

21yodNh6pipcIcO81ZnnHA.text: Overall, this is a great space, indoors & out! The decor is on the funky side. I've enjoyed some food & wine a few times, and once was for the weekly Private Cellar tastings on Thursdays (free with RSVP). A nice event and chance to try the featured winery offerings and Hearthstone apps. The menu is interesting and lately they've offered a 20% discount for locals as well as some brunch specials. After checking out the bar area a few times (they have wine on tap!) I would recommend it for a date or a respite from the casino if need be!

fjusH7-NZQH_y5x579e1dA.text: If you want to shuck for a buck, this is where you go. $1 oysters all day Wednesday will fulfill all your raw seafood cravings! To add, bar service is outstanding! Jocelyn took great care for us and because of her we will be return

QJTl2VM54Qmdo8zv1KBU3w.text: The food wasn't worth the price we paid.... got the seafood platter and for $30 it came with one lobster claw. Took awhile for my coffee to come out.... longer for food. The salad was covered in oil-- too much to enjoy. Overall, the vibe is great and restaurant is beautiful, but I'll pass on the rest.

DKUFNrfy7wlXQtk_8SUHaw.text: Rigo was fantastic! He offered great service, was very attentive and cordial. The atmosphere of the restaurant is a very fun loving experience. Highly recommend this place and be sure to ask for Rigo!

wXR2pPp_5SAcxdhOAd58mA.text: We come here on average once a week... the food is fantastic and what's even more impressive is how wonderful they are with kids. There's build your own pizzas on the kids menu and they even have board games and big coloring books with thick crayons for them to enjoy- top that off with regular kids' brunches and activities and they've got a major score from this local momma! The atmosphere is great too... really amazing decor/vibe. Sort of like a contemporary farmhouse feel to it. The cocktails are on point and Sundays are half off pizzas (yes, including on the kids menu!) Ask for Gerson when you go to Hearthstone... he gives top notch service and is great with kids! Sit on the patio when weather permits. It's wonderful!

SxvDoOTgzEnh5DKkWWlRMA.text: Food is always good. Waitresses and bartenders are always SMOKING hot. Good happy hour. Great place to sweat a game. Good tv's. Very well run operation.

1d94xA_yV3bc5TzO5Xkakg.text: I have always been a fan of Hearthstone. I came again for an early dinner with my boyfriend and we ordered a few shareables with a few drinks. The service was lovely and the food was delicious, as always. It seems as though their portions have gotten smaller since I was there two years ago, but the price remains the same. That was slightly disappointing, but expected for a Vegas restaurant.

sUrUjqg0zS45jCoYMrdENA.text: Great food! Our server was super friendly and great at making menu recommendations. The oysters on the half shell and ricotta appetizer were amazing!

uoC7-8EBFROg3hcj7lofSw.text: first visit was made on a Wednesday for their $1 oyster night. we arrived at 6:25 and chose to sit outside. table was wobbly and chairs were missing arm pads. seriously?   we placed our order - calamari to start, 3 dozen oysters and their $24 lobster boil  and we waited.   and waited.   and waited.  7:45 and all we've had to eat is the calamari. we still have not received our food.   long story short - we were seriously aggravated by then and just wanted to go. the manager comped our dinner if we wanted to wait a little bit longer.   8:00pm and 1 dozen (of the 3 doz) oysters and the lobster arrives. I'm literally dying of starvation at this point. and on a serious time crunch. we ate the comped dozen and the lobster and left.  I don't understand how an establishment like this lets something like that happen. we were not the only ones waiting for food. everyone around us were waiting as well. massive breakdown in the kitchen along with overbooking tables and not holding the door will result in a disastrous dinner service  on the up side - our server was james and he was great. I had a ton of questions and he was very accommodating in between rushing to each table, making sure everyone had what they needed and pacifying irritated customers.  they dozen oysters we got to taste were great. very fresh and succulent. lobster was rushed and not completely done. inside was runny with tons of uncooked liquids.   service and oysters were great and we will try again. maybe come a little earlier.

-02DLdjKi2_afj0tgo6KVw.text: Had such an amazing experience here! Oscar was the best server and was always making sure we had everything we needed. Diane runs an excellent team here at Hearthstone. Highly recommend!

vKeQlwOaJtm7_0SHKYR2vQ.text: To be very clear, this review is strictly for the Thursday night wine tasting.  They've been having it since they opened, or almost, but this was the first opportunity we've had to try it out.  I've checked out the menu outside the restaurant lots of times, but knew early on that this wasn't our kind of place.  I'll eat almost anything, but actually am not enticed by 90% of what they offer.  My husband is much harder to please (if it's not spelled c-h-i-c-k-e-n, he's outta there.).  That, and we both find the prices over the top.  But we wanted to see what all the hoopla was about, so we dipped our toes in.    If I had to rate Hearthstone for ambience, I'd give it a 4, maybe even a 5.  Light, airy, spacious, industrial but warm, comfortable.  It was interesting - and rare - to see most of the attractive booths unoccupied and many more people choosing tables.  The patio was nice, too, and the lounge section is completely open to the patio.    We were given tickets for two wine samplings each, 2 oz pours - a sauvignon blanc or, I think, a pinot grigio.  We chose the white.  I don't know what the heck was in that wine, but before I finished the first sample, I was buzzed.  By the second, I had to seriously take stock of whether I was capable of driving home!  Yeah, I've never been accused of having a hollow leg, but this was unprecedented.    There were also supposed to be passed appetizers, but they didn't materialize.  Instead, more than an hour into the two-hour gig the group of three next to us was served a buffalo mozzarella flatbread.  The wine-tasting wasn't crowded, but for the next 20 minutes, nobody else was given anything.  Finally, a waiter appeared with flatbreads, and all of us had something to stave off the potent wine.    I had high hopes, but we weren't blown away by the pizza.  The mozzarella was too chewy, and the crust too salty.  We'll stick with the one at Kona Grill, whose HH flatbread is less than half the price.  I wanted so much to love it, but alas, I didn't.  Maybe the real food is better, but again, that menu is not singing to me.
