ow7eu--2nMvyrutKlwW9tA.text: Excellent.  The grilled octopus was amazing. Try it. Don't be afraid.    Everything was great. Cool Vegas vibe.  Great spot to order a variety of dishes and share with the entire table.   Our servers name was Lisa and she was terrific.

lQx9lRtrtoeg5bgcLyp1vw.text: I would give zero stars if I could! We were there almost 2 hours before  we got our food. The service was nonexistent.  They forgot our food, after waiting for it for 45 min. The manager did come over to ask us how our meal was going. She did end up comping our meal, and said she was going to bring back a diet soda. 10 min later we just ended up leaving- no soda.   The food that we did get was delicious.  If you like good service then you might fare better trying somewhere else.

KFU-asnneJNkESP5ZjGUYA.text: Steer clear! Very nice looking restaurant attached to the Red Rock Casino....food was good but small portions and very expensive!  Service was not good too! They did not come back to refill my iced tea.

ZALkWD3LjFVNziZ3tbchdA.text: I came into hearthstone this past weekend and had the best time. I walked in with some friends and was quickly greeted by a friendly hostess. The server was super friendly and full of energy. They made some great suggestions for appetizers. Everything we ordered was amazing. The pizza smelled wonderful and the server suggested their nightly special swordfish and a watermelon salad which was . They had a vast wine selection and great cocktails. My favorite was the babymaker or the flower bomb. I literally can't get enough of this place !

oB3L9NqKJJ94T0Te43awjw.text: i think the dining room is beautiful.  The food has great presentation. I sat at the bar to eat so I can't really comment on service, with the exception it was a little slow.  Food was.... ok.  I had the clams, they were a little gritty and the broth was a little too salty.  I think it is pretty pricey for what you get.  Portions are very small.

10T4yfIPGAI409uQ0yRg0Q.text: The food at brunch was amazing! However, the drinks were awful. In the course of 3 hours, my bottomless Bellini was refilled 2.5 times (the first glass they served me was a little over half full!). I also had to ask the waiter to refill it each time. The Bellinis were pre-made and served from a pitcher. They tasted more like peach juice and hardly had any champagne. The bottomless bloody beers were nothing special. I would prefer bottomless bloody Mary's or bottomless mimosas like the other local restaurants who serve brunch. The $70-75 for a bottle of vodka or bottle of champagne to make your own drinks was overpriced. The staff was friendly, but unorganized and slow. Won't go back for the drinks, but the restaurant was beautiful and food was delicious!

R9zFs8aYcS-D8-XL4hL6Pw.text: This place is really great, love the concept. I really hate to share but itd my first time herr and  I really love it! Thank you tien for your service.

hRhChipyD3QofXBfUiHvbA.text: Christian the Busser did a great job. The calamari hit it out of the park, some of the best calamari I've had in a while. The tuna Nicoise salad was amazing, except for the tuna, it tastes like black licorice beware. The decor and ambience is very welcoming. I will definitely be back.

n_7vmjiKS4uvq4UINgSYEQ.text: Jessica G really made our night. So sweet and extensive menu knowledge. Great date night/any night atmosphere.

mNiUiAlZNnkWj19nLKHImg.text: Tonight was my husband and I 3rd time visiting hearthstone.   The food was extremely delicious.   We ordered the tomato soup, shrimp pasta, and a special spinach and garlic pizza. The service from the moment we walked in was top notch.  They use a team effort approach for service with the server (ours was Jessica) and their runners.  The only two downside we experienced was when we offered and then ordered the stone crab special and were later told they were out of stock the second was our favorite part of their menu had been taken off due to not being popular enough.   The meat and cheese boards are no longer offered with their fantastic spreads and jams.   I really hope they bring this back!! Overall we had a romantic dinner and were sat away from the visitors there to watch the game. We will definitely be back.

uO0DiXMCDWD6B8CNqW9dIQ.text: Absolutely love this place. The service was amazing and the food was even more amazing. The oysters were so fresh and delicious.  The fbnj was so unique and sooooo good!!!

-sWhtXjmy4wBQBdxAVFnEg.text: Just wanna say one word!! Service!! Kate was so great and entertaining and informative about everything!! I praise places like this and thank you so much for feeding me the best tasting food but also giving it to me with so much heart and soul. You can tell this girl loves her job and what she does because when we left we felt like family! Love this place!!

h2doSmnVQpgnbzTK7v_lFA.text: I chose this restaurant to entertain business guests. Nice open room. Good atmosphere and energy. My pan fried bass special was good as were the fresh oysters and smoked meats and cheeses. However, the overly zealous servers and bus staff took every opportunity possible to swoop our unfinished plates away. Incredibly, we almost lost 6 uneaten oysters (at $40/dozen) until I defended ourselves as these precious mollusks were almost lifted away. The pressure to eat fast dominated  the meal. I knew not to put down my fork for fear of losing my entree. Notably, my complaints had absolutely no impact on the uneasy and frenetic pace...almost as if a strict task master was standing in the wings demanding that we get the bums rush in order to quickly turn the table. At the suggestion of our server, we ordered two "amazing" deserts to share. We began nibbling when one guest had to leave. We stood up to let her out of our booth and to say goodbye. You guessed it. Before we could sit back down and with our backs turned, our nearly untouched desserts were expertly whisked away. I ended up with an odd sense of emptiness that seemed out of sync with the hefty check ($100/person). In the spirit of full disclosure, the manager did stop by to apologize explaining that the restaurant was only 18 months old and that they were still working out the kinks. We declined her offer to bring us more desserts. I had suffered enough battle fatigue for one meal. Until those "kinks" get worked out, I recommend going elsewhere. The two star rating weighs the good food against the challenge to enjoy it.

PksyWe1Qq32CSMEP_pN-Kg.text: Great food and ambiance, outdoor patio needs misting system during summer always great service, we will be back

OtgPLrEHpYvPEi1qgxYPcQ.text: Nice ambience and decor! Our food was pretty good, I had the shrimp pasta, and she had the cast iron steak. What I really enjoyed and would like a to go order of right now is the yogurt and blackberry jam with toast.....soooo good. Specialty drinks were a little pricey, but I enjoyed the Louisville Slugger. Our server was Elgin, who gave great suggestions, but I also love how everyone steps in to ensure your dining experience is going well. Nice Valentine's Day dinner!

w7FiCHrCyP9wWFJRTAQGBQ.text: Amazing drink, so good on the simple eats. Staff was nice and as busy as they were, very accommodating. You can chill out on their couches and enjoy a great scene or jump up and take your peeps on in some shuffle board. Never walked into a restaurant this style, great concept!

XgHXI1XtwtqRf87Jkw8fyA.text: We have been here many times and love the food, but had a wonderful server and wanted to give her a shout. Crystal, thanks for the great service!

diCjPMnkc6q69FgO7998dg.text: What a great experience with the professional FOH staff! The Chef does a amazing job and please try the Seafood platter its amazing! Fresh Oysters daily!

oQhaXCT4MeB5dDWH6pASOQ.text: One star for the pretty interior design. This place is style over substance. Went there for brunch. Had the salted caramel French toast and smoked salmon eggs with spinach. Portions are small and food was lukewarm. I had to ask twice to have my tiny teacup refilled with more cold coffee.

Dxj_CSJF2vTRQg7Zk6MOmA.text: Awesome food and great service, Jessica was our server. Burger was cooked perfectly and the Arugula salad was wonderful. Don't leave without trying the peanut butter lava cake- Wow!! We'll be back!

Oa1fv68UhRVlZmdvuUzCSA.text: Overrated, nothing special. Went here for dinner and the food was just ok. The staff were friendly and welcoming.

dl0Ss9IT5MbBFx8FyB9WDg.text: Great decor.  Interesting menu  Great service by Jessica G We had a great time with the open atmosphere and cool breeze

cTiDHMpyyrECAGq7T0aXrw.text: Came here on a date with my husband the other night. The place is nice. Service was great and the food was great. I can't believe I always passed by this place and never thought about coming in. I'm glad we did. I will be going back for sure.

O8Gd0x5C6G4GZ1fQ82CAAA.text: What an amazing restaurant this is! One of my friends had been raving about this place, so a few of us decided to give it a go and boy did it live up to the hype.   Our server, Jeff, greeted us immediately and made us feel welcome. He went over the menu with us and made sure to highlight all of the house favorites. We started off with the charred octopus, tuna poke, and the baked ricotta. All of which were delicious! For entrees, I went with the server's recommendation on the hanger steak and it did not disappoint! Make sure you save room for dessert because the peanut butter lava cake is a must try!   Overall, an amazing dinner and will be back for sure.

DWCaZT43RGNExYOFOzV4YA.text: Excellent food and service! Tried the meatballs, dates, octopus, and for dinner the scallops and beef Wellington. Yummy!

ACRLxubJjHO5aGdgKiFOKA.text: The bartender charged me $ 16 a glass of bar wine. Three glasses of wine $ 48+ $6 tip $54 I thought the place is a little pricey for food and drinks.

xKOUnAq-SzObQWiNzJEXoA.text: Came for brunch, had great service and an awesome experience. Our mimosas stayed full all brunch long and our server Ahmed was extremely entertaining and had the best recommendations! He has never steered us wrong in the multiple times we've had him as a server!

pNPFUcq92Iq3H5QcVQVK-w.text: Very weird....Two of us arrived at 5:50pm to join 3 other members of our party for a reservation at 6pm. After waiting a few minutes, we decided to ask the very friendly hostess if the others had yet arrived. She said no, but confirmed our reservation for 5 persons at 6pm. So far, so good. We continued to wait in front of the hostess podium. By the time the other 3 persons arrived at 6:10pm, we were ready to enter together. Then, the hostess explained that the table was not yet ready. Not yet ready?? A table for 5 when the restaurant on a Wednesday night is not particularly busy?? Why was it not ready after we announced our early arrival? Obviously, we were waiting for the other 3 people. Did she not notice this? Clueless! After  another 10, yes TEN, more minutes, she announced that our table needed to be put together or brought from another room or from the basement or some other lame excuse. We waited another 5 or so minutes until the table was finally ready. Wow! No one else entered the restaurant while we were waiting....so what was the holdup? When we finally sat down, we noticed there were many employees. Some were busy, but others were not. The meal took a long time to prepare apparently and all five dishes did not arrive together. Food was at best mediocre. I ordered the salmon that rested on some strange-looking goop that they called eggplant puree. Although not offensive, it didn't taste like eggplant but it looked like spackle with lumps in them. The lumps were garbanzo beans. The portion was not worth the price. Also, they served it in what looked like my dog's water dish. Resting your fork and knife between bites while carrying on a conversation was a challenge. After we ate, no one offered a dessert. Oh well, maybe that would have taken another half hour to prepare. Expensive? yes! Worth it? No!

TbZppZ0GuhjdQtDSYZ_0Jw.text: Server was excellent. While the food overall was quite good we had a couple of issues with this restaurant. My wife had the roasted chicken which she said was just ok, but the big issue was that there was hair in her side salad.  I had the lobster cocktail which was good, but quite small for the price. My filet was excellent and cooked perfectly for my taste. As we were finishing our meal another server came up for the first time with bread and butter!! I think he was about 40 minutes too late. Don't know if we will return as there are many other restaurants in the area that we have had better overall experiences...plus I do not think that my wife will get over the hair in her salad. My overall rating would be a 4.5 for food and server, but drops to 3 as nobody enjoys a strand of hair in their foods

Rvq_SVEiS3LHOJj9dllMLQ.text: Well where to begin. We came here for Sunday brunch, we arrived at 12:40. We were sat right away but not given any menus had to ask for them which is odd as a former server that makes no sense to me. Our server was friendly and up-sold the bottomless mimosa we ordered that and a strawberry cobbler to start. The cobbler took forever and when it arrived it was like luke warm strawberry soup. Would have said something but our server didn't check on us when it arrived.  he returned we ordered the cinnamon bun French toast, and the chicken and waffles.  Flash forward 45 minutes our food finally arrives, my husbands chicken is dry and cold and my cinnamon bun is cold and raw in the middle yet the plates are blazing hot, now the reason for that is the food was made and sitting in the window under a heat lamp causing the plate to heat up. Also the chicken is what is called "sand-bagged" meaning made earlier then refried when ordered which any chef will tell you dries the hell out of it. So we complain, the server re-fires the food. Another 20 minutes and out comes the food, COLD AND DRY AGAIN! at this point I had enough I go to the manager who tells me he will speak to the chef and take our food off the check. So for two hours we got to drink mimosas, what a waste. BTW the mimosas were advertised as bottomless yet we got charged for two bottles and the second one we didn't ask for. Paid 32.00 for two bottles of mimosas. And for the first time in my life we got to spend two hours in a restaurant and leave hungry. I also want to point out that we saw this place on the food network and shame on you food network for making me think this restaurant  was better then it actually is.  Will never go back.

X_d073CYQhjnjvn47s4_FA.text: The vibe and atmosphere, along with the song choice was great, but misleading.  The service was very terrible.  We waited way too long, and I'm pretty patient.  Over 20-30mins waiting for a server!  I had to bug an acquaintance from high school 8years back to go and grab one for us.  People seated after us, about 4tables, ordering way more apps and entrees and refreshments finished and left before our entrees even arrived.  4 times having to be reassured that our food will come out.  The food was pretty good but not too grand to overlook the incompetence and lack of attention to our table.  The chef sent us complimentary deviled eggs.  Delicious but Idk if I can say it was good enough.  I understand there are complications in the kitchens and mistakes can be made, but they're professionals...  I'd have to come back a different time to go ahead and give it one more try, but my first visit here was one to forget.

aNjY8uS2vrzTjie7XsteZA.text: I was expecting more from the food; and I always expect to have great service.  I ordered a 'virgin' Bloddy Mary that took over an hour to get.  Our food came out warm, not hot, and the fries were cold.  I had the California Benny, and was expecting chicken that was cooked in the restaurant and then shreaded, or the breast sliced, but what I received was what looked and tasted like the pre-cooked Foster Farm chicken strips you buy at the store to use on salads.  They used cut and folded portions from their menu under their burgers, which was perplexing; as it wasn't big enough to wrap around the burger to catch drippings and was a soggy mess by the time the rest of my party finished their burgers.  Certainly will not make my "Brunch" list, but I may try again for cocktails and to watch a game with friends...provided I'm not too thirsty.

75Jt0tS4-PyUZw8e9Tapsw.text: The food was amazing. Will sure come back again to try out other food in the menu. Nutella and chocolate de creme was amazing! Can't wait to try their brunch menu.

SplVIGElKs4G5lkPb7CwjA.text: This place is out of control. Been here a number of times and will continue to come back for numerous reasons; the staff, the environment and most of all the delicious food! I threw in a couple pictures of just some of my favorites. The fried chicken topped off with farmers market honey (waiter said that it was voted best in NV or something), the crab cakes which were filled with a ton of crab chunks, the wings which are covered in a flavorful buffalo sauce and my personal favorite, the Hanger Steak. This is the first restaurant I've ever tried a hanger steak at and I can't get enough. It's a large portion steak but the size takes nothing away from the flavor. Medium marbleization with some serious taste. Service is always on point and one of the coolest things about this place is that they have new chef specials everytime I come in. One of my favorites I've had so far was the citrus pork pizza. It was like having an al pastor taco but instead of a taco, it was a pizza!! This place is always coming up with some cool new dishes that I've gotta try. The food here is at a great price range and the portions are more than generous. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger Steak
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken

oZyNbecI0GwebAYvMkGPUg.text: This is a hidden gem inside of Red Rock casino. Right from the street view you already see their giant an incredibly beautiful patio, sadly it's been too cold lately for them to open it up. Then inside the restaurant the interior design is one of the many highlights. The restaurant is very well put together and ha as sophisticated yet rustic vibe. The service is extremely attentive and polite. My water was refilled at a record pace and my server Daniel was so genuine and made our experience even better. The food is amazing. I ordered the Mac n cheese and the D.O.C. Pizza to share with my girlfriends and we were satisfied with everything. The huge flat screen TVs were also a plus. Definitely will be introducing more of my friends to this place!

OkLt_sYp3taa-YoSakdVSw.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try this restaurant we arrived and put our name down and gave our phone number and they said there was a 20 minute wait. About 40 minutes later we decided to go check and see what was the delay.... To our surprise they didn't have our name or number down at all! When they realize that they had made an error of course they took the steps to correct it and got us seated immediately. The salad was very tasty, a little overpriced.  The waitress was not up to par for this restaurant or any other, I should've remembered her name as  wasn't very friendly just kind of aloof. I guess the reason I didn't bother remembering her name is  We do not plan on returning to this restaurant.

NhlW44SwtVHD-uo1v_iCpw.text: Terribly underwhelming for Brunch. I know you all want the details and not my prose so see below :  * Waiter forgot one of the items ordered * Waiter went on break while we were eating and was nowhere to be found to offer further service * Price point for the food was way too high for the portion size. $16 for a piece of toast with Crab is far too high for what it is.  * Waiter did not know the menu selections in order to speak to their ingredients

36Sx3HzleEKxDqDAzPNFaw.text: We ( seven adults) had an enjoyable dinner here. Started with meat and cheese board and seafood tray for appetizers. Dinners ordered were fried chicken, pot pie, scallop risotto, filet mignon, shrimp with pasta and salmon. We shared two side orders ,One of mac and cheese and Brussel sprouts. Only complaint was my filet was a bit undercooked from my requested medium well. I still enjoyed it and had to share with my husband because the portion was large.  A couple desserts were ordered, ice cream, sorbet and the peanut butter lava cake. Large portions and they also put a cookie in the ice cream bowl.  We requested a table change before we ordered as a few of us found the high top table and the chairs uncomfortable, the request was handled very promptly. Service was prompt, efficient and friendly.  Friday night music began at 8pm and the solo singer/guitar player was good. I took off one star because there were too many TV's all with sports.   After dinner we moved over to the lounge area with leather sofas and had a few rounds of the table shuffleboard game. An enjoyable evening and we would return. In better weather the patio is also open.

iWhoJPZVfMpmy69slwBmMQ.text: This place wins on atmosphere if nothing else. The service is great the food is a close third...I'm optimistic that there are a few hidden gems I haven't tried yet

wuWW6RRpF735QRbBvjFN-w.text: I came here with my girlfriends for brunch and we had such a nice time. We sat outside and it was beautiful, the food was delicious and the customer service was great. We will be going back for sure!

ZKH9p4SUgJGDukdJQeTYuQ.text: Last night we decided on Hearthstone for my fiancee's Pre-Birthday dinner and wasn't disappointed. We were joined by our best friends to enjoy this place. I apologize ahead of time for not remembering our server's name but she's a pretty girl that looks like Lea Michele. She is a wonderful server and had spot on recommendations for us, being that it was our first time there. Before I get to the food, let me start with the vibe. This place has great energy, the customers were talking, eating, smiling....definitely a good setting. The live music was great, the guy can sing and was spot on his game. So now to the food, on our waitress's recommendation, we ordered the meat and cheese sampler and  our go to appetizer of spinach & artichoke dip. For our main's, I ordered the impossible burger with fries, my fiancee ordered truffle ricotta w/ chicken and our friend's ordered the prime rib French dip and French onion soup and his wife ordered Calabrian shrimp pasta. Everything was soo good, there were no complaints. Almost forgot, we ordered the house Pinot Grigio and 2 Schofferhofer Hefeweizen. The Pinot was good and the Schofferhofer was possibly the best Hef I have tasted. At the end of our dinner,we wrapped it up with pineapple upside down cake, peanut butter lava cake and the glazed donut bread pudding. All in all, I was very impressed with the food and ambiance of Hearthstone and most importantly the service. We couldn't have asked for a better server! Thank you for a great night

uXWnx9EPfldYEiIEngXfqQ.text: First of all, this place was absolutely huge. It goes all the way from the entrance of the casino to the back where they have outdoor seating with fire pits and tea lights. There are also quite a few televisions if you like an upscale sports bar type of atmosphere. They have quite a bit of seating styles everything from hightops to couches and cubbies.  There are a few games set up for those who wish to have the True bar experience.  They occasionally have live music. The musician who is there was extraordinarily good and played all his own instruments and did some very decent covers.  This establishment has a happy hour. But the window is very narrow so make sure you check the website as I have seen a change twice.  The prices for food and drinks there are reasonable. They did have one drink in particular that had habanero sauce in it... It was classified as a Margarita... It should have been classified as volcanic lava LOL :-) but it was one of the more popular drinks and I saw the bartenders bring out dozens within the few hours I was there.  the staff and bartenders and servers were all very competent and provide service with a smile. This place seemed to even flow as far as busyness one minute he would be extraordinarily packed and then there would be a sparse amount of people.  I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is one of the happy hour items. A small personal pizza. Yes the pepperoni&#39;s R not evenly distributed but what you expect for cheap Food

Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pigs in a blanket with special ketchup and mustard sauce also on the happy hour menu. Buttery crust and hot dogs, what could be better

Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I cannot recall the name of this drink, but is the only margarita with habanero sauce and it. Just know that it&#39;s very spicy, but very good

6gbRS0nS3z0E_OSXsFyFIQ.text: It's ok. The place is nice but the food is average and extremely overpriced. The last time I was there the server was absolutely awful. At one point I actually had to get up and go get someone just to take my order. I would recommend any one trying ONCE and during Happy Hour. Otherwise you bill for "just food" will be quite up there.

cn8FSs5L1pc-WWycCvpRAw.text: Besides the amazing live music by Jeremy Cornwell, my latest visit to Hearthstone was disappointing. The shrimp pasta I loved so much (see previous review) was replaced by a new version with a heavier sauce and much smaller shrimp. A big departure from the old dish. Nothing special about it and I probably wouldn't order it again. The lobster cocktail was tiny and overpriced.   On the flip side, the grilled octopus was very good. My husband had the lobster roll, which he really enjoyed. Service was also pretty good.  I'm not one to choose quantity over quality, but the value should definitely be there. If you're paying $100 for dinner for two (no alcohol), you should be left feeling satisfied. This wasn't the case for me, unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pasta (they changed it, shrimp much smaller and less of it)
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus $18 (yummy)
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster cocktail $18 :/

R3yE7XBzvcdn-3ANT81a6A.text: All I can say Christian the server was amazing! The food and drinks were good but the service from Christian was amazing! He went above and beyond. He was conversational and entertaining! He made our experience exceptional and will definitely be back just to sit in his section!

9h1xS4n8WyOkYoFx7Wl9Ww.text: Food and service great.  The bacon wrapped stuffed dates are so yummy!  Pretty cool atmosphere too.  I'm just not that thrilled with selection.  A bit pricey too.

i5O1BEM9yhE1fg9IFSVYJA.text: This place was great.  First, the service was wonderful.   It seems it did not matter who was the server, everyone was there to provide fast service.  A+.   Now food.  We order a burger which was cooked perfect.   Also the fried chicken was very crispy and delicious.   Although the honey sprinkled on the outside made it more messy and sticky.  The deviled eggs were wonderful and had a slight taste of horseradish which really worked well.   The only dish that failed, and failed terribly, was the hummus.   They seem to grade a jalapeno into it which gives it a little spice, but that's it.  The rest tastes like graded sand.   I think 5 starts would have been given but gave 4 because of hummus and also atmosphere with tons of televisions makes it feel more like a bar than the great restaurant it is.

Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e1_cSmoEd54PxIYeu3-B6Q.text: Luv this place . Great people and good food . Don't have to walk through the casino .

sG4T_0dg4jwzNntCDxq5gQ.text: Really good food.  Really good service.  Price is $$- $$$.  Nice outdoor patio if weather is nice enough.  Great wine selection :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aMWPvPSCLOkDmkB2lAM_rA.text: Went to Hearthstone for our date night. Grilled Octopus had great flavor and was cooked perfect. Pulled pork sandwich was amazing as they use their suckling pig. Lobster roll did not skimp on the lobster. Ahmed took care of us and we had some great drinks too..

_XrTXbXGyUDAczoHnMlq7A.text: I went for happy hour.  It was awesome!!! So was our server Ahmed. Got us all we wanted. Try the French dip. Also the veggie sliders. Ps Saturday night they have live music.

UY4w5QGiNLgjAqnbY7eZ8w.text: Used OpenTable to make a reservation for 5 and had no shortage of options on a Saturday night.  After dining, this is a sincere shock to me because our experience was AMAZING.  Everything was great: food, service, atmosphere.  I received a free glass of Pinot Noir for checking in on Yelp!; their house options were delicious.  We were seated right away and our waitress was attentive and knew her audience (knew how to work the wallet, haha).  We ordered appetizers and had some wine before ordering our main entrees.  We shared the braised shortrib meatballs (in a tomato sauce), bacon wrapped dates (they were HUGE and so good), and the tuna tartare (heavily loaded with truffle oil- not my thing).    After enjoying our appetizers, we ordered the fried chicken, pot pie (more truffle oil), calabrian shrimp pasta, cheeseburger, octopus, and mac and cheese (made with brie and fontina). The pot pie and cheeseburger were okay, but the pasta and octopus were delicious.  The fried chicken and mac and cheese were the solid runaway dishes, though.  The chicken was JUICY and flavorful while the mac and cheese was rich and decadent.  I would order those two items again, no questions asked.  Somehow we were coaxed into ordering dessert (we ate every bite of every entree and practically felt sick when we left) and shared the peanut butter lava cake and chocolate souffle.  The lava cake was also rich and the chocolate souffle was the least exciting thing we ate all night.  After finishing our feast, we took advantage of the shuffleboard games in the corner and had a great time.  We're going back for happy hour on Thursday and we cannot wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus, pot pie, mac n cheese, shrimp pasta, fried chicken, and cheeseburger

spGorLCrBs4n_y5bVmHNDg.text: I was a regular for a little over a year and the one thing I have to say is that the service has gone downhill after my favorite bartender Allie disappeared.  I'm not sure what happened but I could always rely on her and getting my orders in right and tight.  Food is great, service was great. I guess I'll just try again and hope for a cool bartender like Allie again.

r9MXf-98YH2YXFshZ4l_bg.text: We came here because we saw this place on DDD.  If did not disappoint.  It is inside a casino and we really did not expect that.  Everything is house made from scratch.  We had the meat and  cheese board for appetizer.  The steak that was on special melted in your mouth.   We shared a seafood platter and that was delicious.  Very fresh.   We even got a free glass of wine for checking in.   That was great.   Overall great food.

h_YNvd3yWc_NZORmjhl8QA.text: This is one of my favorite local spots in Las Vegas. The food, ambiance and location just cannot be beat, no matter what time of day it is. It's conveniently located just within the Red Rock Casino, which still offers free parking. (Yay!)   I came here for brunch and ordered the Salted Caramel French Toast which was a gigantic cinnamon sticky bun with a warm banana maple syrup on the side. As I sat up at the bar, this dish was a literal head turner. The perfect amount of drizzle, not overly sweet and topped with some of the freshest strawberries, raspberries and blueberries I've ever had...I was basically licking the plate!   I also ordered a cup of coffee, which came as a mini pour-your-own pot with a tiny vial of cream; that's what I love about this place, it's all about the details.   At about 1:30pm on a Saturday I was able to walk right in with my choice of indoor, patio or bar seating! The best part about the layout is the variety. There are high tops, lush couches in the center, (perfect for mingling,) bar seating if you'd like to catch a game or elevated crescent booths for larger parties or snuggling up close to your date. But don't worry, if you chose to sit outside, they've got misting fans to keep you cool!   They also offer bottomless mimosas, live music and wine samplings on select evenings. But, their mind-blowing brunch is only available on the weekends and select holidays!

m7iOYH5SJyyL5zqoukzvhA.text: Really cool place, inside & out. We sat outside & had a nice view of the mountains, palm trees & water fountains. Not a huge menu, got a veggie & greens salad which was very good. My daughter got a salad w/ grilled chicken on top & it was not cooked all the way, still pink in the middle. They were tiny pieces of chicken so it should have been no prob cooking them all the way. Also, this place is not cheap, $7-$9 beers, like regular 12 oz. bottles. Outrageous. Ya, Red Rock is super nice so u expect a lil bit higher prices. But I also expect the food to be cooked properly so no one gets food poisoning & has to go home & puke up raw chicken. We won't go back to this one. (Our server did remove the chic. salad from the bill)

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie &amp; greens salad

pDxZgRWE-z2uF8JKGrlNyQ.text: Christian was the best server we've had! Thank you Christian and Hearthstone for the amazing experience for brunch! We'll definitely be back soon!

sAjqE7ZQKcgKAyDOn0KELw.text: When my friend and I arrived it was about 6:30 PM PST on a Thursday and at first glance, it was really busy. Luckily though, we were seated at the pizza bar towards the back aka away from the noise which was perfect.   We both started out with drinks and appetizers for happy hour. I ordered a Moscow Mule (not part of HH, but I can't resist) and Carly ordered a Bay Breeze. Food wise, she ordered the chicken wings and I chose calamari. The calamari was good, except for the slices of lemon that were fried as well that I accidentally ate....but still good nonetheless LOL   Dinner wise, she ordered the Bussell Sprout Salad w/ Chicken. I passed on trying her dish because of the  Caesar dressing (most Caesar dressings are made with raw eggs) but she said it was amazing. I ordered a Meatball Pizza, coincidentally on National Pizza Day. For $23.00 I thought it was ok. Definitely had great flavors and the ricotta on top was phenomenal, but I've this style pizza elsewhere, for less money, comparing taste, as well as larger.   We finished our bff catch up session with dessert. Carly ordered the Peanut Butter Lava Cake which apparently was delicious (in another life, I may know such pleasures). I ordered vanilla ice cream, which came with three large scoops and a warm cookie. Def wasn't expecting it to be that big of a dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball Pizza with ricotta cheese
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut Butter Lava Cake
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bussell Sprout Salad w/ Chicken - apparently the croutons are pretty bomb

14ppGA7csZ--i0XlUzRB6w.text: Hi everyone! Go to Heartstone because there for is great and their price is right. But go back for Ahmed!!! He just makes everything better, in every way.  He cares and gives u the food u didn't know u want the way u want it. Go Ahmed xx

JkYFTObeKqZnTCoFtKGVjg.text: Went to meet up with friends after a Memorial to catch up on memories and we did the reverse happy hour. Justin the entertainment was great, the happy hour pizza was good. The selections on happy hour for drinks was limited- so if you are looking for cocktails they only have ONE drink on there. That was not appeasing. And the waitress we was rude about it when she explained it to us, sorry first time here and we go to a lot of bars who have more than one cocktail on a happy hour menu!   Would I come here again? Would I recommend this restaurant- sure one bad experience with service should bring people back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reverse happy hour!

dbecFrduov64fUBTxa8VWg.text: After living in Vegas for about 2 years this place has definitely solidified itself as my favorite go to spot for excellent food and atmosphere.  The space is open and beautiful, the staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the food is excellent.  While I'd go any day of the week and enjoy the standard menu they have some excellent happy hours items as well (I love the baked ricotta with truffle honey) and dollar oysters on Wednesdays.  Their cocktail selection is also quite good. My wife always enjoys the blackberry bliss.  Compared to strip prices the cost is very reasonable as well!

ui4cD2u7RRdthOlSLXPPeQ.text: I'm going to write this review while I'm a bit buzzed still, because if I don't, it'd be a 2-star summation. Points for high ceilings and decor. That's it. It's a good night to be generous, so here we are, in uncharacteristic brevity:  I had my free buffet ticket, which included $10 anywhere else in the casino. I went here on (observed) Veterans' Day because the line elsewhere was too much, and it was time to try something new in RedRock. What a letdown.   I had the Calabrian Shrimp Pasta, which sounds exquisite, but is not. It has heat, as indicated by the chili descriptor, but is otherwise devoid of flavor. The entire dish is uniform, no variety in flavor. Noodles too long (twss) and missed the al dente part. This is all I had.   The capstone was billing out. I was told my state-issued ID with veteran status indicated was insufficient. It's a Veterans' Day promo, so imagine the frustration and, sitting next to others, the show. Somehow my casino-issued card cleared the way, though. Thank you for your service? None of that. A manager had to be called into play.  "Oh okay, yes, she will take care of that." Brilliant.  A small but telling fiasco.   Plan: enjoy a free buffet of quality food. Result: mediocre-at-best food at Hearthstone, the runaround, and a $25 tab. $35 on a regular night for blase pasta and shrimp, and one beer? God bless America.    You'll find better food at the Feast buffet a short casino-floor walk away, and far superior service. Would have done better using that coupon at Aunti Anne's pretzels.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; cheese for the table, still couldn&#39;t finish!
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh happy hour quinoa salad
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boring. Don&#39;t get this shrimp pasta dish. It&#39;s been criticized before and looks like they&#39;ve changed nothing.

HdBtmbMKrZJY8hgYWiax4Q.text: Unfriendly staff, overpriced food that doesn't even taste good, it was stale and cold. Very inconsistent with drinks, taste and representation. Automatically charged top shelf without asking during happy hour.  I wouldn't recommend or come back

2AaRYSYkhZrkYovtv_UpYA.text: My fiance ordered the Loco Moco asked for well done meat and hard eggs. They served him raw meat and even after we brought it to their attention they never offered to fix it or refund the meal since it was sent back . Terrible experience!

AdP9CaQKGqwgPF7FeHW0Mw.text: Trued this place while staying at the Red Rock Casino, and was absolutely suprised and pleased. We've gone many times now and have always been treated great and the service was wonderful. The food is slightly addictive and well worth the visit to the casino. Super tasty and i highly recommend.

m5lfQJlla2u8C5ipXBkkNw.text: Walking through the door the room felt warm and lux. The room was spacious with great overall decor. Unfortunately, despite the great first impression, this was not a great experience.   We came with a large group (12 people) for a birthday. We came because they had half price bottles of wine, which was awesome. The happy hour menu offers tasty bites that were decently priced (everything $6) and during a football game you can upgrade the wings to all you can eat ($10). They even had happy hour wine that was also $6 (per glass).   The service however, was so so slow. The restaurant was pretty empty, but it still took forever for everything. I ordered a drink and the waitress came back 20min later asking if I wanted a drink. I told her yes and she came back with a taster glass. What the heck? I told her I wanted the adult size and she finally came back with my drink. That was forgivable, but the worst was the wings. Even for bottomless, they only bring you 4 wings at a time and it took 10 - 15min for each round to come out. It got so bad the manager comped us 3 desserts to make up for it; kudos for that. My friends said something similar happened to them the last time they were there and that they also ended up getting comped food. (I'm sensing a trend).  The wine was tasty, the food was good, but don't come if you are in a rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu. Secret menu - $10 for bottomless wings during football.

7hP6fm46Igb5yknCzegKuQ.text: Celebrated a wedding here in a private dining room. The room itself was beautiful and perfectly lit, and the service was terrific. There was always bountiful food and drinks all around the table.  I must have tried a dozen different things, so I'll just comment on a few of my favorites. The best plate of the night for me was the octopus. I've always been lukewarm toward octopus, which I thought of as overpriced, but this one was so tender that I finally understand the hype.   The tuna tartare was also quite good, although the combination of the large pieces and the super delicate chips made it rather difficult to eat. From what I gather, the Baked Ricotta is the restaurant's signature dish, and I totally get why. Everyone at the table was raving about it and its lifespan couldn't have been but two minutes.  This was truly the perfect venue for the occasion!

DJqUy_KcF8p67_5RJExiAA.text: We came for dinner tonight and had a wonderful meal (as always) but an even better experience because of our server, Rigo. His attention to detail, suggestions, friendly personality and attentiveness was greatly appreciated. He had a way of checking up on us without making us feel overwhelmed. This trait is hard to come by these days. We dine out on average 5 nights a week and very seldom leave reviews but I felt I needed to leave Rigo this review. Thank you for a very pleasant dining experience!

QGAYLrkt4dOzsNgHJLfFGg.text: The atmosphere is beautiful. The food is amazing! The service is great! We had a group of 14 people and everything went great. Our server Ahmed was super fun, kind and attentive. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

nP0-wZZI_FExvMMLGmZlEg.text: Husband was thrilled with his taco tuesday unlimited tequila and then again on wednesday with $1 fresh oysters. We had incredible service from Alessandra and Rigo. I would have taken pictures but everything was torn apart pretty fast.  Vegan menu has several great items. Terrific service!

kXonS9MSX8M-8mKEExJT0Q.text: Great place. Food, service, and decor is excellent. Also a fair value.  Rockin Happy Hour.

NE_yCE0nexGwEzzrh67sLw.text: Great atmosphere for brunch! Our waiter Oscar was wonderful!! The build your own omelette was my to go!

3lgeu3Y9WGHTHNwng48eSA.text: Fantastic dining experience. Christian, our waiter, was completely on point. Impeccable service from being sat on-time with our reservation to the appetizers and entrees coming out. We had two of the pizzas, the octopus, the salmon, and few appetizers. All worthy of being ordered. This is a monthly regular still for us.

alruFXTWBcCgLLvewePIJg.text: Absolutely awesome menu! Pretty much everything we had was wonderfully tasty!  Baked truffle honey Ricotta dip, WOOOO!!! Fried chicken!! Mmmmmmm Worth a trip!!

T7rewwe5s2CjZV4kLtRMRA.text: Hearthstone came recommended by our cocktail server in the casino when we asked for a happy hour location; I was sold on $1.00 oysters and half price signature cocktails but it was so much better than that!  Hot wings, pepperoni pizza with perfect pizza dough that was between thin & crispy and hand tossed, and their herbs and greens salad, 2 cocktails, Blackberry Bliss and Cucumber Essence (all $7 each & shareable) in addition to a dozen oysters.   Our server, Oscar, answered all of my crazy questions, the food came quickly, he always followed up to ask if everything was meeting our expectations, plates cleared when needed without us asking or staging them to be removed, and our beverages never went empty. His personality, work ethic & pleasure he takes in serving his guests were evident & made our evening perfect! We finished the night with a doughnut bread pudding & peanut butter lava cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour at Hearthstone!

Qxca89Seyh0FEArSFThynQ.text: Great food. Calzone special was amazing.  Accidentally posted this on "tips" originally...just updating this review.  I remember that calzone and it's been over a year! :-)

WscJ2K9MljepaoCVdNC7dw.text: I love the meaning behind this restaurant, which is they buy their ingredients from local farms.   For an appetizer we had the jalapeno hummus which was very delish! They were not stingy with the amount they gave us. This appetizer is free when you do a yelp checkin! Also, we had the baked truffle ricotta which was SOO GOOD. I highly recommend, it is on the sweet side, so if you are okay with that, definitely get it.   I ate dinner with my 2 sisters. I got the special they were having which was a halibut wit a mushroom risotto. Honestly, I feel in love with this dish. This dish wasn't heavy, but made me so full when I finished. My fish was cooked perfectly. The rice in my risotto was crunchier than I would like it, but the flavor was heavenly. I ate my whole plate clean.   My sister got the salmon. It was really really good. I highly recommend this dish. The salmon was cooked perfectly. But in my opinion, the real stars of this dish is the MUSHROOMS. The mushrooms were stuffed with a salmon puree, and it was heavenly.  We ran into a situation that they brought her halibut instead of salmon, but it was no big deal. The waiter own up to his mistake and quickly got it resolved. (They did apologize a lot for this mistake which we didn't see it being that big of a deal, but we really appreciate how much they cared)   My other sister got the rotisserie chicken. I thought this was okay because the chicken was on the dry side.   Lastly, we had a dessert (given for free due to the mistake on their side, which was really nice of them). We had the Nutella and chocolate pot de creme. This was amazing. And it came with 2 cookies! This was the perfect dessert especially if you love chocolate, but you want to end with a light dessert.   Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant! But would recommend not getting the rotisserie chicken. Everything else though, was amazing and delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Pot De Creme
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rotisserie Chicken
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut with mushroom risotto

Zf7znci1OmcBeOV7QWOiOQ.text: This is inside the Red Rocks Resort and right off casino floor.  We were hopeful to sit outside by fire pit, but there was a waitZ. We got seated right away inside.  I enjoyed Impossible Burger sliders and octopus, both were amazing.  If you're at this resort it worth eating here.  I wouldn't come to the resort just for this restaurant.  Our server was knowledgeable and engaged us.  Enjoy!!

D59lxvE1Gixzs6bG79vdsw.text: On my first visit my girlfriend invited me here for Wednesday night $1 oysters.  I am not a big fan of oysters but I am a big fan of Happy Hours so I accepted the invite.  Having never been here before I was immediately impressed with the decor.  To me it was very Chip and Joanna farmhouse inspired.  We were seated at a booth facing the bar.  We had two servers, a male and female.  I wish I could remember the male's name but he was training Jillian, the female.  They were both very attentive and offered suggestions.  We were going to order a carafe of wine and Jillian let us know that for the price and amount we were better off ordering by the glass.  Aside from the oysters our table ordered the chicken wings, pepperoni pizza and the herbs and green salad.  The Happy Hour menu offerings are $6 so obviously these aren't large portions and it was what you would expect wings, pizza and salad to be.  At least twice during our meal a manager came by to check on us.   Second visit I came with a group of girlfriends, four of us total.  We had reservations, were seated and given menus, both Happy Hour and regular.  Two of us had preordered the Lobster Bowl special for $24.  We asked the waitress about it and she didn't know what we were talking about as far as reserving it.  Not a big deal because she checked and said there were plenty available, 30 to be exact,  After taking our drink orders she kind of disappeared but not really because we could see her chatting with another waitress while we were sitting there with our menus closed ready to order.  Once she finally noticed we were ready she came back and we ordered our food items.  Service on this occasion was not that great.  It was more of a flag down who you could type of evening.  If not for us flagging who we could down I don't remember her independently checking on us once.   The Lobster Bowl was a disappointment.  The lobster was okay but the accompanying bowl items, the potatoes and sausage were bland, tasteless and not seasoned at all.    At this point just by default I'm sure I will be back at the invite of a friend but I will stick to happy hour going forward and hold my expectations of service to a minimum.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UnFE8uE_O2krq9vaC1hw1A.text: I would've given this restaurant 4 plus stars but the service was terrible. Our server spent more time visiting a table of apparently his friends than serving his tables.  We ordered dessert and sat waiting for more than 20 minutes for it. It was a piece of pie!!  I wanted to cancel it but as I left to use the restroom, he finally brought it. And immediately went back to visit at the friend's table.  I don't know how the manager accepts this. And the person giving us water told us we were lucky to have him as a server because he was awesome. If I could find her I would set her straight.

29CQGflEGGRDAtXJj8Cb3Q.text: This was my first time at this restaurant and I was excited to come due to all the good reviews. Came here on a Wednesday for their $1 oyster and happy hour menu from 5-7pm. Each item was $7, guess the price went up a dollar. Portions were small but you get what you pay for. Had the baked ricotta toast, veggie slider w sweet potato fries, wings, and checked in for the hummus. I am not a vegetarian but the veggie slider was the best I've ever had. I would order that over a greasy cheesy hamburger. That's how good this was. Wings were unmemorable and hummus was meh but can't complain about free food right? Very impressed w the freshness of the oyster.   I'd come back for the oysters and the veggie sliders. Service was surprisingly good and got seated quickly.

r_4H8Bo2ZxDamm9EhFtODQ.text: Coming on Wednesday for $1 oysters and happy hour was a great idea. We had the charcuterie, wings, pizza, and hummus, all super yummy!

3PBRVVs_ErZZ0XjXQEpmqQ.text: Food was so Amazing. Did not have a reservation but was sat pretty quickly by a very friendly host. We sat on the patio so it was a beautiful scenery. I had an amazing server Gerson, he was very knowledgeable and helped with every questioni had . Had an amazing night out with my friend and will definitely come back. Thanks gerson!

Uikq5onY929gdHuX-ixieA.text: I have to say, Rigo was on the the best servers I've ever had. I came in with my bf today to celebrate his birthday and had an amazing experience! The place was great, they had great live music, the food was amazing, and excellent service. I will definitely be back! Thank you!

idGIkqlkXjSa-v1ASSqZoA.text: Great food with fabulous waitstaff and management. We've been going to this restaurant for quite a while and never been disappointed with their food and service. Lisa always remembers to bring me a small sample of onion soup to see if it's what I want with my dinner. The onion soup is great and the chicken dishes are superb. My wife loves the prime rib.  The value and quality is great. Diane, the manager always comes by and remembers everything about what we like. They are very attentive to our needs. We will continue to visit this restaurant. We have an abundance of choices, but the overall experience at Hearthstone is excellent.

A1c9RUMlGnNfLFUZseA9DA.text: Food was excellent and the service was even better! We were served by a nice young man, Gerson. He made sure to answer any questions we had about the menu and gave us excellent suggestions. Another server, didn't catch his name but another young man with a bun as also lovely with helping give direction when we needed it.   The food was absolutely amazing, we had calamari, 4 cheese pizza, a hamburger and a quinoa and apple salad. Everything was brought out quickly and smelled as good as it looked. The burger was cooked directly as ordered and the salad was amazing as well.  Wonderful experience for locals and tourists.

OurHFy0flhugFT9Arr9tzg.text: This place was amazing. We came with about 15 people for brunch and just had the best time. Pizzas, mimosas, seafood, you name it everything was delicious. The service was on point too. The manager Diane was super sweet and our server Rego  never let our drinks run out. Great place for kids too. They had a great time playing shuffle board and watching tv. Highly recommend this place and can't wait to come back for dinner.

562pqvzXLSqN_tPXz3V1Rw.text: Oscar immediately greeted us when we arrived. It was happy hour, he mentioned it to us and helped me decide on a cocktail. The food was ok but his service was what made my night. He checked on us to insure that we were enjoying everything. He was so pleasant and friendly. Ask for Oscar!

SZce2jUuCFLJ4BK9c8ti5Q.text: We recently went to Hearthstone on Sunday afternoon for brunch.   The food was excellent and the service was good.  We went there at 1:00.  Note that on Sundays they have a brunch menu rather than their lunch menu, but they do have several lunch items in case you want lunch rather than brunch type food.   I will go back there for dinner sometime in the future.

IUuzoguZDjRBVZeq5FeymA.text: This place has good food, I'll start there. The drinks were good, too (I liked the Little Boy Blue). We went on a Wednesday, and my hubby partook in the $1 oysters. I'll just say that Anthony Bourdain was right to warn not to order seafood on Wednesday--fresh shipments typically come on Thursday.  I had the vegan sliders and they were delicious. My hubby's rotisserie chicken was good, though not great, and slightly over-spiced. The hummus plate we started with was a win, though; it was a generous portion (not the happy hour size) and served with really yummy crackers.  The biggest plus AND minus was the service. They seemed to be overwhelmed when we arrived and no one came to take our drink order in the bar area for at least 15 minutes. The staff made up for that, however, by acknowledging their mistakes and giving incredibly friendly table service.  All in all, we would return!

1F3hORsj5Qfxz7p__XinoQ.text: I've been here a couple times. But tonight was one of those experiences where you don't return. The hostess was rude upon our arrival, and stated it would be a ten minute wait though the restaurant was probably 30% full. Our water glasses had chunks of fruit on them upon us sitting down. Our waiter took 10 minutes to approach us, another waitress addressed us before he did, to ask us if we wanted menus. After dropping off our food he never once came back to check in, see if we wanted anything else or drinks etc. He finally came to check if we wanted boxes and dropped off the check. In between all of this we had to watch the hostess and another waiter play out what appeared to be their personal drama on the patio. Good grief.

CjmQp5pn9AlD9WoMhYBXdw.text: Excellent service and good food! Our waiter Gerson was really friendly and made sure we were happy throughout our meal :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_dOshD2gjBYbwk47Fc4aVA.text: Best French onion soup I've ever had, it was honestly perfect it was just the perfect amount of cheese it wasn't too salty I would come back for this item alone over and over again. The place is a bit on the pricey side, but the quality of food matches the price, they also have a delicious happy hour.

YQqNIRIDWZVqNGEyge7NUw.text: We got the octopus, recommended by our server Gerson (sorry if I spelled that wrong!) and he was very nice and gave us great service. The octopus was really good too! My husband got the scallops which were great and I got the Hanger steak which was super chewy and didn't have a ton of flavor unfortunately, but luckily came with a really good aioli dip. We got the bread pudding for dessert and it was pretty good too

ES46RXoH4srCw6DuF2-8jQ.text: I have to say, I'm very impressed with this place. The price a little steep, but The food is great, the live band and atmosphere are awesome. Now the bottomless mamosas and micheladas are a out of the park home run. I love taking my employees there. It's a good place to hold small meetings and small office Birthday parties. I give this place two thumbs up.

y9M1pNIQDPJEZLJian14rA.text: My husband and I recently came in for dinner, and may I just say that the service, the food, the atmosphere were ALL spectacular. We came during happy hour, and ordered hummus, which was incredibly tasty. I would definitely recommend ordering it. For our entrees, I ordered one of their specials, which was a soft shell crab sandwich, and my husband ordered their fried chicken. My husband is rather picky with foods he eats (me, not so much as I love everything and anything), and after one single bite of his food he immediately told me that it was some of the best chicken he has had. My sandwich, however, was THE tastiest sandwich I've had in a long time. If they had that as a regular menu item I would order it every time. Overall, our waitress was kind and service was great. I would highly recommend trying this restaurant at least once.

ARyUHrhf9VcFJhRpV_rAeg.text: We came here for dinner again with the whole family. It was Veterans day and a Sunday so it was 50% off for veterans and 50% off pizzas. One of my Uncle's is a veteran and he had his military ID with him.   I split the meatball pizza with my other Uncle. The meatball pizza was with veal and pork meatballs, ricotta and mozzarella. My Aunt ordered a chopped salad to start and shared it with everyone. I had some and it was pretty good. It reminded me of pepperocinics. Probably because there were pickled red peppers and pickled garbanzo beans in it that had that spicy pickled flavor. My parents got the grilled octopus to start and it was alright. it wasn't as crispy as I would like though, kinda slimy on the outside.   All the entrees came out two at a time. We got our pizza last. It was a really delicious pizza. The meatball was meaty, yet smooth and the ricotta globs were creamy. The ricotta was my favorite part. I would even dip my crust from my last slice of pizza into the ricotta from my next slice since it was a little burnt and hard. My Uncle and I destroyed it, we ate the whole thing. Except for one slice though, we gave that to my Dad. They really do have excellent pizza here.   For dessert I got the s'mores milkshake with Kaluhua. It was really good. You could taste the alcohol, but it wasn't too strong and the s'mores was tasty. Service here was great. Our waitress was really nice and informative. This place deserves an extra star. We all had a great dinner.

0YoRSDRILxK8DIASVItagg.text: This was my first visit to Hearthstone and all I can say is they have a great happy hour! Our server Gerson was very tenative and came to check our table more than necessary to make sure our glasses were never empty! The great service from the staff along with the beautiful sun setting over the mountains from the patio seating made this visit my first of many.

lEG8pRJHAR4NgIjb3Mvapw.text: Went here for brunch with my friends and we had so much fun. Not only was everything delicious, but our server was so great. His name was Ahmed & he was super friendly and attentive. We loved him!   Make sure to get their bottomless mimosas during brunch!

yvkNlXVb9WUKz6E3F8xlIw.text: My mom and I came here tonight before going to see a movie.  We got here at 6:30 pm (Friday).  The restaurant was half empty, but we were seated on the patio because all the tables inside were reserved.  It was actually a nice day out, with a little breeze.  The misters were on so that made it kind of cold.  They eventually turned them off, but not before basically being showered on. Lol no biggie, but it was a little chilly.  I ordered the Baked Ricotta Toast with truffle, honey, and chives.  This came off the Happy Hour (5-7 pm) menu.  I thought it was absolutely delicious.  My mom thought it was too sweet.    For my entree I had the Truffle Pasta with peas, prosciutto, truffle cream, and chicken.  It was yummy as well.  I also had a Raging Bull (vodka, passion fruit, orange, cranberry, lemon, Orange Red Bull) which was pretty tasty too.  We didn't have room for dessert.  Maybe next time.  At 7 pm there was live music.  The ambiance was lovely.  The restaurant is large and open, absolutely beautiful.  There are some couches near the live entertainment, but those filled up quickly.  The entire restaurant was almost full when we were finished.  Two cocktails, two happy Happy Hour appetizers, and two entrees came out to $96.  Service was friendly, but kind of slow.  We received our cocktails a few minutes after our appetizers.    I will be back to try more Happy Hour items.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Pasta

4w1ZS57p_hLlpd5xQnKgAQ.text: Holy Pig!! This is a feast truly fit for a king. After a meal like this, I can see why people are tempted to get pig tattoos. Book well advance and starve for the day. The menu lists feeds 5 (starving Vikings) or  10 average men. Be prepared for gawkers as the presentation for this meal will be a show stopper. Im glad I have photos and videos of the event because I was so full and drunk to even remember the rest of the details.
