May6OOanndhKtSIxeGD78A.text: They really take care of their guests! They go above and beyond! Thank you to our waitress and the manager! I'll be back for my lollipop chicken wings!

SHggtnePoeE2YsHAWCxHwA.text: The service here was amazing! Our server Ahmad was so attentive and social, we all really enjoyed talking with him. The food also was amazing! I got the black truffle pasta  definitely recommend coming to see this place.

lbxsQDftnLoyOjU31pMldw.text: I like to visit this place often since it's near me. It's such a happy environment and I definitely recommend the lollipop chicken wings and their quinoa salad. Those are my favorite dishes. Other dishes that I also like are the burger and lobster roll. Personally I don't like oysters but my friends love Hearthstone's oysters since they're so fresh. Also, every Wednesday their oysters are $1. Hope this helped!

qqJydIHuRQvLrR6MUdjEKg.text: Had a birthday event on Friday December 21, at this place. It was fantastic! Absolutely fabulous.... The food was very delicious. We had the famous yummy suckling pig the chef delivered it in front of our table and demonstrate it his skills cutting the pig. Pasta truffles yummm!... Salad , appetizer, desserts just absolutely delicious. The place is nice ,classy and clean . The staffs are very helpful and  friendly! Thank you Russell, Shane, Ahmed , Natalie for all your help and Jazmin for recommending the Heartstone Kitchen and cellar .  Definitely comeback to this place .... Also forgot to mention a few staffs didnt get their names help the actual server of that evening. Thank you very much !

Y0ryafMXonBtviwzXoXREA.text: What more could we ask for? Excellent service, memorable food, perfect drink mixing, and unmatched hospitality. If you have a special occasion, check out Hearthstone Kitchen!   We came for our last night as a bachelorette partly in Vegas, and from the moment we sat down, the entire kitchen staff was attentive and helpful! The kitchen even sent out a complimentary margarita pizza for us which was spectacular!   The bride-to-be had the blossom bomb cocktail and it was one of the most balanced drinks we had in the city and the most beautiful to look at. I asked for a gin drink modified with basil and lemon (which I ask for often, and am always disappointed), but they NAILED it. I'm actually frustrated that we didn't come here sooner in our visit. Make it happen! Visit Hearthstone!

sHPj56Ez445ZdZ8x712cvg.text: Wanted to share our excellent experience yesterday celebrating Mother's Day brunch with AMAZING food, mimosas and service!!!  The atmosphere was beautiful, we had such a wonderful time.  Our server who went above and beyond made our visit very special and she was extremely helpful and patient with our kids...thank you Al!  Highly recommend this restaurant.

BIXtxXStUcXcOAUe4vFizQ.text: Had a wonderful experience for Mother's Day lunch today. Took my wife and kids here after we heard great things about their brunch. Wifey loved the eggs Benedict (the one with the tomato and avocado) and the chicken and waffles were cooked perfectly! Love that they let our kids build their own pizza. Service was on point despite looking really busy! I believe her name was Annie. Definitely want to come back and try their dinner, but will recommend the brunch for sure.

UIR3WhK55TAUSf8oT9kTkw.text: Nice atmosphere, good menu, great staff. Enjoy dining here often.  Enjoy the multiple TVs for Sunday sports. Two thumbs up.

uLVMVboTbQjxOizpHJLptg.text: The food and mimosas were good, but I've never had such horrible service. After the hostess sat us we waited for ~5 minutes before the same hostess came to drop us menus. Another 10 minutes after this the manager came to get drinks from us and told us our waitress would be with us shortly. She came and took our orders shortly after and that was the last time we saw her until she dropped our check off; which she did without saying anything, and before we were finished eating. We paid quickly even though we weren't finished, and then went 55 minutes without anyone coming over at all. After waiting for almost an hour for someone to stop by so we could get more water and mimosas, I asked a different busser if he would be able to grab refills for us. He said yes but after another 15 minutes of waiting and no one coming back we decided to get up and leave. Horrible experience, which is very disappointing considering this place had a very cool atmosphere and good food.

I1F6dijoxIo1o2je_b3OXw.text: Had a great dinner at Hearthstone last night!  It ticked all the boxes for us- food, service, drinks, cleanliness, noise level, and decor. Our table had a pizza, and I had a French dip sandwich, which was perfect. Elisa was our server, and suggested a blackberry bliss, which I LOVED. :)  She was a lot of fun, and on the ball.  We'll be back next trip!

kiZNu8IbE0VOiXpNMJhyPw.text: This place is a great place to eat! My husband, father in law, aunt & uncle and I came in from out of town and love the Summerlin area, so choosing a restaurant at Red Rock hotel and casino was an easy choice! The service was quick and servers were helpful and nice. The food was amazing, I had a ham, egg and cheese croissant, it was messy and so delicious! Everyone chose something different from the menu, no one was disappointed! We all highly recommend coming in for a nice meal!

pX_cdG9tUa7mgBNS-9O3Sw.text: Was with a large group sat on the patio and everything was so great including all the staff, our server Nate gave us the best service ever and Diane is always amazing, food was great and it's such a beautiful restaurant! 10/10 would recommend

bcjEeJsMHkCW3_OcJL1dRA.text: This place is a bit overrated and over priced. They use to have a great happy hour until instead of raising the prices, they just cut the portions in half. They know about it cause they tell me they hear it all the time. The funny thing is they never did anything about it. At least if your going to be raked over the fire at the cash register, you   should stuff me up till I can't feel myself laugh, before you do that. Food is not bad but service is sometimes slow, as they are always understaffed. Go where you feel like a valued and healthy customer. Goto t-bones. You get fed well, great food, great service and it is pricey, which you would expect.

5mnxe7wz1STLgI4N3kPeNg.text: Went for my daughters 25th Birthday and got an amazing server Ahmed . Awesome customer service. We had bacon wrapped dates and meat and cheese board was really good. As for my main course flank steak and lobster tail was delicious. Thanks Ahmed for a great experience...

juedSpzOShNwB_LVn2Y02A.text: Very nice place , our waiter was very attentive and recommended dishes for my group to try.  The Cajun shrimp and grits was awesome.

k-FcJSBlVJrxIH9HU7RscQ.text: Gerston was amazing!!! Excellent service, quick and helpful. He suggested the grilled cheese and it was unbelievable. Food and spicy margarita were unreal!!!

2p-Z8bVfjgFT-DxnUSLo2w.text: When my husband and I went to hearthstone we had the best time! Delicious food and great service to go along with it. Jocelyn was the best! We went during happy hour which is great because all the items on the HH menu are $6! I had a pepperoni pizza and some chicken wings!  Jocelyn let us know that they have $1 oysters on Wednesday's so we will have to come back and visit her on a Wednesday next time!

gmv5bh00vnFVKQm2Qfe2rA.text: Hearthstone is awesome! They have great drinks. My favorites are the babymaker, hearthstone margarita, and raging bull. They offer a great happy hour menu Mon-Fri 5-7pm. As well as $1 oysters on Wednesdays. I have always had great service when I go and the waiter Christian is fantastic. He is very attentive, makes you feel welcomed, and just delivers great service overall! They have a great layout and delicious food. A must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gk_KaiRIbfQi2VDnac7Xdw.text: Went on a Sunday when the pizzas were half price - great food and my bartender was awesome even tho I dont drink alcohol. Great atmosphere and good food - whats not to like? Want to try the Steak next time i go

A9w6Ntfpqgbclu_w_Yn4Ug.text: Went here on a Sunday during brunch.  Let me start by saying the room is very nicely designed and the layout is inviting.  Service was uneven and our waitress simply took our order and seemed disinterested in providing quality customer service.    After reviewing the menu i noticed one thing.....PRICEY.  They have a $21 burger.  All it advertised on the menu was pickle sauce, pimento cheese, onion, lettuce, and tomato. Why the $21 price tag? Wagyu? Truffles?  Prime house made ground beef? I skipped it and went for the Croque Madame.  I ordered a Latte and got a Macchiato (call me a coffee snob but theres an obvious difference) and the wife ordered a coffee which never came.  Food a long time to come out but my dish was delicious.  The baby had pancakes (unfortunately no kids menu was provided). My wife had the Egg sandwich croissant that comes with breakfast potatoes.  It was strange that she requested to substitute the breakfast potatoes for the crispy hash browns on the sides menu (willing to pay an uncharge) she was quickly shut down and told no.  Potato for Potato...anyway she went with a side order of the has browns ($8) which when received (they forgot them when delivered the entrees) were no better than the hash browns you receive at Jack in the box.  They had to be frozen and not house made..disappointing.  Asked for a coke from the busboys.."let me tell your server"..its a coke just go get it.  Never charged on the check.   Wife asked for coffee again and was delivered...Never charged on the check.  This place has a lot of potential but service has the too cool for school attitude.  Hope they improve this area of the concept.

YRgjmeu6fTTe5-BNZQtmtQ.text: My friends and I really enjoy coming to Hearthstone for their Sunday brunch. The decor is modern rustic and very appealing to the eye. They also have a comfy lounge area and their patio is beautiful! I usually get their quinoa salad or mushroom pizza. Their pizzas are to die for here! All their ingredients are fresh and I'm almost certain their dough is home made. Make sure to stop by if you're in the Red Rock Casino.

h2VdRy3dvDNqUcvXV7drhA.text: We have been wanting to attend brunch here for some time now and glad we did.   2 adults and 3 busy kids, the hostess sat us at our requested patio table and the kids sourced some board games from the shelves to stay busy. Kids are allowed in the lounge where they can play shuffle board or just play games.   Everything we ordered was excellent and Sara, the manager on duty was attentive and visible. Wind was blowing the cabana flap behind us, she subtly placed a pillow, kids wanted to play shuffle board and she volunteered to teach them the rules. Real personalized service and a great local spot for any meal.   Would definitely return and thank Sara for her hospitality today to our family.

FmJNEiR_jVUtYcjcaOaUqQ.text: I took my family here for my mothers birthday and I was blown away! The manager Sarah was more than accommodating and helped me set up the table to surprise my mother with flowers. She also sent out appetizers as well and they were phenomenal! The baked truffle ricotta spread was so amazing! The wings, tartare, octopus all were great as well. We then had the apple and quinoa salad, which was a great combination of flavors. The last course was hanger steak, which was very flavorful, truffle pasta and Calabrian shrimp pasta and both were to die for! Our server Alex was on point and was very knowledgeable about the menu. She went above and beyond to ensure that my family had a great dining experience. If you are looking for a place to celebrate special occasions, this is definitely the place to go!

rWkiWDuzWxPXzO8lUJwryw.text: I can not RAVE about this restaurant enough. Food is to die for and the staff is all gorgeous and they have a vast knowledge of their menu. I wish there was a 10 star option

tK5M7fYX1lwGhB9IpDYguw.text: They are getting one star because I love the decor and they could of had potential...  I really really really wanted to like this place, but I just can't justify anything beyond the decor and sitting near carrot top that was worth coming back for.   We arrived for our reservation and were seated promptly. It took over ten min to be greeted and given menus. Okay no big deal. I couldn't tell who our server was because there were about ten people working our table. Ordered a champagne... It tasted old... The cocktails were okay... Tried a few of my friends... The carrot tequila one (the baby maker) was pretty delicious.   We ordered a bunch of food to share... We asked them to make the broccoli vegan... Literally brought out steamed broccoli... No seasoning, garlic... Nothing... Okay. So I asked for a side of balsamic, never came. I asked again, and ten min later it showed up, but by then the broccoli was almost gone. We ordered the jalapeno hummus. I asked for a side of vegetables, told them I would pay. The server wasn't sure if the crispy sesame flat bread was Vegan... So I wanted to play it safer rather than be sorry. He went on to tell me he didn't think the chef would do a side of veggies... SO I had to order fourteen dollar veggies in this ice thing... It came with a green goddess dressing that I couldn't eat because the mayo had egg. Cool. Fourteen dollars for some raw veggies sticking up out of ice so I can eat the hummus. Nice up sell dude. Too bad it sucked and I got suckered. Steps of service guys!! Accommodate your guests without robbing them! The beet salad was really really good. Nice presentation and the only thing I didn't have to modify to death and get up charged on to eat.   Our friends ordered the octopus, said it was okay... And the roasted potatoes... Which were good... And the squash (wasn't vegan) couldn't try it but they said it was okay. They actually forgot to put the squash in and brought out two orders of potatoes on accident. Very accommodating and took both off the bill (props for fixing that one) They ordered the chefs choice meat and cheese board (don't waste your time or your money) it wasn't worth 10 dollars let alone the 20 they spent on it. Four crackers, a few slivers of meat, and a piece of cheese. (Go to honey salt and order it there) Our waters were dry for over twenty min... My friend needed a beer for almost 30 min... By the time they asked, we were ready to go. I promise you I am not even over exaggerating on the time frames right now, it really pissed me off. It was my birthday... Not even a happy birthday from any of the ten people we had working our table.  I love good food, going out, and spending money is never an issue. I was genuinely excited about trying this place. I can honestly say none of us will ever be back. The food I could eat was bland and not flavorful... For the price point... It should of been on point and it just wasn't. I still had a great bday though. And I'm glad to say I could knock this one off our book marks.

wcXv7f_-sfxUL_yIK2FZJA.text: Went here last night for dinner at around 6pm. The design and decor of the place is very inviting with a fun atmosphere. Ordered the artichoke shared plate which was not what we expected. It was 4 hearts with a cilantro sauce. It was tasty don't get me wrong just a little small. Next we ordered to full sized entrees, the Calabrian shrimp pasta and the braised short ribs. Both were awesome tasting but again were small for the price. The only other thing that bothered me just a little was the fact that it felt like we have 5 different waiters serving us. It was pretty hard to figure out who we were tipping at the end of the meal. Overall food was well put together with good complex flavors but service could have been just a bit better with more engaged waitstaff and yes it's inside red rock so expect to pay a premium. These 3 dishes and two drinks a little over 100.00 with tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short ribs

Dy3gTPpVfmMGatfUFodrYA.text: Had the brunch. Shellfish platter was okay. Oysters are fresh though. Chicken club was pretty decent. The menu doesn't offer anything too nice for brunch. Will try the dinner though.

sDuWHGBn2ZmJMfLu1Jm8AQ.text: I will never give this place 4 stars. We ate cauliflower steak, that was bad, don't order it. We ordered grilled octopus and tuna carpaccio that was good, nothing crazy. But, the worst thing was the service, they had more waiters then people at the restaurant and everything took them forever, if you hungry and want a quick food, that's is not the place. We got our appetizer dish before our drink, such a joke. Not recommend at all

9t4Mc3l7UURS7U9v241dpQ.text: There truffled pizza was tasty but salty, hummus was not anything special but their oysters were on point! Amazing! Hence the 3 stars Wine selection is good the free glass wig check in was horrible! Why even offer it...

i66Si63uO1d7fWkQRyiQ9g.text: Rarely to I get so excited about a restaurant, but Hearthstone's chef's creations are worthy of a walk through the casino. My tastebuds jumped for joy in tasting the food, every detail was amazing. I really can't wait to go back

AhF1Ryrp4o6-iZN8E1mnqQ.text: Went in for brunch at noon with my daughter (1year old) and my niece (10 years old). I had 3 friends joining us later for brunch and mimosas. The restaurant was fairly busy. They had two large parties plus a dining room full of people. So I was patient. I'm a server so I understand when things get hectic. We asked to move to the lounge area since the short tables were taken and it isn't possible to put a high chair at the booths. My daughter is one year old so it also gave her more room to run around. We were seated at 12:10pm. Moved at 12:18pm. The server greeted herself and asked if we were dining in or just waiting to be seated. I told her we were dining and wanted drinks around 12:20 we ordered our drinks. Then she didn't come back she was serving all of the other tables around us but not us. At 12:47 I have two hungry and upset children with me; who hadn't eaten all morning. All of the tables around us had eaten some were able to eat and leave before our server even offered us food. So I called over the manager or supervisor danielle. Danielle apologized and turned the experience around. Our food arrived shortly after 1 pm and my kids were finally happy. The food was delicious. If it wasn't for Danielle I wouldn't come back because of bad service. There is no reason you should neglect a particular table for 20-30 minutes. I'm used to it because of the color of my skin. Typically people don't serve me or put their all into me because I'm young and black they think I won't tip or something. But I'm a server myself. And pride myself on customer service and speed of service. So I would hope to be treated that way when I go out to places. I won't post the servers name because towards the end when all of my friends arrived she became faster. Also some of her tables left so I believe she had more time to serve us. This restaurant got 4 stars because of the management. Good management can make or break an establishment.

3lv0_tsIB_ZBxefUVGc1Dw.text: Been twice to this spot and probably won't go back. First off the food is tasty but its different and expensive. The 2nd visit we sat at the bar in front of the beer taps. We had the worst service. We felt invisible and ignored. The poor bar back wasn't allowed to help us b/c they're union and his job wasn't to tend to guests. It was my man's first visit and he said he never needs to go back. There is something about a concept when Light Group owns them that they don't hire experience, they go for looks. Womp womp

ZgWe8BZ2wuS8B8fTpWiSkw.text: Last night I had the pleasure of dining for the first time at Hearthstone Kitchen.  First off the decor and ambiance is great, really lovely atmosphere with nice big tables that feel like you are eating in a reclaimed barn/small town mill of sorts.  Rustic furniture and distressed white washed brick walls made it feel very comfortable and inviting.  The staff was very friendly and very attentive to our large group.  We came to celebrate a birthday and get some food before a move that night.  We never felt rushed and we encouraged to have a great time.  The food was delicious and we sampled from a few of the starters.  Nothing we had was bad so I won't point out something specific to try, just try it all!  I was really craving pork when I got there but the server made a great suggestion with the hanger steak; really delicious.  I would say that I'd give it 5 stars but for them to do that they need to have a pork option other than the beast feast for an entree.  Say a nice thick cut bone in pork chop with a nice reduction sauce....:)  just saying, I really wanted some pork last night! :)  Otherwise a great place I hope to come back to.

XJifQ7y4il3VVRGGxnHaqw.text: The decor here is A-MAZING. I love how cozy and cute and homey it feels here. And the wait staff is pretty darn adorbs too.   However, the food was just okay. I really enjoyed the some of the small plates for sharing. For instance, the Baked Ricotta & Honey was to-die-for, and the Charcuterie had some nice proscuitto & salami. But these plates literally came with like 4 pieces of bread....and weren't really large enough for sharing.   Overall, I just feel like the bang for your buck is not there. It's a cute space and the food is decent, but if I'm paying $11 for a Caesar salad, I expect it to be a full size salad. My salad was maybe the size of a side order, if that. I definitely still left hungry after spending $35....  PS - Came here for the "Share the Love" event, which I think is pretty awesome. If you check in on Yelp, you get a free glass of house wine with dinner, and if you order a charcuterie plate, $5 goes to charity :) Event ends 2/7 so head on over soon if you wanna check it out!

XIf-Bcki2-XOi1fh3E_b4w.text: Pricey but really good and really nice. Cocktails are delicious & unique with a perfect ratio. Ambience was pleasant and comfortable. Service .. Excellent. Menu selection is interesting and fun. Food was fresh and tasty. Ordered crabby snacks to nibble on. Entrees - He ordered the black truffle hanger steak with crispy potatoes. Very good. He didn't want to share. I had raw oysters (I chose East Coast) and they were so good that I didn't even think to ask for crackers like I usually do. The topping and Tabasco were all I needed. The Peanut Butter Lava Cake was heavenly.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

brLtaSrBEyvmzgKLa-3FBw.text: Had family in town and had heard good things about Hearthstone. We visited on Saturday. The room was fairly busy. I enjoyed the service very much and thought the food was great.

2TY9el9cRkqfsrRV_VuuiA.text: Hearthstone is my go to for brunch on Sundays.  We always get the bottomless mimosas which are a great deal.  My favorite brunch item is the California benedict.  Last Sunday I got the Harvest quinoa salad and it was one of the best salads I have had in awhile.  The staff is always friendly and attentive.  The service couldn't be better.  I recommend this place to everyone.

EiCdSJHqK7KAhvbNDhql6w.text: I came here with a large group for a business dinner.  We had some wonderful appetizers and my meal (flatbread pizza) was delicious!!  After all the appetizers we shared I was stuffed by the time the pizza came.    Because I was a vegetarian the waitress did a great job helping me customize a pizza to be hearty and delicious.  I really appreciated that.  The pizza was really amazing and there was a vast array of healthy appetizers to keep us satisfied while we all waited  for the main courses to arrive.  I'd definitely love to eat here again.

EpzuaMFWK_6keSp_qgDe2g.text: Well if you came to have a drink, save your time and money and just have a free drink in the casino. I think my listerine at home has more booze in it than the drinks here. Really unfortunate. The place has an awesome atmosphere, just zero (and I mean zero) quality in the bar arena.

cr_pCn20xtZn5otky2zAUw.text: I love this place, the food rocks. Thank you @marythemanager @Tien for taking care of us tonight, it was very memorable. Coming back for the wings, dates, and beets salad. Real good.

NqBE5XwBOke_pazHEpyL6g.text: Ordered 12 different items. Everything was really good! -flatbreads which are basically pizzas: Doc and Primavera  -bone marrow  -truffle popcorn -bacon wrapped dates -watermelon salad  -burger  -carrots  -hummus  -ricotta honey -artichoke  -crab toast  I'm forgetting some of the other stuff.

leoV_pqadrn4F1O0D9YVtg.text: My new favorite restaurant in Summerlin. Ate here for the first time when they opened and have returned several times since.  I laugh at negative reviews from any new restaurants grand opening.  You have to give it time for them to work out their kinks.    I would return nightly just for their steak tartare.  It is awesome!  In fact, most of their appetizers are really good.  Tuna carpaccio, oysters, seafood platters...    For kids, they let them make their own pizza.  Kudos to any restaurant in a casino that acts like they care about the families with kids.  The ambience is great.  Service is solid.  This is definitely one of the best restaurants in Summerlin.

-0-EN-u6lAZaQ2crPN7lZg.text: My boyfriend and I checked out Hearthstone last night before going to see ghostbusters and I was really impressed! We got there in time for the happy hour which the friendly hostess Ashley informed me was only at the bar and lounge, so we sat at the bar. The restaurant had interesting antiquish decorations and a trendy atmosphere. There is a $6 hh menu, with some drinks on it too. My boyfriend had the steak tar tar bites and I had to try the pepperoni pizza and I'm glad I did! The pizza is so good really smoky with fresh tasting ingredients. For dinner I had the Salmon- delicious and my boyfriend enjoyed the Hanger steak, it was seriously the best. The bartender Fernando also talked us into a lava cake for dessert, It was all incredibly flavorful. I loved the food here, and their happy hour is a pretty good deal. I will definitely be back to try some more woodfired pizzas!

EeTMn8MC8lcdys0XDF7GqQ.text: Came here with my husband the other night and had an incredible experience. If you live in or are even in the Summerlin area this is definitely a place to check out! We came around 6 and even though we did not have a reservation and it was quite busy the hostess was kind and showed us to a table. Our server, Caitlyn arrived almost immediately after and help guide us through the menu and help narrow down some of our choices. She recommended the baked ricotta appetizer which was FANTASTIC, seriously, this was like dipping toast into a pot of gold. My husband got the Hangar Steak which he enjoyed, and I tried the salmon, which was another one of our server's recommendations. I've had a lot of salmon at a lot of different places but this may be the best piece of salmon that I have ever had, it was cooked to perfection and came with an eggplant puree which was the perfect accompaniment to the dish. At the end when the dessert menu was dropped off we were both so full but with the previous courses being so good we decided to suck it up (we're troopers, I know), and try the peanut butter lava cake. And I have no words to describe it, it was fantastic. One of the managers, Sarah even came by the table to make sure that everything was okay which I really appreciated because most restaurants don't do this anymore and it all together was a very enjoyable experience in a very beautiful restaurant. We will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner at Hearthstone! Very trendy and comfortable, beautiful detail and decor.

j8rCXCsGysxxR5xFA7V6jQ.text: I loved my experience here. The service was nothing special. Half way thru our meals our server got switched to another big party and it kind of left of waiting in the wings but not terribly long. The food was fantastic. I had about seven plates because I love to eat and enjoyed eating all of them even if there flavor did no appeal to me. The Brie was awesome almost too much flavor. The beef tartar was unreal good and as crazy as this sounds the bread to put it was on point! Stuffed dates were way different than most and made you think. The meatballs were also good and my wife liked them a lot even though the spices did not agree with mostly because there was some Clive in there which I can't stand. The foie peanut butter and jelly was great in concept and execution. Than the dessert we had the peanut butter lava cake. I loved this plate. It was interactive interesting and intensely flavored. Will go back here for sure! Hope the quality does not fall off after the opening!

fwfDR5UbEUgACbF-V8nKkw.text: Wanted to try a new spot and was recommended to try out Hearthstone by a friend. Great decor and energy. Especially loved the food! Must haves on the menu are the  Steak Tartare, Deviled eggs, Charred Octopus and the Charcuterie! Enjoy!

BsXCzWxNxJZuwa3Fk6Xz3w.text: We love this place great food and drinks great ambiance. One of the best Restuarants in Summerlin.

ju6N0-e-qNGQ9iR-kiIQCw.text: Worst service EVER!!! Was looking forward to dinner here...made reservations for 7:30 for the patio. Was there and told that they were opening patio for service and would be seated. No one in patio at all, and after 40mins of waiting, and being told "we're next",watched others walk up and being seated in patio!!! We left, went next door to Mercandito, to a full restaurant, and they found a patio seating in less than 2 mins and with great service!!!

Z2lQLFlQ2okCmM4GjZOR-Q.text: My go-to place for happy hour, drinks & even dinner & brunch too. Hearthstone has an amazingly good deal for happy hour with just $6 on drinks and certain appetizers. The staff here are all friendly and helpful towards my needs. It's really awesome that they have weekly specials that change up the menu from time to time as well. The lollipop chicken wings I always recommend to all of my friends. They are my favorite item on the menu & they even have them on happy hour too. I just get the best vibes from this restaurant & I recommend everyone to try it at least once. You won't regret, I promise !

_fgZWzs9E7eXc1VN6q3SFQ.text: Oh man, the bacon wrapped dates,  my favorite appetizer.  The lobster roll was good as well. Lots of lobster meat. The decor was cool with a rustic vibe.

YzgZxrDQQSJgdNR8ngAXcw.text: Last night July 14th, we took a party of 16 to this wonderful eatery! To say that we were satisfied doesn't cover it! The placed as packed and they sat us promptly and in a comfortable table. Food came hot, and it was all delicious! Everyone was very happy with their entrees and overall we have a great evening. Shout out to Jeff our waiter who was on top of everything and very pleasant! Recommend this for business or pleasure and we look forward to revisiting Hearthstone Kitchen again soon. Yum!

ZhvnHI6RzT6NGUqo1PGR4Q.text: Waited for a table for 15 minutes when there were a few available tables. Worst part is they asked us to wait at the bar and forgot about us. No apologies from the hostess - it didn't even phase her. I'm sure food is probably good and us leaving didn't break them, but I'm for sure telling everyone I know who lives near by not to go! So there! lol

lUOfhWvhMgxEjuCTXX2CAw.text: Great food, but terrible service. Waitress, Jessica never came back after taking our order. Then after we were done eating she finally came by and rudely asked how lunch was.

Qt2SdEK6m5Cxbz12U9mooQ.text: Brought 17 people in here. Forced 1 bill on us. It is taking us forever to resolve the bill and pay.

XQtkt_GYggOFLyDj4Y9wrQ.text: I like this , visiting from La. A friend eho lives in las vegas told me all about this place. Watching march madness, the wings are amazing. Thank @Tien for the !!??

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The restaurant is a little slow for mach madness but I like.

M_R0_Am12Dnfwl6rBcSRbA.text: Came here for wine lounge, and orders a few things. The Bone marrow was the best thing I had in a long time. I am now a fan of this place :-) a great atmosphere and a beautiful restaurant. #jordan #heartstonelv

RN4C9xNFQ7EJNZscXAhgWQ.text: Great mac an cheese perfert with wine great portion too. Loved it. Great atmosphere here.. with my server shaheena , free dessert ? Yes please OmG peanut butter lava cake to die for yummy yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pkX4PT_8UWRsp-QnW007YQ.text: We were there for wine & apps and ordered the grilled octopus, the stuffed dates, and the bone marrow. The dates and the bone marrow were impressive, and the octopus was good too. The service was good despite being very busy and they were very friendly as I hunted them down mid-task to let them know we were around. Thank you Hearthstone for intriguing food and a well trained staff. #Jordan #HearthstoneLV p.s. the PB Lava cake dessert was fantastic

CqDrvR_VHgqvss2qXHP4QA.text: I met some friends here for dinner.  I had parked outside so I entered through the patio.  Once I entered the door there wasn't any signs about where to check in but there was a desk to the right that looked like it could be a hostess stand.  No one was there but when I turned to the left someone was fixing pictures on the wall.  I asked her where to go to be seated and she told me just to wait here until someone comes to help me then she turned her back and continued to play with the pictures on the wall.  I wondered why she couldn't help me and it felt really cold.  So I eventually got seated with my party.  We were seated by the kitchen and there was a bad smell almost like burnt grease/oil.  I ordered the lobster roll for my entree.  I noticed right away it had a "fishy" not fresh smell.  I took one little bite which confirmed it wasn't fresh.  I didn't want to complain in front of my friends so I just didn't eat it.  After my friends finished the meal the waiter took away the food.  I don't know if they didn't notice or care that my entire meal was still on my plate but no one asked me if my meal was OK or if there was a problem.  I was still hungry so I asked for the desert menu... 3 times!  The third trip back I was served the bill (not the desert menu).  I left hungry and paid for a meal I didn't eat.  The service was horrible the food was horrible.  I will not be returning to this restaurant.  There's too many other options in town.

lWyX3QzdQq6CRLl6XFQelQ.text: Well. I've lived in Vegas 14 years. I frequent Red Rock Casino several times a week and I have NEVER been to this place. Had a couple ladies in town from Cleveland and Toronto so we gave it a try.  It was EXCELLENT. Everything from the young ladies at the entrance to the servers and actually the whole staff. And the food was some of the Best we have had. Looking forward to a return very soon.

MmvZGXGL4Mnf7TPh_Kin5g.text: With knowledge of knowing your owned by clique and along side with once upon a time "Libre" and also "Salute". I truly hope you guys make it man. You guys again out of all three is hands down just amazing. Great food great staff always. Never disappoints ever. Wine nights always success everything's always a success here hopefully you guys don't fall like the other two did and continue on your road of success because you guys truly know what hospitality is.

6UM4CKCSF2gWo4CR7Ad6dA.text: Let me 1st start off by saying I thought the restaurant was beautiful inside. The decor was amazing and they spared no expense. I thought the outdoor dining area was really well planned out and had a great atmosphere. The staff was very caring and the manager even went around to check on people as well which I really enjoyed. The food was a very good. I had the prime rib and a side of mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts and it was all excellent. The pricing was very fair for what type of a restaurant that it was. I think red rock is very lucky to have them as a restaurant and by the way it was an excellent location inside the casino as well.

1Tz0oxQzTe5EsBGpH_eCfg.text: I love this place! Love the service as well. Very easy to find, closest to the outdoor parking lot next to the other restaurants. Easy to get to. It is a great experience from the moment you step foot into the establishment. I was greeted by a lovely gal at the front desk named Natalie with black hair she was able to take a last minute reservation for my family and I on a busy day, accommodated our table requirements and even allowed us to switch the times when we needed to. Outstanding help from the host! (Though I may have been difficult, she is greatly appreciated). Service is quick and thorough. I have dined here for both dinner and brunch. Great place to watch games! It can be a very casual attire or nice spot to get dressed up. During the summer time they have their patio open and it is so beautiful to sit out there. Saturday's they have live music which is very fun! They do take kids here, but I would add that there is a bar and lounge area so be sure to be mindful of that. The manager is so sweet and really cares about the experience of all the guests. Thanks Russell! Love the bottomless mimosas for brunch, the pizza is also SO BOMB HERE!! Thank you Natalie, Russell, and my server Rigo from brunch! Thank you to the bussers who were very attentive to water fills as well! Lovely restaurant!

NQGJVqMdS7xSXcPEAYL0kA.text: Superrrr cute place. I'm big on atmosphere and I loved it. Our server was Ahmed, he was AMAZING. He never let our mimosas go empty and was super friendly. Really great experience, I'll definitely come back and I would 100% recommend it to friends .

1OpITzzn5jjkawnuYhSjiQ.text: This was a great experience and Christian was amazing made you feel like family. He didn't rush you see if anything else you would like. It's was a great experience!! Thank you Christian you were amazing!! Come here and see Christian you won't be disappointed!

mGwOdDu5gCzoKvuXHWy2Ww.text: Unfortunately my whole experience here was a total disaster.    This should be a one star review but the servers were so friendly I'm giving another star.   I went as part of a group dinner.  We waited 45 minutes before someone came and took our drink order.  We waited another 20 minutes for the drinks to come.    We ordered a bottle of wine.   The server brought a different bottle than we ordered but we caught it before the bottle was opened.    While ordering the bottle of wine we inquired about the wine special that was being scrolled nonstop across the tv screen in my hotel room.  The special was order one bottle and get a second bottle at half price.  The server stated the special was just changed to the following day.  The manager refused to honor the special in spite of it being advertised on the tv in our room.    Then we ordered appetizers for the table.  They took a long time to arrive.  We ordered a charcuterie sampler for the table. Everyone agreed the portions were very small.    After we finished eating the appetizers and waited even more, the server came back and took out dinner order.   I ordered a hanger steak.  It came out as I ordered it and it was seasoned well.   The servers were aware of the delays and apologized and stated they were under staffed.   Total 3.5 hours for the dinner due to the delays.     For me, there are many other options in the area.  I won't be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xdmkEcCIoILIj1iOn_hKyQ.text: Our server Annie was amazing!  I'm definitely coming back for the food and the atmosphere.

5pd09B1EvTnuB29hK-x7Sw.text: Great vibes the minute I walked in. The atmosphere was amazing. The waiter Gerson was prompt and eager to help make our night.

YB3yFSTqL27uAyOg--ceoQ.text: Stopped in after work for a quick beer. It was a let down that they no longer serve Pacifico on draft as it is still listed on their website. Not a big deal as the impeccable service and enthusiasm by the  bartender(Allie) more than made up for it. Definitely looking forward to coming back for the MNF specials!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Company website not updated.

oPvEjgTkiRh6Zig8vGlUXA.text: Been coming to Hearthstone for a couple of years now. Food and service is always great. Gerson always takes such good care of us. Good stuff, highly recommend!!!

dZysfQDMIdgR3iBDSBQ2tg.text: Ahmed killed it. Constantly checking on us even though he was swamped. We originally sat outside (my fault) and it was still so hot. He totally arranged for us to move inside without question. Food was so good. Drinks were incredible. But make a point to sit in Ahmed's section

ZajAeREvhuDFI3gNfW_Cug.text: I really want to like this place, but after a challenging 2.5 hour brunch, I can't really recommend it. Most of the food was good and the place is really cute. The server was nice but accidentally spilled a tray of glasses of champagne all over our group. Food took absolutely forever. I mean FOREVER. One dish was sent back but not taken off the check.  It was just chaotic, even though the restaurant wasn't full. In fact, we'd asked to sit at a table in the dining room but because we didn't have a reservation we had to sit at some couches. That would have been acceptable but soooo many tables sat empty for the entire 2.5 hours, I kid you not. That part made me a bit grumpy.

gFibW4SBfOkJq0rG0fv4-Q.text: This place is awesome. The environment is perfect for either a nice date/dinner or to go watch a hockey game. The rustic decor makes for a cool environment and the food is incredible. Happy hour deals are 5$ from 5-7 which is awesome, and the menu is accommodating with meat and vegetarian options. They offer military discount too which is a plus. One of our favorite places for sure.

IL1YY6QL0-z_C4-85nl-hg.text: The ambiance is nice. Took a little while for us to get attention. Food was ok, nothing special. I mostly got a couple of appetizers during happy hour with beer. Honestly would gave ordered more if we were checked up on more often, but that's ok. At least the server was nice. Prices are ok, but portions are not too satisfying. We did receive a round of shots from the manager for a friend's birthday, which was pretty cool. Overall not bad, but being a place inside of Red Rock, I was expecting better.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6 for 4 chicken wings, meh

0inqHFs-0Zpbo-ZTvC629w.text: Had a fantastic dinner here and it was all because of our amazing server Ahmed. He was so knowledgeable of the menu and had the best recommendations for wine. Had such a positive attitude and I could tell he loves his job. So knowledgeable with wine and recommendations were on point. Would come back as long as he is my server. Great job hiring him

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B9-eT6ZZD0uMkX8FuEwJtw.text: Service was excellent. Shane, our waiter, stayed on top of our waters or margaritas. That was our first time at taco Tuesday but we will definitely be back and request him as our waiter. Definitely a 12/10!

NZ7XyinbanXN5bYuYky6bA.text: Really attractive space, great food and the service is consistently good.   Have been here a few times now and each time does not disappoint. Hearthstone is a farm to table feel american restaurant that offers some unique twists that make it a definite place to try.   All of their flatbreads are worth a shot, my favorite is the Abe Froman... not sure who that guy is, but the (not overpowering) fennel goes really well with the garlic sausage.    Ceviche was good but not great... but i am more of a traditionalist on this one... why ruin a good thing and add watermelon to a dish like this? But all the cool kids have new takes on ceviche these days so i get it i guess.   Meatballs: great. Tuna tartare: fantastic. But really if you want to do it right, get a group of friends together and go with the whole suckling pig. Had a chance to do this at a yelp event earlier this year and it was one of my best dining experiences of the last several months IMO. If you can get past the little eyes looking at you (which i quickly did), you will definitely enjoy this. They even come out to the table to cut it up and serve. Cool, but i hear tends to scare the other customers (get over it).   Also try their private cellar on Thursday. Cant beat free wine.

tmHyJBcpWWk3ffqWXXQM5A.text: Came here on a Sunday after church because I been waiting to try this place out. It was a nice day so my boyfriend and I wanted to sit outside. We got seated and had to wait for our server to bring menus which I thought was weird because shouldn't the host who sat us bring us menus? I ordered a Bloody Mary because it looked good and I was happy with my drink. We ordered an order of pancakes, side of bacon and side of hash brown with 3 oysters for $10. Thank goodness we shared because the pancakes were huge and filling. The oysters came out first and it was ok. It was kinda fishy to me and I eat a lot of oysters. Pancakes were decent but the bacon and hash browns were good. The pancakes come in 3 big stacks and it's big so it's shareable. I did notice the water glass they leave out on the table were a bit dirty but I didn't say anything because I drank my Bloody Mary and my boyfriend ordered a coke which our server brought out in separate glass. Overall I think this place is okay. Some things are good and some can be improved.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The massive pancakes with bacon and hash browns
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oysters were okay

j4jyLPxo3NcVMxB3FlD1lw.text: All you can eat wing Mondays, What!!!! Count me in........ or so I thought. Came here on a Monday night for the football specials that included all you can eat chicken wings for 10$ and 10$ pitchers of limited domestic beers. I have yet to find a truly great wing place here in Vegas so I thought why not give Hearthstone's wing special a try. Upon ordering the wings the server looked annoyed and seemed to keep that demeanor the entire length of our dining experience. Once we received our first batch of wings they were soaked in buffalo sauce. The sauce itself was nice and tangy, however there was so much sauce that the wings were floating in a lake of it. I attempted to get our server's attention to ask if my next batch of wings could be made with light sauce but he never came and checked on us. Thankfully a food runner (I believe his name was James) came out of the blue from the kitchen and brought out our next batch of wings with a smile. He informed me that he could make the wings with sauce on the side and quickly brought some out to us. The sauce on the side was a winner and allowed the wings to maintain a crispy exterior. Overall, our experience as a whole was mediocre. The server was horrible and unattentive, however the food runner was amazing. He truly took care of us and deserved all of the credit. I had really high hopes for Hearthstone since they seem to cater towards locals with their specials. However, with the way their service is they may just be a last resort for tourists who are too lazy to leave their hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unsauced wings with buffalo sauce and ranch on the side

CIg8AekE9aa4MtvuhHsefw.text: Been here twice for date night nd with friends visiting from out of town. Food is good and ok service, considering they always seem to be packed on weekends. Excellent atmosphere combined with the Red Rock casino crowd make it a must try place to impress friends.

LcEXceePVtGkNtlEiQcekg.text: I came to hearthstone for their big juicy steaks. The service was excellent and the restaurant overall was visually pleasing!  Servers were very kind and I left full and happy!   Would recommend to everyone!

hAtEd2H2TF1mbf8vJPyfzg.text: Came here with friends and really loved the decor and atmosphere.  They didn't have a drink menu, but they did have bottomless mimosas and red beers for under $20.  Sadly, I didn't love the food. I ordered the prime rib french dip and the meat tasted old to me. It had the taste of reheated meat which I really cannot stand. It came with a side of fries that were cold. I gave it three stars because I tasted someone's coconut cream and seasonal fruit parfait and that was really nice. The fruit was fresh. The yogurt and granola had great flavor and crunch. The waitress was MIA at the beginning but came around more towards the middle to end. I may go back just for that parfait.

AnI7zdxcIHkAyNYCKDV9Jg.text: I've gone to this restaurant twice and both times were amazing. We sat at the bar and the service there was great. The decor is great and makes the place feel so homey.  The first time I had the Mac and cheese and broccoli. The Mac and cheese was fantastic. The broccoli was a little burnt but overall it was good. My boyfriend got the rotisserie chicken and he said that it wasn't that great and he wouldn't order it again.   The second time we went we started with oysters from the west coast and they were super delicious(make sure you get the small ones). However I felt like they were overpriced because we got 6 and that cost $20. Would've loved to get more but that's too expensive.We then got the charcuterie, which I would say was average. My boyfriend got the chicken wings and said they were good. Once again, I got the Mac and cheese which was even more delicious that the 1st time. This time I requested no bread crumbs on the broccoli and it was amazing. Overall I think the sides are much better than the entrees so that's what I'll stick to the next time I go back.

RCcLC2q685D8wH8vZkuDYg.text: Great food! I came for dinner & sat at the bar. I had the shrimp cocktail which was excellent & the banger steak. It was absolutely wonderful! I had dinner at the steak house across the casino that was much more expensive but the food wasn't this good. Ill Be back again. Excellent service too!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger Steak

Ky16K5MAzM2Hi3nHzADozA.text: I went here March 4th, 2018 and.... oh my god.... AMAZING. The waitress was an absolute doll, every time my 4.5 year old dropped his toy she came and picked it up.  So 100% on the customer service. Now, the food.... pricey , amazing , cooked perfectly , will I come back???? % yaasssss..... I got the hanger steak, medium.... it was absolutely the best steak I've ever tasted, tender, cooked perfectly, amazing taste with the truffle aoili. My older sister got the prime rib medium rare... FIRE. It cut like butter and was soooooo tender. I don't like anything below medium, but not oh boy thay prime rib... Lord. Anyway, my son and nephew got the kids pizza. It is super awesome because they bring the pizza dough with eese and the toppings so the kids and decorate their pizza, be interactive with it, then they quickly bake and serve it. My little sister and sister in law got burgers. I can't remember what kind, but they both fell in love. And along with my amazing and perfect steak we got some show string fries... dip it in that aioli sauce.... chowwwww!!!!!!...... I will be back here if not monthly, every other month.

pWxwA0Xllu7RAa8tFqOu5w.text: Amazing crispy fried calamari for appetizer!  Their lobster sandwiches are the best!  If you like sea food, you have to try this restaurant.  Don't miss the Wednesdays'Special Oyster deal of a dollar each!  I give this place a 5 star for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0y7c9wOCh03MSS-TIyy9fw.text: So, for our first time here, it was pretty disappointing.  We came for Sunday brunch. $15 mimosas were great and a good deal. Service was poor. No one at the host station...we literally went into the restaurant after waiting five minutes and found someone. The vibe was good. Music, chat, etc. Our server was nice but it took a long time to get an order in. Meatball pizza: ok at best: burnt crust, kind of bland. Seafood platter: this term is used reaaaally loosely. 2 shrimp, 4 small oysters, 1/2 a small lobster tail...really poor value. For the prices you could do better on the strip. Service was severely lacking. We were hoping for a new Sunday brunch place, but I doubt we'll be back.

T8SbFwfztkMqje9Ew89lNQ.text: Still loving it. The chopped chickpea salad is delicious! When the server realized we were sharing our food, he offered to split it for us. Bolognese pizza, calamari, and crab cakes finished the meal. Maybe someday we will make it to the entrees, but for now, too many tastes thing tempt us on the starter side.

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bolognese flatbread
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cakes

MxSJ_nmKNjuAVs8Lf8s4YA.text: My favorite thing to do on Sunday morning is go to brunch. My favorite place to go to brunch is Hearthstone. The food is so amazing and the service is just as fabulous! We absolutely love the warm chocolate cinnamon roll. This week we got two because I just can share that kind of deliciousness. There's no better way to enjoy your bottomless mimosas than on Hearthstone's couches, and when you need to get up and stretch (so you can eat MORE brunch) you can head to the shuffleboard tables for some healthy competition. Last weekend we had Kate as our waitress and the service could not be matched! We will for sure be asking for her next time we come back for brunch. Thanks for always keeping us smiling, Hearthstone! See you Sunday!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our favorite waitress - Kate! Ask for her next time you are there!

SWzbO2GRA7N3Rv39MC6hiQ.text: Our first time here and we had a great meal! My husband had the Prime rib dip and I had the lobster boil, both were delicious and servings were very generous! Trendy atmosphere with a wide range of people, all types and dresses.  Our server was Lisa and she was very attentive and helpful. Will return again!

YwKB2q0WZwCJ7U55fmsm8g.text: It is important to me that an establishment takes accountability when something goes wrong. Going to spare you the details, but Hearth Stone stepped up and did the right thing. They even offered us a couple glasses of wine when we left.  Thanks

qzxeqE1_qcUCVIH8IbO_0A.text: This is one of my favorite places to get brunch with girlfriends. Their patio outside is gorgeous, although if I'm being really honest, it is the bottomless bellinis & mimosas that keep me coming back!  The patio outside is a great place to sit with friends for a while and chat. It's really beautiful, it's never very crowded and the service is wonderful. I have never sat inside - why would you, on a sunny Vegas morning?! I've never had to make a reservation for brunch. The staff outside has always been very accommodating, even when a few of us have sat there for several hours.   The menu is a little expensive but it's very good. I rarely try a French Dip because the one on the menu at my parents' restaurant is so damn good, but Hearthstone's is honestly the first one that I have found that is legitimately good. I have also tried the salted caramel french toast that was delicious and gorgeous. I've never eaten at the restaurant for lunch or dinner, so don't know about that menu, but the breakfast menu is great!

GSBUBeHYGiXzP-Qrgfon3Q.text: Over priced! Chicken was really greasy! Gouda and toast appetizer was the best thing we had. Buffalo wings were tiny for $16! Had to send mushroom pizza back because it was too salty. Waiter was good

d6cOiSPsOnppFJ1ZTtIcbQ.text: Kate with a K was great!! Best Prime Rib dip I've ever had hands down.  You can never go wrong with Bottomless mimosas for brunch.  Chicken and waffles was ooook but the service and the dip made up for it!

j0GZ1SqJBvo4R-6hxb33Lg.text: I can not believe the food! OUTSTANDING!!!   Everything we have EVER tried here, before and after the menu change. The flatbread pizza, lollipop, buffalo wings, jalapeno hummus, filet mignon, beef marrow appetizer... EVERYTHING is absolutely delectable :)  The only thing that has kept us from going more often is the service :(   Don't get me wrong the servers & staff are BEAUTIFUL  but NOT one, so far, actually knows what service is. I feel like I'm bothering them, no begging them to spend my money there, so sad because the food is unbelievably GREAT!   For what they charge the servers should be forced to take a class in service :/

nuNLQLyrcNhNTHTFPiCerQ.text: Every time I come in for brunch Kate hooks it up!! I haven't been to too many places that serve $15 mimosas and bottomless!! My boyfriend always orders the chicken waffles and he basically dies and comes back every time he has it! Kate keeps our mimosas full so we never know how much we actually drink! Ha I love that! I would recommend this place for Sunday brunch for sure! We haven't tried dinner yet but I heard it was the bomb!!

khK4YMA_t_rI-iMyiBsI5A.text: Love this place! Sat at the bar and had the best service! The bartender Allie was really attentive and friendly. The food and drinks were great but she definitely made our night. Anyone looking for a fun night out with great food come to Hearthstone and sit at the bar with Allie.

8Wmid-i84xiMEAxX2tRBog.text: In one word, amazing!  I absolutely love the decor and warm ambiance.  Its down to earth southern feel is right up my alley.  Everything we ordered was great but have to say the steak tar tar appetizer & flank steak entree were off the chart!    So excited that this place has come to Redrock & cant wait to come back & try some more stuff!

0viBRlEL13zN_xFW59T4YA.text: Been here a few times and I must say...I'm always impressed. Service began when Alex (our server) recognized us from the last time we visited. She quickly had us seated and got us drinking. Split a few apps as well as the nightly special. A delicious tri-tip steak that was cooked to perfection. Not only is the food world class, the vibe and hospitality they have going there is fantastic. I highly recommend a night out at Hearthstone!

photos.caption: Photo of Hearthstone Kitchen & Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!

IeB61vTtmfrHU0LXCFPE7w.text: Had reservations, but we're informed that it would be a 10 minute wait. The actual wait to be seated was 30 minutes. We didn't time how long it took to get our entree but other diners, who were seated about the same time, got their food, ate it, paid their check and departed well before anyone came up to our table. There was no apology for the wait, we were asked how things were going. I said we were waiting for our meals. It wasn't until then that the manager admitted that they had screwed up one of our dishes. We were told it would be just a few minutes more. It was significantly more than that. The sangria was watery, but the rest of the food was quite good. Food - good. Service - unacceptably bad.

bpZxghMrwl9Y-CAh55wYTA.text: Heard rave reviews about Hearthstone... Our experience was okay. Service was slow, don't go if you want a quick dinner.  Overwhelming smell of truffle oil throughout. I like truffle oil, but happened to be in a group with people who didn't like truffle oil.  Their choices were very limited

6TkqzDXDS3jFj7sG2u-JFA.text: Having lunch here, the food is amazing here. It's slow today because usually they're closed but I really enjoy the atmosphere.

KCNVxtcXpAc1HFkxfyFKtw.text: This is our new favorite hangout!  The staff and service are on point and the ambience, and food is simply perfection.  Brunch is amazing  the menu including items both sweet and savory and for dinners be sure to do multiple shared plates, appetizers, and a flatbread.  Beyond satisfying!  Best local spot all around.

dUnFrTk4pQIEEiN9h37lxQ.text: Worst service thus far at red rock. Mercatito was a flop with service. Heartstone is a flop all the way around. Prices, service, loud and very disappointing. I wAnted the meal to end.. right after the salads.  Ugh.

JXaO9a1tlDfDxyKzsqSgIQ.text: I found at Hearthstone their intricate Linoleum flooring to be as genuine as their unconcerned inattentive service. Our waiter et al not only ignore our table of three (empty drink glasses and finished plates) but all of the other surrounding tables as well (server said his name was Josh). He passed our table exactly 5 times without addressing the work at hand. The food is equally lack luster: Lolly Pop Wings (tasted as well as plated) are similar to the product at Buffalo Wild Wing at 3 times the price. The Kale Caesar was tasty, and the super small (east coast?) Oysters (over priced 6 for $20) on the half shell were excellent tasting. However the tasteless Octopus Appetizer, was over boiled prior to charbroiling; as the skin rolled off of every mushy bland bite. I ordered the French Onion soup and 20 minute later was told the Chef need to "refire" it? Noteworthy: the bus boy's filthy Converse tennis shoes, and the manager's insincere tap on our table and with no eye contact blurted out, at the rapid pace of use car auctioneer, "Thanks for joining us, Happy New Year". The food could be a 3 but the service is bad at best. Fool me once Hearthstone.

0cASvwLsnU_cbNaEVh9T5g.text: Love this place. Kinda pricy. Shared the octopus, really liked the spicy aioli.  Intrigued by the Abe Froman flatbread. If you're not a fan of fennel don't try it. I liked it, but my husband, not so much. We will be back again.

6KvP4E9OHYWTcWY1QI7LAQ.text: Lively atmosphere. We came in just for appetizers and decided to be adventurous. We ordered stuffed dates, charred octopus, and baked bone marrow. Oh my God! Absolutely amazing. If I have any complaint, it would be that the staff are far too overworked. # Jordan #hearthstonelv

wWER0IcgPtxiOV0_U0y2Ng.text: I am going to give this place 2 stars because of the hostess in the front. She told us the wait time would be 20 minutes, we patiently waited and said ok we will go to the bar in the meantime and make the wait worth! Well 20 minutes turned into almost 40 and the hostess did not even flinch to call us, we were waiting for a "call" that NEVER came through. Well my husband went to check and she said " well you are going to have to wait 20 more minutes, I mean HELLOOOOOO, how could she? Then thank God for the waitress in the game room area, she took care of us, we were uncomfortable to say the least. We couldn't enjoy each other's company but at least we ate.  So it wasn't memorable but just as regular as any fast food restaurant. The food was good no doubt about it but your hostess threw our nice memorable family dinner out of the window which we paid a lot of money got so for that reason you get 2 stars.

2nys8adUuXK49RkLUl0tBg.text: We've been to Hearthstone several times and we really enjoy the restaurant. Tonight we tried three new (to us) dishes, and one old favorite. Surprisingly, only the old favorite was less than perfect. The new:  the Crab Cake appetizer was one large, very meaty crab cake with a nice crust, that came with a tasty slaw;  the rock shrimp lettuce cups had beautiful pieces of lettuce to wrap around very tasty shrimp; the fried chicken turned out to be four large pieces of juicy, mostly white meat chicken in an exceptionally addicting coating. All these were delicious. The disappointment was  the pasta shrimp, a dish I had had maybe four times previously, and each time it was the dish that I talked about for days after the meal and it was the dish that brought me back for more. I normally don't get spaghetti dishes, but I got this one because this dish used to have a light, distinctive sauce that I couldn't get enough of. Tonight the dish was different. Tonight the sauce was a heavy, creamy, spicy sauce. They warned me about the spice and the spice was not a problem. In fact the dish itself was not really a problem. It was good. The problem was that the dish was different than it had been the four previous times I ordered it. It was creamy and heavy, not light, and that's not what it used to be. So I was disappointed because I ordered expecting one thing based on my previous visits to the restaurant, but I got something that was entirely different.

ghS3FpEs7rlOzTWICqegog.text: We met some friends tonight at Hearthstone to celebrate a birthday. We were a party of 8; 4 couples. We sat outside to enjoy the gorgeous weather-the patio seating is definitely a huge plus. The server came over and took our drink order- which would turn out to be the only one of the night. (Big mistake- we are drinkers, which would have only resulted in a larger tip for her). Never again did she ask if we were ready for another round, not to mention it took 15 minutes just to get water. Then it was time to order food. A friend asked if they had a particular kind of cheese. She waved her hand over the menu and says, "this is it." Okay.... Great... we ordered 2 types. We were never informed of any specials they were having, either. Everyone then ordered the main course. 7 dishes came out- and the 8th, about 7 minutes later. (All drink glasses still empty) She never stayed long enough to give us the chance, between conversation,  to order another. We finished our meals and ordered dessert. They all came out...without silverware. We were then informed that they had no clean spoons available and we would have to eat the ice cream and butterscotch pudding with a FORK. Seriously?! Yes, it was a Saturday night, but they were not busy. Several empty tables. The table next to us got up to get their own water at a nearby server station. Unacceptable. The food was good. The service was awful. Just awful. Walking out, we see the "specials" on the wall, and low and behold- the type of cheese my friend asked for at the beginning of the night- was one of them! At that point- our experience was comical. Don't think we will be back for a long time- if ever. Too many other amazing options Summerlin, with guaranteed stellar service. Hearthstone, your staff needs some extensive training. Good luck.

d3g2YENJE-w6TKec-50xJQ.text: It's a shame the reviews are so lousy, but here's my take on it. It's not very organized. It's new enough that this doesn't bother me, and I own a restaurant so there are things I am relaxed about that prior to being in business I'd have been very upset about.   Here's the negative - things take way too long to get to the table (even the bill can take 20 minutes), but I hope a couple months and this will get worked out. Staff is friendly, but either over worked or disorganized. The music is wayyyyyy to loud. It's hard to talk without yelling. I know this seems to be the new thing and it makes a place seem busy even when it's not, but it drives me nuts (this is about only thing that will keep me from eating there every week or two). The other thing I don't like, which has nothing to do with my dining experience, is the form contact response with email address to a bad review. I empower all of my staff to comp, give out samples, whatever they need to to make customers happy. This makes them feel better about their job too, because they no they can make decisions at work without having to talk with a supervisor (just a suggestion). Also, it's smoother because when someone gets upset it gets fixed right then and there. If you don't like how they handled it, you discuss alternatives later, but let them make choice at the time.   Positive - And, why we'll go back. The food was excellent. I could not pick on the sauce for the short ribs being too salty, but otherwise we had a large group with a lot of things to try and everything was very good.

4x_MfAY1FgoJzl-xGfaCwA.text: This is the worst restaurant I have ever been too. FIRST off I came in with my family visiting from out of town expecting to be treated great with good service and amazing food from the reviews and people I know said it would be nice but I was highly mistaken. The hostess was nice very accommodating but the booth they placed us in was dirty with crumbs all in the tracks  of the seat. It also took 20mins to wait for server to come to even greet the table. The manager was a guy screaming at the chefs and servers very disrespectfully. Once my family noticed this we realized this was a poorly managed facility we decided to leave because of the bad energy. I was very disappointed I wanted to order a bottle wine for the occasion with my family. People who run restaurants should not only value the customers but the people who work for them as well! I will never ever return to a restaurant this unethical.

ch3tKBTuninCFl2yvgTuQA.text: decent wine selection and food.  the layout and tables are a bit too much.  also give yourself time if you need to see a movie; they do not move fast

jHJ24nl-nj6O1xC797REfw.text: went in for a light snack while kids were at the movies our server Jessica was very attentive and gracious  great apps watermelon salad was awesome!!

nqNTy0lhgS-jGWLAHsKoCg.text: I was definitely disappointed with this restaurant... Our server was friendly and pleasant... The food was sub par... I've had better... Now the reason I have chosen to give this one star is because how our check was handled. Our bill was $75.00... We generously left $25.00 and made it an even $100.00... We had used our debit card to charge this... Come the next day our debit card was charged $75 AND another charge of $175... We called the restaurant and spoke a manager she said she would make the corrections... We also called our bank, we were told we had to handle it with the restaurant. The manager told us this would take three days to clear, there were no changes! After a few days not only did we not receive credit to our account there was another charge of $75!!! I could not believe this at all! This is our primary checking account, which was draining slowly as we were paying our bills..we contacted the GM of the restaurant he said he would have this fixed immediately did not happen we given the run around for two weeks. finally I had enough and contacted the Assistant food and beverage director of red rock... He had everything reversed and the $100 charged to our card within three business days... Quite honestly for putting up with this for nearly three weeks I believe everything should have been comped. This is so unprofessional and and was handled in the worst way.. We will never be going back to this restaurant... If you plan on visiting this place make sure you pay cash and even then double check what they give back to is the correct amount of change!

iT_IXCWRm4VZ2AYAMHaC4Q.text: My family and I dined at Hearthstone last night which was our fifth time being there. The atmosphere is great and the food is excellent but nearly every time the service has been just okay or flat out terrible. The baked ricotta as everyone states is to die for, and the meatballs are also incredible so I really hope the staff can get their act together. Last night I think our server was Lisa, which we have had before and has been good in the past. Last night she was training a guy, which I'm sure can be difficult but I hate to make a bunch of excuses. I arrived later than my family and it took about 10 minutes to even acknowledge me and get my drink out on the table. I was told they were out of sangria which is a bummer so I ordered some black berry cocktail that was just subpar. I of course drank it way before the appetizer came out and would have loved to been offered another drink but never was. For the rest of my meal I had no other beverage, not even water. The trainee took our order on a notepad. My mom ordered the chicken to go for my dog (lol) the same time we all ordered our entrees. That food came out within 5 minutes! We're looking good... but then, only mine and my sister's meal come out. We tell one of the guys delivering it that we are still waiting on two more meals, in which he kindly said he would go check. Still haven't seen the waitress and about 15 minutes after that we see our trainee again in which we tell him we didn't receive two of the meals. He looked very confused and then went and finally ordered the entrees. I know he's new so I will cut him a break, but if you are writing it down how do you forget to ring it in? I don't even blame him though; he's new...but why wasn't he more closely followed or helped. I used to serve long ago so I didn't want to say anything but an apology should have happened and something should have been done to make up for the long wait it took to receive their food. I had to leave early to meet my friends, but by the time I left my mom's food was still not out. Hopefully, it was just a bad night for the both of them...
